Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Yorick P
Reviews.Content: It is no surprise that this hotel is a concierge.com editor's pick. From the seamless private transfer, to the welcoming cold towel and Mayan health drink ; offered by a hostess that greets guests in the gorgeous Asian inspired central pavilion, with vast outdoors spaces and arching roofs overlooking a central pond which is a scene straight out of a Kyoto temple. That is when the perfect spirituality of this gorgeous peace of heaven hits you for the first time. The registration formalities are understated and quickly you are on your way, transported by golf trolley by a smiling driver - everybody smiles at the Banyan Tree .The accommodation is spectacular and in this instance a 5000sqft , tri-level townhouse designed in a Adobe/Mayan style.The first floor living area is bigger than many NY apartments and offers sweeping view of tropical ponds and the greens of the PGA golf course which is part of the resort . Downstairs to 3 bedrooms , the master with patio leading to the pond, ensuite bathroom with rainshower and vista tub with panoramic view, beautiful Mexican twin painted vanity sinks add to the Mexican inspired interior decoration to which the simplicity of Asian Feng Shui has been applied. The King size bed is sumptuous and with blackout curtains and only the sound of nature as an accompaniment, it is possible to achieve a primordial peaceful, darkness - great for those who are used to garbage trucks churning at 3am in NYC. Finally, the roof terrace, with infinity pool, lounges-beds,and basic barbecue implements- which are used to prepare catered buffets which are offered as part of the in room dining options . The scent of lemongrass and Ylang ylang offer an olfactory delight , gently relased into the air by scent burners which are attended to by a support team who clean and tidy the villa twice a day , and who at turndown service deposit small locally produced momento- my favorite the carved wooden turle- to symbolise returnng to your roots. The Spa at the Banyan tree has to be the most enchanting experience on the planet. You are transported to invidual Balinese inspired , thatched masage cottages. With your feet floating in pools of rose petal water, your body is gently scrubbed with banana and papaya pulp infused with herbs. Then a massage from an Indonesian therapist whose diminuitive size belies her ability to remove all knots and spains, whilst at the same time offering a tanscendental experience- thank you for your gift Dhassi. Dining at the Banyan Tree offers a varied selection of Thai, Mexican and International cusine at any of the 3 main restaurants- dining on the floating deck at Saffron is a must -try the Thai Tasting menu. Breakfast is served in the Oriente and really is the best deal at the hotel.In addition to the normal breakfast fare of tropical fruits, juices, bread and pastry baskets the kitchen serve some vaired and tempting addtions; shrimp curry, pit roasted pig, grilled sea bass or mexican burritos and refried beans. Of course, American favourites like omelettes and egg benedict can be cooked to order. Sands, the beach side bistro offers a great selection of Asian inspired options complimented with the freshest daily catch of the day and Mexican classics and is a great place to relax late in the afternoon. Finally, the staff at the Banyan Tree are superb.They act like gracious hosts, they are discrete and attentive at the same time and on hand to deliver any of your hearts desires.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful; service lacking”
Reviews.Author: SuperPicky111
Reviews.Content: Have been to Banyan Tree Mayakoba twice. Went back the second time because the first was so terrible they invited us back. Punch line is: hotel is beautiful and beach spectacular but service sub-par. Detail: we stayed on an oceanfront villa. The villa was beautiful with a pool. The bathroom was very nice with a great outdoor tub and shower. The bed was very comfortable and they had a pillow menu. Transportation: since the resort is in two separate area, the reception and the beach, guests need to use the golf carts to get around. The problem is that you can easily wait 10-20 minutes, if not 30 minutes for a golf cart at night when guests are trying to get around. The boat option during the day is cool but not practical since the boat only runs on a set schedule. Gym: nicely appointed with modern equipment. Spa: I got a massage, it was ok, not incredible. The masseuse was Thai and she was very gracious but she had tiny hands with skinny fingers so she struggled to apply real pressure. Also had the water treatment, it was not my favorite. Food: the pool restaurant was good although menu limited so after a week the food was a bit boring. The Thai restaurant was good but could be better. The breakfast was nice, the buffet was quite comprehensive. The restaurant in the main area by the lobby was underwhelming for fine dining. The problem: the whole system falls apart when it rains... The rooms are poorly built so tons of water leaks in so they put towels down to soak up the water. After a few days of rain they are out of towels and things get sticky to the point where they used our bath towels and didn't replace the so we didn't have towels when getting out of the shower. Most of the restaurants are outdoors so they have very limited seating when it rains which meant we ended up having dinner in the yoga studio one night!! Once you have issues the staff has no idea what to do so it becomes a comedy of errors. While it is a beautiful resort we won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Since Arrival at the amazing Mexican location on the Riviera Maya we were welcome by a typical from the area dressed hostess, who offered a delicious refreshing Jamaica flower water, the grounds are amazing! We stay on a private villa with our own private pool. The food was fabulous they had an amazing breakfast buffet and at dinner by the beach was fantastic the Lobster was cooked perfect! And the lamb shanks as well; we wish they had mint jelly to complete that fantastic meal. We enjoyed as well the Rain forest treatment at the spa OMG! It was incredible experience it is a must!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the Western Hemisphere”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter1113
Reviews.Content: I had visited the Yucatan Peninsula on a previous trip and explored Tulum, Chichen Itza, and the other noteworthy sites. This time around, it was all about rest and relaxation, and this hotel was so pampering that I couldn't bring myself to leave the entire 5 nights I was there. The Banyan tree is situated on a prime strip of beach with beautiful turquoise water, and the Asian- inspired decor creates a tranquil oasis. The Courtyard Pool Villa we stayed in was incredibly spacious and luxurious, and featured outdoor shower & bath, huge private pool (that was beyond anything that we could have anticipated), bowl of fresh fruit, a set of tea forte teas, comfortable king sized bed with impressive floor to ceiling headboard, and a his and hers bathroom that was one of the most beautiful and well-designed I have seen in any hotel. During our stay we dined at both Tamarind and Saffron, and in both restaurants the food was very good - though the candlelit Saffron was breathtaking, and therefore more enjoyable. We treated ourselves to Balinese and Thai massages which were both very good, but pricey (as is to be expected at a five star hotel spa). The service was all-around efficient and at a high level, and we were greeted with smiles and by name. While walking the streets of Varansi in India, I came across burning incense that smelled very similar to the Champaka scented ones they burned in the BT Mayakoba spa. It immediately brought back a fond memory of a truly pampering vacation, and compelled me to write this review. I very much look forward to future Banyan Tree & Angsana stays around the world!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation...”
Reviews.Author: Deepali V
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot for a vacation with my husband and 16-month old son. We had a lovely time. The hotel was SUPER accommodating with our son -- they had his crib waiting in the villa at our arrival (normally we have to call for it at any other hotel we stay at). They had a full package of kid products for his bath, etc. The villas was amazing and just as pictured. What can I say about the service...it was UNBELIEVABLE!! Most all of the hotel employees knew my son's name within the first few days of us staying there. We did have a small hiccup with my husband's golf plans, but they resolved it and he was able to play for 2 days at a discounted price. For anyone that is traveling with kids...this is a great spot. They have great pools and the beach is also amazing. If you are going for a long period of time, such as 5+ days, you will run out of dining options - as there are only 3 restaurants on the property -- all of which serve simply amazing food, but you may be a bit bored of it by the 5th or 6th day. However, we did hear that there are some nice restaurants in town...Playa del Carmen which is a few minutes from the property. We would have to compare this property very closely to the hotel we stayed at in the Maldives, in terms of service, food and setting. We couldn't believe we were in Mexico, it almost felt as if we were in Bali or somewhere in the Far East. The only slight drawback was there are not a ton of kid actives, if you have older children...they may be bored somewhat. We did hear about a few excursions, including swimming with dolphins...which is about a 20 minute ride from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent honeymoon/romantic vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: M2NC
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a spa pool villa in early May 2011 for our honeymoon; perfect spot for that kind of thing. Pros: -Privacy (high fence around entire suite, private pool, jacuzzi, outdoor bath with tea candle wall, do-no-disturb switch beside the bed that warns staff outside the front door...). One minor warning--you may be visible from the upstairs outdoor shower during the day--use the downstairs indoor or outdoor showers. -Suite size: yes, you really do get that entire space to yourself. And it's very nice to have the entirely separate sitting area--one person can nap in the bed while the other relaxes in the pavilion. -Thai restaurant: Fantastic. I wish I remembered the name of the mini-appetizer the chef sent out the first day. One of the best things I've ever eaten. And we ordered the massaman curry two nights in a row--it was that good. -Massage services: Had a couple's massage with my wife--her first massage. Both masseuses were excellent, both trained in multiple styles. Our massage room was in a stand-alone building on stilts over the water; much nicer than having someone in the next room. (DIdn't use the spa tables on the 2nd floor of our suite--really too hot in May for that, and I found the massage rooms much more comfortable anyway). -Room & resort appearance/style: Asian simplicity with hints of Mexican flair. Comfortable beds, choice of pillow types, etc. -Rain shower/steam shower: nice combo in your room. -Wifi: worked well in the rooms. Nice when you're taking a break from the sun or looking at excursions. Don't count on Netflix or the like working--those are blocked off in this part of the world by those services. -Service, cleanliness: both excellent. Cons (or potential drawbacks depending on your tastes): -Quiet resort: This isn't the place to party, although the bartenders at the beach/pool bars make great beach drinks. If you don't venture out to the ruins/towns, I'd keep the stay five nights or less. They'll be wonderful, relaxing days and nights...but that's about all the relaxation I can handle. No on-site night life, although you can go to the main complex and have a drink in the open-air bar up top. -Not on the beach: The beach is nearby--you could walk (long walk), take a bike, take the boat from the lobby, or call a golf cart to take you. Didn't bother us a bit--we took the boat the first day and mostly called a cart for the rest of our stay. -Limited number of restaurants: we loved the Thai restaurant and the breakfast buffet, thought the poolside restaurant was fine. Room service has a limited menu; tastes fine, but I prefer the restaurants. You can go eat in town or at one of the other resorts in the Mayakoba complex. To me, this is more of a "duration of stay" item. -Wouldn't take kids: this just isn't the place for them--and by "kids" I mean anything from infants through early teens. I think they might have some kid-related programs during the high season, but given the resort setup and eating choices, I just wouldn't recommend it. -Cleaning time: ok, this is nitpicking, and some people will love it. The suite is big, and you have your own pool, and they keep both very clean (and put away your shoes, etc.)...which takes a while (even though they send in a couple of people at a time for the room and another for the pool and grounds). And then when they come in for the turndown, I swear they do a quick second clean/straighten. Just be prepared to switch between the pavilion and the bedroom if you happen to be in the suite when they come (i'm sure you could get them to come back, but there's really no need--huge couch/day bed in the pavilion, plus table and chairs. You'll need breaks from the sun). Final word--we loved the place from the moment we arrived. Really, couldn't pick a better quiet honeymoon spot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skill123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights At the beginning of our honeymoon and although the place is amazing and I really really want to give this place an excellent review there is something just holding me back. I'll start with the good. The room we stayed in was a courtyard room and it was more than ideal. A huge room with everything you can ask for. An amazing comfortable bed, great aircon, peaceful and an great nights sleep. More than enough room for 2 and I can't really see the point of going for a better room ( except for the hot tub). The resort was clean and perfect but you could have been anywhere really. Although its so nice that you don't really want to leave (well not to go to playa del carmen anyway). The service was great at all times if a little bit formal and scripted but I suppose that's what is expected at this sort of place. And the breakfast buffet was amazing. By far the best I have ever had. But I felt that the overall value was pretty average especially on food and drink. The food options were quite limited and the quality was not as good as expected. Especially the Thai food which, being a Thai brand, I was expecting to be much better. I know that it was never going to be cheap but there is a difference in paying for an amazing room and just being ripped off on little things such as the price of water (up to $10 a bottle). One other tip is that the private pool was freezing and unusable because of the time of year and it wasn't heated so consider this if you're going in winter. I would stay here again without a doubt but maybe for a shorter period so the food doesn't get boring. Oh and there are some mean mosquitoes around the mangroves but no problems in the villa.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...Best hotel I have ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: Tman23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Banyan Tree Mayakoba for four nights during a mini-honeymoon after my wedding in June 2011. It is by far the best resort that I have ever visited. The service at Banyan Tree was amazing. From the green juice they serve when you arrive at the resort, the turn-down service every evening, the keepsakes they leave in your room every night, the amazing beach service and the out-of-this world breaskfast buffet, everything about the hotel was amazing. Pure relaxation at its fine. We initially had plans to visit Cozumel and Playa del Carmen town during our stay but we didn't even bother stepping outside the resort after we got there. I will love to visit Banyan Tree Mayakoba again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: toomanypairs
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I just returned from vacationing at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. We are frequent Cabo visitors (Las Ventanas and Capella) and met a couple while in Cabo that raved about this place. This place is nice....but we felt a little let down. Pros for us: Food is pretty good! We loved biking everywhere!! We stayed in a 3 bedroom townhouse (we got an awesome deal off jet setter) - while there was only 2 of us it was still nice to have such a spacious place to stay. Great Spa! We loved the breakfast buffet! Cons: No full length mirror - I know some people could care less about that but I could not get over the fact that there was no full length mirror anywhere in the 3 bedroom townhouse! Water leaks out of the shower into the bathroom, master toilet does not have a door, there is a his and hers sink...but they are right next to each other, rooms were a little outdated, no mater how cool we set the ac it could never get cold enough - we are from texas and are used the heat and humidity - but it was still tough coming in after a long day on the beach to a not so cool room. This brings up another point - the beach...the hotel is RIGHT on the beach which we found a little strange, and the lack of pools/pool space, we loved the main pool but there were very few places to lay out there - the pool down by the beach was the puniest pool we have ever seen - thus we stayed on the beach despite the strong winds! The service at the beach was lacking - I think they only came around twice the entire day, The gym is also the smallest thing ever - 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals - I know the majority of people probably dont work out on vacation but every time we did the treadmills and ellipticals were consistently being occupied! The service was okay...the place seemed to be pretty empty but it still took quite some time to get a buggy, also service at the lounge area was severely lacking. Don't get me wrong - service was good - but visit Capella or Las Ventanas in Cabo to experience truly amazing customer service. All in all this place is nice...but I feel there are much better places in Mexico that are just as expensive but nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Bola2218
Reviews.Content: Overall Banyan Tree Mayakoba can't be beat and it's just what you're looking for in the middle of winter! from the moment you are greeted, you know your expectations will be surpassed and service excellence is their commitment. We held our wedding there with 40+ people and they surpassed all expectations. Katherine Heisinger, our Romance Coordinator was the best! Highly recommend her! Am putting a more thorough review on bestdestinationwedding if you want more details! Villas: We stayed in two different kinds of villas and had the opportunity to visit 3 different types of villas. Every villa is super clean and the turndown service is great. The beds and pillows are very comfy and they have extra amenities in case you forget them. The best for a couple is the courtyard villa with heated pool and jacuzzi. The environment is intimate and the heated pool in February when it can get a little chilly is perfect to stay a few more hours in the water. The shower is beautiful and the outdoor bath is also great. The three bedroom townhouse is quite spacious and is perfect if you have kids. The only drawback is the unheated pool on the roof. Maybe in the summer it would be fine but in February for me it was too cold. The other one we saw was a one bedroom villa which was also perfect for a couple. Not sure if the pool is heated but the layout is nice. Bellboys/Service at Banyan Tree Mayakoba: We can't say enough about our bellboys and the coordination of all of our transports to/from villa/beach/restaurants/luggage, etc. Beginning from Alberto who always answered our calls so pleasantly, Ernesto who I think orchestrated many details, and then we have the bellboys who during every single moment always had a great demeneaor, were extremely helpful with any request, and were always a nice familiar face. I have to name a few of the one that stood out for us: Erik, Armando, Gui, Jose, Jose Manuel, Gilberto, Adrian (very knowledgeable about the wildlife). Spa: I also had great service at the Spa with Poi and Ami. Very relaxing environment and perfectly tailored to whatever you may need. Food: Breakfasts are perfect! They include a wide selection of fruits, natural fruit juices, fresh breads, eggs any way you want them and delicious creations every day! We ate at the acclaimed thai restaurant, Saffron, one night. Beautiful cozy terrace/restaurant on stilts over the mangrove under the moonlight. We didn't experience any bugs but got to see plenty on huge fish in the water. The service all around is excellent, particularly Benedicto and his buddy. The food was a good thai restaurant (we expected a little more authentic) but the only thing that blew our minds was the sauce that accompanied the bread for the table. We also had food at the Sands beach club. The linguini with clams, left a lot to wish for, however, I had a bruschetta with portobello mushrooms and that was wonderful! Beach Club: The staff at the beach club are amazing: Eduardo (head of recreationn), Cristiano and Guadalupe who were always so attentive and ready to set up our beach beds/umbrella. Manuel with our food and beverage service. I know there were at least another 3-4 people here who went above and beyond and my memory fails me, but suffice it to say, the staff is excellent and as nice as can be. The heated pool was perfect. The beach is very nice, although right in front of the hotel you have rocks, not too many, but enough. I suggest walking towards the fairmont beach or to the right to find a less challening entrance. The other thing to note is Mexico does little to regulate where jet skis go so when you are swimming be careful for newbies on jet skis coming close to shore, particularly if you want to snorkel. Having said that, the Banyan tree staff are equipped with everything you need to snorkel and stay safe (bouy to tie to your lifevest) which I know other resorts are not ready to do. The quality of the snorkel equipment is top notch... so much so we're going to go buy it since we scuba dive and they fit perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “November getaway”
Reviews.Author: traveler29556
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Banyan Tree in November for a romantic getaway. We stayed 5 nights and had an amazing time. Our Garden Pool villa was wonderful, very spacious and clean. The nightly turndown service and housekeeping were fantastic providing lots of bottled water, fruit, towels and a little gift each evening. The villa's pool was a nice size, bigger than your average plunge pool. There was also nice outdoor space surrounding the villa with a 2-person hammock, lounge chairs and eating area. We tried all of the restaurants at the resort. The Oriente breakfast buffet was definitely the standout. There was an amazing selection of fresh fruit and juices along with a variety of hot dishes and pastries. We lingered over breakfast for so long that we often didn't need lunch! Our favorite lunch and dinner option was Sands, the beachside restaurant. The service was great as were the salads and ceviche. Saffron was good, fairly standard Thai fare with interesting rice options. Tamarind was disappointing; food was overpriced and average at best. The grounds of this resort are stunning, and golf carts are readily available to transport you from the main resort down to the beach. There is also a boat that takes you through the Mayakoba, and the guide provides information on the wildlife. You can also rent bikes and explore the Mayakoba on your own. The main pool, just outside Oriente, is very peaceful, perfect for lounging and reading. The infinity pool at the beach is more lively and offers stunning views of the Caribbean Sea. The spa is wonderful. I had the traditional Thai massage and have never felt so relaxed!! We also used the gym daily, small but functional. There were 2 treadmills and 2 ellipticals along with limited weight training equipment. Overall, this is a perfect spot for an escape from reality!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort; relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler1979
Reviews.Content: As noted in the vast majority of the other reviews, this resort is absolutely fantastic. For those on the East Coast of the U.S., it is also a very short flight to take in order to experience a very remote-feeling resort. The greeting upon arrival was quite warm, and I thought the welcome drink was a nice way to start of the checking-in process. You are introduced to your resort host, who walks you through the various ins and outs of the resort. After a quick buggy ride to your villa, you enter into paradise, and relaxation mode commences. Upon entering the villa, you are greeted with the faint scent of incense and the pleasant sounds of a relaxing CD playing. We were in a 2-bedroom courtyard villa, and I cannot imagine a more pleasant layout. Although I would echo prior comments about the 2-bedrooms not being ideal for parents traveling with small children, it is an absolutely spectular set-up for couples, friends, traveling with adult parents, etc. Each and every part of the villa's design is stunning. The use of color, woods, stones and fabrics really did a fantastic job of blending the Asian sensibility of the Banyan Tree heritage with a hint of local Yucatan flavor to remind you of where you are. All in all, I have to say that the bedroom layout and quality (for both bedrooms) was beyond reproach. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathrooms were luxuriously appointed and functional all at the same time. The living room (pavillion) also provided a nice change of scenery if you wanted to get out of the bedroom. Despite my raves about the bedrooms and pavillion, no review of the Banyan Tree Mayakoba could be complete without mentioning the fantasy-like pools! Although the plunge pool concept is not exclusive to the Banyan Tree, I have never been to a resort with a private pool that even comes close to the size of these pools. You could do actual laps, which was a nice way to combine exercise with sloth-like relaxation. We traveled there during the summer, so I have no complaints about the water's temperature. It was always perfect during our stay. The pool was also regularly cleaned, and we were very satisfied with the quality and consistency of the cleaning. If you are looking for an active, mingling-type resort, I question whether this would be the property for you, but if you are looking for exclusivity, privacy, relaxation and top-notch service and food, look no further. Each of the staff members, from the housekeeping to the buggy drivers to the resort hosts to the waiters in the restaurants, was spectacular. Never without a smile on their face, they made you feel so welcome at each point of the day. Their positive attitudes were infectious, and you could not help but get swept away in the spirit of it all. We would like to particularly thank our resort host, Laura, who was simply a gem. The food is also quite fantastic at this resort. I would have to say that it would have been nice to have more "local" fare on offer, but they did a fantastic job of making you forget this after your first meal. The quality of the food was amazing, using the freshest of ingredients and with daring and beautiful presentation. The waiters were also very knowledgeable about the food and quite helpful with suggestions. One tip: try the tasting menu at Saffron; you will not regret it. We ate at each of the restaurants, and I would whole-heartedly recommend each of them. We did not avail ourselves of the opportunity to visit the sister properties in Mayakoba for dinner, and I honestly think there is not much use to doing so, as they have perfectly wonderful food on site. We did not really make use of the common areas during our stay, but I can say that they were magnificently maintained. You will exhaust the memory card on your camera whilst here. Also, be sure to check out their spa. I tried the Balinese massage and have not found a better experience (well, except for the other Banyan Tree I visited recently). Also, be sure to do the lagoon tour. I thought it would be "hokey", but it was quite nice and showed a lot about the property. In sum, this is a fantastic resort for those looking to be pampered and get away from the hustle and bustle of reality. The staff here make every effort to make the guests happy, and even when the occupancy rate is fairly high (as it was during our stay), you feel like you are the only ones there. I would not hesitate to return, and in fact, am looking forward to doing so again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip! More than what we could have ever asked for!”
Reviews.Author: Sangeetha20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning our honeymoon and looked at a lot of different resorts in the Reviera Maya belt. Finally, we found this resort on Jetsetter and reached out to them directly for our reservation. The best decision ever! We arrived in the morning at the resort at around 11:30am and were warmly greeted by our host. They were very organized and expecting us at the right time based on our flight details. Although our check-in time during reservation was specified as 3pm, they immediately gave us our villa and didnt make us wait after a long journey. We really appreciated that service. Then we arrived at the villa which was just gorgeous! I dont have words to describe it -- the huge bedroom, incredibly luxurious bathroom, rain shower, pool, jacuzzi, lounge chairs, hammock etc., just WOW! Since we love being outdoors, we paid for a couple of tours and shows. The resort's agent was very helpful in helping us decide our activities. I'd highly recommend snorkelling and the 'Espectacular show' at Xcaret. We also did a one day visit to the mayan ruins and pyramid. We also dined at all the 4 restaurants in the resort. Our favorite was the beach restaurant called 'Sands'. They have the most delicious appetizers and drinks! We also enjoyed the excellent ambience of the Thai restaurant called 'Saffron'. We had a wonderful dinner under the star studded sky right by the water. The other restaurant called 'Tamarind' was nice -- but a little expensive over the others. Plus, being vegetarians, there were fewer options. All in all, we had a great time at the banyan tree and so glad we chose this for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Really, really good. Can't decide between this and Rosewood...”
Reviews.Author: 30stravelers
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Banyan Tree at Mayakoba. All in all, it was a great experience. We were greeted at the outdoor lobby with a bracelet made of berries and flowers, as well as a drink made from local juice. From there we were taken on a golf cart to our villa (room number 521). The front door of the villa opened into the lawn and pool of the suite. If we turned right, we could access a separate room that had a huge sofa/bed, a small table and chairs, tv and, coffee maker. If we turned left, we reached our room. Once in the room, the bathroom with a walk in closet, huge stand alone double vanity, shower with glass wall to the outside, and private outdoor bathtub, were to the left. To the right was the bedroom with glass on two sides, both sides with direct access to the pool. The "yard" portion of the villa contained a hammock, pool, jacuzzi, lounge chairs and a small table and chairs. The lagoon that connects the three hotels of Mayakoba was behind the villa, although we were told that the area behind the villas is not used to ensure privacy. We ate at two of the three restaurants while there, Tamarind and Orient. We ate at Tamarind for one dinner and ended up doing the seven-course tasting menu. It was really, really good, not great, and expensive, but still enjoyable. Orient was great for breakfast, with lots of standard and Mexican choices. On our last night, we ate on the boat (Xchel) and really enjoyed it. To be honest, the food was very average (we chose the Mexican option) but the experience was magnificent. We spent two hours on the candle lit boat as it was driven around in the dark on the lagoon, going by all three hotels and the golf course. It was SO quiet and peaceful. It was unlike anything I have ever done before. On the middle day of our stay, we had appointments at the spa. We started out together with the "Rainforest Trail." After changing into swimsuits, we met our guide who took us through the many different stations that included a rain walk, three different steam rooms, three different shower experiences, two different saunas, an ice rub and a pool that had three different massaging water features. Everything is indoors and we spent about five minutes at each station. It took about an hour to go through the whole thing. A couple of the stops seems either redundant or not as good as they could be (the water features in the pool at the end were so strong it was hard to relax) but it was a very cool experience and I would highly recommend it. Once done with the Rainforest, I went on to a 90-minute Thai massage which was quite possibly the best massage I've ever had. Great pressure, nice variety of techniques and incredibly relaxing. Like most everything else about our experience, we found the service to be really, really good, but not great. Small details were missing. The staff would sometimes speak loudly when it was inappropriate. We could also hear music and other noise while in our room coming from one of the staff supply areas across the lagoon. There we also more children than we expected, although they only got on our nerves a couple of times. :-) We have now stayed at both the Rosewood and Banyan Tree hotels at Mayakoba. I think overall the Rosewood is more "us." It was tad more modern and the service and food were great. The two things that we liked better about the Banyan Tree though were the pool in our villa (the Rosewood just has plunge pools - still cool, but a lot smaller), and the boat dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: laterallife
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't stay at the hotel, we did see a few rooms and dined in the Thai Saffron restaurant which was OUTSTANDING. Best levels of service ever received in Mexico and that's after many many visits! Food as good as the best in Bangkok (also spent a lot of time there) and the setting over the water just beautiful. The rooms themselves are a work of art. Spacious, inviting, contemporary with some Asian styling that works very well in this part of Mexico. All have such generously sized private plunge pools that put the competition to shame. Next time we hope to stay here and also use their fabulous Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rdiamonds12
Reviews.Content: We went on 1/28/12 for 8 days , that was not enough ! From the villa to the staff and of course the food ! Wow I have been all over the world and the cuisine in this resort was amazing , we did in villa BBQ we had Henry ! Hats of to him he prepared an amazing birthday dinner for me and my boyfriend .. It was perfect ! My favorite that I ate everyday for lunch was the soft shell crab tacos wow wow my mouth is watering right now , that was at the pool on the beach ,,, all of the staff was fabulous every need was met and more , my drink was never empty and anything I needed was already there , I give it 7 stars , everyone if you love luxury and service this resort is a must go even for a weekend , they did not leave anything out . I can go on and on like the breakfast wow they had everything whatever your heart desired the breakfast staff was the best funny funny !! We did some excursions Betty was great we booked a great deep sea fishing tour our own boat she did a great job! We will be returning soon it's our home away from home O and must go to spa to the rainforest walk!!!!!!!!! O and ask for there special drink I had about 25 cups for the 8 days lol!!!!! I hope everyone go and enjoys like we did !!! Thanks banyan tree it was amazing !!!

Reviews.Title: “PGA Quality Course”
Reviews.Author: KipWilson
Reviews.Content: At the time I played the PGA tournament was the next week; the condition of the course was 'incredible'; worth every cent of the $270.00. There is a cave in the middle of the first fairway at about 285 yds that you have to see to believe.

Reviews.Title: “MOST PERFECT PROPOSAL!”
Reviews.Author: YoCBoC
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a more perfect, romantic, amazing proposal! As soon as we arrived at the resort I felt as if I was back in Asia. The staff was incredibly friendly and always greeting you with a smile! I have been to many high-end hotels/resorts and this hotel has exceeded my expectations. Stayed in a Courtyard Pool Villa... all I can say is AMAZING! There are no words to describe this villa. I was looking to plan the most romantic proposal for my fiancé and Michelle the Concierge made it happen. It was a great 3 hr treatment; 1-hr couples massage (one of the best massages I’ve had), foot scrub, salt scrub and endless treatments at their rainforest spa... We ended up in the indoor Jacuzzi with dimmed lights, candles and our song playing in the background, a beautiful wax bowl floated onto of the water with candles and the ring on a bed or red roses inside the bowl made its way to girlfriend she was in complete shock! I cannot describe the dream we were in! You must visit this resort to really understand. The only negative is that the website doesn’t give it the justice it deserves!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: McMurrich77
Reviews.Content: One of our favourite places in the world to visit. The resort is spectacular and the staff is amazing. We booked for 10 days, and began by renting a car in cancun, which i'd recommend and arrived for our second visit. Could somehow be better than the first visit, the accommodations are great, beds are very comfortable, super clean and each villa has it's own mini pool. As always, the breakfast buffet is the best, we'd usually have a 2 hour leisurely breakfast trying various things and reading the paper. After we'd head for the beach / pool which is a ways away from the lobby, but great for us as we would usually walk for some exercise. You can also take a golf cart or the small lagoon boat, which is also great. The restaurants are spectacular, the food and drinks aren't inexpensive but everything is top notch, everything is fresh and very good. eg, no bottled drinks like lemonade, always fresh. The spa is amazing, I'd certainly recommend the classic thai massage. My friends had mixed reivews on the rain shower, although I didn't try it. Definitely the best part is the staff, incredibly helpful. There are so many people that make you feel welcome it's hard to leave. Looking forward to returning again! Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: FieldingYost
Reviews.Content: I rarely write these, but in this case I feel compelled. This trip was a gift to myself (accompanied by my wife) for my 40th birthday. It would have been difficult to find a better place on earth this close to NYC. Everything positive you read below/above is true. This is an incredibly unique/gorgeous property. The grounds/food/staff are absolutely first rate and it always feels like you have the place to yourself. My wife described the entire property as 'spa-like.' I went without my kids. From a couples perspective -- if you want a serene, beach-y, five-star which is relatively easily accessed from the East Coast of the U.S. with minimal to zero headache, then this is your place. The pictures do not lie. The property is incredibly unique, gorgeous and immaculate. The staff and food are first rate. We never felt a need to leave the property and we are not homebodies by any stretch of the imagination (will travel for a researched/recommended meal etc). I was told the place was fairly well booked and yet we always felt secluded. If you want pampered relaxation, then search no further. I will add one last thought -- my wife and I are almost always outwardly affable (but we are incredibly demanding quietly in our own thoughts). Not once in my thoughts was I thinking anything short of something along the lines of 'this place is first rate' (and I have stayed in five stars around the world).

Reviews.Title: “Still nice but service took a hit since our last visit”
Reviews.Author: anna78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Banyan Tree again this December with our 6 month old with the fond memory of our previous stay in August 2009. This time we stayed in a Courtyard Villa which was even nicer than our Garden room from last time. We also got a great deal through Jetsetter. You simply can't find a nicer hotel for the price - assuming you take advantage of the offers that are out there on various discounter sites. However, the service took a big hit since our last stay. Even though the hotel's occupancy was only around 60% during most of our stay, everything we tried to do seemed to be "fully booked." For example, the hotel has this great eco tour around the mangroves that's free for guests. We tried to go sign up on 3 occasions and were told that the tour was booked. We finally went on our last day - we were on a waitlist - and of course after sitting on the boat for 15 minutes waiting for the other guests that never showed, we got our tour. We were the only ones. Apparently this happens all the time. On another night the hotel was having a special Argentinian BBQ at the beach restaurant. We tried to sign up for it and were told that it was booked solid. After complaining, the manager squeezed us in. Needless to say, during our 2 hour dinner we were one of 4 couples eating at the restaurant - so much for fully booked. We finally realized that they hotel management had no idea on how to yield manage its amenities. The other big change since our last stay was that this hotel became very kid friendly. There was tons of families with young children at the property and a nice kids clubs. We were even able to get fresh purees for our 6 month old every day delivered to our room for a nominal price. The babysitting service that the hotel uses is also great and very flexible. If you end up booking the service for more than just a few hours here and there you can negotiate a steep discount to the quoted rate. Bottom line, I would still recommend this hotel. However, if you are staying for more than a few days definitely get a rental car. While Playa del Carmen is a little cheesy, its nice to get off the property for dinner and there are lots of good and much more reasonable dining options in town. Cabs are extremely expensive. Also diving through the hotel and any other services are going to cost you 3x more than if you book directly.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Mexico yet!”
Reviews.Author: punkies
Reviews.Content: My best girlfriend and I traveled to this property from January 9-14, 2012. Normally I travel to Cabo once or twice a year and almost exclusely stay at the One and Only Palmilla. I have stayed at the Rosewood Mayakoba previously and loved it but got such a good deal on this resort that I couldn't pass it up. It exceeded my expectations for sure and I loved it much more than the Rosewood. I booked the trip through Jetsetter (highly recommended as you can get an awesome deal) and we stayed in a Garden Villa. It was more than enough room for the two of us with a lovely outdoor covered daybed as well as loungers and table and chairs. FYI there is a plug by the daybed to charge your ipad or plug in your laptop. This room does not have a hot tub but does have the lovely huge private pool. We had daily visits from a very large but tame anteater in our courtyard and morning wakeups from very annoying chachalaca birds (the locals say they taste like chicken!). As far as bugs go, there were tiny ants in our courtyard which did bite but bug spray helped that. I got maybe 2 mosquito bites the entire week. As others have said when it rained hard there was some water leakage under the front door but not a big deal, loads of towels in the room to dry it up. We had lovely weather the whole week actually so rain wasn't much of an issue anyway. For two people this room is more than enough size and very luxurious and when I return I plan on staying with this room category. We didn't spend enough time in the room to really use a sitting room other than the outdoor areas. We had room 401 btw. We spent the first day at the large pool by the main building which was very quiet and relaxing. After that we trecked to the beach pool for the rest of the days which was a lot smaller but warmer (we were told both were heated). Plus lots more action down at the beach. My friend went out on a snorkeling trip on a kayak with one of the staff (if the water is calm they are happy to take you out) and we had almost daily complimentary massages by the pool which were amazing. We did not golf or take advantage of the spa but heard they are both great. We did not rent bikes but used the golf cart service and never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a cart.The one activity we did participate in was the boat tour. Ignacio knew all the places to find alligators, turtles, nesting birds, and cenotes. It was a really cool tour and worth the time. We were amazed by the food. The breakfast buffet (which we did not miss!) had different hot selections daily including local fare and the chef was happy to make you anything, especially if you were dining late and they ran out of something on the buffet. We had dinner the first 2 nites at Sands which was amazing. We had the grilled seafood for 2 the first night and I had the lamb chops the second night, both excellent. We ate at Saffron the next two nights and this was amazing Thai food with good selections (I live in the midwest so finding good Thai is not easy). We enjoyed the Massaman beef and Shrimp pad thai. The appetizer sampler was also delicious. The third night we ate at Tamarind. Excellent carrot soup-highly recommend! Chairs there were a little strange though! For lunch we ate by the pool or skipped because of a late breakfast. Lunches were quite good. Loved the shrimp quesadillas. The food was almost as good as the One and Only and much better than the Rosewood. We did not leave the resort because the menu options were extensive and all was so delicious! What really made our stay exceptional was the service and the staff. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel at home and all of our needs were met on a timely basis. Room service was quick and friendly. Housekeeping was exceptional. The little nightly local made gifts they left us were a treasure, and they were so kind to provide an extra each night for my friend upon request. We travel a lot together as we live in different parts of the country, and for the past few years we have had a travel companion, a plastic lobster named Larry. He even has his own wardrobe! Larry was a hit with the staff who inquired of him if he was hidden in our bag. Many took pictures with him to show to their kids! At breakfast the chef would bring him his own plate of eggs and the waiters would bring a glass of champagne, just for our toy friend! The bartenders at the pool made him a mini tequila shot which was hysterical! A few staff to mention in particular who were outstanding. I would mention more but I can't remember all the names! The first night at sands we met Emmanuel the manager who was so lovely and accomodating. Erik our waiter was phenomenal and is studying to be a sommelier so his knowledge of wine is extensive. We asked for him the second night there and we were seated out by the pool under the stars which was perfect! Ask for him when dining there. Every day around 3 we would head to Reflections bar to visit with the bartender extraordinaire, William (aka Will.i.am). He is the funnest lovliest guy ever! And quite the fortune teller! He makes a great drink and plays great music. His smile is infectious and we just had a blast with him! We even went by on our last morning to say goodbye and have one last tequila shot! All of our waiters at Saffron, Tamarind, and Oriente were amazing and went above and beyond. I am sorry I cannot recall their names. We enjoyed a glass of wine nightly before dinner at the Copa bar with Cecilia and the gals there just loved Larry. It was so much fun to talk to them. Also we can't forget Eduardo Martinez, the head of the pool/beach staff. He gives an amazing massage and took my friend for her snorkeling expedition. He is an exceptional individual. All the other pool staff were also just as friendly and accomodating. Ignacio from the boat tour was awesome! He let Larry captain the boat! He was very knowledgable. All the staff love practicing their English and love to talk about the local culture and their lives...all you have to do is ask! I highly recommend this property, not only for the accomodations, but for the service and the experience you will have while here. If you are looking to stay right on the beach with the waves breaking at your doorstep, this is not your place. However, if you are looking to relax and enjoy good food and excellent service, this property is not to be missed. The staff made this a truly memorable experience and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled!”
Reviews.Author: ibanez29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned this evening from a three-day, long weekend stay at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba (26-29 January). We were so incredibly impressed by every single facet of our experience, that I am compelled to write an immediate review. The prior reviews suggesting that there are seemingly 3-4 employees per hotel patron are not hyperbole. That is actually the case. These employees bid you a greeting, hold a door for you or explain that "[your] satisfaction is [their] number one priority." Without exaggeration, in the the common areas, it is sometimes virtually impossible for a patron to hold a door for oneself. Although we were told that the property was half-full, we seemed to see only 5 or 6 other couples during our entire stay. Due to the expansiveness of the resort and the desire of many people to not even leave the confines of their villa, I do not doubt that the staff being candid with me about the level of occupancy. That's the beauty of the place: you feel, at all times, like it's yours and yours alone. At times, you need to pinch yourself to check whether you are in a deep utopian dream. We stayed in the lowest end Garden Pool Villa. The pictures on the website don't lie. Even the lowest end villa is an embarrassment of riches -- lavishly appointed room with separate bathroom suite, and a dainty little 1,000 square foot separate outside private pool patio area and an outdoor bed, in addition to the one indoors. While I'm more of an adverturer and my wife is generally more content to stay on-property during beach vacations, at no point did I feel even slightly inclined to leave the property. The exception was taking a shuttle over to the (still on property) Rosewood for dinner one night (which, incidentally, was also exquisite). Read other reviews for how good the food is at every on-property restaurant -- it's all true. What I will add, however, is how it is incomprehensible how many people pay a nearly similar per night rate to stay at all-inclusive hellholes, when they could spend a tad more and stay at one of the world's finest and exclusive resorts.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful place in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: ExtremePickyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the most amazing hotel I've ever stayed at. My husband and I love to travel and are always looking for the best resorts. This hotel will exceed everyone's expectations. The rooms were spectacular. Our friends who arrived a day earlier than us had texted to say they "felt like billionaires" when they walked into their room and private courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Returning again!”
Reviews.Author: KatesyL
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 month baby and stayed for a week at the Banyan Tree in August, and we had such a wonderful time that we are returning again in February (this time splitting our time between BT and Rosewood). We have stayed at some of the top resorts in Thailand/Bali (Aman, FS, GHM), the Caribbean (Viceroy) and Mexico (O&O), and appreciate both quality and value for money. Out of all the places we've stayed at in the western hemisphere, Banyan Tree Mayakoba comes out on top. When we looked around for our spring vacation, I couldn't find anything that offered as nice of a room (in terms of space, pool, etc.), especially for the price. We thought the beach, restaurants, spa and facilities were all very good and the room set-up, service and brunch exceptional. Highly recommend paying a little more for the courtyard suite, to get your own hot tub (as the pools are on the cool side, even in August) and dining pavilion. While I generally prefer to stay right on the beach, the inland private setting was lovely, and I didn't mind the 5 minute commute by golf cart. While this hotel has more of a honeymoon than a family vibe, we found it to be absolutely ideal for traveling with a young child. While our baby was napping, we were able to enjoy the villa's pool, lounge chairs and spacious outdoor area. The hotel provided a nice crib and swag for baby, and we were thrilled to see that the crib fit perfectly in the walk-in closet, so our baby had her own sleeping quarters where she had total darkness and slept soundly. Most nights we ordered room service after our baby went to bed and enjoyed a nice leisurely dinner in the villa (we brought our monitor so we could be in the pavilion and hear she was ok). When the baby was awake, she had plenty of room to play and run around in the villa (which was relatively babyproof) - she loved every minute of this place! The staff was incredibly warm toward children, the babysitter we used twice was very sweet and good with kids, and there were a few other kids our baby's age who seemed to be enjoying as well. Re food, We enjoyed dinner at Saffron (gorgeous setting), liked the restaurant at the beach for lunch and dinner and didn't try Tamarind (no kids, but this time I will have them deliver to our room) - all were the same price as restaurants in NYC and not quite as good, but still above average for a beach resort (I have yet to find one with truly exceptional food). Room service was quite good, but I wish the menu had a bit more variety (it got old after so many nights). The in-room BBQ looked amazing but was incredibly expensive, so we did not partake. As far as concerns, nothing material - we had a few ants when we left food out, but as soon as we dealt with the food, there were no more ants. I didn't get any mosquito bites despite seeing them in the air (they normally eat me alive). The beach did have a few rocks upon entry, which wasn't ideal, but our daughter wore swim socks and they didn't bother her.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Willc65
Reviews.Content: Amazing place . The staff are fantastic. Food & service excellent. The boat trip through mangroves to the private beach was magical.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: daevans
Reviews.Content: We spent a week for our honeymoon in mid-October at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba after spending countless hours on TripAdvisor researching venues in the area. The reviews on this site swayed us to stay at the Banyan Tree over the other Mayakoba properties, and I can say that we were THRILLED to have made that choice. Arriving at the BTM was a really cool experience. Entering through the grand Mayakoba gate, passing through the serene path, and then through another security gate was both exciting, and also added a good sense of security. We pulled up to the amazing entrance of the resort and were immediately greeted by staff who welcomed us, took our bags and car, and brought us in to meet our “greeter”. Everyone called us by name right from the start. The greeter walked us in to the outdoor lounge area, served us a nice local juice concoction, and gave us a great explanation of the resort. She then escorted us to our villa. We chose to stay in a Garden Pool Villa, #111. It was conveniently located right near the main area. Having your own villa is great, and having one with a really big pool, yard, outdoor tub, outdoor lounge, along with the view of the lagoon is just amazing - and this was the 'lowest' level accommodation. We settled into our room and just took in the amazing surroundings. The villa itself was really great. The decor was really nice, and the huge glass windows/doors gave us great views of our gorgeous yard and pool. The bathroom was luxurious and opened up to a really romantic private tub. The yard itself was perhaps the greatest part about the BTM. Multiple couches and lounge chairs adorned the large private yard settled around a pretty large infinity splash pool. We found ourselves lounging here a lot throughout the vacation. Some folks have commented that the unheated pool was a problem - certainly a bit warmer would have been nicer, but I didn't find it to be a big deal. Also, I'd recommend asking for turndown service nightly - our first night we came back from dinner to find our bed covered in roses, with incense burning, music playing, and a bottle of wine ready to be opened. It was wonderfully romantic. The main area of the resort was quite spectacular. Besides the stunning architecture and artwork, it was a wonderful place to relax. Whether it was the bar with live music, to the outdoor couches to lounge on, or in the gallery and shops, there was always something to do in the main area. Dining at the BTM was also great. We ate at the Sands, Oriente, Tamarind, and Saffron. Each was a special experience. Our first night we ate at the Sands and had a great authentic Mexican meal, accompanied by some really tasty Tequila drinks. The service was personal and friendly from our server Eric. This meal set the bar high, and every meal following was equally as good. Tamarind was a really good Mediterranean meal, and Saffron, the signature restaurant was amazing. I'd recommend asking for the two person table on the pier overlooking the river. It was absolutely stunning to enjoy 5-star Thai food while looking out on the water under the moonlight. It was so good we went back. We also ate at the Sands every day for lunch on the beach - great Mexican snacks and light meals to go along with your margarita and pina colada. And anyone who goes to the BTM will tell you that the breakfast at Oriente is epic. Calling it breakfast is a disservice - it's one of the most sumptuous meals you'll ever eat. A combination of classic continental breakfast along with a complete feast of local fare will have you going back for seconds and thirds. It's an amazing way to start your day. And as usual, the service was some of the best I've ever had. We actually travelled to the Rosewood for one meal at Punta Bonita (Mexican food) and it was quite good too. It's great that you can travel between the Mayakoba resorts and bill to your room. When you're at a resort like this, you are going to spend a lot of time on the beach. I will admit, the beach down at Mayakoba isn't that huge, but it's certainly adequate for hours of lounging. It's located by the Sands restaurant and the infinity pool and bar. When we arrived, we asked for two beach beds which the staff graciously set up for us. No better way to relax on the white sand than with a comfortable lounge bed. The ocean water was warm and clear blue...we could have spent all day in it! The staff from the Sands were always very attentive to us, bringing us drinks, snacks, towels or umbrellas - always making sure we were happy and comfortable out on the beach. I highly recommend guests take a ride on the free Eco boat tour. It's a great way to see the entire grounds of Mayakoba and also see some beautiful plants and animals indigenous to the region. We also HIGHLY recommend the rainforest spa. I've never seen anything like it. It's a full hour temperature, color, sound, and texture sensation that you can go through as a couple. You go through various showers, spas, saunas, and heat pools designed to soothe you. You walk out feeling brand new. And don't forget to check in on Foursquare for a discount! Finally, though we didn't get to do it, I hear the cooking classes are a fun way to learn about the local cuisine and try something new. Next time we'll have to try it. There are SOOO many great things to say about BTM that I can't even remember them all here - and really, only minor things to complain about. My only gripes are the availability of some of the restaurants for dinner (Oriente and Sands are rarely open for dinner, and sometimes in Mexico you want Mexican food), the unheated pool, or perhaps the reliance on buggys to get around (which worked just fine for us). We also definitely recommend using the bug spray provided in your room and at the outdoor restaurants! The resort is just spectacular, and honestly, I've never experienced service as good as I had there. It is the warmest, friendliest, and most helpful resort staff I've seen in my life - and they'll do ANYTHING to make your trip perfect. I can't express how much of a game-changer that is - I'd rather go back to BTM knowing how great it is than try one of the other, very good resorts in the area. You cannot go wrong, and most certainly will be happy if you book a trip to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. Unplug, Unwind. Amazing Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Bvegas1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited the Banya Tree Mayakoba for a 2nd honeymoon. The property was really special, and our villa couldn't have been any more private, comfortable and beautiful. The service was impeccable from the moment we arrived and were served a refreshing drink and a cool towel at check-in. The service was of such high quality that it felt like there was more staff than guests. The staff was eager to please, and was helpful in all our small random requests. The daily Asian-style complimentary breakfast was delicious, with seemingly endless tasty options. The toughest decision you'll have to make is whether to stay at your villa or head to the beautiful, white sand, private beach!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MilakdM
Reviews.Content: This is very Exquisite hotel and it is perfect for honeymooners because of the privacy. The grounds area amazing and biking was very much fun. It is ultimate get away from busy places. We loved the villa with pool and jacuzzi. We would definately return. Breakfast food was very good but at the evening the food in the restaurants was not very tasty. Also they were so eager to serve us at dinner time that we had four waiters asking us the same question every few minutes and it was disturbing our conversation to the point where both nights we wrapped up really quickly while third night we drove for food somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury Resort I've Ever Been to”
Reviews.Author: vionnets
Reviews.Content: This is no exaggeration -- my fiance and I have traveled to many beach resorts, and this is the best we have been to yet. After traveling far and wide to some amazing resorts, Banyan Tree Mayakoba stood out like no other, and we have even decided to return to this resort every year from here on. PROPERTY: This property is stunning. I noticed a previous reviewer mentioned that no matter how much you read, whatever pictures you see, and how much you build up your expectations, you will still not believe it until you see it with your own eyes. Every last detail put into this resort is incredible. From the Banyan Tree itself literally in the middle of the resort to the decor in even the bathrooms, this place is gorgeous. We must have taken over 100 pictures a day of probably the same thing over and over again, but we could not get over how beautiful everything was. Similar to the St. Regis, the entrance is very jungle-like until you reach the entrance and lobby presented with their grand architecture and a lilly pond. The lagoon is a really nice addition in which the Banyan Tree stands, and I love that you can take a boat ride over to the other side of the resort and even eat at one of the restaurants that is on the lagoon! Also, I strongly recommend everyone rent bikes... I learned to ride a bike here! We then rode our bikes literally everywhere, including around the golf course. It was an amazing ride and a great way to get around as the beach is further away. There are paths everywhere, this is a no brainer. While most resorts offer transportation via golf carts, Banyan Tree gets it right by also offering the option to take the boat to some locations as well as renting bikes to get around the property at your leisure. The one annoying thing is that it's $5 to rent each bike per day, but considering that is the one issue I had, who cares. SPA: Oh.My.God. We walked into the spa thinking we'd just take a look, but the service was so amazing (they serve Hibiscus water as you sit with a consultant, yum!) and the trophy labeled "2011 Best Luxury Resort Spa" standing true and proud on the counter, we just had to try a massage regardless of price. This is the best massage I have ever had, my masseuse was actually trained in and came directly from Bali. I can't explain the experience, I just know it is a must for anyone that stays here. We also did the rainforest experience -- another experience that cannot be imitated. This is an incredible idea and experience, we had so much fun and my body was and still is glowing. GYM: Great gym. It's not big, but it has newer equipment and everything you need for a full body workout, is very clean, and is always stocked with towels and water. FOOD: The reviewer that said breakfast is an emotional experience nailed it. Get the breakfast buffet, you won't regret it. Anything you want, you got it. If you want to be really healthy or really disgusting, there are options and they will fill you up. Further, they serve you your drinks so it's not annoying to carry your plate as you try and pour and create a mess. In Villa dining is very quick, but it's hard to customize certain orders -- we are vegetarian, so it was tough. Regardless, all delicious and I requested a tea that was from the spa but not on the menu, and they got the ingredients and made it for me, wow! The other restaurants are delicious... I've never been to a place where I could eat at all the restaurants and really enjoy the food, but here I did, and there's great variety. One thing I did miss was authentic Mexican food. Also, had I known that you could venture to the Rosewood to check out other restaurants, I would have definitely done so. ROOMS: Just, wow. And we only had the standard Garden Villa. Our villa was next to the lobby, so I can't relate to the complaints about being far, but again, you are on vacation and either enjoy the walk over or rent a bike, because if it weren't for property size, the amenities wouldn't exist. Anyway, the first entrance opens up to a ginormous area where you have a mini outdoor pavilion with a couch you can lay on (think Miami), as well as two very very large and comfortable lounge chairs with an umbrella. The pool is large, I mean, you can swim laps around this thing. Past the pool and around the corner of the villa is a hammock to lay out (nice!) and nearby is a view of the lake (which is blocked enough by trees for some privacy) and a small dining area for two... nice! There are sliding doors all around (see picture) and when you enter the room, to the right is the mini bar, foyer, office area and bed. The ceilings are huge, the lighting is excellent, and the beds are oh so comfortable. The decor is amazing all around. The mini bar has an espresso maker stocked with illy - really fun to make my own frothy cappuccino every morning. The bathroom is to the left of the main entrance, and it is my dream bathroom. There is a HUGE walk in closet, a separate bathroom, and a separate rainforest shower big enough for two and even has a marble seating area. There are two large sinks within the counter in the middle of the bathroom, and floor to ceiling mirrors -- needless to say, it was plenty of space for the two of us. There are sliding doors that lead outside to a beautiful bathtub with a wall of candles, it was too bad we couldn't use it because it was cold. A really nice touch is that the resort thinks of everything -- in the closet you will find a beach bag, swimsuit bag, laundry bag, umbrellas, bug spray, and other necessities. In the bathroom on the sinks there are pouchettes with toiletries like shaving foam and a razor, toothbrush and toothpaste, swabs, hair brush and comb, etc. It was a small touch, but like I said, every detail is thought through at this place and I have to mention it. SERVICE: I wanted to hug everyone at this place. Each and every staff member's contagious, genuine smiles made me smile back. These people take their jobs seriously and literally take pleasure in making people happy. I can go on about this for pages, but basically anything you need, they will do. The cleaning service is so amazing (we had six people cleaning our villa every day from stocking the fridge to cleaning the pool and even folding and hanging all of our clothes) and the friendly service makes you beam. Overall, this is a gem of a find and you cannot go wrong with this price. Your experience will be an unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible luxury”
Reviews.Author: Cascorpchick777
Reviews.Content: Every time I visit Mayakoba, and particularly Banyan Tree, I love it more than the last time. The breathtaking views, fabulous beach, incredible accommodations and great food make it the perfect destination. Plus, with so many direct flights to Cancun, it's easier to get there from LA than to Hawaii. I can't wait to go again. Make sure to have their brunch and find out about how they've helped increase the number of animal species on their property since building it. SO INCREDIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: complexara
Reviews.Content: Ok you may read a lot about this hotel in tripadvisor. But even these great expectations that are created while reading the reviews are far outreached from the moment you arive there. It is highly recomended for honeymooners (like us) and its perfect either you want to spend all of your days in the hotel villa either you want to have many activities on the nearby town of playa del Carmen and Chichen Itza ancient Mayan ruin place. All i can say to describe the hotel have been already written from other but i can give a little bit of advise. You are taking a risk if you plan to visit during july. It can be very raining. we were there from 5-15 july and the first 2 days were stormy. But we were lucky and had after this 8 sunny days, so be aware. Hope I helped someone to decide.... Have a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Things you should know!”
Reviews.Author: SBH16
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree and the Mayakoba area is beautiful and much more special then your typical hotel. The Garden Villa was spacious, with a huge bathroom, outside tub, a separate comfortable seating area, private pool and hot-tub (both heated). All was very private and luxe looking. The resort property is very nice and the service is fabulous. Townhouse Room I am giving this resort 4 stars because of the hiccups we had with our first room (we switch because of this). Our first room was a 3 bedroom townhouse (for 2 people but, I got a great deal on expedia). The platform bed was broken - literally the board kept collapsing. The safe broke and we couldn't get our money out until the next morning (missed dinner out), the lights down the stairs broke 4 times (or rather there was a circut issue). The town house was huge and probably great for a family but, we didn't need all of the space and walking downstairs to the bedroom felt like we were going into a basement. When we moved to the garden villa - it was fabulous. Same type of room but, all on one floor. The pool here was heated but, in the townhouse it was not. Odd. HERE IS WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW If you are looking to have a room on the beach - this is not the place for you. In mayakoba, the hotel (main lobby) and the rooms (private bungalows) are surrounded by manicured trees, mangroves, canals that runs on for about 6 miles. There are three large hotels in the mayakoba area. At the Banyan tree and I think the others - you need a golf cart to take you around the resort. It is spread out in a very pretty setting - a natural jungle like setting which is a little ways in a cart from the beach. All of it is very pretty but, you are not right on the beach. It is hard to get a sense of where you are in the resort because all of the rooms are separate and spread out. We liked the Banyan Tree set up but, were happy to have a few days in Cancun at a hotel right on the beach. THE BEACH at the banyan tree is a very small strip. Not the nicest MAIN POOL (pool looking at the ocean) was quite small - chairs were limited. We didn't sit by the pool by the hotel - it was not by the ocean and it was not heated. RESTAURANTS Oriental - great buffet breakfast Saffron - pretty good. limited inside seating and it was cold Rosewood Beach restaurant - you can take a golf cart there as well - pretty good. Spa - incredible massage We loved our stay was we switched to the Garden Villa and actually used all of the space. Regarding other reviews - the mosquitos were not troublesome. They were there but, I didnt get one bite! The gym - I am a work out fanatic. There is a gym - small but, very nice. Despite only having 2 elipticals, 2 treadmills, 1 bike plus weight machines etc I never waited for the use of anything. It certainly fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Just Do It! It's Worth Every Cent!”
Reviews.Author: tbatt
Reviews.Content: This property was amazing! The grounds were lovely and included a waterway where you could take a boat to the other side of the property (the property is very large) and along the way enjoy wildlife, including aligators. The beach was really nice with white sand and lounge chairs with cushions and umbrellas. The service was the best I have ever had - very attentive, but not overbearing. We stayed in a two-bedroom villa near the bear, which was beautiful and exceptionally clean (very important for me). The only reason I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is the food. The Thai restaurant and breakfast buffet were both pretty good, but the other restaurants were mediocre. For the money, I would expect a little higher standard. Otherwise, there isn't one thing I can complain about and I wouldn't hesitate to go back again! It is a bit of a drive outside of the town of Playa and the taxi ride is about $20-$25. This wasn't a problem for us, as our main goal was to lounge at the beach. However, if you wanted to go into town everyday you may consider renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: chantal_dunbar
Reviews.Content: As all Banyan Tree properties tend to be, this one is superb through and through. Design, service and sustainably operated, BT Mayakoka is ideal for a romantic retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: MiaMew
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING! We went for our honeymoon for 7 nights and every staff in the resort made sure we had a great time. The hotel was nice, each room has its own private pool, massive outdoor bath tub. We stayed in the garden villa, amenities were great everything you need was provided from the usual bath, shampoo etc to mosquitos repellant, flip flop, beach towel and beach tote! There were lots of nice things to say about this place, but the highlight of our stay were definitely the service, especially at breakfast and at the beach club!, the food and drink at breakfast was the best we ever experienced, lots of varieties, and the everyday trip to the beach club by boat and the eco tour (we saw a couple of crocodiles!, lots of iguanas and beautiful birds). Our favourite dining were orient (modern Mediterranean) and saffron (Thai). The food at the beach club was average. Our only constructive criticism is they should have more restaurant options for lunch. One tip, you can book a table to dine a the other hotels through the reception and they also take you there for free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Danielle H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on Banyan Tree for our September honeymoon after much debate on location (it being typical hurricane season). We were nervous about the weather, but lucked out. We booked a regular suite and were upgraded to a two bedroom suite which was unbelievable with nightly turn-down service and daily breakfast. Everyone was SO friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet and dinner at Safron was absolutely delicious. We were slightly disappointed about the lack of Mexican flare at the hotel, but it is Thai inspired. We were able to go to a neighboring hotel (Rosewood Mayakoba) for a traditional Mexican dinner and it was unreal. I highly recommend coming here for a romantic getaway - you don't have to leave your suite unless you want to, and even when you do, you probably won't run into too many people (we saw the most people at breakfast). We would absolutely love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: magicshel
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree Resort was lovely, the setting was even more beautiful than the photos seen on tripadvisor. We had a smooth check in, the Concierge service was outstanding throughout our stay. Our Villa was gorgeous, the closet space was fantastic. We loved the separate Pavillion for Dining and relaxing. Yes, the pool was unseated but just fine. The outdoor living space was fabulous.loved the bathroom and outdoor tub. All of our meals were delicious, we had breakfast included and I enjoyed the special champagne drink each morning. We dined at the other two Sister properties and they were excellent. We were shuttled almost every night over to the tennis courts and they turned on the lights for us and picked us up. The swimming pools were nice, clean and the surrounding were lovely. The beachside pool is not large so we got there early to grab a chair. Constant poolside service, towels, bar etc. the beach was fine, the water was a bit chilly in February but we still dove right in. We enjoyed the Spa couples "rain thingy" experience and it was fun, refreshing and soothing. My husband had a massage at the spa as well. We loved it. Renting bicycles was the best call! Thank you tripadvisor friends for that tip!!! We rode bikes all over the place. I felt safe even at night and the security was top notch. Overall, our Banyan Tree experience was excellent. Because of the setting, I thought that I would miss a "beachfront" style Holiday. But I didn't at all. The Villas make you feel like you are in a vacation home not a Hotel room. The privacy is wonderful and the services were great. We really enjoyed our stay. If you want peace, quiet, serenity and natural beauty stay at the Banyan Tree.
