If you want nightlife and a happening bar, don't stay here. Overall, our experience was excellent at the Banyan Tree. We never encountered Mosquitos, as another poster claimed, nor ants or any bugs of any sort. We

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: TheTub
Reviews.Content: The resort is located in the new Mayakoba complex (about 40 minutes drive from Cancun Airport -- USD250 return with the hotel transfer or USD130 return with an equivalent external premium transfer service -- and 15 minutes from Playa del Carmen). The complex, set amongst a large network of mangroves and canals, comprises three resorts (the Banyan Tree, the Fairmont and the Rosewood), an 18-hole golf course managed by the Fairmont, as well as room for two additional resorts. The set-up of the Banyan Tree, similarly to that of the Fairmont and Rosewood, differs from your typical beach-side hotel, in that the majority of the villas (aside from very few large two-bedroom villas) do not face the sea. Instead, they are spread out in the mangroves, facing internal (man-made, surprisingly) canals, clustered around the main structure of the hotel where most amenities are (reception, restaurants, spa, boutiques, main pool, etc.). Guests access the beach through a beach club reachable by buggy, boat trip through the canals (from reception, about 10 mins every 15-30 mins) or bicycles (which can be rented for USD5 per day; journey time depends on location of the room, but I reckon anywhere between 5 and 15 minutes). Now, although this set-up can be strikingly pictoresque at times, being at least 10/15 minutes away from the beach may not be to everybody’s liking (I must say I wasn’t a huge fan) and it is something that should be borne in mind before booking. Rooms The rooms themselves are well appointed (we stayed in Garden Villas, the basic type), with a large-ish outdoor pool facing the mangroves/canals (not heated, a problem during the slightly cooler season), Bose stereo, large flat-screen TV, free Wi-Fi (which could have been decidedly faster), coffee machine (with Illy system), walk-in closet, large bathroom with separate tub (outdoor) and shower. As the hotel is relatively new, the state of décor/cleanliness in the room is immaculate. However, in my view, the key factor for the rooms is location - I recommend requesting villas that are close to reception, so that you can walk to the restaurants, spa, etc. As people have pointed out before, you do not want to be stuck somewhere in the middle between the beach and the reception area, which would force you to take the bicycle/buggy everywhere. As I have said before, very few (large) villas are actually by the beach, and you will invariably need some sort of transportation to access it, so you might as well be near reception. Beach The beach club, once you get to it, is rather disappointing. The pool is far too small and the beach loungers are mostly concentrated on the stretch of beach immediately facing the pool, which, during high season, makes for a rather unpleasant and cramped atmosphere (with loungers placed horizontally, i.e. not facing the sea, all next to each other, as you can see from some travelers’ pictures). There are some loungers located on an adjacent stretch of beach, which are more spread out so you don’t quite feel like a sardine. The catch is that you are exposed to more wind. There are two restaurants at the beach club, more on which later. The sea is also nothing special. The main pool by the reception area is quite nice and feels more secluded and intimate. It is heated, which is certainly a plus in December/January, and the are fewer, better spread-out loungers. Alas, most of them face the wrong way, away from the sun all day long. By my reckoning, there are only 6 or so loungers (by the children’s pool) which actually do face the sun. A rather silly design flaw, if you ask me. Which brings to another problem, the sun itself. At least in December/January, the sun sets rather early (at around 6pm) and is weak after 4pm. This is obviously not the fault of the resort but it is something that people should bear in mind when considering the Riviera Maya as a destination during the winter months. Restaurants As to the food, it tends to be rather good. As has been mentioned many times before, the breakfast buffet at Oriente is particularly well assorted, with pretty much every breakfast food you can think of, most of it of excellent quality. Tamarind, a Western-type formal(ish) a la carte restaurant, was truly excellent one night (tasting menu) and somewhat disappointing another (a la carte). Sands (by the beach club) and Reflections (by the main pool) were both excellent for lunch fare, with the club sandwich at Reflections one of the best I’ve had in a hotel recently. Saffron, Banyan Tree’s ‘signature’ Thai restaurant, was very good for dinner (a la carte). My only gripe is that there is a rotating buffet that alternates between Sands, Oriente and Saffron for dinner. We caught it at Sands (BBQ theme) and it really wasn’t very good I’m afraid. Then again, I am strongly prejudiced against buffets and I wished they got rid of them altogether, keeping both Saffron and Sands always a la carte at dinner time and simply shutting Oriente. Also, next to Sands, there is MK Blue, which, at least during high season, offers a light lunch-time BBQ buffet to relieve some of the pressure off Sands. We tried it once and it was just about OK (all the meats were pre-cooked of course and simply re-grilled to order, a la Nando’s). The prices are reasonable, perhaps cheaper than at expensive US resorts and certainly much cheaper that a equivalent resorts in Europe (USD10-20ish for starters, USD20-40ish for main courses, USD15 for cocktails, USD6 for beer, etc.), though bear in mind the service charge and taxes (more on the former below). In particular, the wine list was put together with an eye to value, with decent bottles at, considering the context, far from extortionate prices, with plenty of (good) choices below the USD100 mark and a fair few below the USD50 mark. For a resort of this kind, this was rather refreshing. Normally, you can also try the restaurants in the other Mayakoba resorts, something which we looked forward to doing. Alas, this was not an option during the Christmas/New Year period. Having said that the food was generally quite good, we had one spectacular disappointment – the New Year’s Eve ‘gala’ dinner at MK Blue, by the beach. At USD300 plus drinks, it was reasonably expensive and was, simply put, beyond redemption. With large communal tables of 10-12 people, food that was mostly pre-prepared and generally not very good (some sort of Asian fusion from hell), and really cheesy entertainment (band with Diana Ross wigs, fire jugglers, and, I kid you not, people on stilts), it felt very much like being at a poor wedding reception or corporate event. We dined out on two occasions: once at Luna Maya in Playa del Carmen (reasonably good Mexican food in a pleasant setting, away from the street chaos, though with painfully slow service) and once at La Marea restaurant at the Tides (the restaurant was very good; the hotel, which I had considered booking instead of the Banyan Tree, seemed rather charming, if a little bit on the tired side). Service The service was impeccable. It truly was. Everybody was extremely friendly, polite and efficient. I don’t think I exaggerate when I say that it probably was the best service I have come across in a resort of this sort recently. With one exception. I was told by a member of the concierge staff that, in light of the high season, it was highly advisable to book restaurants ahead. After some toing and froing with the concierge, we settled on a plan, which the concierge confirmed, including NYE dinner at MK Blue and a dinner at a restaurant in another Mayakoba resort. Upon arrival, I was presented with a restaurant itinerary for our stay. There was no mention of the other Mayakoba restaurant (only then I was told that during high season each Mayakoba resort only takes bookings from its own guests) or of the NYE dinner (which I had to book from scratch there and then; fortunately (or unfortunately, as it turned out), there were places left). The reservations at the Tides and Luna Maya were, however, confirmed. Or so we thought. When we showed up at both, they had no record of our reservations. Thankfully, both had tables available (though at Luna Maya the table was inside, which was not quite as pleasant as outside). All a bit bizarre, I must say. I planned on raising the issue with the concierge but never got around to it. I should also point out an oddity regarding the service charge. The room fee is subject to a 15% service charge, which, for a week during high season in a Garden Villa, comes to about a grand. I thought this would cover all tips in the hotel. Not so. Each food/beverage/service is subject to an additional 15% service charge. On top of that, you can leave ‘additional tip’. Frankly, I was a bit baffled by this entire arrangement and asked what it was all about. It seems that the 15% service charge is shared amongst all the hotel employees, whereas the ‘additional tip’ goes to the person that served you directly. Of course, as everybody was so nice, you always felt you should leave at least 5%-10% additional tip. However, if you take into account how much you’re paying for ‘service’ in total, it does add up. I did say that the prices for food/drinks are fair, so 15%-25% on that is fine, but the rooms are really quite expensive and paying 15% on that on top of everything else seems a bit much. Golf Although I am an appalling golfer, I did give the golf course a go. The green fee is not cheap at USD120 per person (from 3pm onwards) (plus USD40 for the clubs and a USD30 rider fee for those not playing), but the course seemed very good (at least to my decidedly amateurish eyes). Conclusion All in all, a beautiful resort, though not without flaws. For those looking for a ‘pure’ beach experience, as perhaps I was, I recommend looking elsewhere (not just in Playa, but beyond). For those who are keen on Playa, then, if you can live with not being right on the beach, then I suspect that, despite the hiccups, the Banyan Tree is as good as you’re going to get (possibly tied with the Rosewood). P.S. Unlike some posters below, we did not have any problems with mosquitoes at all and had only minor issues with the ants (not in the rooms, but when walking around/on the beach).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: thekiwiguy
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and stayed in some amazing places.....This place ranks right up there as one of my favorite. It was so good that we never left the resort to venture out and visit the local attractions! Everyday we woke up and talke about leaving the resort, but everyday we were seduced by the tranquility of the place. From the AMAZING breakfast buffet that was open till noon everyday, thru to the surperb private beach and plunge pools...we were totally impressed. The management has clearly put alot of effort into their hiring, and the types of folks that want working there also, because all the staff we AMAZING! There was absolutely nothing they would not do for us when we asked. We had a garden villa and it was perfect for the two of us. The villa came complete with a private pool and deck which was a total treat. The main pool in the resort is also amazing and HUGE. There were many highlights, but the standout for us was the quality of service and the FOOD as all the restaurants on site. Really top notch stuff. The food/beverage manager (Pedro) has a ton of experience and when we chatted with him, it was clear that he was very talented. He was also very friendly and helpful. The Spa was another highlight! Chandra gave me one of the best massages i have ever had! I loved it so much that i had to go back and get a second one! Overall this place rocks.....Its not overrun with loud obnoxious people (like the all inclusive places are), and even though its huge, we always felt like we had the place to ourselves. I highly recommend this place, and we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit was not as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: scott g
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and i have stayed at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. The first time was in in 2009 several months after they opened, and when time opened usually improves the quality of service and getting out the kinx, the oppositie was true with this property. First, lets start with the positive. I must admit, the rooms at this place are incredible and at the price point, nearly impossible to beat. Huge rooms, private pools, etc. However, the service has gone downhill BIG time since the first visit. The attention to detail seems to have vanished and they have a REALLY hard time managing their own reservation systems. 2 examples. They have on sight special BBQs on the beach. When we attempted to sign up, we were told it was booked solid and they had no space. They called us last minute with a cancellation. Well, when we got to the BBQ, we literally were one of about 3 couples there over a two hour window- so "sold out" didnt appear to be the case. Same holds true with their Eco Tour-- every time we tried to sign up for it, completely booked. But when we finally got on the last day of our trip due to a couple cancelling, we literally were the ONLY ONES on the boat. Again- bad management of their own reservations systems. Food was ok- but worth having a car and going in to Playa for better, more authentic, and more reasonably priced food. Finally- while the first time around, we didnt seem to mind the carts you have to take to the beach club. Well this time we had our infant in tow, and realized it is a bit of a pain to have to load up all of his stuff on a cart, and constantly be waiting for transportation, to get back and forth to the villa. All in all, its still a nice place and i would recommend it- but its not the stand out amazing property i remembered from our first trip-- service needs a serious upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Five star potential, four star review”
Reviews.Author: maddeline
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying Banyan Tree is a truly lovely resort with amazing service and I will recommend it to friends in the future. Our courtyard garden villa (one level above the basic) had high ceilings, plenty of space, and a separate sitting room that served as an office. Our private plunge pool was large enough to swim in and the jacuzzi was fantastic. The grounds are gorgeous, there were always friendly faces available to help, the buffet breakfast was scrumptious, the spa delightful, room service exquisite, and Saffron restaurant was perfect (see below) In sum, it is a world class resort. So why the four star review? Well we had a rough start. We arrived at noon and were informed our room would not be ready until 3. Totally fair since that is check in time. We went to the beach to wait, ordered some food (they got the order wrong) and when we inquired about our room at 2, they informed us shortly thereafter that our room was ready. We packed up our stuff and took the five minute golf cart ride to the room. When we arrived the seemingly confused host asked our names and realized that this was not our room (which was a blessing since this room 211 is between the beach ad the lobby making either one a significant hike). We stood there for ten to fifteen minutes as she made phone calls only to eventually inform us that this was not our room. We were taken back to the lobby and then just left there until we walked in to ask what was going on and were finally informed our room was ready (which we loved and was in a perfect location walking distance from the main lobby).  Other issues were related to the fact that in high season they seem a bit overwhelmed. We had to wait for a table on more than one morning at the breakfast buffet, the tour guide/travel advisor was almost always occupied with others, and the gym was often crowded with one cardio machine (out of four) that was out of order for most of the week and another that worked on and off. We informed the staff about it but they remained out of order and so we simply had to forego cardio on a couple of occasions (I know not the end of the world but still. . .) Finally, when they moved the lovely Saffron into a different location due to weather claiming it would be the same food, service etc., it was a shell of our first experience with none of the amenities and only mediocre service (the other restaurant tamarind is also lovely). Bottom line, this is, I am confident, a five star resort in the off season, was slightly below that for us but we would certainly consider returning again!

Reviews.Title: “Totally beautiful”
Reviews.Author: copygirlBoston
Reviews.Content: The grounds, the buildings, the pools , the rooms are all gorgeous. The people are very friendly and it seems genuine. The beginning of December seems to be a slow period (remember this for next year) and we were able to get a great rate and an upgrade from the lowest category room to the next level. With the upgrade comes an additional room with a living and dining area, a slightly larger pool and a hot tub. I would definitely want these again for our next visit. Our room was close to the lobby area and 2 of the 4 restaurants - which means that it was quite far from the beach. However, every half hour during the daylight hours there is a boat that leaves from the lobby to the beach area. It takes about 10 minutes and it is just so serene and beautiful - I looked forward to it each time. If you miss the boat there are always golf carts ready to take you back and forth. The beach is very nice and the beach front pool is heated. There is also a big, beautiful pool in the lobby area which is unfortunately not heated so I never saw anyone in it. I knew going in that our villa pool would be unheated so I didn't expect to use it. I forced myself to go in one day and it was okay once I got used to it, but not really enjoyable. My husband went in a couple of times and said it was "refreshing". The restaurants were all very nice and the food was very good. Tamarind and Saffron were both very beautiful at night. If we had stayed another few days we would have liked to try the restaurants at Rosewood or elsewhere, but we never felt the nned to leave the premises for the 4 days were there. Of course, nothing is totally perfect. The bathroom and dressing area lighting is not very good for putting on makeup. The outdoor dining table and chairs in our villa could use a coat of paint. And install some heaters in the pools - personally, I would pay an extra daily charge for a heated pool.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel that misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: travelingdad56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for 6 nights. The resort is magnificent in so many ways but the service is very uneven and it makes a potentially great experience just a very good one. The facilty is beautiful. We stayed in a garden one bedroom. We had our own pool (not heated) with a covered outside seating area directly on the lagoon. The room was large, the bathroom spacious with a great rainforest type shower and an outdoor bath. Unfortunately the room had a mildew smell that wouldn't go away. The courtyard of the room was in mild disrepair. The pool had cracks in the paint. The stones were dirty and the grass had weeds.The air conditioning was impossible to regulate and it was either freezing or boiling. Everyone was very nice and agreeable but never got the task done. A free newspaper is suppose to be delivered daily. I asked for the New York Times Digest to be delivered with the USA Today. It came once and each request was met with we will get it for you tomorrow. Every restaurant on the property (including the ones at the Fairmont and the Rosewood) were booked. The reception desk "worked hard " to get us in for dinner. Yet when we arrived at the restaurants and for the duration of the meal the place was at best half full. The same thing happened when making a reservation for the Eco Tour. It was full and so we waited 2 days to get a space. Friends also staying at the hotel tried to get on the boat but were told it was full. The boat left with 4 empty spaces. The spa is outstanding. We got a couples massage that was terrific. The gym was totally inadequate. The fitness room had 2 treadmills and 2 elliptical machines one of which was broken the entire stay. Later I was told it was broken for over a month. When we arrived the hotel was 70 percent full after 2 days it was at 100 percent capacity. While you don't feel the crowd the staff is clearly overwhelmed by the hotel being full. They are always smiling and trying but they are not competent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: NYBK100
Reviews.Content: We were a bit skeptical about paying this amount for a resort in Mexico, but by the end of the trip, it was clear that new standards have been set. A few cons before we get to the pros. -We went in December and were eaten by mosquitoes. Although this maynot be indicative of the resort and just the area/season, waking up with mosquito bites makes for an itchy day! -There are 2 fine dining restaurants at the Banyan Tree with the option to also go to sister resorts (the Rosewood and The Fairmont) aswell. However, when we were there the Rosewood had private events, so the restaurants were not available. Advice: take the time to book in advance and know your options. Pros: -The Banyan Tree resort is beautiful. Immaculately maintained with all the amenities you could want in a resort. The villas were spaced out nicely to allow for adequate privacy but you didn't feel deserted. The beach and pool club was a little far, but one can easily call to be escorted by golf cart or rent bikes for the duration of your stay, like we did. The bike ride was really nice and bikes can be parked easily all over the resort. The villas are very modern with attention to every detail to make your stay comfortable. When we were there the plunge pools were too cold to use, however we imagine these are a wonderful amenity to have when visiting in the summer. -The breakfast at the Oriente was great. A versatile offering of food each day, all prepared fresh and well made. The juice bar was a favorite of mine, especially the delicious Green Juice (Jugo Verde), which I wish I had gotten the recipe for! The lunch option was mainly the Sands, which was right by the beach. This was adequate for lunch and the convenience of not having to leave the pool/beach area was great. For dinner, we dined one night at Tamarind and another night at Saffron. Both were very good, with excellent service catering toany special food needs you may have. The experience at both were very enjoyable. The third night we took a recommendation from the hotel of a place to go to in Playa del Carmen called Maya Luna. The food was ok, the service was good but the area around the restaurant was empty (it was raining that night), so we didn't walk around and returned right after our meal. Unless you plan on walking around, probably not worth it. -The boat tour of the mangroves was something we were going to skip, but then upon recommendation of the staff, we decided to go. It was definitely a fun/interesting thing to do. We were able to see some beautiful birds, croccodiles and some other parts of the Mayakoba property. It took about 1hr and 15 min to do and the boat ride was pleasant. -We also had an excellent experience at the Spa. The masseuses were extremely skilled and the spa itself was really clean and calming. -Lastly, the service throughout the entire resort was impeccable and extremely impressive. We were always greated with a smile and anything we needed was attended to within seconds. The staff is constantly communcating via radio/earpiece in a subtle manner that ensures that the resort runs securely and efficiently and all guests are attended to. Advice: Bring extra singles with you for tipping. We ran out of them and getting change was only possible at the main reception (which, with the layout of this hotel, we didn't frequent). Given the extraordinary service, you will want to show your appreciation.We really can't say enough about the wonderful service at the Banyan Tree and it is one of the leading reasons we will definitely return! Thank you to everyone that made it enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: TylerREBroker
Reviews.Content: If you have read any of my reviews from other locations/resorts, you will find that my wife and I make it somewhat of a hobby to find and visit the new and highly rated resorts..mainly in the Caribbean. Until now, we have not re-visited any of those resorts. We originally visited the Banyan Tree when it was new and we were extremely impressed. In fact, it sort of set the standard by which we judge other resorts. It is likely our favorite resort, but I think it is more a summation of the entire package that makes it that. You simply will not find any nicer accommodations and or service anywhere. I can see where some of the reviewers are coming from when they talk about how far away the beach is, but when you combine the outstanding food (far better this time around in our opinion) with the close proximity of the town of Playa (which is our favorite town in Mexico), it is just a hard combination to beat. Along with the improvement of cuisine I found it very interesting to see how the landscaping has matured to provide the privacy that it was obviously designed to do. If you go here and you find a resort that you feel is superior, please tell me where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place with rooms, service and facilities second to none. The staff were attentive and went out of their way ensure our stay was sensational. The location although extremely secluded and quiet which suited the ambience was a fair way from the 2 main towns. There was no hotel shuttle and or transport which could be something that could be considered going forward. Having said that you go to this Banyan Tree for relaxation and privacy so wanting to go to Playa or Cancun is not high on the list of things to do. Would recommend a stay here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Finest hotel in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: alexshulman
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our third trip to BT. We are obviously big fans of this resort and this was our third visit in the last two years. This hotel delivers a unique, luxurious, relaxing feel that they have been able to preserve since opening. Their service, from the moment you arrive to the property to the minute you get into the car to go to the airport, is outstanding with a great attention to detail without being overbearing. A few areas that stand out: 1) service @ breakfast buffet (Compliments to Chef Erik Sanz)- in my opinion, their breakfast buffet, in terms of variety, presentation and quality, is one of the best in North America, 2) pool/beach service- very comfortable lounge chairs and overall clean, well kept, well serviced, not overcrowded beach area, 3) Sands Restaurant- we had lunch and dinner there. Ambience, quality of food, level of service deserves high praise, 4) In Villa dining- we orderd room service 2 nights and the food, presentation, promptness of delivery were excellent, 5) quality of villa/surround area- clean, outstanding furniture/amenities. Overall, BT remains one of the finest resorts that we have visited in twenty years of travelling on both side of Atlantic. Sincerely, Alex Shulman

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Banyan Tree at Mayakoba was a great experience. I enjoyed the fact of being sourrounded by a fabulous nature , having privacy, tranquility and good service. I enjoyed as well playing golf and relaxing at the beach club. I didn´t like so much the accommodation I had. I was in a big three rooms Tower Villa, where the bedrooms were downstairs and that made them dark and not so pretty as other smaller villas with a little garden.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate, book now!”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDC
Reviews.Content: Love this property. From check in to check out, they make you feel very much at home. The food, villas and beach are beyond compare. Loved it and hope to go back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree is a wonderful resort. The service, food, and the property itself are all truly outstanding! The villa are beautiful and the spa is incredible. I would recommend to anyone that the go to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: brooke103
Reviews.Content: We just returned a little over a week ago from this exquisite resort, and we are still talking about how we can't wait to get back. We chose the Banyan Tree Mayakoba under an unusual set of circumstances - we had actually rented a house on the beach that was horrible upon arrival. Frantically I used TripAdvisor to find a suitable replacement for the remainder of our trip, and I knew Banyan Tree from some Asian vacations my husband and I had taken. We both agree now that it was the best thing that could have happened to us, as we would not have found this oasis of a vacation destination to which we are certainly planning to return. We literally showed up at the front door asking if they had availability, as the house we had rented did not have cell service. We felt welcomed right from the start, with fresh towels and drinks for the whole family. They took ALL of our bags, including a ton of groceries (since we had been planning to cook), to our room and didn't say a word about the hassle. They escorted us to their family-friendly restaurant while our room was being prepared, and that was the start of our worry-free, spoiled-rotten vacation. A few people have noted that they did not think the Banyan Tree was a preferable resort to take your children. I whole-heartedly disagree. The 3-bedroom townhouse could not have been more perfect for our family, with the roof-top pool and the small kitchen. I read that some of the villas had separate rooms that small childrens would have to walk across a courtyard and/or pool to get to their parents. To those folks I would say - get the townhouse. All 3 rooms on the same level with your children just across the hallway. Everyone had their own bathroom, and tons of room for all of our family "stuff". I also think that the rooftop pool was perfect for a family - a good size and not bothering anyone with the kids splashing around. The Banyan Tree was VERY catering to our family. We even called to ask if they had a baby gate to keep our 1-year-old from falling down the stairs, and they had one to us in short order with the tags still on it. We joked that they probably didn't have one, but ran right out to buy one for us. Now that's service! The service really was top-notch. From the same waiter that greeted us every morning and welcomed us to the fantastic breakfast buffet, to the employees always willing to whisk us away on a golf cart to wherever we wanted to go. The turn down services were so nice....the candles and the soft relaxing music. It was even romantic with a baby and toddler running around! The whole family loved the boat tour, as we cruised around the riverways of the resort with an incredibly nice host who went out of his way to show my kids animals that would make them squeal with joy. One of the highlights exemplifying the service at this resort was a request we had on Thanksgiving day. They were only serving Thanksgiving dinner at their "adults only" restaurant, which at first really disappointed us, as we were there with our 3 kids and wanted to celebrate this day as a family. Instead they brought us the entire meal, course by course, to our room and set it up at our in-room dining table. The poor guy had to keep going back to get the next course, but it was all delicious and presented in such a lovely setting. It was a fantastic Thanksgiving! We were so grateful they made that happen for us at our request. We are just thrilled to have found a non-traditional resort in Mexico, as my husband and I both agree that we are not as in to the typical all-inclusive resorts there. We absolutely love Asia and their amazing properties, of which the Banyan Tree reminds us. I sometimes had to remind myself that we were actually in Mexico, and not Bali. For us, having this type of property on the other end of a 3-hour direct flight, is something we are DEFINITELY going to take advantage of for future family and "just us" trips. Thank you, Banyan Tree, for taking care of us in our time of need. We'll be seeing you again soon! PS - don't forget the mosquito repellent. Unfortunately the way it is being surrounded by water, but with repellent, it was no-big-deal.

Reviews.Title: “The best for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Munster
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. I have done a fair amount of travel and this is the best place I have stayed. Why? service, accommodations, unique, private, tranquil, luxurious, etc. Their were families here, but this is a fantastic place for couples to spend time with each other. This is a great place for a honeymoon, anniversary or any special occassion. The reviews you read about this place are true! It will exceed your expectations. We especially enjoyed Cesar and Alejandro at breakfast. They wait in the Oriente breakfast buffet. They were extremely personal and warmed our mornings. They remembered our names and always made us feel welcome. As many have mentioned the breakfast buffet is incredible. It had plentiful offerings of fresh fruit and juices, meats, cheeses, breads, mexican specialties, omlettes prepared to order, etc. We dined at Sands at the beach for a late lunch. Open air, nice selection of foods, the most reasonably priced restaurant on property. We also dined at Tamerind. The setting was very nice, but the food was amazing. My wife and I both had the carrot soup. I had lobster and she had scallops. I finished with the lemon pie. Everything was incredibly tasty. We would finish our buffet every morning and take the 15 minute stroll down to the beach. The pool and beach setting was private and beautiful with great service. We would walk back in the afternoon and relax in the very private pool and courtyard at our villa. (110) I also want to mention Fransisco in reception. He was a delight. Quick with a smile and always willing to help with recommendations. Take the boat to the beach once. Worth the trip, beautiful scenery. The golf course looked challenging as well. I did not play on this trip though. There is more to stay, but here are my Pro's and Con's (not really) Pro's - Great service - no one passes you without smiling and saying hello. It appears genuine. Either way, the staff has been well trained. - Private, tranquil, and relaxing. - Great Spa - my wife and I enjoyed a couples massage. - Adequate work out facility - Wifi included throughout the resort - Private, uncrowded beach - Fantastic restaurants - There are more, but you get the idea. Con's - - It is expensive, but worth it if you can afford it. - If you are looking for something where you walk out of your room and onto the beach, this probably isn't your property. - If you like crowds and being around alot of people etc., not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: iloveshoes72
Reviews.Content: Whatever you thought you knew about a resort...think again. The Banyan Tree is absolutely stunning. I think I might have had the best massage I've ever had in my life. And I love a massage! Would highly recommend for lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: FR88_11
Reviews.Content: Hard to imagine more extraordinary accommodations. Every "villa" has its own pool and private courtyard, and no interior walls connect with your neighbor giving you complete privacy and quiet. Just check the pictures on their website. The entire time we were there we continually marveled at the vision, the design execution, and the incomprehensible amount of money that went into building what is arguably the finest resort in North America - built in the middle of a swamp in Mexico. But this "swamp" is unlike any I've ever seen before. It is uniformly lush and green, with all the vegetation at a uniform height, and the water is crystal clear and pristine. The manicured quality of all the wild vegetation sometimes made it hard to determine where the landscaping ended and the wild swamp began. And the most amazing thing we noticed was the complete lack of bugs at the resort (in November). Everything said about the high quality of service is true. An example of the attention paid to the customer occured during routine turndown service. My partner and I are both over 6' tall, and one of the guest robes was a small. I noticed the next day it got discretely changed to a large. Same was true with ice. (Why is it the more deluxe the resort the more involved it is to get ice?) When we ordered some upon our arrival, it came in a small insulated ice chest. Perfect - it lasted two days. The third day, upon returning from dinner, we were delighted to see it had been thoughtfully refilled. Breakfast was a treat. Included with the room rate, the buffet menu changed daily with a wonderful variety of interesting dishes. Not once did I go to the omelet station - I can have standard eggs and bacon anywhere - but grazing the constantly changing, high quality array of food items was a great way to start the day. Regarding the other restaurants, the food and drink at the hotel is uniformly good, if rather pricey. Drinks are $15 each, but I must say, the Mai Tais at the Beach Club pool were abundantly sized and superb, nearly equaling the slightly drier original only available at Trader Vic's. Also, the Sands Restaurant at the Beach Club is terrific for light lunches. We ate there twice. This is an amazing, unique place, unlike any I have ever encountered. Our stay there was magical. Before arriving, I read that many people never left the property once they arrived. i thought, how odd, with such a lively town nearby with so many restaurants, etc. But after being at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba I now understand why you never want to leave! (But we did leave to explore a bit, and enjoyed dinners in Playa and a trip to Tulum.) Highly recommend this place. Spring for the extra $$$ it costs to stay here - it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Couples Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: atlmojo
Reviews.Content: Went here with my husband for our one year wedding anniversary and it was fantastic! Our room was upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa and it was beautiful and spacious! I literally could jump into our private pool from the bedroom. Bikes are available for rental to get around the property or you can call for transportation which arrives promptly. The service there was incredible! Everyone was well mannered, informative, well groomed, and spoke english and spanish fluently. The food was great and I especially liked the breakfast; fresh juice every morning! Please go to the spa! My husband and I had the rainforest indulgence (I'm not sure if that was the exact name or not but it's something similar) and it was amazing!!! Bottom Line: This is a must go for couples. Great honeymoon spot as well. Would not recommend if you're looking for the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but not as good as it was last year....”
Reviews.Author: Runningshoes
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. After a spectacular experience last year, we decided to return. Overall, I would still say this is a fantastic property with great service. However, the bar was set quite high last year and somehow Banyan Tree didn't quite live up to expectations on this stay. As someone that was looking to get a work out in on their vacation every day, the gym was a real let down. For a property of this caliber you would expect something much nicer. It is very small with 4 pieces of cardio equipment -- one machine was out of order and the other 3 had touch screens which were not calibrated properly leading to frustration for anyone attempting to use them. The temperature in the gym was 77 degrees despite numerous complaints I heard every day from other guests to the staff. The gym is so small there is no room to put a mat out anywhere. There was one mat provided in the gym which happened to be really gross and dirty. While the service at Banyan Tree is still great, it is not at the same level as last year. For example, on our previous stay we were assigned a resort host who checked in with us every day at breakfast and was the one point person we dealt with during our entire stay for all requests and issues. This time we were not assigned such a host. There was also a hiccup with our transportation reservation to go to the airport. Despite receiving written confirmation that transportation has been arranged, turned out it wasn't. We had to order a taxi at the last minute resulting in about a 20 minute delay in getting to airport. The resort was a lot busier this time than on our previous stay which I think impacted service all round. Buggies could take 15-20 minutes to get to your villa, phone calls to guest services took longer to get answered (sometimes no answer), and service was slower at breakfast. The quality of the villas and housekeeping is still outstanding. We had a courtyard pool villa which is the same as the spa villa we stayed in last year minus an outdoor shower and roof top massage tables which we didn't miss. Having experienced a "perfect" stay on our first trip, we noticed other minor items that we probably wouldn't have otherwise. However nothing was significant enough to prevent us from coming back to Banyan Tree Mayakoba.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing stay with top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: Just fantastic! We always stay in five star resorts and the Banyan Tree Mayakoba provided us with some of the best accomodation we have ever stayed in. We had booked a Courtyard Pool Villa, but on arrival were upgraded to a 2 Bedroom Pool Villa. The villa was so spacious, private and spotlessly clean that we spent most of our time in our own garden lounging by our pool and enjoying the hottub. The breakfast buffet was amazing, with a huge array of choices, and was served until midday so you could turn it into brunch if you wished! We stayed 9 nights and in that time ate in all three of the restaurants.My partner has a wheat and dairy intolerance and we found that all of the restaurants bent over backwards to accommodate his dietary requirements, bringing him all sorts of special dishes and generally spoilling him! Every meal we had was delicious and although not cheap was of a standard that you would expect in some top London restaurant. We particularly loved eating on the dock at Saffron, very romantic! Cycling to the beach every afternoon for cocktails and a walk by the ocean was the only exercise we managed all week. The beach was a tiny bit disappointing, and there were areas that we felt were not being properly cleaned, but it was lovely sitting at the beach club and looking out to sea. The staff throughout the resort were excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone had a smile for you. I would recommend the complementary Mangrove Tour, it was really interesting and a relaxing way to while away an hour. We also spent the day on a tour with a company called 'Your Private Tour' which was fantastic. (See separate review) A truly relaxing and luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - Best room we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: MAW-Oldham
Reviews.Content: What an unbelievable hotel this is. A 10.5 hour flight each way for a week in the sun needs the hotel to be something special and BT Mayakoba certainly didn't disappoint. As always at Banyan Trees we were met in reception and givena gift of a flower bracelet and a soothing drink as we checked in before being taken to our villa. We had booked a garden villa but were upgraded to a courtyard villa. We've stayed in some fantastic rooms in the past but I think this probably claimed the top prize. The villa comprised a large bedroom with huge patio doors that take you straight into the pool and a lovely big bathroom off which is a walk in wardrobe and a wet room. The bath is located outside. Across the courtyard was the pavillion. This was a lounge come dining room which in itself is probably as large as some rooms we've previously stayed in. As has been mentioned on here in other reviews, the pool itself (which was about 10-12 metres long) is a little nippy, especially as ours never really got the sun. It wasn't too cold to stop me doing 10 lengths before breakfast each morning though. The resort as a whole is stunning although I can imagine some people being frustrtated that the beach is a fifteen minutes walk away. There are buggies and a boat though if you don't want to walk. We found it was nice to have a stroll, especially outside the hottest hours of the day. It is a bit strange in the resort as even when it is full, the fact that all suites have their own pool means that the public areas are very quiet. This was perfect for us but some people might like somewhere a little more lively. There isn't a great choice of restaurants but the food is excellent. The breakfast at Oriente was wonderful. A wide variety of food including many items you would never associate with breakfast. For dinner, Oriente didn't open but on a rotating basis, two out of Saffron, Sands and Tamarand. We ate in both Saffron and Sands where the menu was varied and the food delicious. The only negative comment I would have about the hotel was the staff on reception. They were friendly enough but the customer service didn't quite live up to the rest of the staff. We were given incorrect information on more than one occasion and they also failed to inform the bell boys that we had checked out despite me asking for the cases to be picked up and when trying to book a restaurant several hours before dinner didn't let me know until an hour before the booking that it was full and so they hadn't been able to confirm the bookings. On the final day we did the Eco tour on the boat around the resort's rivers. I would highly recommend this but make sure you book it early as it can only accommodate about 6 people per day.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was the first 5star location that I have stayed at. Breakfast was the most amazing food that I have ever had. Resort was 80% sold out and we still felt like we were the only people there. Their employes are trained to anticipate what you want before you even do. Everyones English was better than mine! LOL. Great place and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations...AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria L
Reviews.Content: I'm always cautious about getting my hopes up for a place then finding little things (dust balls hiding in the corners, not enough towels, run down furniture, etc) wrong that would irritate me. This place was not the case and it was absolutely stunning from the moment we entered the first gate and started our long (but beautiful) drive towards the main reception. The entire resort is beautifully manicured with lush trees, shrubs, flowers, and grass. This is the first time I've felt like I was on a vacation and felt the special treatment. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. This was the first vacation for my boyfriend and I and I couldn't have asked for a more perfect place. We rented bikes to get around the property and it was the perfect combo of relaxed bonding time with my love and you're on the move to your next destination.Our villa was stunning from our own pool to the hammock to the incredible bathroom, to the grand master bedroom...all the details were closely paid attention to and there was not one thing I was unhappy with. If you are thinking about this place...book it! I promise there will be no disappointments. I miss it already and I left less than 24hrs ago.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Maya Riviera”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Maya Riviera a number of times and the Banyan Tree Mayakoba is by far the best value for the money in the area and an absolutely spectacular resort. The villas are private, gorgeous, luxe and huge, the spa and service impeccable, the beach perfect. The whole experience for us defined a tranquil, luxurious getaway and proved much more satisfying (for pretty much the same price tag) than the spartan Rosewood and the downright depressing, sloppy, past-its-prime Tides (even after the renovations).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Neshell
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew we found somewhere special to celebrate our honeymoon. Our villa was amazing with a private pool and hot tub. The living room was nice but not necessary. Everything else was perfect. The staff here are so helpful and friendly. The tour office helped us to book two great day trips for diving in Cozumel and to ruins and a cenote. We dined at Saffron a Thai restaurant at the resort. Absolutely delicious! The duck curry is a must! Finally our trip to the spa really was a cherry on top of the sundae! Thanks banyan tree for a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location for a relaxing week”
Reviews.Author: tonka100
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Banyan Tree Resort and I was mightily impressed. They pretty much got everything right. I just wished the staff smiled a bit more. I didnt get a sense of team spirit at the resort and the staff looked a little unhappy. Mexico is full of amazing people but something has been lost at Baynan Tree. I suggest the management visit Vila Vita in Portugual to see how simple eye contact and smiles with the guests can make a massive difference. Not withstanding this - this hotel is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Exclusive all Villa Resort near Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: krnesbitt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for a long weekend trip with another couple in late August of 2011. We rented a car and drove to the property from the Cancun airport. It took us about 45 minutes to an hour to reach the resort complex. The Mayakoba resort complex contains the Banyan Tree, the Fairmont, and the Rosewood Hotels. Once inside the large, main gate (with security personnel who verify your reservation) you drive through winding paths of trees & grasses to reach the actual hotel. You will encounter at least one other security guard on the path to the resort, who will again verify that you are a guest of the resort. May seem like a bit much, but I did feel very safe at this resort. All the villas at this resort have their own private pool, which we loved. It is actually large enough to swim around a little bit, or have at least 4 to 5 people in it. The villa had a good sized courtyard area with two beach chairs and an umbrella set up by the pool. The villa entrance has a large privacy fence, and large bushes frame the other side of the courtyard. Privacy is paramount here, which is great for couples. The villa itself was beautiful. It was very large and airy, due mostly in part to the 20 or 30 foot ceiling in the bedroom area. The bathroom is well appointed, with a rainfall shower, ceramic Mexican-inspired sinks, and an outdoor bathtub. You will also receive two travel kits-one for men, one for women, with any sort of toiletry or other amenity you could possibly need. We also really liked the large, walk-in closet, that allowed us to keep all our luggage (including my scuba gear) and clothing out of sight, but well organized and easily accessible. The mini-bar in the room is nicely stocked, and there is an iPod/iPhone dock in your room should you want to play your own music. The only issue we had with anything in the room was trying to get the coffee maker to work! My husband struggled with it for a while and finally did get it to work. We had a great meal at Saffron Restaurant, excellent service, wine selection, and food. On our last morning at the Banyan Tree, we asked the staff to set up a private dinner for the four of us in the resort's wine cellar that evening. They gladly obliged, drew up a menu, sent it to us for approval, and paired excellent wines with each meal course. Our waiter was extremely attentive, friendly, professional, and well versed on both food and wine. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip. The breakfast setup was well done and had a myriad of different choices, from eggs prepared to your liking, to cereal, yogurt, pastries, fruit, and some Asian specialties. The freshly-squeezed and/or prepared juices were delicious! The experience is taken a notch higher with the addition of sparkling wine. :) We liked the pool with the swim-up bar, and the beach was also well maintained. You can either request a golf cart to take you to the beach, or take a boat through the mangrove-lined freshwater estuary. The bar had a great atmosphere to relax with friends and enjoy drinks and tapas. There was even live music on some evenings. My husband and our friends utilized the gym, and enjoyed the facility and the equipment (all brand-new and top-notch!) Should you want to go anywhere around the resort and not walk, simply call the front desk, and a golf cart will arrive in short order to pick you up and take you wherever you wish. I would definitely recommend renting a car and getting off the property (as nice as it is!) to explore Playa del Carmen, the Tulum Ruins, and some of the other smaller towns, like Puerto Morales. Bottom Line: We would certainly return to Banyan Tree Mayakoba. The service, food, and facilities were excellent and top of the line!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Long Island City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Total Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An amazing trip!!! The minute we entered the grounds of the resort we left all of our troubles behind. The place is absolutely beautiful and the service is by far the best I have had yet... Omar was especially great and a pleasure to chat with in the morning during breakfast. We were upgraded to a villa which was a nice surprise although it didn't have a jacuzzi ..this was a little disappointing as I was so looking forward to those relaxing moments and the turn down service with all the candles that I read so much about . The one suggestion I would have to make is that the lighting in the rooms are a bit to low in the villa we stayed in, especially in the bedroom since it is on the lower level (the villas have 3 floors)...it felt a bit dark at times. The food at the Sands (at beach & pool) was really good... we tried a few mixed drinks and was not so thrilled about them (a bit watered down) so we stuck to drinking ice cold coronas. The best drink I had at the resort was at to hotel's lobby bar "Copa". We also ordered food there which was great and not pricey. We also had dinner at Saffron (wanted to experience it) and I was not thrilled at all. It was definitely over priced and in my opinion not authentic Thai food..fine but not great..and again the drinks soso @ $15 per drink..didn't taste any alcohol in them at all and very small glass. We did go into town at Playa de Carmen 5th ave one night for dinner..cab there from hotel $20..cab back $12. You can easily catch a cab back on 5th. It was fun for one night..the rest of the trip we just stayed at the resort and ate there. For the transportation service to and from the airport; I arranged through "USA transfer" for a private car/van @ $80 total round trip for 2 people. Service was great and on time...could have went through another service "Best Way" for less but wanted our own car so that we didn't have to make any stops. We also added the stop to the "Big K Mart" for an additional $30 to pick up some stuff although the driver recommended to take us to a different store instead which he said was just as good (said it was closer to resort and to avoid construction traffic) was not great ...fine for the basics (water,soda,cigs) would not suggest. Overall it was an amazing trip. I was so sad to leave and definitely would go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Exclusive Hotel and Service !!”
Reviews.Author: salomas Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel in other world, please come here to experience it. Excellent service, rooms, staff, place, spa, etc. I stay only 2 nights and was enough to relax. Restaurants are five or more stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Brendan O
Reviews.Content: Banyan Tree is great. The service is excellent, grounds are immaculate. Good Stuff: 1. We got a free upgrade upon our arrival which was nice. 2. It was our anniversary and the hotel left us a bottle of wine and flower petals on our bed congratulating us. 3. Saffron has an excellent, excellent atmosphere and the food is great. It is worth the price. 4. All of the staff, from the beach to the restaurant to the general people we passed were super friendly. OK Stuff: 1. Bed in the townhouses were not amazingly comfortable. OK but not great. Tips: 1. Go to Playa del Carmen for a night at least. It will be worth it for the money you save on dinner. 2. If you rent a car, the gas station outside the airport WILL try to rip you off. They do accept credit no matter what they say.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, Friendly, Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: whit88
Reviews.Content: I went with my newly wed wife to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba in early November. This resort is simply stunning; I have been to none better. You get your own Villa with a decent sized pool. The pool isn't heated but, personally, was a great way to kick start the morning. You could walk right out of your bedroom, open the doors, and jump right in. The yard was very well kept, bordering the snaking mangroves/streams. There are ipod docks. Mini bar. In room dining. They give you little gifts every morning. The staff was kind, very concerned about your needs; I asked for some ice, they brought coolers of ice to my door. The rental car company had forgotten to return my credit card, they called them up and took care of it. One of the bartenders, who earlier in the week gave us a highly recommended Tequilla tasting, showed us out to look at the moon through a telescope on the lobby terrace. The food for breakfast was very good with plenty of options. It's a free buffet style with anything from sushi, to chicken curry, to waffles, to papaya and kiwi. We dined at the Saffron and Sands. I wouldn't say Saffron is a must; if you have good Thai food in your city, which we do as we're from NYC, then this isn't anything mind bending--and is a bit pricey. The location is nice; watch out for mosquitos. Sands is better; a bit more casual and with more Mexican flavors. We also had several mean cocktails by the beach around Sands--all of them strong and tasty. Do know that all food, and activity charges, come with a standard 15 percent service charge, which you can add more tip to. We had a sports massage which I'd recommend. Beautiful grounds for the spa. We took the free Eco tour by the Banyan tree in the lobby. Also recommended as we saw some Cenotes and Crocs. We also took a yoga class; our teacher was wonderful, she knew her stuff, but i'm not flexible, so I may have embarrassed myself. You can rent bikes but the walk isn't too bad and you can also call a buggy and they'll take you right there. The lobby's bar has live music at night and sell cigars. The reflections pool is well designed, clear and cool; you can swim around in a small loop and also wade right up to the pool bar. I would suggest making it out to Playa del Carmen if you're at the resort for more than a couple days--the food and experiences there are welcome changes to the secluded, relaxed scene at Banyan. We rented a car but they will call you a taxi. The only complaint I have was the way I was charged...My account had a hefty deposit held on it for several days after I left and I wasn't able to access any of those funds. It was resolved eventually--but I had to wait four days after I got back until that held deposit cleared. Best experiences: Lounging in our backyard in the Villa drinking Tequila, waking up and jumping in for a swim, having lunch and cocktails at Sands, Tequila tasting. Good but not musts: Spa treatment, Saffron. Five star trip and resort.

Reviews.Title: “There is no where else you should be ...”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing. It beat our every expectation and we have traveled to several world class resorts. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Our room was beautiful and relaxing at all hours. The nightly turndown service was great, and each night we were left another local art/craft to bring home. The pool bartenders and staff at Sands during the day are solid at offering the perfect cocktail and associated services. The life music in the lobby at night is to die for. We wish we would have known about it sooner on our trip. While the spa facilities were simple (outside of the rainforest walk, which rocked), the staff was world class. We would highly recommend dinner at Sands. We are big "foodies" and while the oher establishments were quite good. The food and service at Sands was unrivaled. We were on our honeymoon and we are already planning our 3 and 5 year aniversaries to this resort. Honestly, reading my review above, I have not done the Banyan Tree or its staff justice. We loved this place and words posted to TripAdvisor do not adequately reflect how amazingly pleased we were with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the middle of the Mangroves”
Reviews.Author: Gaelm0r
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW! The Villas are beautifully designed, comfortable, and well-appointed- step out of your room and your own private pool and hottub are right there. Entertaining? A separate day room is at your disposal. All the latest mod cons, subtle and unobtrusive design in every corner. They even thought of a hammock for two and a spa-level bathing tub that is designed to take mud baths. Once you step outside your villa (although you may not want to), bicycles are available to putter around the 15 hectare resort, which is build with Mother Nature in mind- take your bike to the only PGA golf-course on the Mexican Riviera, to the Sands, the beach club, the slow cruising boat that takes guests on Nature tours of the natural wetlands or the Spa. The tender touch massage I had there was easily one of the best I have ever experienced. Finally, I must speak of the service- I have stayed in many five star hotels, but the level of service that is demanded at the Banyan Tree is second to none. The staff are earnest, eager and actually happy to do their job, making this resort so heavenly. There are just two words of warning- 1. bring your bug spray, and use it often. Being essentially in the swamp, there are loads of voracious insects, all more than happy to deplete you of your blood, but it is a small price to pay for such a genuine experience. 2. The food is only so-so- they try, but I found most of my food a little undercooked and therefore had to be sent back, but there are excellent restaurants in the nearby fishing village. Not just a holiday but an event, each moment makes one feel pampered and indulged. Excellent for honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Heaven - can't wait till return”
Reviews.Author: happymamaof3
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 went to Banyan Tree back in 2010. It was a while ago but I thought the resort deserves a recognition. From the moment you get picked up from the airport, they made me feel like a special person. We asked the driver to stop by at a convenience store to pick up milk and water for our little kids and he was more than willing to accomodate and wait while we finished shopping. That was a nice begginning to our heavenly trip to Banyan Tree. We stayed at a 3 bedroom townhouse and it worked out perfectly. Each room was very well decorated at a 5 start level. Bathroom fixtures were top notch europeans. Linens were flawless. Attention to detail was clearly visible. We also had a kitchen and it helped a lot cooking for our picky 2 year old. The hotel seemed almost empty so we were able to truly relax. The open design similar to those seen in Bali was extremely airy and attractive. We spent more than $1000 a night but felt that we were getting a lot of value out of it but trust me, we're not millionaires. When the level of service, atmosphere and everything else balance well, that is when you feel like you're getting every single penny out of the experiences, and that is exactly how we felt in Banyan Tree. The rooftop pool was very nice for our screaming kids. I didn't need to worry about bothering other guests and the kids were able to play freely. The toddler pool in the main resort was very spacey and nice too. Breakfast was stunning. Nothing you can compare to fancy breakfast in the US. We were able to experience the true Asian-like hospitality in Mexico. We travled to Bali a few times and I have to say that it was almost close to the real thing. Service again was top notch. Every single person was there to please us including our 2 year old daughter. The boat-ride to the beach was fun too. We took a golf cart back to the room. The only thing is that several of us got sick toward the end of the trip. We were really careful about drinking water but we suspect that it may have come from one of the drinks we had in the beach resturant. Perhaps ice cubes...no idea. We had lunch there and got sick from the late afternoon and that basically ruined the rest of the trip. Again, everything is extremely clean on the surface and nicely decorated. Silverware and china were high end items and bathrooms were extremely well maintained. I still can't figure out how we got sick. However, the resort was beautiful, we had a great time and can't wait till going back.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good”
Reviews.Author: rizadorojo
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Banyan Tree, two years after the first. We were delighted to find it still gorgeous and welcoming. Our villa with bedroom and separate living room, was totally private, quiet, beautifully maintained. The restaurants, however, are less impressive this time around. Tamarind, which was formerly creative Mexican, is now more continental style. Saffron Restaurant is still Thai, but much less impressive this time. Breakfasts at Oriente are eclectic, with Asian, Mexican, and Western choices which were all good, but not great. Last time the breakfasts knocked our socks off with all the creative salsas, the buffet, and menu offerings. Now, there is an egg station instead of the menu with Mexican specialities. A little disappointing, too, to find out that now the hotel charges for bicycles. Seems like nickel and diming at a resort of this caliber. It was very flattering to be recognized by staff who remembered us from our former visit. Service everywhere--in the restaurants and throughout the hotel--was excellent, but there were a few misunderstandings with the front desk--when we called to get our car, they brought around one of the hotel vehicles, instead. All in all, the hotel seems a little less well run than on our previous visit.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation, but would try out rosewood mayakoba next time”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob21
Reviews.Content: my husband and I had a great five day trip to banyan tree mayakoba. There were definitely pros and cons, but all in all, would recommend this hotel. Our favorite parts of the vacation were: * the amazing breakfast - I would suggest trying EVERYTHING, the food was seriously awesome. I usually never eat a full meal, and I swear I ate as much as michael phelps. my favorite was the pineapple tamale, and i am so pissed that I didn't try it until our last day!! * the rainforest - this is like disneyland for adults. a guide takes you through all these spa's/sauna's/shower's to rejuvenate your body. it was AMAZING the first time around, but definitely wasn't necessary to do a second time. * taco night at rosewood mayakoba hotel - i can't put into words how much I enjoyed this meal. we were starving when we arrived, so we definitely ate too many chips. SAVE UP ROOM FOR THE TACOS!! The flank steak taco?! the shrimp tempura taco?! the chorizo taco?!!!! Everything tasted better than the last, which we didn't think was possible. And the tacos are endless, but we were only able to each eat one. We should have taken the advise of our excellent waiter to slow down on the chips, but the chips and the various dips were so good too, we couldn't help ourselves! the parts of the trip that were sub-par: * they didn't have our hotel room ready, and it took them almost three hours to get one (and mind you, the hotel was at 30% capacity, so not sure what took so long). although they did give us a free lunch, i was surprised that they didn't upgrade us. * my husband LOVED his massage, but mine was just okay. in my opinion, the spa closes early (6:45), and we didn't end up getting a lot of treatments because of this. also, they don't have a steam room/sauna in the locker room, which was a bummer. * the thai restaurant was okay - felt the restaurants at rosewood mayakoba were MUCH better. * private pool is FREEZING. * seating area at the main pool is limited, and the beach was tiny and had four chairs available to guests (we also arrived after a big storm, so this could have been the reason why the beach was lacking) * we rented bikes for a day (the property is very large, and although it is possible to walk, would suggest calling for the golf carts to pick you up), and the breaks didn't work. plus the walkways are so small, everytime a golf cart came by, I would end up driving my bike into the woods to let them pass. all in all, the services and pool seemed much better at the rosewood mayakoba. again, the banyan tree mayakoba was excellent, and we would definitely recommend. but if you have a choice between rosewood and banyan tree, I would try out rosewood!! We will be for our next vacation to mexico :)

Reviews.Title: “Better options out there”
Reviews.Author: Leah T
Reviews.Content: My stay at banyan tree was not thoroughly enjoyable. To start with the resort is a good distance from the beach. You have to take the golf cart from the villa to get there. I personally did not expect it to be that far away and you cannon see a trace of the sea from your villa unless you stay at the 2 bed room beach front villas. One of the reasons we booked banyan tree was the private pools which we had in our villa. The weather does not permit swimming at all as a result having a pool and paying about 600 usd is a complete waste. I then thought that I could use the tub in wash room but that was outdoor as well and I felt really bad for the whole experience. The resort should anticipate such weather and have some covering against the rain. The breakfast is good but the food at sands near the beach was not up to the mark. We will be dining in the Thai restaurant and we expect that to be nice since banyan tree is an Asia based resort. The spa is great and take tours from the private taxis avilable through the concierge. It is very expensive to book private tours from the hotel tour company.

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree Review 10/11”
Reviews.Author: vsAlbert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to Pacific coast Mexico several times but this was our first trip to the Yucatan. We saw the Mayakoba Banyan Tree on Snique Away at a great price and made the leap. We stayed 10/9/11 through 10/13/11 at a Garden Pool Villa. The villa was even better than we had expected. I was concerned about space as it was the smaller of the single bedroom villas available, but for our purposes it was perfect. Situated not far from the main building our location provided great access to all the hotel had to offer. The private pool was ideal, the outdoor living areas were wonderful and well used, while the view of the water behind it was beautiful and entertaining with the wide variety of birds that frequented it. The high ceiling, and sliding glass doors that afforded expansive views of the pool area from the foot of the bed and the stream from the side gave a feeling of living outside while being comfortable inside. We were afforded complete privacy which we took full advantage of. Never heard our neighbors or felt in anyway that we weren't alone when in our villa. We never noticed any noise from traffic along the path outside or from the cleaning and gardening crews that were constantly at work. The service we received throughout our stay was exemplary. Every member of the Banyan Tree staff that we passed said hello and smiled, while every request was met with a friendly willingness to see that we were completely satisfied with the outcome. Our first morning after breakfast we asked the manager of the Oriente where the Saffron restaurant was located as we would be dining there two days later. He didn't just point it out, he didn't merely show us the path that led there, he walked us there, showed us around and thanked us for giving him the opportunity to do so. The breakfast buffet in the Oriente restaurant was fantastic each and every day. They offered an impressive variety of breakfast fare each morning. The wait staff brought your drinks and each time you left to go get more from the buffet you'd find that by the time you returned to the table your napkin was folded and clean silverware provided. Fruit to start including bananas, peaches, watermelon, cantaloupe, kiwi fruit, honey dew melon, assorted berries and more. There were several yogurts along with granola and other cereals to mix. A selection of cheeses and cold cuts. Several different breads along with English muffins. The hot dish servings of starches and meats changed each day save for the standard bacon and link sausage; some were Thai and some were Mexican. Eggs and omelets were made to order and brought to your table when ready. The staff exceeded expectations as they were always quick to help and very friendly. The Sands restaurant and beach bar was nice. Most inexpensive food at the resort, too. We rode bikes out there and that was fun. Also took the buggy and that was quicker, but I'd opt for the bikes even with the $5 charge for the day. The pool bar at the beach was nice, although that pool seems to be where people with kids hang out. Once again the service was fantastic. As we walked up two gentlemen met us, asked where we would like to sit. After picking our spot one set up the umbrella while the other prepared our loungers with a towel on the bottom, a towel and pillow on the top and a third towel for use when we got out of the pool or the came in from the beach. The beach has a few rocks - mostly off shore, but it was pleasant and the water felt great. Our first night we had dinner at Tamarind. We ate at a reasonable hour, about 7pm, but we were almost the only ones in the entire restaurant, even when we left around 9. The service again was wonderful, the food was delicious and we had a great time other than when one of the waiters had to encourage a bat to leave the dining area. I'm compelled to go off on a bit of a tangent here. We were told they were at 60-70% of capacity but for much of our stay we felt as if it were our own private resort. I don't know if it always feels like that or if we just happened to hit the resort at an odd time - we were staying Sunday through Thursday so we missed any weekend crowd. We went in the main pool three times - we were always the only people in it. Eco tour had two other people on it. Tamarind was empty when we ate there. We had cocktails at Le Copa twice and saw only 4 other people total not counting the wait staff. Did the Rainforest experience and saw no other folks in the spa or locker room. At Saffron we had only two other tables occupied during our dinner. We did see a few people out at the beach both times we went, but never more than 3 other people in the pool there and had our pick of loungers. Also Oriente was busy but not crowded for breakfast each morning, so I know there were other guests. Perhaps the seclusion and serenity of the rooms kept most folks otherwise occupied. We took the Eco tour and really enjoyed it. It launches from the dock by the Saffron restaurant and traverses canals throughout the Mayakoba property, taking you past Rosewood and Fairmont resorts, too. You see a variety of wildlife including crocodiles, birds, lizards, and fish along with interesting views of the reserve. I recommend you take advantage of this should you visit. Some jumbled miscellaneous thoughts on our stay: Get out and see the other resorts, Rosewood and Fairmont. We had a wonderful evening spent at the Tequila Library at Rosewood where it just happened to be Margarita Monday and Fatima helped us make our own margaritas selecting different flavor infused tequilas to do it. The food was good too. Trip into Play del Carmen runs $20 each way plus tip. Worth going in to see the beach and the city, but the huksters are insistent. I did have one salesman at a cigar shop try very hard to get me to sell my Tommy Bahama shirt to him which was amusing. If you think perhaps you can save money on food in PDC over what you pay at the resort you'll need to stay for two meals in order to account for cab fare spent. Ride the bikes at least once. It was a fun and pleasant trip out to the beach that way. Be warned though, if you indulge in a few shots of tequila at the pool bar you're still going to have to ride back. Wifi worked great. I have an over-sized laptop and housekeeping/security kept leaving me notes to lock it up when out of the room, but it didn't fit in the room safe. The mosquito kit in the room let us know to be wary of these pests. While I was never bothered my wife did have one night where she was bit several times. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We're already trying to set up a group visit with some of friends. It was beautiful, it was luxurious, it was peaceful and we were well taken care of by a warm and friendly staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Too many service & maintenance issues, not relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: DeTraveler05
Reviews.Content: Any place with a plunge pool IN your own private villa starts off with 5 stars from me. Unfortunately this resort could not keep them. I was shocked (after reading so many positive tripadvisor reviews) to say this was my least relaxing vacation. I typically skip over reading reviews detailing too many petty complaints but I could write one. I’ll spare you the details but suffice to say, my best friend and I checked out 4 days early. Most of the staff we encountered were very nice and that keeps me from giving only one or two stars for this review. However, there were way too many service issues on top of the facilities being in disrepair. I’ve never paid double my airfare to leave a vacation early before.
