We weren’t mad at anyone, we felt a little cheated at all the money we had spent for so many problems, but we felt sorry for the resort at the same time. This resort’s plunge pools aren’t heated and were far too cold to use. None of the scenic beauty can be seen from most of the resort: the main lobby, breakfast, spa or villa areas. I’d recommend Banyan Tree’s Cabo Marques in Acapulco over this resort. At Cabo Marques you can see panoramic beauty from your bathtub, breakfast table and hotel lobby. We also had a lot of rain while here and the villa is geared toward outside living. We would’ve preferred a bath tub that at least had a cover/roof over it so it could be enjoyed in the rain or beating sun. An indoor tub would be even better--sometimes you just want to escape the swarms of mosquitos and get clean. (There were more mosquitos here than I’m used to seeing. Perhaps they don’t spray?) Our tub wouldn’t hold water when we tried to use it. Also, if you get a garden pool villa, there is nowhere for two to sit inside unless you want to get in your bed. We ran into a whole host of maintenance issues and I slept two nights in two different rooms that each had standing water next to the bed I was in. There was really hard rain, which is not the resort’s fault, but I would expect facilities that can keep the water out especially near the beds. Even the ceiling over the computers in the business center was leaking in several spots. I've never encountered so many issues at a resort before. My best friend and I live in separate states and we met here for this vacation we planned 7 months ago. We hadn't seen each other in over a year and we woudn't have cut our vacations short if it were even remotely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Except for swimming.”
Reviews.Author: vaporrub
Reviews.Content: This place is very well planned. Everything flows effortlessly. The breakfast buffets are terrific. Dinners are okay. The villa's are quite perfect. The only problem is the water at the beach isn't quite warm enough and none of the pools are heated. Kind of a drag when on spring break with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddylev
Reviews.Content: There isnt much else to add that hasnt been said already. This is the best resort I have ever stayed in. It is simply outstanding and a level of luxury and class that the USA simply just does not have. Every single employee there is warm, welcoming, and there to make your stay better. I will try and answer certain questions that I wondered BEFORE i went there. Location - Mayakoba is a complex of hotels consisting of Fairmont, Rosewood, and Banyan Tree. While all separate, Banyan Tree will shuttle you to any of the other hotels, and you can sign your Villa # for dining at Fairmont. Not sure about Rosewood, as we didnt venture there. Dining - As previously mentioned in other reviews, it is expensive. We are not big liquor drinkers. Saffron the food is about a 7/10, but the setting/service is a 10/10. We had the spring rolls, a rib eye salad, and chicken satay as appetizers and all were fantastic. For our main courses we had one of the shrimp dishes, and the wok fried noodles. Both were ok. Nothing out of this world, but good. Total cost including tip (tip is included into everything), was $130.00 US with 2 diet cokes as drinks. We also ate 2 meals at Fairmont, one at La Laguna and the other at El Puerto. La Laguna is their traditional mexican restaurant. We had a guac appetizer, 2 main dishes, 2 grey gooses + sodas, 2 tequila shots, and a pack of cigarettes for $98.00. Great value. Food is pretty solid. El Puerto is the Fairmont steak/seafood restaurant. Decent. Nothing outstanding. Slightly cheaper then US steakhouse prices. Meal with 3 apps, 2 mains, no desert and 2 drinks was $130 US. We also ate everyday at Sands by the beach. Best restaurant at the resort. This is at Banyan. Amazing! We loved it everyday. Beach - Heaven. Ask for the beds and spend the money and ride the bikes down there! They are totally worth it. Bikes were awesome Villas - Also simply outstanding. I took a video of our garden pool villa and if you want to see exactly what they look like, PM Me and I will send you the youtube video link. Service - This is what sets Banyan Tree apart from anywhere. On our last day i was stung by a jellyfish. When i returned to the room that evening I had a gorgeous tropical bouquet waiting for us, wishing me a quick recovery. Simply cannot wait to go back. Worth every dollar of the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING RESORT!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine what to say that hasn't been said, but this is one of the best service oriented resorts I have ever been to. We have traveled all over the Caribbean and Central America and this resort has them beat. It's one thing when the staff members graciously work to grant your every wish with an amazing smile and genuineness. It's another when they actually watch over you and anticipate your every need...I just can't say enough about our "crew" of people that looked out for us...From the bellboys to the waiters to the pool attendants, everything was PERFECTION!!! The villas are gorgeous and private, the restaurants serve amazing food, the resort is beautifully laid out..I would not hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone wanting an upscale getaway. BTW...I did see several children there and they seemed to be having a great time. I know other reviews have said this isn't a place for kids, but the staff seemed genuinely happy to have them and if your kids just love to swim in the pool and play in the sand and surf this would be a great spot. Playa del Carmen is 10 minutes away and plenty of activities to do there if you sought them out.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay, the staff was very friendly, the rooms are pretty and quite, and also the meals are very great, I recomender it at 100%. The only thing is that the beach is a little far away

Reviews.Title: “Absolute relaxation at it's best, brilliant staff, just a truly wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Thenewlywedds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent just 5 nights At the end of our honeymoon but it felt like a lifetime. Very Beautiful & peaceful place (could be the time of year) but would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Friendly and attentive staff. Spa, pools, villa, beach and restaurants were all lovely especially the Thai. Didnt want to leave...a truly special place, which will give you memories to match.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: jpark4183
Reviews.Content: My dad passed away 6 months ago, and my mom and I never really had the chance to recover or debrief in any way since she had to go to Korea to take care of her ill father right away, and I had to go back to work after the month-long leave of absence I took off. When she told me she'd be visiting me in September and she wanted to go on a vacation, I wanted to pick a place that was literally an escape from reality, somewhere we could really relax for the first time and just not think of anything that had to do with our lives back home. just for a week. And BTMK delivers. just to reiterate what all the positive reviews have already been saying, this hotel is 5 stars for a reason. Many of them in fact. I have never received such warm, genuine service; each and every staff member you come across, whether they be opening your taxi door, escorting you to your villa in a golf cart (they call them buggies), or carrying your plate of food back to your table for you, they would always have a smile and a greeting for you. It really makes you feel like you're at home. A beautiful, really nice smelling home that cleans itself. I loved the soap and lotion in the villa so much I bought a travel pack in the gift shop before going back home. We were upgraded to the spa pool villa (#701) from the courtyard pool villa, the only difference is that there is another level above the main bedroom with spa beds and a shower - this is probably just so you spend more money on in-villa spa services, and we didn't end up using it at all. Nevertheless the villa is beautiful... all the linens, the fixtures, beautifully appointed. The bathroom... the bathroom! To die for... I dream of having my own steam shower someday. The separate living pavilion was convenient since my boyfriend tagged along and it provided an extra bedroom (and privacy) for both him and me and my mom. We just asked the staff to prepare the oversized (really large) sofa as a bed every night. No rollaway bed needed, so we saved $200 a night this way. Our reservation only included 2 breakfast buffets, and even though we signed a bill every time my boyfriend chose to join us for breakfast, they never included any of his breakfast meals on our final invoice, which was a nice gesture (he had complained a bit about the food at Saffron, and the manager said he wanted to make it up to us). The food...the breakfast buffet is, as they say, amazing. Impressive variety, and they do change up the fruit and hot dishes every day which is great. I got to try a lot of new things (mexican hot chocolate, nopales) and everyone working in the restaurant was very friendly and helpful. Roussell even happily obliged us with takeout containers when we said we wanted to take some food for later. Sands is the best option for lunch if you are staying on grounds, but we also had the hotel call us a cab (they find much nicer ones sitting along the streets) to take us into town and also to place where the driver likes to eat (best way to eat locally!). We ended up hiring the same driver for the whole week so he became more like a friend to us - highly recommend this route. Saffron was their fine Thai dining option... coming from Los Angeles it's hard to say this food was good; there is so much good (and cheap) Thai food where I live, and this place felt a bit stuffy and oppressive... I felt like I couldn't speak loudly or take any photos, like a museum. Our last night we had dinner at Tamarind, their open air fine dining option and we were totally impressed. From the amuse bouche to the dessert, everything was outstanding. For a recommendation in town, I recommend Yaxche, off 5th Avenue, for excellent Mayan cuisine. Next time I visit PDC, I will probably stay at a more modest establishment, as BTMK is definitely a decadent splurge for a once in a lifetime experience. But it will not disappoint. The beachfront property is small for some people, but I felt it was cozy and felt more personal, and the water is unbelievably clear. Jose operates the boat that will take you there from the lobby, he'll show you all the wildlife on the way there; makes for a much more pleasant experience and you forget that the beach isn't that close by. The only thing I would warn against is the mosquito population - being on the water is lovely but DO bring a strong repellant if you are susceptible to bites. I got eaten alive despite bringing my own since it was usually a choice between sunblock, repellant - and later - aloe vera for my sunburn! I second another reviewer who recommended the turndown service. We only asked for it a few nights out of the week but it's really nice what they do - light the candles, turn on soothing music, lay out your robes and slippers, and get your bed ready to sleep in while leaving you a schedule of the next days activities, the weather report, and a small handmade trinket :) In summary, if you are looking for a place to get away from it all where all your needs will be met before you even realize you have any... then this is the place. It's luxurious, provides over the top service, and is like no other place i've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing is an Understatement”
Reviews.Author: Shirronda S
Reviews.Content: Very rarely do I place a review for anything, but I felt compelled to do so today. My husband and I just returned yesterday from the Banyan Tree. We went for nothing but relaxation and pampering. That’s exactly what we received. The food was better than delicious. The villas were private and serene. The staff was exceptional. Oh Pom. I don’t want to forget Pom. She gave me the best massage ever. For the record my husband and I travel often, from England to Panama from Canada to Anguilla and all in between. We’ve stayed at some of the finest and found Banyan Tree the BEST. We are now planning out next trip to another one of their locations. Thailand here we come. Whom ever gave this resort less than a perfect score those are the people who will always find something to complain about – like the weather as if Banyan Tree can control that… We love you Banyan Tree

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: thejourneysofar
Reviews.Content: There's really not much more we can add to what other reviewers have written about BT - this resort is incredible and very much deserves it's rating as the best resort in Playa del Carmen. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by valet parking and smiling resort hosts we knew we were in for something special; and we weren't disappointed. Nothing is too much for the staff and they go out of their way to ensure you enjoy your stay. And how could you not enjoy it! We stayed in a Garden Villa which was close to the main hub and ideal for walking to restaurants and breakfast. Getting to the beach mean't a longish walk or simply jumping on a golf buggy or the boat. The boat was a nice way to see the river and some local flora and fauna. Each villa has a pool and the rooms are very welcoming with tasteful decor and luxurious feel to them. The turn down service at night was a lovely touch as were the bathroom extra's in case you forgot anything. Bug repellant was provided - and needed! This again highlighted that BT goes the extra mile to give you what you need for a lovely stay. Moving onto the food - we ate at The Sands for both lunch (when at the beach) and for dinner. Tamarind was another lovely meal and we also enjoyed La Copa bar and tapas on our last night. It was fantastic to eat under the stars! We found the prices to be comparable to many other resorts of this standard and not anymore expensive then what you'd pay for a nice meal in London. Of course for Mexico that may seem costly but for what you receive, the service and location it is all worth it. And then there's breakfast! This is a buffet with a difference; the fruit was delicious and changed daily, there was choice after choice of different meal options and they provided take away when we headed out early for the day. And Grandma's hot chocolate is a must try! Spa - our booking included a 60 minute massage for one which was another luxurious treat and highly recommended if you get the chance. Very relaxing. Golf - although we didn't play the course looked immaculate and is Greg Norman designed. The hole by the beach looks like quite the water hazard! Driving into Playa was a breeze and you can find parking for 13-20pesos/hr on 10th Avenue which is only one block up from the popular 5th Ave pedestrian area. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, markets and general shopping to do along with a nice beach to wander. So what else is there to say? BT is an absolutely stunning resort and we would return tomorrow if we could. Maybe next year!

Reviews.Title: “Some things are worth it...”
Reviews.Author: Tripreviewergirl
Reviews.Content: As longtime Riviera Maya fans, we just returned from our second trip to the amazing Banyan Tree. Waiting patiently for a deal on Luxury Link, we jumped as soon as it became available and are sooooooo glad we did. The service, public space, food and general ambience is the ultimate in luxury, without being glitzy and in your face. Make no mistake, it is VERY expensive. Plan on spending at least $150-200 on dinner, $75-100 on lunch. My fantastic massage in the impeccable spa cost far more than most ($160 plus gratutity for a 60-minute massage) and the endless breakfast buffet (which most of the time is included in your room rate) was $80 for two! The lobby bar and Tamerind Restaurant afford magnificant views of the lobby/lagoon. If given an opportunity to visit the Banyan Tree, don't pass it up; this is one special place. We can't wait to return...

Reviews.Title: “Priceless experience!”
Reviews.Author: Meesha1276
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it!! Service was great... Room was spectacular! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree Mayakoba”
Reviews.Author: Robertorx
Reviews.Content: Great resort. The villas are truly amazing! from the private pool and jacuzzi to the amazing bathroom with outdoor shower and tub to the bedroom doors that slide open all the way. Some people may be put off by having to take a bike or golf cart to the beach or restaurants but its really not a big deal. It is kinda pricey but we got a deal through jetsetter.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: clu99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the BT on Aug. 4-Aug. 7. We wanted a relaxing vacation (without the kiddos) and this was absolutely the perfect resort for us. The resort was absolutely beautiful and felt so initimate. Our villa/courtyard /pool was so private and tranquil. The room decor was simplistic but warm and tasteful. The room had everything we needed to be comfortable even an ipod docking station. The best part of BT was the service and staff. The staff were all so courteous and friendly and really seemed to enjoy their work. There was never a wait for anything! The staff went above and beyond and provided great attention to details. I saw an employee adjust an umbrella 3 times so that a sleeping guest would continue to be in the shade. When I commented to him about it, he just replied with a smile "I don't want the sun to wake her up from her nap": The nightly turndown service was perfect--loved it! Only negative was that our outdoor bathtub didn't work and there was a slight unpleasant odor in the room( due to the humidity). But no worries with the candles and incense provided by the hotel it was not much of a problem at all. Overall a fabulous experience that was well worth the money. You really get what you pay for. Even with our bad sunburn and my scrapes/bruises from my bike accident, this was one of our best vacation. By the way, the hotel sent me flowers when they found out about my accident. (Tip: sun is really strong so wear lots of sunblock even on brief outings) Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip here in Banyan tree and this time it's even way better than my first experience! As usual everybody was superb with the service. I commend everyone! They even upgraded me without me asking them too! I'm so pleased and they helped me out with the rate when I got stranded for 5 more days . This place is the only place I go to when I am going back to Mexico again next year. Kudos everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Scott L
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon at Banyan Tree Mayakoba and my wife and I absolutely love this place - I cannot overstate this enough. This is easily the nicest resort/hotel we have ever stayed at, and although we normally would not have been able to afford such a nice place, they were offering great deals since this is their low season. Since it was the low season, we also had the resort all to ourselves for the most part as they told us only ~ 15% of the resort was occupied. Although it is not a large resort, the off season feel really made it feel like a boutique resort and all the more special! Here were the most impressive aspects of this property in our opinion: 1) the service was absolutely top notch with a staff to guest ratio that was unbelievable (again partly due to low season). They made us feel like VIPs at every single turn, and we were only staying in the (least expensive) garden villa. Everyone was extremely courteous and always willing to help a hand or do whatever they needed too to wait on you hand and foot and pamper you to the max. 2) the room and resort architecture/layout/scenery was amazingly beautiful and inspiring. This place was every bit as good as the pictures look in the internet and better. Apparently it is only 2 years old and one of the newest resorts in Playa del Carmen. Banyan Tree is top tier Asian resort chain that specializes is expansive and decadent villas instead of typical room layouts. Their resorts seem to be just as nice as Four Seasons, St. Regis, Ritz, etc. but have an amazing uniqueness about them. Our villa was a complete sanctuary of peacefulness and romance, and we found that we ended up just camping out there often even though we are generally the adventurous, want to get out types. Otherwise, the resort and all the common areas was almost completely open-air and done very tastefully in a mexican/asian theme that was very attractive. Mosquitoes were around, but were not nearly as bad as we though they'd be. 3) the food was amazing at all of the restaurants for breakfast, lunch (although the breakfast would often hold you over), and dinner, and although the breakfast was included, the dinners were very expensive (but worth it in our opinion). And lastly, 4) the beach was our favorite place. This is a great resort to go to if you really want to unwind, relax, and check out mentally. Although the beach is not next to the main resort (and is short bike or buggy ride away - this was actually kind of nice because it made the resort feel more expansive and "broken up"), it is accompanied by a wonderful restaurant, infinity pool on the beach (with great swim up bar), and a lovely little beach with wonderful staff. The only drawback was that getting in the water was a little tough because of the rocky seabed right as you walked in (it got much better once you got a little bit). Otherwise, we felt like rockstars on our beach bed/lounges with umbrellas, getting food and drinks served to us and pampered like none else. It truly reminds you of a Corona commercial. Other than that, we'd recommend you ask for a villa that is close to the main facilities since some can be on the "outer loop" and require a bit more walking to get to all the amenities. Make sure you visit the spa if possible too since Banyan Tree is world-renowned for this. If the services are too expensive, try the Rainforest experience at the very least, which is very affordable. The weather was great for us, and going in to Playa and doing some of the surrounding activities was a blast as well. We recommend trying the Mayan restaurant Yaxche in Playa for great cuisine and El Fogon if you are looking for true great mexican food at this common local eatery. All in all, we were absolutely captivated by this place and are already trying to figure out when we will be back. It was absolutely the best vacation we have ever had, and we would be saying that even if it wasn't our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall great resort with excellent staff. Beautiful, quiet resort The only 2 negatives are 1) the expense ($17 for a Pina Colada) and and 2) the lack of variety in dining options. The lack of variety is compounded exponentially if you don't eat seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Best summer vacation ever!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyMikie
Reviews.Content: I came to stay at this place during my summer vacation on June. I heard lots of recommendation and i saw lots of thumbs up for this place. So i finally decide to see myself. From the front desk to my room, everything is magnificent. I was speechless at how beautiful the resort is. Definitely one of the best resorts in the world. The service is superb. I can feel like it is my home away from home. The money i spent is way worth it compare to the service i received during my stay. Definitely must a place to staybif you happen to go to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “once in a lifetime romantic trip”
Reviews.Author: Tita1975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 10 year anniversary at this wonderful resort in Mayakoba, Mexico, 10mins from Playa. We had a Garden Villa, it was incredible, this place oozes romance and serenity everywhere. The beach is not adjacent to the property, but it is a quick golf cart or bike ride away. Besides you can always leave your bike anywhere on the property and ask for it to be taken back to your room so you can bike to the beach, and if you've had one too many tequilas @ the beach you can take the golf cart back to you room. The breakfasts are amazing!!! The variety is great and it really can be like a brunch style breakfast to keep you full till dinner. The food from Room Service left much to be desired, it was nothing special, but the service was top notch. I particularly enjoyed the SPA more than anything else at this resort. I had a full morning of treatments that ended with a Thai expert giving me a massage....OH BLISS. It was heaven. My husband and I did the couples circuit (which is $40.00 per person I think) and that was a great and more economical option both of us. I researched all the hoteld in PDC and ultimately decided to go all out and come here....I am so glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic place”
Reviews.Author: StevenVHG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the banyan tree begin sept in a spa pool villa. The villa is very spacious with a massage place on top of the roof. Includes a swimming pool and jacuzzi (privat of course) So if you are into a romantic place to stay : go for it! The reception and guest services are very good and discrete. The restaurants are ok but not top. The small snacks with your aperive at the beginning of your meal are always(!) the same. So difficult for a chef to make something creative as starter? Same at the end of your meal with your coffee.... Whole week the same sweeties. ... We did the romantic boat trip with diner in the evening : DO IT ! Very special! Also one evening we tried the in house villa dining with privat bbq..... Also this I can advise to do. Nice thing is that you can hire bikes to travel through the hotel ( beachclub (which is very good!) is 7 minutes biking away) so some sporting is done meanwhile If you do not like to bike, no worry : more then enough staff in golfcars to drive you around, just call them.... Ohhh just a special applause for the cleaning service of the rooms! Very very good!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Happy_On_Vacation_10 Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful villas, well appointed and very private. The service is excellent and you will not want for anything. This a great place for a romantic getaway for a few days. While they reportedly require that you dress elegant for dinner, this is not at all the case. You can dress very casual for dinner in any of their restaurants provided you keep it tasteful. The food is very good (a bit costly, especially for Mexico). We highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Exceeded my expectations. Suites are SO nice; pure pleasure!!! We celebrated our 19th wedding anniversary and the hotel took excellent care of us! Very nicely done!! Dinner at Saffron was very good, although pricy!! I recommend it for special celebrations and preferably no kids as they would need to sleep quite separate from parents.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it just a little....”
Reviews.Author: veyarestaxa
Reviews.Content: This is a bit long but......We stayed at Banyan Tree for a luxurious 8 days. After reading all of the reviews, I expected a little bit of let-down (nothing could be that perfect) but WOW, was I wrong. Beyond perfect. Transfer from airport was easy (we booked USA Transfers for $80 round trip). Warm welcome with a couch, cool drink, refreshing towels, bracelets and tour. Then, off to the villa in our "buggy". Courtyard Villa was just great-we loved having our own pool, outdoor jacuzzi, and bath for 2. Our favorite feature was the separate room, "Pavillion" which had a huge daybed, coffee/tea station, dining area, tv and stereo. The tough decisions each day were: beach, pool by the beach, pool by the main building, or our own villa pool...then the next tough decision was what to choose from the breakfast buffet. Words can not express the perfection that is the BT breakfast. You just have to see it. The juices, pastries, entrees, smoked fishes, meats, mexican, thai, european, anything you could possible want was there. We fell into an easy routine of breakfast, late light lunch and then late dinner. We did not eat anywhere else, we did not want to leave BT once we arrived-it was too perfect. We went into the trip thinking we would go see some ruins, cenotes, etc. We could not tear ourselves away. We also thought we would venture out to Playa del Carmen and/or Rosewood, Fairmount but quickly realized that there was no reason to. We ate 1 dinner at Tamarind, 1 dinner at La Copa (Tapas), 1 dinner at Sands, 4 dinners at Saffron, and 1 dinner in our villa (by the pool). All were great but we really enjoyed Saffron (as you can probably tell). The prices were reasonable for us. Don't quote me on prices here (I was enjoying my holiday too much to pay attention). Cocktails were pricey ($12-16) but so well made, worth every peso. Beer was $6. Menu prices were similiar to what you'd pay at any fine dining restaurant and cheaper than most resorts we have eaten at. Appetizers around $10-15, entrees around $20-40, desserts about $8, if I recall. The quality was consistently great. We did not do the Villa BBQ because we felt we couldn't eat that much food but the in room dining options were varied and we enjoyed that very much. We played golf (excellent), did the rainforest experience followed by couples massages (finally a strong, Balinese, massage), eco tour via boat (loved that and saw 2 crocodiles, iguanas, a coati mundi and many birds). We walked a lot, rode bikes one day, took the boat to the beach a couple of times and had the buggy bring us home if we got tired. The amenities in the villa are great: flip flops, beach bag, robes, shaving cream, toothbrushes, ironing, hair dryer-anything you need (I could have packed a lot lighter). Turn down service was so great-little gifts, candies, lighting, music..all waiting when we returned from dinner. And now, the best part, service. Never have we experienced such incredible, thoughful service as this. Polite, friendly, professional always. Across the board-from housekeepers, waitstaff, resort hosts, gardeners...every single employee was great. We quickly realized that any experience after this was going to pale in comparison. One more thing we loved about the BT-well, two more things actually-the landscaping and the decor. The landscaping was lush and well maintained-I came away with many inspirations and ideas for home. The decor was this understated, relaxed mix of Mexican and Asian. Uncluttered and warm. Textures, colors and great lighting. One more adjective to describe the entire experience: Romantic. Counting the days until we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: JenandVin
Reviews.Content: The resort is elegant and peaceful with exceptionally refined service by their english speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JessTravels
Reviews.Content: If you have the opportunity to stay at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba - do it! It is fabulous and will change any preconceived notions you have about a Mexican vacation. The property is very beautiful but it is large and spread out. You can rent bikes to ride around but you won't want to be riding at night. As an alternative, you can call a golf cart to drive you around. This isn't necessarily a "con" but you don't plan well, you could spend some time waiting around for your "chauffeur" to arrive. The villas are luxurious and incredibly spacious. You have no reason to ever leave! The "plunge" pool puts others to shame. My only complaint is the same echoed by other reviewers - the food. Besides the breakfast buffet (which is absolutely incredible!), I wasn't all that impressed with the restaurant options. Sands is way over-priced and just not that good. Tamarind is good but nothing to write home about. Unfortunately we were never able to experience Saffron (be sure to book more than a day in advance). You will need to make advance reservations for all of the restaurants. It was frustrating to be told nightly that our preferred time was not available - only to go past the restaurants and see they were only 1/4 full. I strongly recommend renting a car and driving from the airport in Cancun. It is a very easy drive - a busy, straight motorway. We felt very safe - even driving at night. Having a car will give you the convenience to go into PDC for dinner (which we did often). You can also experience day trips to all of the attractions that area has to offer. And the cost will be much less than the roundtrip SUV service that the resort offers.

Reviews.Title: “An assian living in Mexican patterns and colours... Our magical 11 th anniversary paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: kikola12
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a whole week ,full of privacy and relaxation thanks to your huge courtyard pool villa, with all the service,badler, , the amazing view ever, such a peaceful location with the fantastic beach with so white fine sandy powdered beach.... A place above expectation that fulfilled our dreams come true!!! Mexico a destination full of real green culture with so many secrets underwater ,and discoveries , water activities , the cents experience and more and more! We loved the culture ever so much, the so friendly welcoming people always smiling and ready to serve you any time anyplace any moment full of happiness all the way! The resort , so new only 2.5 yrs old left us the dream of assia in real Mexican way could ever have... The sands Mexican American restaurant, the tamarind with the most unusual dishes ever, the beautiful location around the lagunas view by night, the most romantic with the fantastic contemporary thai restaurant we couldn't live without, and the amazing oriente around the pool water which by night was so spectacular , and the food so lovely and unique tastes! We really deeply from our heart would like to thank all the amazing staff of this awarded resort that really made our heart melt ! Definitely we ll return back to you for the definition of everlasting luxurious privacy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Asian Luxury in the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our aniversary trip in Banyan Tree. The Hotel was spectacular. Staff always very friendly, rooms are big, private, luxurious and exotic. Food at the beach club and at the Saffron restaurants are great. Had a great time having some drinks at the bar in the pool at the beach club.. The beach is clean, private and the water is perfect. We rented a bike for $5 USD per day to g from our room to the beach, this was efficient, fast and enjoyable.. Also the breakfast buffet is great.. Had a great time, definitively a great choice..

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!! Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Mike884
Reviews.Content: The Bayan Tree was awesome. The private villa and plunge pool were very nice. I planned this trip with my GF to propose and everything was perfect! The proposal was perfect! This place is very romantic and relaxing. We were blown away the very first moment we pulled up to the property. We were blown away again when we were taken to our room. The daily breakfast buffet was great as well. My only complaint was the food and drinks at the resort-- they were very expensive and not really worth the price. We ended up spending about $60- $100 bucks for every meal. I would suggest going to the other resorts on the property for some of the meals. Also, I would recommend buying a bottle at the airport, before heading to the resort, to enjoy your own drinks in the room. Overall, this was an excellent resort and we will definitely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A bit too much hype?”
Reviews.Author: Eyeous
Reviews.Content: Following research online and particularly on Trip Advisor (TA), I selected the banyan tree as the ideal place for a holiday with my wife. Overwhelmingly, the reviews on TA rate the hotel as 'excellent' and rave about absolutely everything. Certainly the daily room rate indicates that this should be the case and so my expectations were set sky high. Honestly, I felt a little bit disappointed that only 4 ot 5 reviewers pointed out the significant improvements still required with the service. I felt it was important to add my own experience here in an effort to balance out some statements! The service to me seemed at times amateurish - although staff were polite, I lost track of the number of instances that I had to repeat myself to get stuff done. A bit of a buzz kill. Room service and house keeping were the main offenders - no doubt because of the size of the resort things moved veeeeeery slowly.  I expected the room would be cleaned by the time we had finished with lunch and headed back for a little siesta. Typically this was not the case...they normally showed up after 3pm by which time we would typically be sleeping and so things got a bit out of sync. To be fair they did a thorough job once they showed up.  Similar story with room service taking for ever to deliver the simplest of things...and then needing multiple chasers to clear up. It seemed that various bugs and especially ants were much more keen to make an appearance and clear the food (all 30 million of them). Talking of food - the restaurant options are average with the exception of the breakfast (which was epic) and the Tamarind which made a good effort. This is a problem because being on a resort means you're a little bit stuck for options. We were there for just over a week and so started dining at the nearby resorts...cost/quality ratio the dining left me underwhelmed. The breakfast was phenomenal and you could see some wise old owls "stocking up" to avoid having to have lunch at the resort...shame I thought. To end with a positive, the resort is immaculately kept, sensationally decorated and felt very special. The amenities were brand new, the details and tangible "stuff" is all there and at your disposal. Making a visit to the nearby resorts for  food emphasizes that banyan tree is head and shoulders above the rest in terms of style. However, Management must resolve the service/food issues to earn a top rating. As these things are fundamental and when factoring in the costs, I rate banyan tree as 3 of 5 stars with a clear conscience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service mayakoba”
Reviews.Author: LondonWanderer66
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Terrific staff and service and great villas. It's a bit too secluded and out the way for us as it's a $20 cab ride each way to Playa Del Carmen. The food is good but pricey so I would recommend eating in the other hotels as well. The Fairmount and Rosewood are in Mayakoba and you can get a ride to them no problem. Not great for families with children I don't think. Great service and staff though. Very friendly and helpful. Couldn't fault them.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about luxury!”
Reviews.Author: samcards
Reviews.Content: Fabulous trip with wife and our little boy (~4 yrs old) Loved: 1. The great to-fro transportation albeit charged for. 2. Wonderfully private rooms with own pool and sauna. 3. Wonderful layout of the villas. The instrumental music CDs playing on the bose system (so relaxing). 4. Outstanding room service (We ordered breakfast-like sausages ad eggs) and they set up a wonderful spread with different types of bread accompaniments/toaster/various types of jams etc etc) 5. Fantastic breakfast buffet 6. Great spa 7. Perfect beach with personal service as regards setting up umbrellas/towels and multiple complimentary cocktail tastings throughout the day. 8. Kids entertainment room right by the beach (was unmanned when we were there, but the movies kept our guy busy) 9. Kids under 6 eat for free! 10. The restaurants all served great food. We visited the adjoining ..was it Rosewood resort...their restaurant is great too... 11. Not sure if I would even recommend venturing out of this resort. Just stay there and take it all in!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expections, Will Definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: slexnuz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a "couples trip" with four of our friends, and Banyan Tree Mayakoba was the perfect location for both relaxation and fun. We felt totally pampered. The rooms were immaculate. The service was fantastic. The swimming pools in each villa were enormous. The food was eclectic. The access to the beach was unique. The golf course was unbelievably well kept and wide open. The town of Playa Del Carmen is a 15 ride for exploring other food options or hitting a few bars. The rooms were enormous and the housekeeping service was incredible. Each day at least three different people came through our room to turnover the room and clean the pool. Our peronal villa pool was larger than we expected. The six of us literally played marco polo in one couple's private pool, and it was a blast. We did the in-room "Mexican BBQ" which is highly highly recommended (though expensive). They set up a table and chairs for the 6 of us in our of our villa's gardens right next to the pool. They setup their own grill and cooked 4 courses for us while we relaxed and chatted. They played music for us on an iPod dock, served us wine, then cleaned and removed everything after providing us a most memorable meal under the stars. Our meal included appetizers ceviche, salsas, guacamole, grilled shrimps, grilled fish, grilled lobster, baked potatoes, grilled corn, and grilled ribeyes. And desert was berries and chocolate pieces. They offer two other versions, one Thai and one Mediterranean. Again, highly recommended. We did the Rainforest experience at the spa, and that was very unique and good option for a group of 2-3 couples. Book your spa needs on your first day there, as they fill up very quickly. Breakfast each morning is great and if you eat around 10-12pm, it lasts you comfortably through evening without a separate lunch. Breakfast includes made to order omlettes, waffles, chilaquiles, breads, authentic dishes, and randomly some sushi items. We ate at Saffron one evening and while the scenery and setting was amazing, the food was mediocre for the expensive price (we are thai food snobs though). But I don't regret eating there as the experience was worth it. The Sands beach club is accessible by boat or golf cart, either takes ~5-10 minutes. Marcus set up lounge chairs and umbrellas for us each day and was extremely friendly. We appreciate your kindness Marcus. And my last morning there, I called guest services at 630am to see if I could get on the El Cameleon golf course. In 10 minutes a buggy was there to pick me up, and by 7am I was teeing off on the first hole. Where else can you literally walk onto a world class golf course on 30 minutes notice? I was impressed beyond words. Thank you to all the staff and personnel that made our trip so enjoyable. We are looking forward to coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Better the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: Martousa
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Banyan Tree in Mayakoba and we were already planning visit #3 while wading in our private villa pool. Needless to say we love this property and can't wait to come back. The service is impeccable. Nothing says this more then when we saw Alejandro at the Oriente for breakfast and he remembered us from our previous trip there in December of 2009. Alejandro is a pleasure to be around and made us feel like we were back home hanging with family. He lit up our every morning and started our day just right. The service at the beach and pool were amazing as well. We were always attended to and never without an empty glass. The accommodations are too die for. We had a candlelit bath waiting for us one night and the incense and oils truly makes for a sensory experience. These are the details you get at the BT Mayakoba that make the trip so worthwhile. The bike rentals make for a fun adventure. We biked back and forth from the beach club to our villa and always had a splendid time. As many posters have stated- you are in the jungle, so please be prepared for the wildlife be it mosquitoes (which the BT leaves mosquito replant in your closet for), coatis, skunks, bats at the Copa bar, etc...but that just make for an adventurous time and lot of good stories when you come home. You are also only 20 minutes from Playa del Carmen, so you can go back and forth easily by a taxi and enjoy the nightlife or authentic Mexican food. My husband and I are looking forward to our next visit to the BT Mayakoba and hopefully a lot more Banyan Tree resorts in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Earth”
Reviews.Author: maimonidesflorida
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom suite with private pool, chase longs, jacuzzi and a separate livin room. Incredible service, amazing food. The best place to relax and enjoy. Longing to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow--a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about the Banyan Tree and Mayakoba. I don't think people realize what an amazing area Mayakoba is. You are in for a real treat if you take this trip, and specifically if you stay at Banyan Tree. The service was absolutely top notch. The villas are super spacious and beautiful. I liked that the Banyan Tree was almost like a jungle with lagoons weaving throughout the property, and then just take a beautiful 10 minute bike ride to one of the most beautiful beaches you'll ever see. The service at the beach was again phenomenal. We sipped drinks on daybeds just feet away from the shore. Banyan Tree is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MJN1
Reviews.Content: Stellar service, excellent food, beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was absolutely fabulous and we will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: atlsuburbanite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Banyan Tree because we wanted a very secluded experience and we thought the private villas would be perfect. We had looked at similar accomodations in Thailand, etc....and chose this property because of its rave reviews on Trip Advisor and because we would not have to spend significant time flying. Overall, it was a wonderful experience. The highpoints are detailed below.... We went for the luxury SUV service to and from the airport, which was wonderful (I don't know if it was $275 per couple wonderful, but considering a cab each way would have been between 120-140 round trip, we went for it). It was also nice to not have to worry about having to be poached upon at the airport by the tons and tons of companies providing taxi service. We arrived to our welcome bracelet and drink- both nice touches- and our "resort experience specialist" highlighted parts of the resort while our room was prepared. I fired off several questions which she was able to answer with ease. We took the buggy service to our villa where our specialist showed us around. Our courtyard pool villa was magnificant. It was completely secluded and completely enclosed. I agree with the other reviewers who noted that even if the resort was booked, you would never know it. The only place you might see other people would be the beach or in the restaurants. Everything was just top scale luxury all the way- in every aspect of their operations. Banyan really "wowed" us after an unfortunate issue with ants. On our second day there, we noticed ants in the bed. Literally within 30 minutes, a team of people were at our villa, including a full housekeeping team and exterminator. They took apart the bed, sprayed, cleaned, and then sprayed and cleaned all of the other areas of the villa- interior and exterior- for good measure. That appeared to have taken care of the problem until three days later. We had not noticed anything, but received a call from the front desk asking us when a good time to fumigate would be, as the housekeeper had reported seeing ants again. I was impressed that they brought this to our attention rather then waiting for us to notice it. We spent all day at the beach, and when we returned to the villa, we still saw bugs (even after we verified that the fumigation had been done). They promptly moved us to another (bigger) villa, and all was well. A note about the bug situation: YOU ARE IN THE JUNGLE. So, this should all be fairly expected. Also, count on mosquitoes. Bring your own bug spray, because the organic stuff that is provided in your room works okay, but hard core chemicals appear to work better. And wear it all the time. All of the dining was amazing, albeit expensive. We expected this caliber of pricing given the pricing of the resort as a whole. I felt that the food selection was great; however, after 6 days, and even this vast selection got boring. The breakfast buffet (and Orient staff) was so wonderful, I really wish I could have forced myself to eat more every morning I was there. The buggy service was amazing. You call them and they come within mintues (usually). We did not rent the bikes; however, we chose to walk a good bit throughout the resort. All are viable options. The beach, pool, spa- all were wonderful. Ask for Pim if you are getting a massage. Oh, and we were not as thrilled as other reviewers with the Rainforest Experience. We kind of thought it reminded us of like multiple different types of water torture. You go from hot to cold and back with water being sprayed in your face during multiple intervals. I am half joking, but we really didn't think it was worth the money for that amount of discomfort. If you venture into Playa del Carmen, which I do suggest, go to Bites. It is a tapas place on one end of 5th Avenue, and all of the food is to die for. We tried most of the small plates on the menu and paired them with their signature Guava Mojito- which was one of the best drinks I have ever consumed. This place caught our eye because it was one fo the only places not begging you to come eat there. We feel if you have to beg for patrons, your food must not be that great. We also ventured into Coba to hike the ruins, and arranged a car rental rather then booking a tour. We don't like to be herded on buses, and would rather do our own thing. If this is more your bag too, all you have to do is arrange it through the tour desk.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place of the world”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful holiday in one of the finest hotels in the world. The staff was wonderful. The cleanliness second to none. The beach is a dream and the beauty of Villas are not put into words. We can only recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Unparallel service”
Reviews.Author: niklovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Fairmont Mayakoba earlier this year, and decided to venture to the other properties nearby for lunch. We were taken aback by Banyan Tree's beauty, and ended up staying for a few drinks poolside. It's smaller and much quieter, and much more serene than the Fairmont. Don't get me wrong - the Fairmont was a lovely property, but Banyan Tree stands on a higher plain altogether. Emmanuel attended to our every need. Gorgeous atmosphere, great food aside - Emmanuel was the most valuable asset this place had. That's not to say all of the staff wasn't friendly. We've travelled extensively, and have never been so blown away by fantastic service like this. His attention to detail was... admirable. It's apparent Banyan Tree is committed to providing something of a paradise retreat to their guests. It's not a cheap experience, but if you're looking to be pampered, you'll get your money's worth. Especially if you're fortunate enough to encounter Emmanuel. Hope to see them again next year. This time we know where to stay. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate in Pure Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: dwestonx3
Reviews.Content: I searched all over to find the perfect place for my husband & I to unwind for a few nights and am SO glad that I stumbled upon this gem! They thought of Everything from the excellent service, wonderful attention to detail, delicious food, amazing spa (I highly recommend the Rainforest sampler), to the (I'm running out of superlatives) awesome villa! I can not wait to go back although I would recommend staying away mid-summer: lots of potential for rain and therefore mosquitos. But it didn't hamper our vacation one bit! I joined my husband on the golf course and had a blast-even when the monsoon came through! All in all, if you want ultra-chill, this is the place to be! Do NOT miss out on this experience!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This the perfect places to relax and be pamper. You can see that everyone that works in Banyan is proud and happy to do it, and it is directly reflected in their service and level put in each detail. Congrats and thanks to everyone, to make this weekend one of the best of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: fprice Posted by a BanyanTree.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We went for fun in the sun and relaxation and to be pampered... and we were. The Resort itself and Villas are super gorgeous. The resturants are amazing and the staff if super fabulous. We had a courtyard with private pool and a lagoon view. Very private and and secure. Buggy/golf carts available all the time. or rent some bikes to get around . The Saffron Resturant is Thai and the food is out -of- this -world great. The Sands resturant at the beach was our favorite as more casual with our daughter . She 5 years old and we loved how they doted over Her like a Princess.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in world”
Reviews.Author: AndresGuevara
Reviews.Content: This hotel is warranty of service, the property is beautiful, the beach, restaurants, an the people of the staff, everything is excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the villa, but a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: marissad
Reviews.Content: Check in to hotel was a breeze, Eduardo our "resort host" was very nice and hospitable. My husband and I are on a strict diet and brought along our own frozen food and asked of the hotel to heat it up for us each night. We told them very specifically what time to bring it to our villa/restaurant and we were assured that it was not an issue at all and they were used to this from other guests at the hotel. ( By the way, yes we paid them to have to heat the food up, which is totally understandable and was not an issue and we were willing to do). Dinner time came and our food was not at our villa the time we asked- we called in villa dining and they said there was a mistake and it would be another hour. We we very hungry and upset because we were assured it would be taken care of and not a problem. We were there for 6 nights in total and 2 out of 6 nights there was a "mistake in the kitchen" and our food was never prepared for us, even thought we reminded them every single day and even called the front desk to remind them. It sounds like not a big deal, but when you had a long day in the sun and are very hungry, it was just not ideal. We were actually so surprised that it happened a second time because after the first mistake we were assured that it would not happen again. This was definitely a flaw on the hotel/kitchen part. We ended up getting comped the fee to heat up the food, and the second time they felt bad and we had a free set up of the outdoor bath, which I would never spend the money on because all they do is light up candles and throw some rose petals around for $100. That being said, the villa is magnificent, the architecture and design of the hotel is something really special and amazing. The outdoor areas and the villa is kept extremely clean. I would recommend getting a room close to the reception and spa so you do not need to walk/bike/trolley anywhere far. The only time we took the trolley or the boat on the lagoon was to the beach. Besides for the earlier mishap I discussed, the service was good. The best service I have ever had? definitely not, however, it was pretty good. Chef Eric was very helpful even with the mishap, he tried to go out of his way to help us. For the weather in July, it was very hot and humid. If you were not swimming or at the beach, it was way too hot to enjoy. At night and even by day, the bugs are beyond awful. Been to lots of islands and never had such bad mosquito bites. Also, the black raven birds were very loud due to the fact that the hotel is set on wildlife around these muggy swampy lagoons of water, which also is why the bugs are so bad. The best part of this hotel is the private pools in your own room. The pool was always clean, right off the master bedroom, and soooo amazing! Bathing suits do not even need to be worn because its so private. The outdoor areas are immaculate and beautiful. The finishes and fabrics and design of the villa is superb. The bathroom is stunning, huge walk in closet, incredibly comfortable bed, the villa always had this amazing smell also. They left us these incense sticks to light and it made the room smell incredible. Another unbelievable part of Banyan Tree was the spa, yes very expensive, but very well worth it. Try the Balinese massage. The masseuses are brought in from Thailand and trained special for the Banyan Tree spas. The treatments are great and the private villas where they perform the treatments are beautiful and clean and smelled amazing as well. While we were there, a bunch of families with young children were there, I do not understand this, because this hotel did not seem family friendly at all. But, to each its own.... The beach was nice, not great, cannot be compared to Anguilla's and Turks and Caicos beaches at all. The water was very rocky and not clear at all. I was expecting a nicer beach, Also, the actual area of sand is tiny! I was so surprised at how little sand area there was for the guests to sit on. The service at the beach definitely could have been better. Anytime I wanted a drink, I could not get a servers attention, I had to stand up and physically wave them down...which I was not too happy about. All in all, go here for the amazing villas with private pools, but do not go for an amazing beach, or for the not so out of this world service. Would I go back? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury resort, but small beach and no snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: Vogel1
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I styed 6 nights in May 2011. Most has been said before: a beautiful 5* property, with in general very good service and great attention to detail. Noticable: all personel gave the impression they enjoyed working there and being of assistence. Breakfast (included) very nice and we had good dinners at the various restaurants (though one dinner with poor service at Sands). Restaurants are generally upmarket and priced as such (London prices) and the resort could do with a more simpler option in our view. The rooms are the differentiating factor of the hotel. We had a Garden Villa: the villas are next to eachother, but the "garden" of the villa is completely private. The pool of the villa was larger than the plunge pool we had expected and obviously very nice. Whilst having so much privacy is nice in a large resort, we missed having a view at some point (if you stay in your villa/garden, your world becomes very small). We hardly saw any mosquitos, but liked the wildlife in the mangroves (fish, turtles, crocodiles, etc) and would recommend taking the free resort boat tour. The beach is a short boat/buggy trip away, but is too far to walk. The beach is of nice white sand, but not very wide and the coastline in general is not very exciting. We had hoped to do some snorkelling, but the reef is too far away to do this from the hotel. Overall the proprerty is very nice and most suited for couples who want a couple of days of privacy with 5* service. However, we felt the beach somewhat underwhelming and next time would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not for familes with kids”
Reviews.Author: irwin
Reviews.Content: We planned A 7 day family vacation with 2 young children and booked 3 nights in Banyan and 4 nights in town at El Taj. We heard these were the best properties in all of Playa del Carmen. Our first stay was at Banyan and when we arrived we were greeted by the concierge that was extremely helpful. The check in process is very classy system not the typical hotel reception desk. The property is magnificent and we stayed in a garden villa in front of a cenote The cenote is a river stream with very little movement in the water and is more like a nesting ground for Mosquitoes and flies. The property is surrounded by jungle and mangroves and swamp land. We got eaten alive by Mosquitoes and we highly recommend you bring lots of bug repellent. The spa was awesome We thought the prices at the restaurants were extremely overpriced but the service was excellent. Our Kids got very bored because there was very little for them to do. We do not recommend this place to bring kids but excellent for honeymooners. The beach was quite a distance from our room and we thought the property was too spread out for couples traveling with small kids. One night we decided to go into town. The town has a street called Fifth Ave. which is a pedestrian street with a carnival atmosphere with loads of restaurants and shops It took us almost 45 minutes to get to the popular town and 25 USD each way for Taxi. Even though we found this property to be beautiful we left early because we checked out our next hotel when we were in town and wished we booked it for the entire 7 nights. We recommend banyan tree for Romantic seekers or if you want to lock yourself up in a beautiful villa.

Reviews.Title: “2+ Bedroom Villas MIserable for Families of Small Children-Wonderful for CouplesI have b”
Reviews.Author: DorothyOz
Reviews.Content: I have felt bad for nearly a year that I have not written this review- so that other travelers with small children do not spend $25,000 for a 3 bedroom villas for a miserable week as we did.. The staff is wonderful, the villas gorgeous, everything is a dream. However, it is not for families with small children, unless you do not mind having the1 yr, 3 yr old and 6 year old in a total separate building by themselves. Even the upstairs room on the 2 bedroom villa, is an exterior stairwell at opposite end of building and around the corner.. Please study diagrams carefully and quite frankly it should not be marketed to families with small children. I cringed as I flew home and saw an ad touting it as a family resort- I guess to fill their 2 & 3 bedroom villas. The 3 rd bedroom is across the yard in the livingroom pavillion which has the small kitchen (no utensils/pans) The problem is even that has an open swimming pool and open hot tub between it and Master villa that a sleeping child could step in- not to mention the baby or 3 year walking around in day time. In addition, it opens to the beach so even a 6 year child could walk off- or even worse be visited by a beach walker during the night- in their totally different building bedroom or exterior entrance upstairs bedrooom. In addition, there were no children's play area at pool, beach or whereever, the kids club literally looked like it had been planned to be a beach restroom or changing room and was converted to a beach club that housed basically crayons. No activities for children or anything- very very boring for little small children. Staff was wonderful, it was beautiful, from the bell staff always having car with cold waters packed when you left the site, to the kids manager, etc, everyone was wonderful and gracious, but restaurants were not meant for children even if allowed, We had 3 adults and 3 chidlren -so plenty of supervision but the resort is not set up for families of small children. If you had a choice the neighboring Fairmont had better options for small children- pool area and kids club. If you must stay at Banyan Tree with small children, the option would be one bedroom or the timeshare 3 floored villas- they are all contained in one unit and your bedroom is next to children's. Staff wonderul- just not set up for children. I am rating terrible as people need to know- We spent a tremendous amount of money on restaurants as well- thaty is fine but a $600 back yard B B Q for 3 adults and 3 little kids is really too much- and in rain. I truly believe it is dishonest to market this to families with small children. (A side note- even though it is beautiful; romantic etc, I personally wouldn't want to be there even just with spouse- as other than beach, massages & restaurants- nothing else going on- I mean nothing- however, that may be what you are looking for in a vacation and if so they are the best.)

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: mich408
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for 4 nights in June of 2011. I had researched the Mayakoba property prior to going and almost booked the Rosemont. I’m very glad that I didn’t. The Banyan Tree is a fantastic resort with a terrific staff. I booked the regular garden villa for $430 per night. Total came to just over $500 per night with the taxes and gratuity. We rented a car and drove down from Cancun around noon. The property was stunning visually upon arrival. We were greeted and taken to an outdoor seating area where Eduardo gave us a welcome drink, welcome bracelet made from fresh flowers(nice touch) and our key. It was all very relaxed and low key, you didn’t feel like you were checking in at all. A ‘buggie’ which is really just a golf cart took us to our villa. Eduardo was great about showing us around and answering questions. My only complaint, if I had to be really picky, was Eduardo set my bag on the bed and I would rather not have had the dirty bottom touching nice clean sheets. The villa itself is fantastic. The website says private but it really is PRIVATE. Like bring a swimsuit but you won’t need to wear it around your villa. Every single villa has its own pool and they aren’t just a plunge pools either. The water comes right up to the sliding glass door and has steps into the pool from the main courtyard or the side patio by the hammock. There was also a little pavilion with a lounging sofa on the opposite side of the courtyard. The ‘river’ which is really a small channel of water borders the back of the villa/courtyard but there is so many trees and shrubs that its impossible for anyone to see in. Ditto for the people staying on either side of you. The main room of the villa is beautiful, furnished nicely and very clean. The bathroom area is stunning as well with a separate outdoor soaking bathtub surrounded by candles and very romantic. There are two ipod docks and a Bose CD player in the room which is nice when you open all the sliding glass doors and have music playing while swimming, etc. A word about prices, I think the resort is fairly priced and a decent value. The villa itself was a step above/on par with Esperanza in Cabo which charges around $1000 per night. Breakfast for two was included (and delicious) which cuts down on food costs – its huge, you likely won’t be hungry until dinner. Dinner at Tamarind with 2 drinks each cost $168. Margaritas cost $12 inclusive of tax and tip. A beer is $6 from any bar/restaurant on property or the minibar. We had rented a car so several of our meals were had off property. We also stocked up on a few bottles of wine and brought them back to our room which saved. The cheapest bottle of wine on in suite dining cost around $48 incl tax and grat and goes up to $1224 per bottle. In room dining is 24 hours and fantastic. A pizza with goat cheese and asparagus costs $20. The spa was really incredible as well and is worth a separate mention. Treatment rooms are in private little mini villas so you don’t have the large locker room and have to hang out with everyone else while getting ready. Everything is so private. The massage was very good and included with our reservation so I can’t even tell you what it would normally cost. Upon leaving the spa I was too blissed out to think about grabbing a menu of services. I loved how many of the staff greeted us by name, even several days after checking in and how friendly the staff was in general. I love the public areas, gorgeous landscaping, beautiful décor. I didn’t love that it rained almost every day we were there, no fault of the resort. I didn’t love the little ants that found their way into our villa and on our bed. With that being said, housekeeping was quick to change our bedding and some of that is expected with the complete indoor/outdoor open set up that the villas have. I didn’t love that the resort itself is somewhat difficult to figure out and although we requested a map of the property we never saw it. When you turn off the 307 (main hwy) and pass through the gates you need to go through about 2 more guard points which are along winding roads that aren’t clearly marked. Is it charming getting lost in the jungle, trying to find your way to your fabulous resort? Sure. After the third time, I just wanted more signs. The Banyan property itself is set up into 2 main areas. The river front portion is the main part with the reception, all restaurants/bar except for Sands, spa and about two thirds of the villas. The second part of the property is the ocean front portion which can only be reached by buggy, boat (leaves every 30 minutes) or a really, really long walk. If you go for the ocean front villa you will get the beach but you are somewhat cut off from the rest of the property. The restaurant, the Sands, is delicious and the beach staff is great about bringing water, drinks, towels. I do believe that the oceanfront villas are somewhat less private as we were walking on the beach we could sort of see into the courtyards of some of the villas. I don’t think anyone would be comfortable skinny dipping in those villas. If we go back I don’t think I would ever stay in the oceanfront portion as I found it to be slightly irritating to wait for transportation back to the main resort. Do take the boat ride and have Jose cruise you around the Banyan tree’s waterways and the adjoining properties which are all connected on the water. The wildlife is amazing and seeing it close up from the comfort of your boat with a drink in hand at sunrise was priceless. Also, when you make reservations, make sure to request a villa close up to the main portion if you prefer to walk to restaurants, spa, etc. or further away if you don’t mind having to call a buggy every time you leave your villa. The resort is big and spread out which is great bc it never appears crowded but you do get your exercise. Speaking of exercise, the work out room is clean, well equipped but in a somewhat public place with walls of glass. All in all a fantastic resort. We’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Che_Bruno
Reviews.Content: Banyan Tree Mayakoba was simply amazing. From the moment you step foot on the property the serenity envelopes you and you relax immediately. I wasn’t sure what to expect before our arrival due to some sketchy service from the Concierge. In my experience, emails sent during Mexican office hours were replied to, whilst those sent out of hours were either forgotten or ignored and had to be followed up with another email. Not exactly a great start so my tip is to reserve email correspondence to Mexican office hours. Despite my concerns, everything was booked as I had requested and I was presented with my itinerary upon arrival. We had originally booked a Courtyard Villa but as members of Leading Hotels of the World we were upgraded to a 2-bedroom villa. As an aside, it is worth joining LHW if you travel to these types of properties as they have special offers. I expected the villa to be beautiful but was blown away by the design. It’s hard to say what our favourite part of the villa was,: the separate pavilion to lounge in; the huge outdoor bath & shower area; the master suite with doors that opened straight out onto the pool. All of it was superb. As it was our honeymoon, we came back on our first night to find rose petals on the bed. A really nice touch. The in villa bbq was sublime with delicious food prepared by the friendly, yet professional waiter. We also had a couples massage & did the rainforest experience – both of which were fabulous. My husband declared that Banyan Tree Mayakoba is his new favourite hotel. I tend to agree.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Stasonis
Reviews.Content: My wife spent a week at Mayakoba with our two children, 2 1/2 years old and 5 months. At first we we're a bit concerned that a hotel like this wouldn't be all that accommodating to children this young but they went above and beyond to assure we all enjoyed ourselves. Every detail was taken care of and the staff was amazingly friendly, including taking our 5 month old for a little walk around during breakfast one morning (There aren't many hotel's whose staff I would trust with my infant, so this should tell you something)

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: Philly324
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon in May. From the moment we pulled into the resort it took my breath away. We stayed in a standard garden villa and absolutely loved every minute of it. The rooms were fantastic. We really enjoyed the rose petals and bottle of wine that was waiting for us after dinner on the first night. Every morning we stayed in our villa and used the pool until about noon and then made our way to the beach. The service and food were great. Never had a bad meal or came across an unfriendly employee. Yes, the food was expensive, but that should be expected when booking at a resort of this caliber. The breakfast buffet was the best I have ever had when travelling. After eating there every morning we were full until late afternoon. We also rented the bikes which were really fun. However, I do agree with other reviews that they should not be charging for these. The Spa was also a great experience. My husband I did the Rainforest Experience which we very much enjoyed. The resort is meant for privacy. With that said the resort was a little too quiet for us. Even at the pool or pool bar people kept to themselves. We where there on our honeymoon and like to relax, but we also like to socialize with other guests, which we did not find here. Overall Banyan Tree is exceptional in everyway. We typically go to all inclusives, so this was new to us, but we enjoyed every minute of it. We hope to make it back one day :)

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing Asian Resort, but this time in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to visiting the new Banayan Tree Mayakoba, since it opened a few years ago. We ended up splitting our time between this resort and another one on the beach in Playa Del Carmen, and I'm glad we got a chance to experience both. Lets start with stating the obvious - mind blowing architecture, extremely spacious individual rooms with plunge pool, restaurants in a spectacular setting, outstanding breakfast buffet, over the top Thai spa, and attentive staff. The down side - semi inconvenient of getting to the beach, having to wait around for carts (unfortunately, can't get anywhere without them! ) and not being able to see the ocean the second you walk in. This is not a beach front resort, you will need to take a 5 minute boat ride along the lagoon to get there.. Another words, you will not be able to see the ocean the minute you walk into the lobby, from the restaurants or the rooms (unless there's ocean views rooms?), HOWEVER, they have done a fine job with the lagoons and make up for it in many other ways! Anyhow, after spending 3 nights in a dream casita within 80 steps to the waters of the Caribbean, I was a little bored at the Banyan Tree, and couldn't gotten the idea in 2 nights. My husband and I are fine travels and have had the pleasure of enjoying some amazing resorts, and this is definitely up there. If you are looking for tranquility, peace, quiet, and away from it all, then this is your place. Thank you for the nice 3 bedroom condo upgrade Banyan Tree, looking forward to visiting your property in Phuket :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - but not without hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Willhelmson
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that I and my girlfriend only stayed here for 3 nights, as I had spent 4 nights previously at 'The Royal Playa Del Carmen' so my review is not based on a particularly long stay. Also, as a side note, some of the pictures of the resort are outdated. They have hedges planted along the lagoon edge, so there's no lagoon view in the Spa Pool Villas. The beachside pool also has a higher hedge for some reason, so it's not quite so "infinity" When we arrived at the resort, we were greeted by Guadalupe, who was very friendly and provided us with much needed cold drinks and cold towels. We were there as part of our celebrations for our 7th anniversary and we were given an upgrade from a 'Courtyard Villa' to a 'Spa Pool Villa' which we would come to regret. Our first evening, we made reservations for Tamarind, and contrary to a number of the other reviews, we very much enjoyed the food. Our first evening was quite relaxed and enjoyable. On our first "day" there, we woke up early and had a very nice breakfast at Oriente and then went back to our villa to change into our swim wear. It's at this point, after changing, that we found..! An army of ants had appeared, marching out of the walls of the closet into all the drawers, our clothes AND into all of our luggage. We absolutely panicked initially, and called housekeeping to figure out a solution. It took over 2-3 hours to "resolve" the situation, as initially only a staff member with a bug spray canister came to the scene. It took us elevating the issue to the head of housekeeping and accommodations before someone realized it wouldn't simply be a "spray" problem, as there was no way I was taking these guests back home with me from Mexico. Eventually the situation got handled, and appeared to be handled well - all our clothes were laundered, we were given some clothing to wear from the gift shop (we were only in our swim wear) and we were moved to another villa. An appropriate response, which we were satisfied with, but the whole event consumed much of our morning. We were told our clothes would be ready by the evening and we made reservations at Saffron that night. We were also asked that if we wanted to check out late or extend our stay as we had lost so much time to resolve the issue - unfortunately we had a hard flight out and couldn't stay longer. We spent the day at the beach and enjoyed the amazing service at the sands and by far the most delicious flank steak sandwich I've had in a very long time.
