My girlfriend had the soft shell crab tacos which were also delicious. The staff at the beachside were fantastic, ever ready to adjust our umbrellas and even refreshed our melted drinks for free! Kudos. When we arrived back at our Villa - there were no clothes waiting for us. We waited. And waited. Called housekeeping. Called guest services. And waited more. Our clothes did not arrive until 11PM. Another issue. We couldn't go to dinner until we had clothes - the restaurant had a dress code, so a late dinner we had that night. We were told when we departed that they were very sorry for the issue with the clothes and had comp’d our dinner that night. Overall, the resort is beautiful, absolute paradise - and the Spa, wow, absolutely amazing! We did the “Rainforest” treatment as well as a couples massage, and their spa services are as good as I have ever had. Overall the resort is beautiful, a very serene romantic environment that is perfect for couples celebrating their honeymoon or anniversary. Side note: if you're someone who attracts mosquitoes like me - be aware that all of Mayakoba is situated on a lagoon and there are lots of mosquitoes! They provide you natural bug spray so that should provide a clue. There were much fewer during our visit, but will always be an issue for when you make use of the outdoor amenities in the Villa or eat out on the patios/decks in the evenings. So in closing, I have many many good things to say about the resort, the staff, the food and Banyan Tree overall.. But for there to be such issues at the resort AND to have such difficulty resolving such issues (which ate up a significant portion of our short stay there!) - at such an exclusive high end resort was simply unacceptable! I must say even in closing that I feel conflicted, as the resort was so beautiful, I feel like my vacation there could have been so much more. As I look upon our vacation photos and the photos on Tripadvisor, it makes me feel like I should go back and even recommend the resort to others based on the “good times” that we experienced, but I find it difficult to justify it given what had happened.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Atlbrown_Fun_Seeker
Reviews.Content: The villas, beach, service, and food are 5 star. We just left today and extended our stay one extra night because we were having such a great time. As everyone says, the villas provide everything needed ...great bed/mattress, the indoor and outside bathroom is incredible (oh and the shower and water pressure was awesome). There are Bose wave radios so just bring your IPOD. I've read some complaints about the location of the TV, well if you go to Banyan Tree to watch TV you're wasting $$$. The "plunge pool" is too large to be called a plunge pool - the water was great and being able to take a late night or early morning swim was great. The pool size was a huge plus over Rosewood. The service was special and what you'd come to expect at a 5 star resort. Every attempt is made to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Marcos at the beach was always on the job take care of business …thanks Marcos. For golfers the golf course is right on property and it's a fair and beautiful course. I finished 18 holes in 3.5 hours and really enjoyed the course. One thing that I hadn't read before is the ability to shuttle between the Fairmont, Rosewood, and Banyan. If the concierge makes dinner reservations or other arrangements on your behalf, you can charge directly to your room. Also, each hotel will take you to the other hotel, as there seems to be a working arrangement between all resorts. We didn't go to the Fairmont, but Rosewood's lobby area is picturesque and it's work going over there to the tequila bar or lobby areas. We really wanted to stay at a resort where we could see and hear the beach from our room, and if that’s must there are 5 star resorts like Maroma. That said we also really like the villa feel of Banyan and getting to and from the beach was never an issue. Bottom-line, Banyan Tree is a special place and one we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: smblue1
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 5 nights of our honeymoon here. WOW!!!! This is a really special place, It is amzingly beautiful. You feel like you are in a little slice of heaven. Our Villla was really fantastic. It's big and the private pool was a really great way to enjoy the sun and have some privacy. Of course nothing seemed crowded on the resort at any point. I reccommend going into Playa del Carmen and Going to Coba if you stay here. This place is top notch. The only people I would say might not enjoy this place would be the ones who need the resort to be right on the beach. You have to be taken by boat or they will pick you up and take you on a golf cart to the beach club.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: Jana5417
Reviews.Content: Friendly and attentive staff. Gorgeous rooms with luxury abounds. The beachfront villas are the best in the Caribbean, each with a private pool and hot tub. Location could not be more perfect. Beautiful lagoons surround the resort with lots of wildlife to observe and enjoy. The Concierge made fabulous recommendations for everything from spa services (which are extensive with an exceptional staff), activities to fill the day and dinner reservations. Truly a world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing honeymoon place!”
Reviews.Author: Masha330
Reviews.Content: I spent a very long time looking for the perfect honeymoon resort and Banyan Tree was definitely the perfect choice! The place was beautiful, our villa was amazing, the service was the best! The restaurants were great, loved the breakfast buffet. Perfect place for a honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise with a Price”
Reviews.Author: lloydgprice
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree is a beautiful, peaceful and impressive Resort, but very expensive so be prepared to pay for staying in paradise. Stayed their for 1 week from 19th to 26th of May 2011, weather was amazing, overall service pretty good, one or two issues with the service but nothing major. Thought about what to say in this review and best advice/tips for anyone thinking of going, so here goes ... 1) Day Trips - recommend using the hotel travel office, they can arrange trips and activities for lots of things, we did the Mayan ruins tour to Tulum and Coba, cost $600 for 2 people which sounds ridiculous but actually well worth the money as you get your own air conditioned car, local tour guide, don't have to queue etc... 2) Beach Club - in my opinion the best part of the Mayakoba resort and well under marketed on the official Banyan Tree website. The beach is nice, sand not pebbles and the Caribbean sea literally takes your breath away, waves are not big or small, fairly calm. Have breakfast around 9am (served till 12) and then be at the beach for 10am to get the best loungers, the ones by the trees are good as they provide all day shade. 3) Bikes - a lot of people are annoyed you have to pay $5 per day per person to hire a bike and I agree, when spending $500 a night on a room, it is not fair to have to pay this charge, think Banyan Tree seriously underestimate all the negative PR they get for this. Anyway, bikes are good, its very easy to ride round the resort, down to the beach, to the main reception or the spa, restaurants.. 4) MiniBar - is very expensive as all high end hotels are, recommend taking a bottle of whiskey, gin or whatever you like with you and then using the coke, lemonade etc... Its very nice having a drink around 6pm as the sun goes down in your own villa with a lot of privacy. 5) iPods/Music - all Villas have a Bose radio/CD/ipod player so take your own music as you quickly get bored with the Chillout music from the 2 CD's they tend to play everyday. 6) Restaurants - not a lot of choice considering its status as one of the leading hotels of the world. Recommend using the other hotel restaurants at the Fairmont or Rosewood. (there are 3 hotels on the Mayakoba complex) Food choice in the restaurants is fairly limited to be honest and one surprise is there is no mexican food on the menu's. The fish/meat grill was the best thing we eat all week, kind of surf n turf style at Sands, the beach resort. 7) Sun cream - take lots with you, its very expensive in the hotel shop, $50 per bottle ! 8) Tips - another controversial subject which gets a lot of attention in reviews, the hotel charges 26% on top of any bill for food/drinks. 11% is for Tax and then 15% is automatically applied as a service charge. So leaving another 10% to 15% as a Tip is hard to accept and another PR issue I think the Banyan Tree needs to communicate a lot better to avoid the regular negative backlash. 9) Bath tub - is huge and well worth relaxing in ! They offer bath experiences in your villa, bottle of champagne, honey and milk oils, candles lit everywhere etc.. 10) Wardrobe - you will have a large walk in wardrobe so don't worry about storage space, take as many clothes as you want, there are plenty of drawers and hangers for two people. Happy to answer any questions, email lloyd.price@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “this is paradise”
Reviews.Author: mayakoba2011
Reviews.Content: everything was exellent they trat you as kings,we didnt find anything wrong, it was a perfect vaction to rest!!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: Gurler
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about this hotel (the service, the food, the location, the villas, the atmosphere...) was truly perfect. We went with a three year old. She enjoyed it as much as we did. It is in close proximity to playa del carmen, xcharet and tulum (all in 30mins range) I recommend this hotel with no reservations. Two things could have been improved 1) our hardwood bed that squeaked with every little move - which they could not fix . 2) Childrens club that was freezing cold and very unattractive.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kates1010
Reviews.Content: Our week at Banyan Tree Mayakoba was one of the most wonderfully relaxing, special and amazing weeks ever. First and foremost, I can't speak more highly of the staff, as they are who make the stay so welcoming, accommodating, and stress-free. Everyone was so warm and friendly; we were treated so kindly everywhere we went, whether it be the boat, the beach or the spa. Truly, they were amazing. And that's just the staff! The resort itself is incredible. Agree with other reviewers that the place felt empty more or less the entire time--but in the way that made it a special secret, just for us to enjoy. The grounds are immaculate, the decor beautiful. Take the boat tour of the canals and see the incredible wildlife! Crocodiles, great blue herons, turtles, everything! With Adrian at the boat's helm and the on-staff biologist (I'm sorry I've forgotten her name!) pointing out all of the incredible birds nesting around, it will definitely be an hour to remember. The beach is too good to be true. The sand is so fine and white and never once is hot to the touch. The food was wonderful. Darn, that's a great breakfast buffet. Just TRY not going back for seconds. Not possible. And the green juice? You'll wish you had bottled it and smuggled it home (I do). As a vegetarian, I found there were always loads of options at every meal. I do wish they were a little bit better about preparing tofu but really, that's splitting hairs. My boyfriend loved everything (meat included) he ate. Our villa was amazing. Between the peace and quiet of sitting by the private pool while reading my book and listening to the birds sing to each other in the canal, the incredible bathroom and shower, the beautifully appointed (and inviting!) bed and the outdoor bathtub in our Garden Villa, it was tough to figure out where to roost! Coming home to the turn-down service was a true treat, as well. And don't forget the spa and the Rainforest! Both were amazing experiences, though I think I'd take a treatment from Aim over the water-park-made-for-adults. All in all, BT Mayakoba is amazing. My only other critiques would be the $5/day charge per bike (which, nonetheless, were super fun) and the hefty charge for transportation to and from the airport. Seems that when you're spending as much as you are for your stay at the resort, these things would be included.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: chup56
Reviews.Content: Looking for a perfect place for a second (First) honey moon ? we just found it. Excellent Service & Food , Beautiful facilities, Private Not even One single complain, it’s just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - it doesn't get better than this”
Reviews.Author: AERICTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but based on the some of the others I felt compelled.... First, this place is in an amazing location "Mayakoba" which is definitely the best location to stay in Playa Del Carmen. The weather was great for our stay and the scenery was unmatched; from a world class PGA tour course, to the beach, to the lagoons surrounding the property, the whole thing is surreal. Upon check in we were greeted by a host who showed us to our villa which was second to none. My wife and I travel 5 star very frequently and have never stayed in nicer accommodations. The villa was like a small guest house complete with a private pool, outdoor tub, lounge and hammock area, etc. The inside was great too....I would say that the villa was about 800 sq. feet and was spacious and inviting. Food - For us it was amazing. We ate at both Tamarind and Saffron and enjoyed their portions, price, and selection. The staff of the entire resort was what made it for me. As a business owner myself I understand the importance of human capital and that is clearly evident here! The employees love working there and take pride in their jobs. The grounds were lush, the workers were polite and all spoke English, they were all very accommodating all of the time. If anything were to set this apart from other locations we have traveled in the world it would definitely be the people. Spa - World class...we did a spa day with lunch in between and I would compare it to some of the best spas in the world. The treatment rooms are villas that are private and all of the people working are expertly trained in Thailand. Truly a relaxing experience that was unique to this property. Beach - Perfect, clear blue water, true (comfortable) lounging chairs, and attentive service at both the beach and swim up pool beachside. Tip....order the soft-shell crab tacos for lunch they are wonderful! Overall, for us it couldn't be better, of course there are people that will complain about anything but there was nothing to pick on here....the Rosewood and Fairmont are within walking distance for other dining options. You needn't have a reservation b/c the restaurants are never full...you walk in when you are ready to eat and you are seated immediately. Planning a return trip soon! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Villas... but you may want to eat somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TweetieBird_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banyan Tree as our first stop on our riviera maya "tour." I could not believe how large and private their amazing villas are! We stayed for four nights before we continued to other five star resorts... It was great that you could rent bikes to head down to the beach with (perfectly convenient; however; I don't believe they should charge to rent bikes daily it should be included at this type of resort)... The beach was perfect and the pool area & sea in that area was calmer than in some other areas we went to. The biggest disappointment at this resort is their restaurants were lacking in service and there seemed to be more of a communication barrier with their staff there in general than at other resorts - Saffron was a nice restaurant for Thai food however; extremely expensive and portions seemed relatively small in comparison to the cost. We truly did love the Villa and the size of the Villa's are incredible! You will definitely love their accomodations however; if it were up to me to go back again I would definitely have meals at either the Fairmont or Rosewood, within the same Mayakoba development rather than spending so much money at Banyan Tree and being disappointed with the service staff & meals... Everything else was terrific! F.Y.I., Also, the property is quite large so if you are looking to stay at a smaller resort beware that this is a major hotel. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: JWimmer74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an amazing time at the Banyan Tree resort. The property is spectacular, and the service exceptional! Everyone there was so eager to help, and always with a smile. We stayed in a Garden Room Villa and loved the spacious room, pool and garden area, outdoor tub and great bathroom. The turn down service was incredible. They had the most relaxing music playing, a great aroma and lighting, and always left a small souvenir/gift. The night before Easter Sunday they even left an Easter basket full of chocolates. I was very impressed with their attention to detail. We ate at all three restaurants, and liked the Saffon the best. The breakfast buffet was incredible. We had a BBQ at the Sands one night that was very good. The spa was also amazing. We enjoyed the Rainforest Experience and highly recommend doing it at the end of the day, as we both went home so relaxed that we crashed that night. We also enjoyed a 3 hour spa package, and the treatments and massages were great. We also enjoyed that boat trips to and from the beach, as well as riding the bikes around the property and to the beach. A few of the days at the beach it was quite windy, and the conditions weren't great for swimming. If you walk down the beach a ways to the next resort property the beach is better for swimming. Overall, we had an amazing experience! Our only regret is not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around, even better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: sjbroadway
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Banyan tree. Our first trip was just us, and everything was so amazing, we decided we had to share it with friends. Our party all together was 2 couples and we had a 2 Bedroom Sunset Ocean side room. The room was AMAAAZING and had more than enough for room for all of us. When we arrived there were 2 beds in the upstairs bedroom, after requesting to push them together, they did and you couldn't feel that it was 2 beds, so our friends slept very comfortably. Everything there was just as amazing as the last time we went, even better. The menus were updated, there were more options for dining, and the service was, as always, superb. We tried one of the new options, the in room Grill. They come and set up your villa with a table and candles etc, and cook a HUGE meal for you right in your own villa. It was a great way to end the vacation. HIGHLY, CANNOT SAY IT ENOUGH, RECOMMEND this place. BOOK NOW! We've already sent other friends here and they all come back raving! It's so special and romantic and like nothing else in Mexico. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great villa concept, let down by dining options and inefficient hosts”
Reviews.Author: Dannyt986
Reviews.Content: For the price of the villas and the very expensive extras including food and beverage any guest at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba should be entitled to expect close to perfection and a totally stress free break. The Banyan Tree Mayakoba could get there but only once some real annoyances are ironed out. These annoyances are highlight by other reviewers and we saw others staying at the same time as us experience similar frustrations too. First the positives: - The villa concept is great and we loved our private, squeaky clean, quiet villa space with pool, hot tub, day room etc. - The communal areas are also clean, well maintained and beautifully designed - The staff are smart, friendly and always willing to help (albeit not so efficiently always) - The golf course is in great shape and challenging but fair (and windy!) - The breakfast buffet and team are outstanding. This brings us to our first big annoyance. Far too many requests were forgotten, incorrectly followed through or simply not possible. Our restaurant booking the first night did not exist, on the second night was messed up too. After spending the first two days stressing if we had dinner reservations or not, eventually we gave up, and ate at the Fairmont the next three days where the telephone receptionist was able to make bookings in any restaurant with immediate confirmation. We had to ask 4 times for the lock to the main villa door to be repaired, twice it was patched up, twice nothing happened at all, never was it properly fixed despite me showing the maintenance guy where the real problem was! I recommend that you book SPA treatments, in Villa BBQ (great BTW), etc before arriving. We stayed 7 nights and on day 1 were told the first BBQ booking available was on our last night 6 days later. Never were there any free SPA treatment in the popular 4-6 slot. For an exclusive hotel there should be more capacity for such requests. Our second big annoyance was the dining options. During our stay Oriente breakfast restaurant was closed evenings, leaving a Thai restaurant, a high end Mediterranean restaurant and a beach restaurant with only a set menu Grill choice. Getting reservations is overly complicated: in an exclusive hotel you should not need to book yet we saw at least three parties including ourselves being turned away from these restaurants despite clearly available tables - completely inexcusable. I gather in room dining is great (our BBQ certainly was) but after a day in your private compound you want a change of scenery. The food was always fine, but the Mayakoba's dining alternatives do not offer value for money or provide enough real alternatives. All advertised prices are exclusive of 10% tax and 15% service charge that is applied regardless of party size: it ends up costing c.25% more than equivalent service and quality at the neighboring properties. I would love to be able to wholeheartdly recommend Mayakoba Banyan Tree, but cant right now. All it requires is a bit of hands on management: Mr Lennkh, get out from behind your PC responding to Tripadvisor reviews with "I'll pass your comment on messages" and spend a bit more time walking the hotel. We did not once in a week have any interaction or see any management in action. The villas are a lovely concept. My recommendation for now is if you go: reserve all treatments, restaurants, golf, bbq well in advance and get confirmation in writing. Then relax and enjoy. Take dark glasses to avoid seeing the damage at checkout!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth - except the food”
Reviews.Author: travelfromMN
Reviews.Content: If you're even considering staying here, don't think twice. It is the most fantastic, relaxing trip we have ever taken. Pros: -The rooms are wonderful; spacious, clean, provide you with coffee, flip flops, beach bag etc. -The service couldn't be better; always friendly, smiling -The beach is beautifully kept -Getting around on bikes, by boat, and golf carts was great -The property was gorgeous; apparently the hotel was full because of Easter weekend, but we hardly saw anyone there except at the beach or the restaurants -We did not take the kids, but I think it's a perfect place for kids. They have activities and the private pools make it perfect. For those who don't enjoy children, go to an adults only resort! -Morning brunch is extensive and yummy Cons -The food. Mediocre at best. There are a few decent meals, but otherwise quite boring. Not much selection on the menus. We had the asian barbecue at the Sands Restaurant the first night. I can do better on my george foreman grill! On the up side, the service and ambience are so fantastic it almost makes up for it. Almost. -Charging for the bike rentals. Seriously people - why the 5$ for the bikes? - Pools should be heated. We were there in April when the weather was hot but pool still too cold to go for an evening or nighttime swim Overall, though, you can't go wrong. Banyan Tree is my new favorite chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, totally relaxing and great service: Must experience”
Reviews.Author: 7continents99
Reviews.Content: We came here for a portion of our babymoon and my wife loved this place. The service is exceptional, the rooms are fantastic - we stayed in the spa suite with our own private pool and living room. We've stayed in a lot of nice hotels: i.e. Ritz, Luxury Collection, Mandarian Oriental and this is one of the best. The only knock is that the food is good but not great. We enjoyed the Thai restaurant which was authentic and tasty, but the other ones were just okay.

Reviews.Title: “It is the best.”
Reviews.Author: Coloradotmom
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to Banyan Tree and the Riviera Maya. Several employees made our visit and outstanding one. There were Manuel and Alejandro at the bar, Manuel, Francisco, Felipe at breakfast and the Sands. Ivan, Carlos and Emmanuel at the beach club. Their smiles were so warm and we immediately felt welcome. A tip is to rent bikes to get to and from the beach. $5 a day. What a fun way to see the property, which was immaculate. Every single person we saw on our daily ride greeted us with smiles. Another tip is to get extra key cards to use for the a/c while you are out of your villa. Our unit did not cool down fast enough in the evenings without the key card in place all day. Pack your sunblock and the sun is intense! it is $26 a bottle at the gift shop. Change money to offer as tips and pay for smaller items. Our villa was a garden villa. We did not have a hot tub or bigger casita. We did not need one! We used the pool daily. The temperature was perfect. The hammock was key for naps. Bottles of water, fresh fruit and delicious coffee were in our villa every single day. The bed and linens were top notch. The rain shower felt heavenly on my sunburned skin. The Beach Club and Sands has the only lunch option outside of room service. I enjoyed every single dish I tried. Breakfast, which is included, was the biggest and best buffet. Even had sushi! And if you did not see something you wanted, they would find it for you. Saffron was our only choice for dinner. And it did not disappoint. We had the filet and pad thai, several appetizers and wine. We sat outside and watched huge fish swim by the dock. A very romantic setting. We went off campus to the Fairmont and Grand Velas. Both hotels were beautiful. But not to the level of The Banyan Tree. We played El Cameleon Golf Course twice and saw crocodiles and tons of iguanas. We went to Playa Del Carmen twice by taxi. It is a $20 ride and so much fun. I felt very safe the entire time I was there. Whether I was at the Banyan Tree or if we were downtown. Although we saw several children enjoying their vacation, I would not bring my little kids until they were old enough to enjoy the luxury of this hotel. The majority of the visitors paid a lot of money to enjoy the peace and serenity. I would not want to disturb their vacation. And now to the spa. Heaven inside the Banyan Tree. We had a couples massage and enjoyed a scrub, a shower, and then the massage. It is a must do at this hotel. It will spoil every massage you have after your visit. We were sad to leave. The week flew by and we were incredibly relaxed. I cannot wait to return. Thank you Banyan Tree staff for a remarkable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CT1230
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for 5 days in March. We selected the hotel mainly because of all the good reviews in Tripadvisor, and it was really very , very good. When we arrived, the Villa wasn't ready yet, but they took us to the beachclub to have lunch and picked us up an hour later. We were upgraded to a Spa Villa, very beautiful and spacious. The garden is very secluded, the pool amazing. The first evening we had in room dining, it came within half an hour after ordering and was really nice. The people that work at the Banyan are very, very nice. They knew us by name after one day. We didn't leave the property other than one meal at the Rosewood, just to check that out, and although that looks very nice at night, it seems to be much larger than the Banyan. A The Saffron is a good restaurant and especially their tasting meal is very good. Be aware that only breakfast is included (also one of the best we've ever had in a hotel!) and all the prices are New York standard and sometimes more. But it's absolutely one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at, and we've seen quite a lot...

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree is a Dream”
Reviews.Author: YoungMAK
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I will probably ever stay at. The service is second to none. The place is just amazing... It was my second stay, and I can not wait to go back. The place is perfect if you prefer relaxation and tranquitlity, more so than adventure an excitement. My wife and I had a villa with a hot tub and private pool, and we pretty much stayed in most of the time, since the beach was windier and we had everything we needed in the villa. The Rooms: - Huge Villa, Cozy, Comfortable, Clean My wife and I had a villa with a hot tub and private pool, and we pretty much stayed in most of the time, since the beach was windier and we had everything we needed in the villa. Food: - Breakfasts are excellent. - For dinner feel free to try some other restaurants on the Mayakoba Grounds - We really liked our dinner at the Rosewood Mexican Restaurant. - For dinner or an afternoon snack I ordered in-room service ceviche, which I just loved. Overall: I can't quite put my finger on it, but I stayed there last year, and somethings did not seem quite as nice as my initial visit, but that might just because I was in awe during my first visit. All in all, the Banayan Tree Mayakoba may be my most favorite place in the world.

Reviews.Title: “HARD TO DESCRIBE IN WORDS THE UNIQUENESS OF THIS PROPERTY - AWESOMEST VACATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: KonstantinR
Reviews.Content: I don't want to spoil it fro you. You just have to go and see for yourself. All I can say that we enjoyed every second of our vacation at Banyan tree. Have tons of pictures and surely going to come back. One advise: Take the boat tour around the Mayakoba canals...you won't regret it. Thank you and all the best, KR

Reviews.Title: “Overrated 4 star at best”
Reviews.Author: 60763Tgg
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell - Location, grounds, common areas, pools and service were all outstanding. The villa/room was lacking only due to minor repair issues, outside areas in need of painting and fabric tears. Room layout (or rather TV placement required you to lay in bed to view TV or move furniture so that you could sit. I would expect this in a hotel room but not a villa. The private villa pool is simply unusable in March since the water is cold. The pool should be heated. Probably a good thing since the circulating pump is on a timer which allows for insects and debris to build up while not operating. The breakfast buffet is the best eats at the Banyan. We tried the 3 remaining restaurants and found the food to be average at best and seriously overpriced. As noted in the rating the hotel is a solid 3 to 4 Star. I would recommend with these deficits in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Service sets this resort apart”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier_Daddy95
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Banyan Tree-Mayakoba in the past two years (first visit was the week that they opened (March 2009), and the second was March 2010)). Rooms: Awesome rooms...every year we've had the villa with a bedroom and separate pavilion. Each suite has a private pool and jacuzzi...and an outdoor bathtub (some have outdoor showers in addition to the indoor shower). Bathrooms are massive...lotsa space to explode your luggage. Restaurants: We ate at Oriente every morning for breakfast (full buffet included in room rate), and typically went to Saffron, their signature Thai restaurant for the dinners where we ate out. Saffron's manager started out as a waiter at Banyan Tree-Phuket, so it was gratifying to see that the Banyan Tree corporation is promoting from within and offering opportunities abroad for their talented staff. Great Thai food, by the way. Bellmen: Awesome. These folks are the backbone of the resort. They're empowered to cater to their guests' needs, and follow-thru with any and all requests. Check-in/Check-out: A pain point for our visit. We had a $14US room service charge that we were overcharged and brought it to the check-out staff's attention the night prior to leaving. The follow-up that was committed was never completed. The next morning, when we went to settle our bill, the day staff at check-out weren't aware of the issue, nor did they seem to be empowered to make the decision to adjust our bill. This has been a consistent issue with each of our visits. It was a minor charge, but wasn't the best way to end our vacation. Beach/pool staff: Excellent. The folks there recognized us from our previous visits, and were extremely attentive. We were able to leave our children at the kids' club one morning and they had a great time. One thing we did notice on this trip was that there was a bit more trash on the beach compared to last year. Room Service: We had room service dinner for five of the seven nights we were there...par for the course if you've got young children. Room service dinners were as nice as eating at the restaurants, especially if you have dinner set up in the pavilions. Follow-up: Resort hosts were there for the check-in, but when we contacted them about activities or special requests, the follow-thru didn't seem to be there...we had to call them back to get a response. Suggestion: In-room checkout...by the resort hosts. This may smooth out the check-out process issues that we've had. One comment about the breakfast staff..actually more of a commentary about the other guests: Even though breakfast was included in the room rate, we tipped the staff $5-$10 each morning. This seemed to not be the norm, and mid-way thru our visit, we were noticing that the waitstaff were EXTRA attentive to our family. These folks were working very diligently to ensure that breakfast was running smoothly, plates were being cleared, etc. We got the impression that the other guests weren't tipping them at all. Service was already very good in 2009, excellent in 2010, but we feel that it may have dropped a small notch this year.

Reviews.Title: “A couples retreat like we have never seen before”
Reviews.Author: carlyle
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site do the hotel justice - it is an amazing place to reunite, or just unite with that someone special. Waking to an outdoor shower, stepping out of the bedroom directly into a heated private pool, having a wonderful dinner cooked by a private chef, this place is simply wonderful. Some things I was wondering about before we went and now understand: The difference between a spa pool villa and a courtyard villa is more than just the rooftop massage area. The spa villa gives you a heated pool and spa versus just a heated spa plus you get a steam shower in the master bedroom (AWESOME!!!!). We thought we would like the roof massage for two but the mid day sun was sooo hot we elected to do our massage in the pavillion. If you do get a spa villa book the massages well in advance for sunset and it will be perfect - the hotel was full when we arrived and we had only morning and early afternoon massages available (hint most packages come with a massage so the hotel has a much higher spa use ratio than most properties) OK some hints if you are going here: book the in villa barbq - we left for a cocktail party and when we returned they had placed magical lights all around our pool and dining area and we had a great chef grilling our dinner, serving us on white linen under the stars, a wonderful time and not too pricy about $135 per person - almost $500 less than places like Las Ventanas charge for a private chef experienece. The Ixachel private boat dinner was certainly remarkable and an event we will never forget, but all in it came in at $450 per person for dinner and drinks so it may be out of reach for most, but 3 hours sailing along on a boat, listening to love songs while the sun set and a private chef fed us drinks and expert food, it was beyond awesome! The rooms are as great as the rest of the posts describe, the little touches like a full size laundry hamper and seven pillow choices we continued to really appreciate through our stay. Improvement areas are with the free internet service: one word SLOW. This place would seem to demand good high speed service rather than the turtle speed we had. The front of the house (cars, shuttles, etc.) seemed to be off a bit as well and we waited much longer than necessary for anything except arrival and deprture, those things are precise.. In every other aspect this hotel is one of the most very special properties you will ever stay at. If its time - go - it will give you what you need to make everything in your relationship right...oh yeah, leave the kids home, we did...HURRAAYYY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BT Mayakoba sets the bar a notch above high.”
Reviews.Author: EscapistNYC
Reviews.Content: This review is quite belated as our stay dates back to May of ’10. Nonetheless, as I seek out vacation options for this year, I find myself comparing every resort to BT. Given the property was new at the time and perhaps remains so in comparison to Mayakoba alternatives, there were some excusable.. shall we say.. areas of improvement (incl. bike rental $5 fee should really be waived, water anywhere should be complimentary, and guests should not have to go to neighboring resort to get some Advil). Overall however, the level of service coupled with the accommodations is superb. The breakfast extravaganza is an event I truly miss and have not seen anyone else come close. The beach is quite small, yes. I think May is not the best month if you’re expecting crystal clear waters. But that’s not in their control. Many have complained about mosquitoes but that’s simply a reality when you’re surrounded by nature. Again, it was a fantastic experience and I am a very meticulous, perhaps demanding traveler. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Sky high expectations exceeded...”
Reviews.Author: TheotherOC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I knew going into this trip that the Banyan Tree Mayakoba was one of the highest rated resorts in the world, and we were expecting a lot. We were not disappointed! From the moment we checked in, we felt the warmth of the staff who would do absolutely anything to make your stay perfect. We were immediately given flower bracelets and a delicious 'vitality' drink. We were promptly shown our villa, and then offered a boat ride around the property. This is a must. Our guide, Jose, was very knowledgable about all the wildlife we saw. We stayed in a garden pool villa, and we enjoyed laying out by our own private pool. The bathroom is gorgeous, and the outdoor tub is great at night, complete with candles. We rented bikes and enjoyed riding to the beach and around this well-manicured property. Breakfast at Orient was included, and was much more like a large brunch. Fresh fruit, juice bar, delicious pasteries, mexican specialties, and more. We didn't ever have to eat lunch after this large meal. Cesar did an amazing job serving us. The rainforest experience at the spa was very fairly priced, and included several shower environments, sauna, and several pool stations. The Banyan Tree is an elaborate resort on prime beachfront, but it is their warm and courteous employees that make this stunning setting feel like home...a home to which we plan to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: CJMTraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for my job and rarely am I "wowed" but this resort is amazing. From the arrival and check in to check out...I highly recommend this resort. I traveled for business and it is an ideal property for a high-end incentive or board meeting. But for couples...PERFECTLY romantic. There is so much I could write here but not enough space. The staff "gets it"...great hospitality. Beautiful beach, beautiful accomodations, excellet spa. Oh, and the restaurants...Saffron...incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise! Perfect romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissos
Reviews.Content: Went there with my fiancee for a long weekend and I just have to say that it overpassed all of our expectations! Beautiful and spacious room! Excellent service! Its not just a hotel its an experience! It is the perfect romantic getaway.... Not really a family though... Banyan tree has become my new favorite hotel chain!

Reviews.Title: “As romantic as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: lrf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been waiting to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and 50th birthday. We knew this was going to be the place for us, we just had to make the time. Mission accomplished. We were transported by private Escalade to the Banyan Tree. Check in was flawless. We stayed in a courtyard pool villa and it was incredible. Our private indoor and outdoor living space was romantic, relaxing and private. The candles, incense, music, windows, guest amenities, thick towels, slippers, beach totes, flowers, fresh fruit, mood lighting all enhanced the experience. We stayed one week and never felt as if we needed to leave the property. The food was lovely. Breakfasts in Oriente are a must. We would arrive around 10AM and eat enough to tide us over until dinner. Don't forget to ask about the sparkling wine cocktail of the morning. For dinner, we ate at Saffron three times, Tamarind and Sands once each, room service twice. In our opinion, there were always enough restaurants open (at least two out of three, plus room service) for options. Do not forget to try the room service option for dinner. Our dinners were delivered hot (not warn) and with all the condiments, candles, silverware, crystal needed for royalty. We ate both of these dinners outside by our pool and jacuzzi. It you choose to dine outside at Saffron, they have a "moon table" that overlooks the lagoon. Ask for it when you make reservations. It's semi private and extremely romantic. In the late morning, early afternoon we would ride our bikes to the beach. There were huge loungers with comfy pads and thick towels waiting for us. The beach attendants were helpful with positioning our chairs and beach umbrellas as the sun revolved. Drinks were of high quality (grey goose, herradura, etc.) and plentiful. Often times we would be the last to leave the beach club and they had "spotters" on the path to assist us with finding the way back to our villa on our bicycles. The spa is incredible. We had several treatments and all were first rate. The actual treatment lasted as long as advertised. The rain forest is an experience. If you indulge in the Valentine's special (3 hrs. of bliss with your companion) it's a private session there. The exercise room has very nice equipment but is on the small and warm side. This is one of the few recommendations that I would have for Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Enlarge the space and install fans. The golf course was gorgeous. It is hosting a PGA event later this month. Price was reasonable and the head pro very friendly. Having stayed at Las Ventanas in Cabo is a close comparison. Accommodation wise, BTM has the most luxurious villas in the market. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfection as we have found...”
Reviews.Author: aboutfacenj
Reviews.Content: This resort truly is. The villas are spacious, comfortably appointed and very private. The courtyard area of the villa we stayed in was so nice, we spent several afternoons just hanging out there. The staff is professional, friendly and attentive without being over-bearing. You get the impression that they truly care, not just seem to. The overall design and architecture of the buildings and property is superb, the perfect blend of Asian and Mayan esthetic. The planners took special care to preserve the natural environement and natures abounds. The whole place exudes tranquility. We enjoyed the food, especially the breakfast buffet that satisfied a wide variety of international tastes. We wished that The Orient (breakfast restaurant) was open for dinner as well offering an additional option for dining. The hotel staff were very accommodating and made sure that our needs were met. Ask, and anything you wanted was yours. We especially want to thank Laura, the concierege, for all that she did to make our stay so wonderful. Other notable staff that we'd also like to thank are: Alejandro, Carlos, Eduardo, Ernesto, Federico and Omar, but there are many others whose names we cannot recall. Thank you, thank you for making our much needed vacation so wonderful. We look forward to our next visit, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “breathe the open air, and re-charge”
Reviews.Author: bluehorizen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a budding star. The concept is brilliant. The Villas are huge and self contained. Outdoor bathtub, spa, pool, and great big lounge beds. Very clean. We were outside at all times - riding our bike to the ocean and sitting in our back yard, bathing in our outdoor tub. The messages and spa services are outstanding. The only drawback is the service - well intentioned but needs refinement. Responses to requests were usually really slow or flawed. All was done with the best intentions and a graceful smile - so it is hard to criticize them. I believe that with time, they will work out these kinks and this place is a winner. The food is adequate but could be better. Saffron is the only restaurant we really liked.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves and robbers working at Mayakoba”
Reviews.Author: Brockxerox
Reviews.Content: I would avoud this place like a plague, i had my room turned down the first night and as i left for dinner, i forgot something and when i walked back to my room i saw about 8-10 people in the bushes outside my balcony window and the turn down service inside.. They are all working together to clean out the rooms. I had camera stolen and diving gear stolen. A watch and some other items. The hotel takes guest to a fake police center that they control and help to cover up the crimes.. I would avoid this place even if you think it looks pretty and good. Most of these other reviews are by their staff who post them..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3Ring
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as a getaway from the kids. At first I was leery of staying in a villa that had no view of the ocean, but the vill was spacious, very well done and private - soon I realized I wasn't that bothered about the lack of an ocean view. The beds are super comfy with great linens. The bathrooms spacious and superbly appointed. The villa pool was beautiful, if cold (villa pools are not heated so in Dec., Jan., Feb. they can be quite chilly). And even the large outdoor space was very, very private. We stayed in a garden villa and it was great. I believe to be on the beach/have a beach view, you need to be in a 2 or 3 BR villa. Regardless, we loved the room. The short bike ride to the beach (along the golf course) was no problem - enjoyable, even. The beach club seems a bit small for the property size, especially considering the large (and largely unused) pool by the main building. The staff at the beach club, as throughout the property, were great. In the mornings it was perfect: quiet and calm. In the afternoon, the pool area got a bit crowded, so we went down to the beach on some lounges and we were fine. Every so often, the staff would check on us and they were always available if you needed something. The hotels in Mayakoba all have charging privileges with each other. One night we wanted seafood, so we took the complimentary shuttle to the Fairmont and had a nice meal outside on their patio. The breakfast buffet is very nice. And the staff there quickly learned our preferences. We'll certainly go back. And we want to try the Acapulco property as well. After this first stay, consider us Banyan Tree fans. The service was outstanding, always available, but never infringing.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Mini-Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandAmanda2011
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I were married in Riviera Maya earlier this month. At the last minute, we decided to extend our stay in Mexico and head to a different resort after the big day. We chose the Banyan Tree mainly because of the appeal of a more private, relaxing type of environment than the larger resort we chose for our wedding. From the minute we arrived, the service was impeccable. Yunita greeted us with cool towels and refreshments as we checked in. As we arrived earlier than check-in time, she escorted us to the beach to relax until our villa was ready. We were there just long enough to enjoy a cocktail and enjoy some sunshine when we were notified that our villa was ready. THE VILLAS We chose a Courtyard Villa for our three day stay. It was beautiful. Wonderfully appointed with a lounge area separate from the master bedroom. Private pool and jacuzzi as well. With the amazing room service, there was absolutely no need to leave our villa. THE SPA Very accommodating - fantastic, relaxing, a must do. We did not experience it firsthand, but The Rainforest was unlike anything I had ever seen before. We chose the Thai Detox Treatment and it was phenomenal! OVERALL The food, the service, the staff - everything was impeccable. I would recommend this for anyone looking for a quiet and relaxing private getaway.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel a little too quiet in the evenings awesome beach club”
Reviews.Author: BostonGringo
Reviews.Content: We went with small children and they were very relaxed at the kids club. The pool at the beach is 90 and the kids loved it. The breakfast buffet is amazing and you should include it in package. Saffron is a very good thai restaurant. Seemed like most went to Playa at night.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it now!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLuxuryHotels
Reviews.Content: I am not going to write a long review for this resort as other reviewers have covered most aspects in detail; I will honestly just say- book it! It is a slice of Asian luxury in Mexico, and it works perfectly! My husband and I visited during Thanksgiving weekend when the resort was at capacity, but it still felt secluded and private. The pro of going then- not a single bug/mosquito; the con- the private pool was too cold to use. Once the resort converts the pools to heated, it is an incredible winter getaway, and not far from the east coast at all given direct flights into CUN. So, if you are considering the hotel, just book it and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: RafBenN
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Banyan tree we've stayed in. The villas are lovely and spacious; everything you would hope for and expect. The hotel is immaculate. The spa is excellent. The beach is also very nice. The breakfast is outstanding. Clearly it is a hotel for couples, but even so they were very accommodating for families with babies, they had excellent babysitters, high chairs, and even a small kids club. Despite everything we had a lovely week at the Banyan tree. The achilles heel of the hotel is its service. We had an issue on the first night when to cut a long story short we thought the first villa smelled of damp and it took 2.5 hours to change villa even though there were other villas available. It was irritating because we had a small baby who needed to go to sleep, and by the time we moved we had to wake him because the hotel had no more cots. To cap it off, when we finally moved room and were getting ready for bed, semi-undressed, a security guard walked in without knocking on the door. At 11pm someone called to discuss (in Spanish) the do not disturb sign that I had reported broken an hour earlier. Irritation turned to insult when the manager was unavailable to speak to us at the time, or the next day, or the next. Does the hotel even have a general manager? All customer communications are delegated to the hotel hostesses who are not much more than perma-smiley receptionists. They left the standard plate of truffles in our room which according to earlier reviews seems to be the standard compensation. We didn't even realise it was intended as an apology as we had just come from a hotel that cost less than half that left truffles in our room every night. We started to question if we were being unreasonable, but for nearly $1k per night for the cheapest room we expect excellence. Eventually the very capable rooms manager found us on the beach, said and did all the right things, and redeemed the hotel. The problem is that the hotel has a chronic service problem. The staff are very helpful and eager to please and I almost feel guilty writing this. If you ask for a buggy, or some ice, to be sent to the room, sometimes it arrives immediately, but more often it takes up to an hour. If you ask for tea with cold milk at breakfast, it may come with no milk, hot milk, or sometimes you get a cappuccino. Only once in 7 attempts did they manage to bring it correctly. We were told restaurants were closed only to find that they were open. Waiters in the restaurants didn't even have a passing knowledge of the menu, if you asked a question about a dish it was as if they were hearing about it for the first time. You get the picture. Things did improve after new years day as the hotel got quieter but a well run hotel should be able to deliver a good service even when full. The Banyan is going to have to raise its game to stay number one.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful. Every praise wrote here before is true”
Reviews.Author: barranqtraveler
Reviews.Content: What could i say in addition to everything that has been said in other reviews? That if you are in doubt about where to go for your beach vacation, and you can afford the rates, you must go to this hotel! Also, that I am 100% positive you will not find anything close to Banyan in Riviera Maya or Cancun in terms of service, accomodations, ambience, or overall quality. Not even the neighboring Rosewood which comes to a close second place, but second after all. Being a seasoned traveler that have stayed at St Regis, Four Seasons, Jumeirahs, Peninsulas, Mandarin Orientals and other Leading Hotels of the World, I can guarantee that the service of Banyan Tree Mayakoba equals or outperforms the very best of the formers. Not to mention the rooms (a 4000 sq ft villa, with a mid size private pool, gardens, separate dining/lounge area, enormous and beautiful bathroom and bedroom is your room). Food is excellent in almost all the restaurants (with the exception perhaps of Tamarind which is not bad at all, but has some dishes that can disappoint compared to the excellent level of others dishes of the same restaurant or other restaurants of the hotel). A hint, if you decide to go, ask for Alejandro to be your resort host ( a sort of personal vacation planner but also a butler when you need butler servicing, that the Hotel provides you with) What an excellent and gentle staffer! To say it all, this was my first time there, and already am in the planning of a second stay for this easter season.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Runningshoes
Reviews.Content: This places lives up to all the hype and more. It is a 6-star resort. We stayed in a Spa Villa – the private pool (which is a proper pool you can swim laps in), hot tub, in-door/outdoor showers, outdoor bathtub and the complete privacy all add up to a truly spectacular experience. I’d be happy just staying in the villa during my entire stay. Since we had a spa villa, we took advantage of the spa setup on our rooftop twice and got in-room massages. The massage therapists from Thailand are the best I’ve experienced. Highly recommend the in-villa BBQ – you get your own personal chef to come to your villa and prepare a multi-course meal complete with romantic lighting setup around the pool. It was the best meal of our stay and incredibly romantic. We received outstanding service throughout our stay – it is the type of Asian luxury resort customer service that you just don’t get in North America. Other reviews mention some customer service issues but thankfully we experienced none. The only negative was the number of mosquitoes on the property but not really sure that can be helped. Six months later, I still have the scars. Recommend taking some strong mosquito repellent with you if tend to attract mosquitoes. The repellent in the villa was not strong enough to protect me. Overall Banyan Tree Mayakoba highly exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Miraculous, Private and Amazing Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: jadaisy123
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write up a review on this Incredible Resort for months now. I will do my best to recollect - but it was honestly so dreamlike!!! We chose Mexico for our honeymoon (Aug 17 - 22, 2010) since it was convenient location-wise. We wanted to find the best-of-the-best resort... and we DEFINITELY did. Banyan Tree Mayakoba is by far the most exquisite, relaxing, amazing, private, romantic place I have ever been. It would rank 6 stars on a 5 star scale. We rented a car from Cancun airport (to save some money and have some freedom) and drove ourselves to the resort. It was an easy to find and no hassle drive and Banyan parked our car for free. Upon arrival we were greeted with fresh towels and delicious exotic juice. Our host, Marian, was the sweetest and most helpful person!!!! She answered all or our questions and even went out of her way on occasion to find us at breakfast and inquire of how our stay was going. After our tour of the resort and our villa (we were upgraded to the Courtyard Villa!!) we unpacked in our spacious modern-style villa and then rented our bikes to explore. (I highly recommend renting the bikes as it is both fun and exercise :) Otherwise you can opt to be driven by golfcart). The beach was a short ride away - including a restaurant, beach drink service and infinity pool... you are all set! Each villa has it's own pool and or hot tub, so you can swim privately or at the wonderful public reflections pool. Each night, we received a romantic turn-down service. When we would return from dinner our room would be prepared for a restful and romantic nights sleep. During our stay here, we ate at all restaurants... ALL AMAZING!!! We even splurged and booked Itchel, the private boat tour w/ private chef. It was one of the most incredible meals I have EVER tasted. The chef was both personable and informative and even gave us privacy at the end for a moonlit tour of the lagoons. I definitely recommend getting the daily breakfast at the Orient - the variety left us stunned each morning. They have the freshest and most unique options! We mainly meandered between our villa and the beach most days. We also booked a couples massage that was wonderful! However - if you are looking for nightlife all day everyday... I would suggest another resort. Banyan was very private and quite empty during our stay (which is Exactly what we wanted). We did take 2 day trips- 1. Playa del Carmen 2. Tour of Mayan Ruins & Ceynotes Staff Experience: World Class, 110% attentive and left us 110% statisfied Ivan waited on us a few nights (Sands & Tamarind)- he was so helpful, nice and gave great meal recommendations. Montserrat at La Copa was so pleasant when serving us drinks and appetizers. She always remembered our reservations and asked if we enjoyed them the day after! Amondo at the reflections pool was so fun and care free - we even signed up for his Cocktail Making class. Another staff member, Daniel, was so helpful to us when our bikes weren't working properly too. Overall I HIGHLY recommend this resort. We hope to make it back someday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury honeymoon ... we cannot wait for our next stay at a Banyan Tree.”
Reviews.Author: K-LoAstoria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from our honeymoon to Banyan Tree this past November. We could not have picked a more perfect resort. Not only is the resort stunning, but the service was impeccable. There's a host/hostess available to you 24-hrs a day, a buggy on-call at your disposal, and all the waiters/servers are kind and trained to the utmost of standards. The villas themselves were spectacular. We stayed in a courtyard villa which has its own separate breakfast nook with TV, bar, dinner table, large sofa, etc. Outside we had our own pool and jacuzzi. The pool was sometimes chilly (not heated), and the jacuzzi sometimes hot (but they would always send someone to adjust it), but we just preferred the beach and the resort pool anyway. The bedrooms in the villa have a cathedral ceiling, huge bathroom for two, walk-in closet, massive shower, and outdoor bath. The food at the resort was divine. We ate at Saffron first when we arrived for our stay. They greet the women with flowers for their hair, and sat us at the special table at the end of the dock, overlooking the mangroves. Tamarind was also delicious and quite eclectic downstairs from the lobby. Sands (at the beach club) had a great barbecue night and served Mexican food in Oriente (which was closed for dinner during our stay because of 'low-season'). Breakfast every morning was at Oriente and believe us, you've never seen breakfast buffets like this. Think sushi bar, yogurt bar, fruit bar, bread bar, juice bar, pastry bar, omelet/egg bar, and hot stations. If you have the chance, the 24-hr in-villa dining is actually really good and the presentation is impressive. The resort has a bar in the lobby, at the pool, and at the beach. The bar at the pool was closed during our stay (again, 'low-season'), but the staff around the pool was happy to order us drinks and bring them down from the lobby. You can get around the resort in the buggy, rent a bike, or walking in most cases from the villas to the lobby. The beach is a bit further and can't be walked to easily, but you can take the buggy/a bike and they do have a boat that leaves from the lobby which makes a really nice trip to the beach club. Definitely take the short eco boat trip which takes you around the mangroves to see the local wildlife. Last, but not least, the spa. We spent two mornings in the spa. The first was a massage in our private spa villa with a bathroom, shower, and a seat for tea/water before/after the treatment. Really professional staff who are experts in their treatments. The second morning was the 'Rainforest Indulgence' which included an abbreviated 'Rainforest Experience' session followed by another massage in the villas. The 'Rainforest' portion included a cold/hot shower, steam room, full body scrub and shower, salt steam room (brine room), and then a tropical shower, followed by time in the vitality pool. While staying in Riviera Maya, definitely put a few days aside to make a trip to Chichen Itza and to Tulum. We piggy-backed our trip to Tulum to also go zip-lining, snorkel in two cenotes (a must-do) and eat lunch at a local restaurant. And after Chichen Itza we went through Valladolid, a Spanish Colonial town, for a nice lunch in the most charming hotel, El Meson del Marques. We spent three days following our trip in Cozumel. While we were anxious to get into a more festive, social environment, we were quickly missing Banyan Tree. We will absolutely look into additional Banyan Tree resorts for our future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But Not For Everyone....”
Reviews.Author: SIMONandCARO
Reviews.Content: The preceding reviews of this hotel are fairly accurate. The Villas are excellent, the Spa is fantastic and the level of service is very high. But rather than repeat what others have already said, let me make a few observations about the hotel and the surrounding area based on my 14 night stay, which you may find relevant: LOCATION: The hotel is located in a private resort about 30 minutes away from Playa del Carmen. While the Banyan Tree is a peaceful, quiet and serene environment, Playa del Carmen is a cheap, touristy, dirty and run down place. On 5th Avenue (the major tourist thoroughfare), you will find very poor quality shops, bars and restaurants and streets littered with trash and dead animals (today a dog). Although some people will enjoy the delights of "Playa", it's hard to imagine that anyone who enjoys the Banyan Tree, will enjoy it's neighbouring town. DINING: Having conveyed my views on Playa, it should be clear that any decent dining options lay in the hotel itself, or in the restaurants of the surrounding 5* hotels. In the Banyan Tree, the dining options are extremely limited. This is problematic given how unappealing it is to leave the resort. "Saffron" the signature restaurant of the Banyan Tree is a perfectly good Thai restaurant set in the most romantic setting within the hotel on a series of piers overlooking the lagoon. The food here is nice, but not spectacular, and my palette generally struggles with Thai any more than once a week. The next option is "Tamarind", the hotels fine dining restaurant. This restaurant is located in the somewhat sterile lobby building and the food is far too complicated and over-engineered to be a regular dining option. And while the food in here is ok, you probably won't want to eat there twice - think Nouvelle Cuisine with large portions and just a few too many flavours going on on one plate. That leaves "Oriente", which is the main hotel restaurant where an excellent breakfast is served. In the evening however, Oriente normally serves a buffet, which in my experience is exceptionally poor and overpriced. Furthermore the atmosphere is one of a canteen, which at $65 per person for the buffet is unacceptable. In short then, dining options outside the hotel are very limited, while the hotels own dining options are not adequate to carry the burden. The in-villa BBQ dining is well worth doing however and restaurants at the nearby Mandarin and Rosewood, can help to fill the voids. ATMOSPHERE: the hotel is tranquil, calm and relaxing. As a consequence, do not expect any night life, energy or vibrancy in the hotel in the evening. BEACH: my experience of beach and poolside service was very good. The beach is nice, but the sea bed is covered in a green algae which feels unpleasant underfoot. TENNIS: the hotel shares 2 tennis courts with the adjoining Fairmont and Rosewood (around 800 guests max) which is inadequate for a resort of this size and booking a court is difficult. CONCIERGE: the concierge function at the hotel is not strong. There is little understanding of the quality / type of travel and dinning arrangements that guests require outside of the hotel. Notwithstanding the above comments, we loved our stay at the Banyan Tree and enjoyed the environment of the Mayakoba Resort. The hotel also proved a good base to explore Tulum, Chitchen Itza and Cozumel - on the latter place, the scuba/snorkelling here is fantastic and the beaches are nice, but the rest of the place is a total dump, so I would advise against taking the 40 minute boat unless you want to explore the reef. In summary then, the Banyan Tree is a great hotel to relax, unwind and enjoy the sun. As ling as that's all you are looking for, you will not go wrong at the Banyan Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Rooms, service a bit unpolished.”
Reviews.Author: Pumkin2000
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is amazingly beautiful. If I give it 3 stars, it is because I am not sure it was worth the money it asked from us. Money aside, this is without doubt a 5 star venue. It is the curse of the super exclusive resort that every little blemish gets overblown exponentially by the demanding guest. I am aware of this and will try to avoid giving the wrong impression that this resort is terrible. It is not, it is very nice. However: Biggest problem: Service. Very friendly, but perhaps a bit over-motivated? When we moved in we asked for a couple of extras. "Yes yes, we will check" was the answer to everythying and then I never heard from them again. There was always a tendency to over-promise and under-deliver. It extended to the restaurants as well, for example, they would say "ok we will serve the spice and coriander separate from the soup" and then everything was mixed together anyways. Or, they would ask "are you allergic to any foods" and then what do they actually do with that information? Nothing. My wife has lactose intolerance. They still recommended all kinds of cheese and milk dishes. It is nice you ask, but what do you actually do with it? My wife and I have stayed at much more exclusive and expensive resorts in the past (e.g. six senses) where they ask the same things, but they actually do work with that information. Unlike Banyan Tree, they also make sure your special requests are handled correctly. For example, we asked for late check out and were surprised to hear, a couple days later, that our request had actually not been entered. We also asked for a copy of the menus from all the restaurants so we could plan our dinners, asked twice (!), and never got them. Was that a difficult request? I asked for a cable to connect my MP3 player to the stereo, was told "I will check for you" and never heard back. Not to mention the buggy that never came to pick us up on our first night. On the last night I offloaded my frustration over all these things on the poor guy who takes the guests phone calls. Maybe I overreacted, but thinking about the level of service we experienced in other resorts I really do believe I had a point there. Minor thing: My wife and I have different last names. Hotel staff kept addressing me with my wife's name. They did take my credit card and passport when I checked in, so they should have known I have my own name. Then my wife got hurt when the hammock crashed down because it was not tied properly. No serious injury, and we are not Americans who sue for millions in damages for emotional trauma. But she does have a chronic back problem and this was potentially dangerous! The staff did not immediately understand the problem and it felt a bit as if they did not believe us. They sent chocolates, this is nice, but also a bit lame. If my wife had dislocated the disc in her back, our vacation would have been over. When the hotel repaired the hammock, they used what sailors call a Palstek type knot, but it was not done right and I had to correct it. It felt as though they did not (want) to get out of their way to make us feel better about this incident. I suspect they did not really believe us. Another thing that was a bit uncomfortable was the Wifi. There was no signal in our villa. We had to go to the garden to get a signal, but it was so weak that the connection was very slow. Same applies to cell phone coverage. I wanted to make some business calls and actually had to hike up to the lobby to get a good signal. The food: I did not think the restaurants were very good. I mean, really expensive and really average. The so-called christmas dinner was very average and very overpriced. Speaking of Xmas: Did it actually happen? There was not a trace of Xmas in the hotel. Why? The Thai restaurant was outstanding, not because of the food, but because of the owner (I guess he was the owner, the thai guy). He made us feel very special and gave us the best and most romantic table in the whole restaurant, overlooking the water. This is the kind of service and attention to the customer that I had been expecting from everybody there. Perhaps I am a bit spoiled from having stayed at more expensive resorts. But I really thought that Banyan Tree was playing in a similar league. I am sorry if this is not the case and my high expectations were unjustified.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Met Our Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: emma2303
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banyan Tree for our honeymoon and I would recommend it to everyone. We did have an issue when we arrived though. On the first day, they brought us to our villa, which was amazing, but it was hot. They said to give it 30 minutes to cool down. So we went and got some drinks/snacks at the bar. Went back to our villa about an hour later, and it was still hot. The A/C appeared to be broken, which isn't good when you're in Mexico in August. So we called the front desk. They came and looked at it, I'm not sure if they did anything, but they said to wait 45 more minutes and it should be working. The room stayed hot. Now at this point, it was just getting ridiculous. This was our first day there, they knew it was our honeymoon, and for the price of this place, I would have expected them to either fix the A/C ASAP or move us to a new villa ASAP. So I was getting really annoyed that they were wasting our time with this. We called the front desk back and they came back to the villa. They said that the A/C was broken and they were going to upgrade our room now. Oh thanks a lot, after this whole ordeal took 4 hours out of our first day here. So we had a rocky start. But everything after that first day was great. I would recommend swimming with the whale sharks. That was an unforgettable experience but I think it's a seasonal excusion. We visited the other hotels, Rosewood and Fairmont and both had great food. Also, the Rosewood acknowledged our honeymoon with a dessert :) The food and drinks at the Banyan Tree were good too. As everyone stated below, be ready to pay a premium price for EVERYTHING. We prepared for that beforehand but it's still difficult to order an $18 drink and try to enjoy it. The in-villa dining experience was amazing. Definitely one of the top 5 meals I've ever had. Overall, I think we would go back to the Banyan Tree if we were ready to spend a small fortune again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AdamCLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in December. Suite was fantastic with surprisingly big on site pool and a bathroom the size of many apartments. Setting of hotel between mangroves and sea is simply stunning and architecture very well suited. Room service and massage both good. Was not impressed however by restaurants. The THai restaurant Saffron is no better than my local Thai restaurant in London for 3x the price and the mediteranean restaurant Tamarind was also a big disappointment. Staff are friendly but a little inexperienced for a hotel of this standard

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba was heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: distinctivetravels
Reviews.Content: From our private in-villa pool and Jacuzzi, to the rain shower, to the exceptionally friendly and attentive staff, this place is unlike other luxury resorts. It truly is a paradise, especially for couples seeking a romantic, secluded getaway. The fusion of Thai and Mayan influences are felt throughout the design of the property, the spa and the cuisine… making the Banyan Tree Mayakoba a unique experience. Some of our favorite experiences were: biking around the resort on their Trek bicycles and taking in the lush landscape as we biked to the beach, dining at Saffron, where the Thai staff cooked up remarkably authentic Thai dishes (the Massaman Curry is a must,) sitting in our outdoor soaking tub surrounded by a carved stone wall of lit candles while gazing at the stars, and ending the day with a Balinese massage.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation we've ever had...Twice in a row!”
Reviews.Author: 1987300ZX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reluctantly chose to return to the same destination two years in a row, although it was well worth it. The Banyan Tree Mayakoba was as wonderful as it was in 2009 with the most subtle of changes. - Bikes now cost $5 each per day although it didn't bother us one bit. We got along just fine with outstanding buggy service, and occasionally chose the water taxi from the beach back to the main pavilion which is a beautiful choice, but not if you're in a rush. - The absolutely essential "Rainforest Walk" has decreased in price to $39.99 each over last year, although I would easily pay double that for the experience. In short, it's a private tour of a beautiful spa facility consisting of different sauna's, steam rooms, etc. The final stage is my personal favorite, a serene pool area with jacuzzi's and different pools to get lost in. The whole experience lasts more like 90 minutes vs. the advertised 60, and your personal assistant can't wait to describe each stage, hand you fresh water or a cool washcloth. If you don't make a reservation while at the Banyan Tree...Shame on you! There's too much to cover about the stay although it's the breakfast buffet that is for someone that truly appreciates fresh food, nearly an emotional experience. I dare Tom Colicchio and Padma Lakshmi to come up with a reason to give the buffet experience less than a 10. If you like to hold yourselves hostage on the resort grounds for the week as my wife and I did though, you may find yourselves looking for some alternatives for lunch and dinner by day 4. The Thai influenced "Saffron" is a wonderful experience but I would give it 4 out of 4 dollar signs for pricing, an experience that leaves your wallet asking you "Did you just take me to NYC's Le Bernardin for a chef's tasting?" All told though, we made it work with a combination of huge breakfasts, light lunches at the beach and "In Villa Dining" 3 times during the week. Don't you dare refer to the "In Villa Dining" as room service as it doesn't compare. Portions can be a tad stingy (I'm being nice as I'm so in love with the Banyan Tree) although the service is as attentive as some five star restaurants here in NY. Bottom line: Cash in your JetBlue credits now, fly to Cancun and take the 35-40 minute ride to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba, at which point you will forget that the rest of the world exists, at least for the week. The plush surroundings. The most attentive, humble staff on Earth. We are absolutely in love with the Banyan Tree Mayakoba and have plans to return each and every year we can.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous hotel with pretty darn good service”
Reviews.Author: greggcohan
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience here was outstanding. The rooms and the surroundings are gorgeous. The service is very good. There are only a few issues that I would point out. Although there are multiple restaurants, they are not all open for all meals. For example, the only really viable options for lunch would be room service or the Sands which is near the beach and a bit of a hike. One day we were at the pool near the main hotel and we asked for food to be brought over poolside from the Sands. It nearly took an act of God for this to happen. The Oriente and Tamarind were always closed at lunch time. The only really great food was at Saffron and the breakfasst buffet. Lunch at the Sands was very good. Tamarind was a bit disappointing so we only went there once. This is important because you are likely to have most of your meals at the resort. Bottom line is that the service and food isn't quite up to the surroundings. The worst problem I had was at checkout. There were several incorrect charges. Obviously if I caught 3 errors on my bill, this must happen there quite often.
