Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a one week stay at Banyan tree. As has already been mentioned in many prior reviews, this hotel is outstanding overall. The inside of Courtyard Villa was beautiful as was the private pool. The friendliness and warmth of the staff working at this hotel is unparalleled. In particular, Cesar at Oriente, Sarah at the Beach club, and Marian at reception were outstanding. I have never met a nicer hotel staff at the premiere hotels in which I have stayed. Only have two complaints: The first involves the many lizards seen throughout the hotel. We have traveled to tropical regions many times before and have seen many lizards on the grounds of hotels. However, never have we seen so many lizards INSIDE our bedroom. We found 9 lizards in our bedroom and courtyard villa. The sizes ranged from 4inches to over half a foot long. Given that we paid $800 per night to stay in this hotel, this is not acceptable. Again, we have stayed at other elite hotels such as One and Only, other Rosewoods, Fairmont, etc, in locations where lizards are endemic. However, never have we seen lizards INSIDE the rooms. We ended up repacking all our belongings and moving to a different Courtyard villa after finding 3 lizards in the first 36hrs. of our stay. The second room was pre-sprayed with "lizard deterrent" prior to us moving but had the same problem. We found another 6 lizards. One of them even fell off the ceiling onto my wife's head. My 2.5yr old son who was sleeping on a cot on the floor had nightmares of lizards crawling on his bed (one of them nearly did). Because of these experiences, both were afraid to spend time much time in our courtyard villa and bedroom -- definitely a huge waste. He ended up being afraid of sleeping in his cot and spent most nights sleeping with us. Again, this is not acceptable for a hotel that charges this amount. To compensate us for this, we were were given just a $40 discount off a massage at the Spa -- somewhat sad given the small proportional value compared to the $800 per night rate. Lastly, the food at this hotel is very good but not great. The highlight of the food is the Oriente buffet breakfast. We ate at all the restaurants at the hotel and were not particularly impressed. We ended up eating 3 dinners at the Rosewood Mayakoba which has better food. As an aside, the service provided by the In-Villa dining is superb. Overall, the hotel appearance, ambiance, gracious and friendly staff, and service was great. However, because of the experience with the lizards I must warn all those who are not in-touch with nature to consider this prior to booking. One might argue that our experience is an anomaly, but we did have this experience in two different villas, one of which was pre-sprayed with deterrent. Coincidence, I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon/Romantic Destination”
Reviews.Author: adlr
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to the Banyan Tree. The hotel was quiet when we were there (40% full) this added to the exclusive and private feeling of the grounds. We stayed for 11 days and in that time ate in all the resturants on site plus a number off site. I thought the food was excellent, a little pricey. The Thia resturant, Saffron is outstanding. We also ate in the villa on a number of occassions which was excellent (Kobe Beefburger is awesome). We popped next door to the Rosewood a couple of times (fine dining) which was worth the trip. We also travelled into Playa Del Carman for food which gave a different scene to the hotel but we were also happy to return. The SPA was incredible and you have to do the Rainforest walk, it is the best $35 you’ll ever spend. Service and staff we excellent, we had a resort host that helped us with everything we needed. We did Bed and Breakfast which I recommend as the breakast buffet was fantastic. All in all 10 out of 10. The only critisiums we can level at the place is It was extremmely hot in June and there are a lot of mostiqitos.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place to enjoy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotels in the western hemisphere. Excellent servie, impecable accomodations, the staff is so professional and so diligent!!! Food is very good and the entire property is well maintained. This is a place to really enjoy nature, to walk or ride your bike and get the most out of the wonderfull surroundings. The villa that was assigned to me had such a great location! All you could hear was birds, the wind and nothing else. I could have stayed there for weeks! The Spa is a must. The therapists are Thai and they are so professional and so well trained. The entire Spa is a delight and the aray of treatments will certainly behove you to come back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, serene, and special”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: This spectacular hotel is a treat for all senses. From your arrival towards the impressive architecture of the main building, to the impeccable service from its staff, you’ll be astounded by just how well you will be treated at this fine & romantic establishment. We were invited to stay a night here with friends who were upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa. While I can’t speak to price / value, I did want to share my comments and photos, as this place really left an impression. The two bedroom villa was incredible. A private pool and Jacuzzi, a separate relaxation hut and space (that we used for drink preparation), the most unbelievably beautiful bathrooms you’ll ever see, and tasteful modern furnishings. The beds / pillows (with pillow menu) were extremely comfortable, and with the fantastic air conditioning, we had a sound night’s sleep. The accommodations are true 5-star. We opted for a BBQ – where two friendly gentlemen brought a bbq, table setting and all food into the private villa, cooking a feast of delicious cold salads, seafood appetizers, grilled lobster, and steak. This entire experience is a must! The superb staff explained the proceedings, slapped a freshly squeezed lime margarita into your hand as they cooked away and the twilight fades – tiki torches light up the outdoor area and you are served a delicious meal. They offered cappuccinos at the end, and a simple phone call results in the table setting being cleared. Incredible. Another highlight was the buffet breakfast – outstanding quality and variety – we opted for made-to-order omelets but also tried a warm shrimp salad, guacamole, cactus juice, hot chocolate…enough options to please anyone. The beach area & pool are relaxing and very quiet (no kids that I saw), and the grounds of the entire hotel have to be seen to be believed. This is the perfect place for a romantic, recharging getaway. I’ll let the photos speak for themselves…we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalled Luxury”
Reviews.Author: katster88
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Banyan Tree was one of the most relaxing experiences I have ever had! If you have any doubts about staying here like I did, don't worry it WILL live up to your expectations. The pictures on their website and Tripadvisor really do it no justice - the entire experience from the luxuriousness of the property, to the ultra attentive staff and the serene nature of the environment make for an amazing getaway. My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights at the Banyan Tree and we were so relaxed by the time we left that we felt like we had been there for days. Yes, it is VERY expensive, but it is worth it. I have stayed at many luxury collection hotels around the world and am so glad to have this one so close to home (NYC). Although there were a few hiccups along the way none of it would deter us from coming again. We went over Memorial Day Weekend which was perfect because it was low season without the hurricanes and few mosquitos - we felt like we had the place to ourselves. Checkin - our hostess Mariana greeted us with some juice, cold towels and flowers. She sat us down at the lobby, gave us an opportunity to relax while she checked to see if our villa was ready. We arrived a few hours before checkin but our villa was ready within 20 minutes. Villa - We had a Courtyard villa (#204) which was HUGE. One building housed the bedroom, the bathroom with his and hers sinks, the outdoor bath, a large rainshower that overlooked the outdoor bath and a walk in closet. In response to one of the other reviewer's comments about the air conditioner - i am particularly sensitive to cold and it was not a problem. The best part of the villa was the ability to just open the door and jump into your own pool. The pool was not heated but at 85 degrees outside, mother nature took care of that. Next to the pool was a hot jacuzzi, a hammock and a pool bed. The way the villas are laid out ensured privacy - no one can look into your villa or pool area and there is a privacy sign outside to let the staff know when you don't want to be disturbed. The turn down service was really exceptionally. The staff draws all of the curtains, cleans up any mess you have (they even folded our dirty clothes), sets the music and lightening to make for a restful and romantic return. Bikes (problem) - The beach is a bit far away from the villas but we are big bikers and rented a bike to get us to the beach which was a great experience. One thing we would recommend is better signs for the bike path to the beach. We got lost initially and the second time we had an aggravated encounter with a golfer who said we were not suppose to be on the path. This could have been avoided by clearer signs of which paths to take particularly at intersections. If you are not a biker, they have a boat and buggy that can take you to the beach. Beach and Pool - The beach was amazing. The sand was extremely soft, no rocks and the Gulf water was warm. When you arrive at the beach, the staff sets up your beach chairs and they come by every so often to see if you want anything. The only problem that I had was that I had to ask for water 3 times before someone got it for me which was a small annoyance given how perfect the rest of the service was. We did not use the pools because we had one in our own villa but there are 2 pools - one heated and one unheated. Food - The breakfast buffet at the Oriente had alot of wonderful healthy options. I would have liked to see more savory options because there were a ton of sweets. We had lunch and one dinner at Sands (the menus were different) - they serve traditional Mexican food which was very good. We also had dinner at Saffron which was amazing. The restaurant is the most romantic restaurant that I have ever been to and I HIGHLY recommend going there. We had the 7 course meal which was $65 a person - definitely worth it to try all of their signature dishes. ALSO we had a special lemongrass ice tea which was delicious and refreshing particularly with spicy food - DEFINITELY ask them to make it. Eco Tour - Everyday at 11am they have an eco tour by boat where they take you to see a ton of animals. It also passed by the Rosewood and Fairmont and there is no question that the Banyan is nicer. Service - Overall the service was impeccable. The staff greeted you wherever you went. I had a minor spider bite accident and they even sent a get well dessert dish to my villa and Mariana asked how I was doing every day.

Reviews.Title: “Mose exquisite AND relaxing vacation we've ever been on.”
Reviews.Author: foxycoxy8
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this resort. Absolutely everything was wonderful. The price to stay here is definitely out of our normal price range, but we splurged and it was well worth it. The resort is beautiful, and the food is spectacular, but the STAFF is actually the best part. We've never experienced anything like it. They are so incredibly nice - they literally wait on you hand and foot and seem very happy to do so - to the point that it's almost embarrassing. We actually had an out of the ordinary thing happen to us while we were there. I had a biking accident that required me to be taken to the hospital in an ambulance. It was a whirlwind of a night, but the staff was amazing. Pedro, the head of food services, drove us back to our villa and stayed with us until the ambulance came. Then he, along with our host Eduardo (sorry if I misspelled the name!), came to the hospital! And Eduardo stayed the whole time, which was 3-4 hours...way past the end of his shift. He personal drove us back to the villa, and even stopped at a pharmacy on the way home to help my husband get my prescriptions. When we arrived back at the villa around midnight, Pedro had dinner waiting for us there since we hadn't been able to eat beforehand. There was also a gorgeous bouquet of flowers with a card signed by a fair amount of the staff. The rest of the week many of the staff members checked in on me, especially Eduardo and Pedro. We still can't believe the staff did so much for us. They are all truly wonderful people, and we would gladly give them our business time and time again. Also, the resort really is gorgeous, and there weren't many people there at all, so it was very private. We actually spent a lot of time at our villa, since it was so nice and we had a pool and hot tub all to ourselves, but the "public" pools and beach were great as well. The beach was especially nice (and the pool right by it) because wait staff come by sometimes with little hors d'oeuvres and drinks compliments of the chef (there is a restaurant right there). The resort offers a free Eco Tour a couple of times a week, and we would highly recommend that if you are at all into nature. I think it's about an hour long, and we saw all kinds of animal life, exotic birds up close, etc. It was great! The only slightly negative thing I could say is that the cab ride to go into Play del Carmen is a little high. I think it was $17 plus tip each way, so we only went into town a couple of nights. BUT, if you're paying the price to stay in such a nice resort, you should probably stay and enjoy it anyway right?

Reviews.Title: “This was truly a romantic getaway...”
Reviews.Author: mojiCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba from May 1-8, 2010 and had the most marvelous vacation of our lives. It was quiet, intimate, private and romantic. This resort is for those who want the privacy of staying in a private vacation villa isolated from neighbors but also want the benefits of having hotel amenities to take advantage of. We booked a Spa Pool Villa which is an incredible choice for couples. The villa is outfitted with more romantic options than you could possibly expect. we never left to make use of any of the common areas because we felt like we were in a private peice of paradise. This hotel pays attention to a lot of details. the staff ratio to guests is very high and all staff express a warmth and serenity when thye greet and communicate with you. villa was beautifully maintained, housekeeping was FANTASTIC and kept the exterior and interior immaculate. breakfast was included with our package and was at the Oriente restaurant. Terrific and fresh choices. More of a brunch rather than just breakfast items. Food was always at temp which I have rarely run into at buffets in other resorts(even very expensive ones). lots of fruit, yogurt and healthy options as well as indulgent options. gym was outfitted VERY well. small, but there was never an issue getting on equipment that you wanted. they even left fruit, water and these fantastic homemade granola bars that i became addicted to. As far as food went, I would not say that the restaurants were the best i've ever been to.I thought the food didnt quite stand up to the standard of the rest of the resort with the exception of Saffron which was by far and away the best Thai food I have ever had. We love thai food. I had asked the waiter if they had my favorite thai dish as i didnt see it on the menu, and even though we ordered the tasting menu he had spoken to the chef and it arrived with our main courses. The chef even took the time to spend almost half an hour with us at our table discussig thai cuisine and how to make our favorite dishes. He gave us his card in case i had more questions. Exceptional food and service that evening!! Tamarind was a real let down for us. Food was average and lacking in taste. Service was still very good, and that is a common theme everywhere in the resort. Room service was hit and miss. Never order a salad because the two times I did it arrived so soggy it was inedible. (caesar salad and cobb salad) We took a taxi into Playa Del Carmen and ate in town 4 nights and had a little entertainemnt and some very nice meals. surprisingly the best restaurants on 5th ave are the italian ones. If you get the spa pool villa, make sure you take advantage of the top floor of your villa and have the spa service done invilla. Fantastic experience!! Great massages!! I have only one complaint about the entire resort and it unfortunately came right at check in. Our villa was not ready when we arrived which was slightly before the posted check in time, which kind of stinks when you are that tired after a long flight but we were escorted down to the beach restaurant where we had lunch and waited for them to tell us it was ready. About 90mins later we were told it was ready and a resort host accompanied us to the villa. As we were walking through with her I immediately started to notice that it didnt seem like the pictures I had seen on the virtual tour I had done. then when we sat down to sign the check in sheet, my husband had gone up to look at the spa level and he said that it was just a bedroom with two single beds. The check in sheet and the resort host then said we had been "upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa" . This was ridiculous and had my blood pressure going through the roof!! Thsi is not what I had booked or paid for. I dont know about you but two single beds is NOT an upgrade for a couple. we specifically had booked for the spa pool villa so that we could take advantage of the shaded sitting area upstairs and the in villa spa services. at first the host said that no spa pool villas were available and then I think she must have noticed the steam coming out of my ears because she picked up the phone and called someone. we were told it would take a few hours but that we could be moved either in the morning or a few hours later. I opted for that day, because i didnt want to unpack, repack in the morning and then unpack again. when we did get into the villa we were EXHAUSTED and i must say that experience did taint the beginning of what was upposed to be a dream holiday. The resort offered us a trip through the rain forest as an apology which is varying differnt degree pools and water therapy. we never did use it. I think it would have been a nicer touch to send some champage and dessert or something to that effect. we are not big on scheduling things on holidays. I truly wish this had not happened because i could then have given this resort a PERFECT 10. Even with that said, we are waiting on some business transactions to go through and then we will try to get to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expecations”
Reviews.Author: Chi_LonTraveler
Reviews.Content: Having checked TripAdvisor frequently before the trip for reviews on this hotel....I was a bit nervous that the hotel would not live up to its expectations. However, upon arrival, I soon realized that the hotel would only exceed our expectations. Having stayed at high end resorts like One and Only Palmilla, Four Seasons, and the Peninsula, I can only say that the service at this hotel matched if not exceeded all of my previous hotel experiences. There was not enough there that the friendly staff could not do for you or would not do for you. The spa was the best spa experience I have ever had to date. Literally, I could go on and on....but I don't want to spoil any surprises. Like others have mentioned on this forum, if you are considering going....GO!!! Mayakoba is a wonderful complex to stay in but after seeing the other hotels and eating at the Rosewood, I am happy we stayed at the Banyan Tree as truly nothing else compares. We even checked on the Mandarin Oriental and we were not impressed. The food was delicious too and we found many unique choices were at Tamarind and Saffron. The room had amazing amenities. Throughout the entire trip we felt truly relaxed and at peace. The only problem was on the last two days. It breaks my heart to say anything negative about my beloved Banyan Tree but I am only posting this as a suggestion to future travelers to consider as well as the hotel management to be aware of these issues. On the last two days a large business group of rather rowdy people infiltrated the hotel. I realize that as a hotel the Banyan Tree has to keep rooms filled to generate business, but when a large amount of people are there (approx 30 or more) that KNOW ONE ANOTHER it takes away from the atmosphere that the staff work so hard to create. On our last full day at the beach club pool, we had to leave the area as the group started drinking and being loud and obnoxious. And why wouldn't they be....they were staying at a hotel they would probably never stay at except for the fact that the business was footing the bill or at least a portion of the bill. We moved to the "quiet" pool near the hotel and then had to leave that area eventually as well once the group moved in on that area. At least we could take refuge in our private pool at the villa. At breakfast, the usually over attentive servers were spread thin as this large group all came to breakfast at once. Our drinks came late and were never refilled until we flagged someone down. I won't let these last two days shadow over the whole experience as it truly was unforgettable. However, you may want to make sure a large group isn't coming through when you book or the hotel should be a little more cautious about what type of groups they let in especially when others are paying a lot to come there. I have never experienced this "group" problem at other high end hotels and I don't think the Banyan Tree would want this to tarnish their well deserved reputation. My husband and I would go again in a heartbeat. We are even considering to try the property in Acapulco. You should RUN to this hotel..... A special note to the Sands Beach Club Staff who made every day so enjoyable....Abel, Eduardo and Jesus. The massage therapists Jay and Lanau (sp?) were the two of the sweetest ladies. Ricardo was a great driver!!! Book this hotel and Enjoy the finest hotel experience in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba”
Reviews.Author: victoria1981
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba and enjoyed every minute of it. We dont normally stay at resort hotels as we like our privacy on holiday but this place provided all the privacy we needed in the most comfortable surroundings. The staff were fantasic, they fall over themselves to help you, nothing seems to be too much trouble. The villas are spotless in terms of cleanliness as is the rest of the resort, the grounds are beautiful and the restaurants serve very good food especially Safron, the Thai restaurant. If you like luxury, excellent service and good food this is definatley a place worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - have a couple of suggestions”
Reviews.Author: norm5Seattle
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a very relaxing stay at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Love the place but have a couple of suggestions to improve it as I know that Mr. Llamas reads these reviews. Before I get to the suggestions I would like to point out the truly wonderful aspects of the resort: Terrific villas with full private swimming pools and with the courtyard villa like we had, an outdoor jacuzzi. Marvelous breakfast buffet with everything imaginable. Excellent food all around - we ate at the Tamarind and Saffron. Great ecological boat tour - very interesting and informative. Like being on the Amazon, but right at the resort. Perfect spa - very atmospheric and great treatments. Well attended at beach with assistance in setting up beach chairs and gettng occasional snacks. Enjoyable set up with the other two resorts at Mayakoba where each would provide transportation to any resort you would like to explore. Particularly enjoyed the Rosewood's Casa Del Lago restaurant which had a chef from Barcelona and great food. Friendly staff at the Banyan Tree. Certain individuals really stood out - Chaba, a therapist at the Spa; Pedro the general restaurant manager; and Federico, the manager of the Oriente restaurant. Now the suggestions: The resort has a mosquito problem at night (at least during the time we were there). We attempted to eat at the Tamarind Restaurant which has really good food, but were attacked by an army of mosquitos. Although the staff provided bug spray, it was of little consequence. The meal would have been a total disaster except for the intervention of Pedro, the restaurant manager, who moved us inside the air-conditioned Oriente to enjoy our entrees and who also gave us a complimentary dessert. For some odd reason, the Banyan Tree had closed its air-conditioned restaurant Oriente for dinner in favor of two outdoor restaurants, Tamarind and the Sands. Would strongly recommend that the Banyan Tree enclose the Tamarind to keep the mosquitos out or move the Tamarind to the Oriente which is already air-conditioned. We returned to the Casa Del Lago at the Rosewood not only for the food but because it had air-conditioning. Another recommendation has to do with the service at the breakfast. Service is excellent, but some staff tend to try much too hard to strike up conversations with you while you are talking to your spouse. They need to look at body language and sometimes refrain from talking. Lastly, a minor recommendation. Since the resort is sprawling, the buggies should be at your beck and call almost immediately. Generally they were, but on our first night we waited 40 minutes - not a good start to our vacation. All in all, a terrific place and wish that we can some day try some of the other Banyan Trees around the world. Congratulations to the Banyan Tree on a terrific resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great time on our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: mille125
Reviews.Content: What an amazing stay. We booked a two bedroom sunrise room for 4 nights. We have been to many high end resorts (ie FourSeasons, Peninsula, Ritz Carlton) and this had to be one of the most tranquil and relaxing times that we have had. The layout of the resort makes you feel like you have the whole resort to yourself. The hotel surprised us with a private seranade via mariachi band after one of our dinners. What a great touch!! We didnt visit the beach that much because of some high winds that were prevalent during our first two days (not the hotel's fault). We enjoyed the daily brunch at Oriente and really enjoyed the rainforest experience at the spa. We plan to spend every anniversary here. There was a minor problem at checkout as the hotel tried to charge my credit card twice for the same stay which was significant because the bill was over 50000 pesos. I was able to sort it out with them. There may have been a minor language barrier. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST-VISIT”
Reviews.Author: bayeriffic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a few days at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba, and we wanted to post this review immediately. We never post reviews on any site, but this trip was so unforgettable, that we wanted to share our experience. 1) Service: The best and most attentive service we have ever experienced(and we have stayed in some of the nicest hotels/resorts in the world). From the moment we arrived, my wife and I felt as if we were the only people at the resort. We had a personal resort host(Fernanda, who was fantastic), who took care of all our needs, as well as showing us around. 2) Villas- We stayed in a Courtyard Pool Villa, which was immaculate, beautiful, enormous, etc. I could not believe how gorgeous the villas were, as well as the wonderful plunge pool that overlooked the lagoons of Mayakoba. Housekeeping was superb. I love the lounge area of the Villa as well. 3) Food-Breakfast Buffet is incredible. The food and service were great-Fernando was a great manager. Enough said. Dinner was wonderful at Saffron. However, a very special mention needs to be made about TAMARIND, which the staff at the resort dubbed as their fine-dining, "eclectic" restaurant. Because of the description, my wife and I almost didn't go, because eclectic signifies strange/different to us. However, because we decided to bail on dinner at the Rosewood(beautiful, but not nearly as great of a property in our opinion), we walked into Tamarind on a whim...WERE WE GLAD WE DID. The service and food were unsurpassed...better than any dining experience we've had anywhere-we are from New York, and Tamarind rivals some of the finest NYC restaurants we've been to. The whole staff, fantastic menu were unforgettable. It was so good, we went back the next night! Special mention to Manuel and Christian, who made us feel so welcome. 4)Grounds/Facilities/Spa: Grounds are immaculate and beautiful. Exquisitely maintained. Spa is second-to-none. You must visit and have an Island Dew massage. Pools were nice, but almost no need because of plunge pools. Still, if you feel the need with kids to go, the pools were lovely. Especially the swim-up bars. If going to the beach, make sure you take the boat from the main part of the resort to the beach area on the lagoon. What a peaceful, wonderful experience. All in all, the trip was one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: csnyder10
Reviews.Content: We booked our honeymoon pretty much solely based on the tripadvisor reviews the Banyan Tree Mayakoba received. We had such high expectations which were certainly met. The food, service and accommodations were all top class. The spa was was also wonderful. If you're still on the fence about choosing this resort then stop thinking about it and just book now!!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: sava87
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at Banyan Tree. It took me days to choose between Banyan Tree, Rosewood and Esencia, eventually I opted for Banyan Tree purely based on the better reviews on tripadvisor. Mayakoba is a private estate by the beach about 5-6 kms before Playa del Carmen. When we first arrived, we were greeted at the entrance by the lovely Miss Colina who was our resort host, she gave us welcome drinks and a bracelet made out of some tropical fruits. As soon as we stepped foot into the place we knew that it was not going to disappoint. After a mini tour of the property we took a buggy to the villa, we were upgraded to a courtyard view villa since I'm a leaders club member. The villa was beautiful, the layout, the bathroom, the pool, the pavilion(lounge) area that was seperate from the bedroom, the outdoor bath tub and the jacuzzi, they were all perfect. What makes this hotel perfect is not just the incredible villas, the staff are unbelievably professional and kind and attentive, in the 6 days we were there we never came across a single staff member who didn't do their job perfectly. Housekeeping was amazing, the reception and concierge staff were great (Miss Fernanda and Zuleyka and our host Coleena are a few of the amazing ones I remember). The main pool is very dead but the one at the Beach club is busier and also nicer but it's quite small so if you're not a beach person, go to the main pool which is located right at the front of the property. The spa is also out of this world, the treatments are very good and the layout is also really nice. Miss Yo and Miss Dayana were both amazing masseurs. We rented bicycles to get to and back from the beach as it was about a 20 minute walk from our villa, I recommend that you do that. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants except for the Oriente for breakfast and in-room dining, both were fantastic. The golf course also looked beautiful but we didn't use it. If you're looking to get away from the world, then this is your place. You feel so relaxed and everything runs so smoothly that you really feel like you're in a different planet! We went to Banyan Tree to relax after 4 days at the Ritz Carlton in Cancun (also fantastic and i will write a review about that too). Playa del Carmen is a beautiful town, it's very cultured compared to Cancun and there are many good retaurants and bars are based around 5th Avenue. I'm a frequent traveller and have stayed in many good hotels but this one was one of the ones that stood out, It reminded me of the Four Seasons Jimbaran in Bali but it was better overall. I highly highly recommend this beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK NOW!! USA-level Luxury and Service in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: sjbroadway
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Banyan last November 2009 and stayed in the GARDEN POOL VILLA. The pictures on the website are exactly what you get! And the service from the second you drive into the resort is comparable to service you get at high end hotels in the USA (ie Ritz, Wynn Encore, Waldorf, W, etc) which after traveling Mexico, I know is hard to find, even when it's advertised...... GREETING- Smooth, Relaxing, Great! ROOM- Cannot say enough! HUGE room with doors that open on all sides for views of the Lagoon or the Pool, your PRIVATE pool that you can dangle your feet in from the Bedroom, while sipping a Margarita...unheard of. Bathroom great! LARGE, HUGE walk in closet! and outdoor soaking tub with gorgeous stone wall fitted with candles. Like nothing I've ever seen before! BEACH- Great! People always complain about beach conditions etc as if it is the hotels fault, but that's mother nature kids! The beach here is beautiful and the service is amazing. Tell them where you want to sit and they set up beach chairs and towels for you , then bring over iced water and cold towels. Throughout the day, they would bring amuse-bouches out that were refreshing!!!!!! FOOD- Breakfast buffet....Amazing! All restaurants were good, expensive, but good. Saffron is the best, sitting out over lagoon cannot be beat! We got bikes to get to and from the beach and it was great. A quick 5 minute ride over the bridge, through a jungle and there you are....in paradise at the beach! The grounds are amazing, clean, well kept, modern. Absolutely unbelievable!!!!! SOOO good, that we are going back in June with friends and booked the 2 bedroom! Twice in one year, that's how good it was!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Like vacationing with infants and toddlers? You'll love BTM!”
Reviews.Author: metadata
Reviews.Content: Villas: A We stayed in a Courtyard Villa. I would recommend this as the minimum room category for anyone staying at BTM during the colder winter months. The villa pools are not heated and were too cold for swimming except for a brave and quick dip in the water, so the hot tub was a nice addition. There are no hot tubs in the base category room, the Garden Villa. The other way this room differs from the Garden Villa is the addition of the pavilion. We enjoyed having this space for being able to quietly make coffee in the morning, as I tend to wake up earlier than my husband. It was also useful for in-villa dining, because the messy dishes were not left in your bedroom area. Food: B+ The breakfast buffet is amazing, and definitely on par with the one at the Ritz in Cancun. It's much larger than the buffet at the Rosewood Mayakoba, in terms of sheer quantity of selection. Other than breakfast at Oriente, we only ate at lunch and dinner at Sands, Saffron, or via in-villa dining. All of those places have plenty of vegetarian options, and I never got bored with the food even though we stayed for eight days. Our main challenge in terms of food was that dinner options seemed too fussy and formal for us. We were typically exhausted after a full day in the sun and we didn't feel like sitting through a multi-course fine dining experience. We often wished that we could just order a light meal or snack at the lobby bar. Also, I know it's Mexico (and not Italy), but the pizza needs to be reconsidered. It quite honestly looked and tasted like Lean Cuisine pizza. The Ritz in Cancun has amazing wood fired pizzas, and although that might not be possible in the BTM kitchens, there is certainly some room for improvement. Service: A Overall the service was great and what you would expect, although nobody brought us dry towels or some of the other things that I have read here. As much as I would like anticipation of my needs, I certainly don't expect it. If a five star resort can more or less offer me what I want, when I want (within reason), then I am happy. If I could make the service even better, I would do so by adding butler service to the villas so that there was one person to contact for any request. We sometimes didn't take advantage of the activities at the hotel because it was unclear who to ask or how to go about making a reservation - and the sun was shining, and the beach was calling! Quiet/Seclusion: C- Yikes! I am barely exaggerating when I tell you that children under the age of three outnumbered adult guests at the resort. Yes, I understand that we visited during a time when it was likely to be spring break somewhere. What was surprising to me was the number of infants and toddlers. One late afternoon when we were at the main pool (the only one that was heated), I looked over at the swim up bar and counted nine kids. I said to my husband, "Look, it's Happy Hour for the under three feet tall crowd!" Even when we spent the day at our villa pool we could hear children yelling and playing in nearby villas. And in case you were wondering, yes there were also kids in the beach pool. Breakfast was especially bad with kids running around, crying, yelling, and even one day - running through the restaurant with silverware in their hands! We often felt like we had to eat as fast as possible, because it was not a relaxing environment. Also, the one evening that we went to Saffron (which we adore - order a Ginger Lagoon - yum!) a table was seated near us with two kids young enough to need high chairs. For me, that was liking taking a baby to dinner at Top of the Hub, or whatever your town's "go to" romantic dining establishment might be. I know that kids will be kids and I do love kids, but I was just a little surprised at the sheer number of them especially since the majority of them were under the age of three, couldn't swim, and were too young to ever be able to remember that they had vacationed in Mexico. I left wishing that Disney would open a five star resort so that these families would have somewhere age appropriate to vacation! Summary As you might be able to infer from this review we're not billionaires and we don't have kids. We love traveling and staying in five star resorts, especially beach destinations. We're 30-somethings that work hard and when we're on vacation we like to relax, eat delicious food, and experience excellent service. BTM fits our criteria perfectly, but I think we may have stayed there during an off week. I would return to this resort, but probably only if we were traveling with a group of friends. If I was looking for a more quiet and intimate vacation I would probably choose a different resort. Of course, this is based only on my experience and it seems that our stay here was not typical. Feel free to contact me with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Dopanijoso
Reviews.Content: We landed back in New York after a blissful week at Banyan Tree Mayakoba and miss it already. We stayed in a 3-bedroom terrace villa, which was beautifully decorated with an Asian, Zen-style theme. A big living room on the middle floor, three bedrooms on the ground floor, a master with a king, an additional king and another with 2 twins, all with full bathrooms ensuite. On the top floor we had our smallish private pool, overlooking the golf course and a big lounging bed for sunbathing. Service could not have been friendlier, all the staff tried incredibly hard to please and succeeded almost all the time. The buffet breakfast was outstanding, perhaps the best I have ever had at a hotel, and the food at the 4 restaurants we tried was very good, albeit pretty fully priced. The beach, reached via a 5 minute golf cart ride was gorgeous, with fantastically comfortable bed like beach loungers The gym. though small, had great equipment and the spa services were great, with therapists from Thailand and Mexico. Although the spa service pricing was crazily high at over $200 including tax and service but before therapist's tip for a one hour massage - presented as 90 minutes as it includes 30 minutes relaxation with tea after the treatment. All in all Banyan Tree Mayakoba now ranks as my favourite hotel in the world ahead of Amanpuri in Thailand, The Upper House in Hong Kong and Cliveden in England.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Food Amazing....”
Reviews.Author: goof87
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights and cannot say enough good things about this special resort. Lots more kids than I would have thought for a Banyan Tree which can be good or bad depending on what you are looking for. But given that every villa has a pool and there is plenty of privacy to be had on the beach, if kids are not your thing you can get away from them. Also the Tamarind restaurant is kid free for dinner. Book the transportation from the airport through the hotel. Seamless and professional. By far the biggest impression that my wife and I were left with was the genuine kindness of the staff. Everyone from maids to maintenance to waitstaff to pool attendants always had a smile and a yes to any request. From a baby gate to guard the stairs of the villa to a frying pan to warm the baby's food and everything in between. The Banyan Tree training must be amazing because I have never seen a staff this well trained and responsive in the Caribbean. Only thing even close is the Four Seasons in Costa Rica. Food was consistently excellent. The Saffron thai restauraunt one of the best meals I can remember in a stunning outdoor setting. Imagine the bugs could get bad in summer so book one of the few inside tables in advance if bugs arent your thing. The beach restauraunt had a very interesting lunch menu and the Oriente breakfast buffet is fabulous with everything you could want for breakfast and then some very interesting mexican and thai additions. Tamarind for dinner was eclectic as advertised but overall a winner. I would eat at Saffron every night though. Management was ever present and always stopping by to make sure everything was ok. Only real beef I have with the whole stay is the 3 bed room villa. Like others have said there is a mustiness to the villa that may come from the limestone in the area but it is a nuisance that takes away from the experience. Also, the layout of the villa with all three bedrooms clustered downstairs makes it tough to have any privacy. Plus steep stairs are not very kid friendly and my pregnant wife struggled with them. No bathroom on the middle family room level is weird too. Upstairs pool area smaller than I imagined but my sister really enjoyed the privacy. Overall I think the 3 story villa is a good family option but you dont get the full benefit of the open pool centered layout of the other villas. Biking around the property was fun but my bike was a bit beat up and could have used a tune up. I am sure if I had said something another bike would have been there in minutes. Golf course was excellent. Only played front nine but conditioning was immaculate which again is very unusual for courses outside of the states. My wife and sister raved about the spa. Apparently is set up without a central locker room so the whole experience is very private and intimate with no waiting around naked in a robe waiting for your name to be called. Both said their treatments and overall spa experience were best they have had. Beach club is a bit of a ride from the main property but you get used to it. Buggies/carts are the price you pay at properties that dont just build vertically. Pool at beach small (as is main pool) but given that every room has its own pool it was never a problem getting a chair or service of any type. Great loungers at pool and on beach as comfortable as a bed. I walked down the beach and felt sorry for the folks at the Fairmont on crappy unpadded beach chairs. Boat ride was cool. Driver very kind to my infant daughter and had her smiling the whole way. No one ever on the boat so it is like a private little cruise and the drivers will take you to their spots for wildlife if you request. Saw a baby croc that was pretty cool. Overall very impressed and cannot wait to go back. This time with wife only though. Spent a lot of $$ so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelalottoliveitup
Reviews.Content: -Top tier service - thanks to everyone who made our stay so welcoming, calm and luxurious, and I mean everyone from the front desk, travel services, restaurant service, breakfast cooks, golf cart drivers, car drivers, housekeeping, guest room services, pool and beach club staff....everyone. -Terrific villa, exceeding our expectations. Outdoor shower to candlelight is tops. -Prescila, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you read in the previous reviews is absolutely true”
Reviews.Author: alexshulman
Reviews.Content: you can choose one of two following things: you can go read last 150 reviews or just believe me that this is one of the best resorts you have ever stayed in your life. if you are planning your leisurely vacation on mexican riviera you will not find place with better service/ambience/location/ quality of the room/amenities. on a separate note, their breakfast is single best breakfast i have ever tried on both sides of the Atlantic. we just hope that they will be able to continue to keep the same level of service for foreseeable future. thanks, alex shulman

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Best Villa and Private Pool”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinequeen_7
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes space and privacy on holiday, the private pool was the biggest that I had ever seen and it is a pool rather than just a 'plunge pool' which is what you get with most villas. The service was fantastic and anything you asked for they made happen, we had a few things we requested and at one point we had 5 staff at the villa busy meeting our demands - something that I had never seen at any resort before, they really do want to make your stay as fantastic as possible and there is no shortage of staff. On arrival we changed villas because we wanted a villa that had the sun later in the day, they either have villas that are sunrise or sunset, the villa we moved to 306 was a corner plot and was massive and really private you are not over-looked at all, which again is unheard at a resort and we had the sun until 4pm every day, moving villas wasn’t a problem for the staff at all they wanted us to be happy. We hired bikes to get around as it was fun, but you don't need to you can easily walk or call up for the buggy service which we never waited more than 5 minutes for. The Beach club and pool is smaller than expected but perfect, the service was fantastic and the food good - although I would say that by the time they add 15% service charge and tax it is an expensive place to eat and drink - but then all resorts usually are but everything we got was of a very high standard and waiting time was minimum. The in-villa dining was something else and they made a real effort, all food was delivered within 30 minutes and again everything was hot and to a high standard. The breakfast was out of this world from fresh fruit to local Mexican, to American the choice is yours. I would say that this resort isn't the place to go if you like spending all your time at the beach, you pay the for money for the private pool and villa, unless you book a villa that is on the beach which is slightly less private but do have fantastic views of the sea and is a 30 second walk to the beach. The resort had a nice mixture of couples and families neither dominated the resort which made it a nice environment. I would recommend this hotel to couples and families something that I haven't done before because I usually stay clear of any resort or hotel that has a kids club but they have got the balance right here. It is 15 minutes into Playa from the hotel in a taxi which we did a couple of times, its nice to go off site, we had a great day while the rain was falling and tried out a one of the beach clubs on St Patricks Day which lively, a lot of fun but was nice to get back to our luxury villa. We also got taken on one of the boats around the lagoon which lasted about 45mins and we saw all sorts of wildlife including birds, crocs, turtles, they don't advertise this but really recommend you do this. It has free wi-fi all over the resort again a nice touch. There is a golf course on site - which looked fantastic but as a non golf player couldn't say more than that. We also took one of the house cars and went to the fairmont hotel for drinks and dinner one evening which was a nice experience and you can charge back to your room which makes it easy. Lastly I know there are a couple of comments about the temputure of the pools and they are a little on the chilly side even when its 27+ and although we used our pool all the time i could understand why this may be a problem if you have small children as i don't think any of them are heated. Overall we had a great week here and would recommend it as a real 5 star luxury resort and although it takes 10 hours to get to we would recommend it and intend to return in the future and can confirm that resort deserves it number 1 rating.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: vicaustin
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest and best hotels I have ever stayed in. It compares to the Four Seasons in Maui. But the service at Banyan Tree was too superb and flawless! From Sarah the beach manager to Otto one of the executive chefs, I can not thank them enough for all they did for us and for everyone else we came in contact with at the hotel during the stay. The politeness, the detail to attention, the wonderful menu especially for vegetarians, everything was perfect and we will be back for sure! Thank you to Banyan Tree for making this an awesome trip. VM at Villa 629.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, grounds and people and all your needs covered+”
Reviews.Author: Checked-it-0ut
Reviews.Content: Just back. My husband, son (12) and I have traveled a fair bit and found the Banyan Tree absolutely beautiful – the kind, sincere and always helpful people (Eduardo anticipated our every need. He was easy to find whenever we wanted anything, any time), the well appointed fantastic suite (indoor rain shower, outdoor shower & tub, outdoor hot tub and personal pool – for starters), the close proximity to Playa del Carmen and many tours & activities, the stunning lobby and restaurants (also did an in-villa private BBQ - en experience), the amazing choices on the breakfast buffet, the beach, the boat to the beach (captain Adrian was very knowledgeable pointing out the wildlife).... waking to the sounds of the jungle... we felt we could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Once you been here,nothing else comes close”
Reviews.Author: NENJAY
Reviews.Content: Need I say more. This place exceeded my every expectation . My only complaint is the bathrooms. The designers must have been asleep when they designed the bathrooms. They are beautiful but not at all functional. Shaving was at best awkward and I can imagine that a woman would find it even worse, given the lack of mirrors, above the sink and the poor lighting. The lack of shelving or counterpace in and around the sinks was also disturbing. Nevertheless, it is a small price to pay and easily corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Number one with a smile”
Reviews.Author: curt01
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at this property last March the first week it openned and upon check in we were disappointed , workmen all over , minimal landscaping between villas offering no privacy etc and so we decdied that time to not stay and instead moved to another 5 star property close by . Figuring that last March was brand new openning pains and reading some favourable reviews we decided to try it once again . We were thrilled that we did . Hands down this is the best property now in Riviera Maya . From the beautiful villas with sizeable private pools, , to the dramatic lobby and common areas to the service which was all done with a smile , all of it was first class . Special mention for Marien , Jose Luis who went out of their way to make sure that whatver we could think of needing was anticapated in advance. I read some reviews that complained of the wait for the carts to drive you around the property , we faced none of that , the Bicycles were great and when we did need a cart it never felt like we were being kept waiting. If there is any room for improvemnet at all it may be only in having the villa pools heated for the months when the weather is a bit cooler but the private whilpool and the fantastic candle lit outdoor tub goes a long way . make sure you take the lagoon boat ride . This resort is on par with the best out there and we look forward to comming back shortly with our children.

Reviews.Title: “Somebody Wake Me Up”
Reviews.Author: junoman973
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree Mayakoba is an amazing property. I went to the property to review for my company and thought I was in a dream. I loved this property from the moment I checked in to the moment we departed. If you are looking for a quiet zen like experience and want the most amazing service ever this is your property. If you are looking for a resort with tons of beach activities and party like atmosphere this is not your resort. Its great for honeymooners , celebrities and people who just want to get away from it all. This hotel can be expensive but you get what you pay for and more. I never heard the word "No". The restaurants are all great, Oriente for breakfast, Saffron and Tamarind for dinner. One of the great points of this hotel is that you can eat at any of the other properties in Mayakoba such as Rosewood, and Fairmont and bill it back to your room. We ate at Pueblo Bonito at Rosewood and it was great. My only wish is that Banyan Resorts opens more of them in the US, this company really knows how to run a hotel. The spa was the best I ever used both in the US and abroad. We had a garden villa and the accomadation was more than we needed, and I loved the turn down service. Many of the resort guests used bikes to get around but we liked walking everywhere for extra exercise. Usually when I have to go home, I am ready, but this time my partner had to pull me out of the hotel. If you want an experience like no other try Banyan Mayakoba you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime, Surrealistic Experience - was it a dream?”
Reviews.Author: MTechSolutions
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-bedroom Villa on the lagoon for myself and my mom to help celebrate her 74th birthday. Our flight was delayed for several hours, yet regardless, the transfer service we ordered from the hotel was awaiting our arrival with a smile. The ride to Mayakoba is relatively short - 45 minutes. When you arrive at the gates to the development, it is what seems to be about another mile+ on gently lit, winding narrow cobble roads through the jungle. By now the sun had set, so we arrived at the entrance to the hotel in all it's night time glory, with the huge fire torches blazing away against the reflecting pools below. It's a stunning entrance, and the hotel lobby itself is no less impressive - the photos on the website do not begin to do the property justice. Upon arrival we were greeted by Claudia, who immediately made us feel welcome and comfortable by seating us and offering us a cool drink and towels, then proceeded to give us a brief tour of the property from the perspective of the lobby and then we were drive to our villa (303) in one of the roaming electic buggies. Again, since it was already night, we were greeted with a fully lit pool, spa and courtyard landscape. You can't help but be inspired at this point... The layout of the villa was ideal for us - I had the entire second floor, accessible via a separate stairway outside to a private entrance, which included a large full bath with tub, separate rainshower, etc, walk-in dressing room, and a large bedroom with 2 full beds. Sliders led out to a large deck with dining table and chairs, and another pair of sliders opened to a small balcony overlooking the courtyard. Take note of the clever architecture of the villas. They have been designed for total privacy - from your courtyard, you see nobody - you don't look across or laterally into any one else's space, and nobody has line of sight into yours (other than the occasional boat that floats by, or if you happen to be on the golf course). The layout of the villas is far more private than Rosewood, where you had very little privacy compartively. Even from the second floor decks and balconies, you don't look into anyone elses private space. I doubt this is sheer luck - but rather, is exemplary architectural design. The main bedroom on the ground floor had a larger bathroom with sitting area, and an additional outdoor tub and shower. Every detail imaginable was considered - even the individual water bottles were encased in signature batik-print cosies. Privacy is controlled via a switch from inside the bedroom, which illuminates a sign on the exterior of the villa indicating you wish not to be bothered. The heated jet-spa was big and powerful, with lots of nozzles at different heights that could be individually controlled for strength and aeration, as well as powerfull floor aearators that really made the whole tub powerfully "erupt" and boil. Seating is around the perimeter and on different levels so it's easy to find the perfect position for yourself. The ideal counterpoint was the pool - some people complain that they're not heated but really, they don't need to be. Slip over the side of the hot tub after soaking a few minutes and take a few refreshing laps through the pool, then back into the spa. It was absolutely perfect for me. Our villa also had a separate enclosed a/c pavilion with TV, an awesome Espresso machine (Francis Francis!) - the bar was always fully stocked with everything imaginable, and the full-wall pillow-laden deeeeeeeeeep lounger had enough room for several people to completely strecth out in and watch TV from...or nap (which is what I did). If you had kids you could easily make use of this lounging area as a place for them to sleep, and from what I understand that's exactly what some people do. I personally would have been perfectly comfortable sleeping in the pavilion. I've noted that some people complain that this is not a "beach resort" but I am not quite sure what they are talking about. There are 2 rows of villas right on the beach, so if you are opposed to what amounts to a 10 minute stroll from the main resort area through the wisely protected and ecologically important mangrove forest, then you can stay in one of those villas. There was absolutely no need for me to take a buggy - my 74 year old mom and I loved the walk, and got to see a lot of unusual wildlife along the way. (As others have mentioned, do not miss the eco-boat tour that takes you through the otherwise inaccessible estuaries and lagoons throughout Mayakoba). This hour long free tour turned out to be one of the big highlights of our stay. Dining at each of the three restaurants was excellent. Oriente was superb (try the Short-Ribs with Polenta and Mole with fried plantains), Tamarind was a bit more expensive and worth every penny for the 7-course tasting menu (the veal cheek...WOW!) and Saffron, their "signature" Thai restaurant, has the most ambience and atmosphere, but we were made a bit uncomfortable by the over-zealous servers that watched our every move like hawks - probably because there was only one other table occupied when we were there. Small point worth noting was that the brewed coffee served at the restaurants was uniformly excellent. I'm somewhat of a coffee snob and the coffee was always fresh, hot, strong, and full bodied. Breakfast was also a big calorie-busting carb and fat fest - if you wanted it to be, but they also had a great assortment of fresh fruits/melone/berries/grains etc for those health-conscious people (unlike myself) that don't eat like a pig when vacationing. The assortment of hot mexican dishes served alongside the more traditional breakfast choices were amazing in both quality and sheer variety. Our departing flight was late afternoon - we were asked at check-in what time we wanted to arrange for transport back to the airport. There was no mention of any check-out time - and we didn't leave our villa till almost 2PM on our last day which made our last day leisurely and not all pressure-filled feeling like we had to race to vacate. Our reservation included a 90-minute spa treatment. I think that if you are a spa aficionado you will be probably impressed with their treatments and facilities. I am by no means a spa guy expert, but Fon, my petite and friendly therapist ran over me like an all-benevolent steamroller for the full duration. She managed to zone right in on my 2 main trouble spots in my middle and lower back without a word of direction from me. I came out of the experience a new man. All the therapists are from Thailand. Also, Do NOT miss out on a journey through the "rain forest". The gym was perfect given the size of the resort. Besides univeral weight stations, there were state-of-the-art elliptical trainers and treadmills, and a selection of free-weights. It was never crowded. My only negative comment would be regarding the air-conditioning in the villa. It was on the loud side, and the upper level unit didn't seem to work as well as the downstairs one. Another surprising comment I've read from some reviews regarded upper management at the hotel. I have to say that during our stay, on more than one occasion we saw Sr. Llamas actively engaged in checking out hotel operations - in particular, we saw him show up at breakfast early one morning to observe and take note of how things were going. The guy is clearly engaged and personally involved in this operation, and it was evident to me that he is a real gentleman and that his staff really like him, if the warm greetings they all exchanged was any indication. In the reception area is a large format book of photos and bios of the resort staff - do yourself a favor, take a moment to flip through it, read their bios, and you'll be able to recognize some of the wonderful folks during your stay who make this place truly special. I'm sure many people who are considering Banyan Tree are also considering Rosewood - I've had the opportunity to stay at both, and for me the Banyan Tree gets the nod - Rosewood is more edgy and chic, and ironically a bit more family-friendly. Banyan Tree is all-zen and tranquil - and clearly less oriented towards families with young children, although they do seem to accomodate them well with their kids club. If for nothing else, the sheer size of the accomodations plus the huge bonus of having your own private swimming pool, Banyan Tree wins the prize. Overall, this is an auspicious entry into the American market for this brand, and they've set a new high bar on service and accomodation in the area. I can't wait to check out the new Banyan Tree Cabo Marques in Acapulco.

Reviews.Title: “Close, but not it.”
Reviews.Author: fitz5
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely gorgeous. However, we booked online through American Express and several of the "included" package items were in fact not included due to an error in booking. The hotel did offer us a 20% discount on our breakfast tab (bringing it to $175 instead of $240). The terrace villas are terribly designed and have major fiunctional issues. Other submitters have mentioned the danky, basement feeling to the rooms. This is putting it very mildly. All employees were incredibly kind and well trained but top management doesnt seem to understand the customer comes first mantra. We were offered a different villa when we complained about the problems, only to have that offer retracted later. Think twice if you require more than one bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very Conflicted”
Reviews.Author: kannm
Reviews.Content: I am extremely conflicted about this resort, it had some very big highs and very low lows. Restaurants: Beyond amazing staff, polite, gracious and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is nice and the food is very good as well. Personally, I would stay away from their Italian inspired choices, they were not bad by any means, but not exceptional like some of the other food. Special Events: I planned a canapes, drinks, dinner and a bonfire. It was beautiful and well orchestrated. And the food ended up very good. We also had a BBQ and it was really great -- Ivan and Jefferson (I hope I am getting their names correct) prepared it for us and they were funny and great. The Resort: Serene and very nice. As others have mentioned, it is very annoying to get to the beach side. And you will wait for 15 or 20 mins for a buggy sometimes and you will always have to be sure you have the 5 dollars on hand to tip the driver. This is fine, but it is not relaxing. Honestly, I don't know how they would remedy this though, perhaps more boat stops? At least you would feel like you were waiting for something worthwhile. The Pools: All the Villa and Beach Pools are not heated. This is where the Banyan Tree Mayakoba loses me -- why are you heating only the kids pool in the center of the resort? And why not the gorgeous one with the swim up bar on the beach side -- which over our 6 days we never saw someone brave enough to risk hypothermia go in. I guess the Villa pools you can give a pass on not heating, because of the expense, but at the end of Feb. I can assure you that unless the weather is very warm (which it was for about half of our stay) the downright cold temp of the pool renders it unusable. In which case make sure you get one of the Villas with a Hot Tub. Perhaps in the summer this is not an issue. Spa: We did the Rainforest Walk and had a pedicure. The Rainforest Walk was nice and different and the pedicure was OK. For some reason my 90 minute pedicure lasted 60 mins -- but maybe they were including 30 mins for drying time? Not something I would do again, but it was fairly inexpensive, so it didn't really bother me. Other Items: We were there during a PGA event and it was really grating. You could not get from the main hotel to the beach club without being stopped for 10 mins (during which time you had to be in COMPLETE silence.) This is fully understandable and proper etiquette if you are actually there to watch the event, not just trying to get to get some lunch (you see, the only place open for lunch is on the beach side). Sometimes things would get so backed up that you would have to combine gold carts while waiting -- because only one could get through before the next player arrived and shut down the ONLY path to the beach. Overall Impression: The staff below management are excellent and kind. Some management on the other hand, needs to be retrained. Look below at management responses to each of the tripadvisor reviews which all start with "Dear Value Guest" -- A simple mistake, but not when it is done 75 times. We were spending pretty freely over our trip and couldn't help but feel that we were getting nickel and dimed on the strangest things -- so as people pay more than seriously discounted rates -- you will truly feel like a "Value" guest.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place”
Reviews.Author: al1eng
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba in November. This place is a really decadent and beautiful resort. We had a spa pool villa. Amazing. Service and property are fantastic. We stayed at the Rosewood next door two years ago. Honestly both are great and I would recommend them to anyone, except not for families with small kids. Mayakoba is just not that kind of place. If the Banyan Tree has any advantage over Rosewood, it's the large private pool at each villa. The advantage the Rosewood has is the availability of beachside or overwater one-room villas. Otherwise amenities service and ambience are about the same. We booked with a half off opening special that's unfortunately over (I checked back), so rates are astronomical. Food at the restaurants at night was really good, but not great. Most villas are a long way from the beach or lobby /restaurant area, but they give you bikes or cart rides to get around. It's weird seeing all the guests buzzing around on bikes, but they do. The spa is 5-star. Service 5-star. The mosquitos at night were oppressive, so we never went out without mosquito spray. Bottom line - pure relaxation and a fantastic resort at a steep price. Easily one of the best hotels in Mexico and the Caribbean. So happy that Banyan Tree came to this side of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - not for young children though and not a beach resort”
Reviews.Author: TarheelCT
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Banyan Tree is better than those we have experienced at any other resort. They go out of their way to assist you in making your stay enjoyable. However, there is only so much that they can do. Upon our arrival at the Banyan Tree, we were escorted to our two-bedroom villa. What we learned was that the two bedrooms are located on separate levels, and in order to access the upstairs bedroom, you are required to walk outside, around a corner and up a flight of stairs. Obviously, this does not work when you are traveling with younger children. The resort website should be revised to better explain this room setup. While the two-bedroom villa was beautiful, this setup did not work for us. The resort moved us to a three-bedroom terrace room. While the bedrooms are all adjacent to one another, they are located in the ground level and you feel like you are living in a dungeon. You get little natural light in these rooms and are required to use a flashlight when trying to find something in your closet. These bedrooms are dark and musty. The pool for the three bedroom villa is located on the rooftop. There is no hot tub with these pools, so they are ice cold. Getting around this resort is difficult. You can request a "buggy". You sometimes have to wait fifteen minutes or longer for a buggy to arrive. Also, the odds of getting run over by a buggy or room service cart are quite high at this resort. My family and I were required to constantly step aside into the grass in order to allow these carts to get through. By the third day, you are tired of doing this. You could rent a bike. However, if your children are young, there are few, if any, small bikes for rent. Our kids are 9 and 11 and only our 11 year old could ride the adult bike provided (just barely though). The beach is located quite far from the villas. If you plan on going to the beach, it will be an all day venture as you will not want to go back and forth. Overall, the staff is quite friendly (especially Eduardo). However, this is not a resort for younger children. There is little for them to do and it is quite difficult to get around. Also, the villas simply do not work. If you are a honeymooner or a couple looking to get away, then this is the place for you. If you are looking for a true beach resort for your family, I recommend that you look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “First class resort and staff - great place to relax and adventure from”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Family_Five
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the Connecticut snow from 8 days at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. This was our first trip to Mexico and we picked the Banyan Tree based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. Congrats to the Trip Advisor family - the high ratings were right on target! We are an active couple with three children ages 10, 8 and 6. Overall, the Banyan Tree is as good or better than any resort we have stayed in (Four Seasons, Rtiz etc...). The resort is beautiful and is imbued with a zen like feeling that as you start to abosrb it over a few days, you begin to notice the flow and details. By far the biggest plus for the resort is a staff that is always looking for ways to make your stay a little bit better. This is a young, bright and eager staff of mostly locals that give you the feeling they truly enjoy helping you rather than just angling for a tip. Biggest Plusses: 1. Staff (see above) 2. Design - beautiful flow, scenery. Do the boat ride/eco tour that the resort offers. Its less than hour, and a fun view of the area from the canals. We saw a huge (6-8') croc sunning itself on the banks! 3. Food - the breakfast buffet is fantastic (and open until noon!). Make sure you get it included in your room rate. We filled up there every morning, enjoyed chatting with the staff, then had a light snack for a late lunch. Dinners were often back at the main restaurant, out in Playa Del Carmen, or "in villa dining". We had the in room barbecue on the roof of our villa one night which was a lot of fun. Overall food quality is exceptional - you can order from any of the restaurants for in villa dining, so while not actually eating in Saffron, we ordered from it and were delighted. Biggest Drawbacks 1. Sleeping in the dungeon. We were in a 3 bedroom terrace villa. The bedrooms are in the ground floor which feels like you are underground. There is a permanent damp, dank mustiness to it that might be nice in the heat of summer but is not pleasant at all in February. We would definitley not choose to stay in one of these again, despite the huge layout and ample space. We couldn't get the place to warm up or de-humidify. Yes, the rooftop pools are cold. To add insult to injury, all the bathrooms are on the bottom floor and we had a major plumbing problem where waste/sewer water was seeping up into the shower drains. The smell was pretty bad for a couple days, which mixed in with the natural musty smell to keep us upstairs for anything but sleep. To the resort's credit, they offered to move us, which we declined given the hassle. Lots of incense and candle oils helped to offset. 2. Beach access/layout. If you are looking for a true beach vacation, this is probably not the place to go. The beach is nice, but you have to plan to go. You can take a golf cart or bike to the beach very easily, just make sure you change before you go as there are no changing facilities there (we changed in the bathroom the first time as we were expecting a changing room at the "beach club"). Other resorts not in Mayakoba are right on the beach if that is what you are looking for. 3. Spa has no wating or recovery area. You have your tea after your treatment in the office were the ladies are typing! Also, made a reservation for a yoga class for wife and two daughters, and when we arrived, they were full with walk ins - so wife and only one daughter participated, with wife's feet hanging under the curtain practically out the door. This was the only staff member that we felt was a bit rude and unwilling to help. She seemed a bit put off that we were not happy that our reservation wouldn't be honored. Overall we give it 4 stars - would have been 5 easily if not for sleeping in the dungeon. The adventures we did from the resort were Xplor, Tulum and Xcaret. Xplor was fantastic, we wrote a separate review for it. We rented a car for a day and drove to Tulum. It's about an hour's drive and was very interesting (don't eat there - the food in the village area gave us a taste of Mexico that we are trying to forget!). The guide we hired at the gate was pretty lousy. You are better off with buying a book at the entrance and eavesdropping on all the other guides. Xcaret is huge amazing place - sort of a zoo, archeologic, water park, sea world all wrapped up in one. We had bad weater for our day there, so didn't do the water activities which was too bad. For those willing to, the dolphin experience and faux scuba diving looked great. We also spent some time in Playa del Carmen - walking 5th avenue is a lot of fun, with countless restaurants and shops and lots of street hawkers vying for your dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Escape”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: I will strat by saying this was hands down the best vacation I have ever taken and I would return to Banyan Tree without hesitation however, there are a few areas I think could be improved on...The resorts seems to appear torn between being a family friendly resort or being a spa destination. In my opinion you can not be both as a a truely tranquil spa destination does not have small children and loud teenagers running about. There is a huge disparity in patrons at this resort. At one end of the spectrum you would find a well appointed Italian couple dropping Channel and at the other end an American group of 15 travelers complete with tatoos, camouflaged bathingsuit covers, and children who did not know how to cover their mouths when the coughed. Prior to taking this trip I reviewed the comments on this website and noted that one couple had given the resort 4 stars based on the quality of the food. I echo this sentiment. I have stayed at many resorts/hotels worlwide and the food is almost always lacking. The problem with the Banyan Tree is that there is no convenient alterative due to the secluded location. The resort host a few themed eating venues all priced in USD. We found the food some what lacking and after a few days bacame boring. The cerviche was excellent. The breakfast buffet was well appointed with foods from Mexico, pasteries, fresh fruits (which two days in a row there was mold on the raspberries) traditional American, as well as Scandanavian choices. The problem was that it was like a cattle call with children running about, babies crying, and loud parties of multi-famlies. The last morning the dining room was so packed that I felt rushed to eat. Not the most relaxing atmosphere. The staff spoke English very well but on numerous occasions request were lost in translation. On two occasions we ended up with other guest's orders and drinks were not prepared as advertised often missing garnishes. Our dinner reservations were also mixed up one evening. The staff always made a great effort to correct mistakes but it still seemed that eating was chaotic rather than a relaxing, enjoyable experience. The best meals were enjoyed in the privacy of our villa. On to the spa. The staff in the spa were amazing! The treatments were also very good; we found the rooms were a little cold. The before and after drinks were excellent and we enjoyed the free yoga. Our only complaint is that you had to pay to utilize the steam rooms etc. Having traveled to spa locations in areas of Europe use of such facilities is usually complimentary. At a minimum Banyan Tree should allow access to these areas for paying spa customers. The last area that I see could use improvement is the staff use of the golf carts (or buggies as they call them).
