On numerous occasions staff traveled much too fast considering that the golf carts share the same path as bicycles and pedestrians and there is barely enough room for the golf cart. We had to move off the path an into the grass to allow the carts to pass and we were almost hit one time as sevice staff was traveling in the dark and did not see us. The things we really enjoyed at the Banyan Tree....we arrived at Cancun airport only to wait in line for an hour to pass immigrations and customs. The private transfer was well worth the money and we suggest you try it. We arrived at the resort and were promptly greeted and taken on a quick tour and served refreshments. Our villa was perfect! The room was staged with soft music. Perhaps we were just lucky but we never heard another guest while inside our villa during the entire stay. This was the best part. I very much enjoyed the seclusion and privacy provided by our villa. I often have trouble sleeping when away from home due to noisy neighbors, street noise, and hard beds...not at the Banyan Tree....it was perfect! We relished in the tranquility of the villa; often the only noise heard was a signing bird. The villa also comes with complimentary espresso machine, coffee, and milk as well as fruit, water, and insence. There was an IPod docking station in the bathroom and several CDs in the room. The resort was also very clean. We live in a beach resort area and the birds will almost attack you at resturants on the beach; the Banyan Tree does an excellent job of keeping the wildlife out of the main resort area while ensure they are allowed to remain in the surrounding environment. We did not utilize the beach facility other than to eat light meals. The view was beautiful but again a very "family" oriented area of the resort with children running about. We do not play golf but the PGA tour was playing during our stay (which I think added to the chaotic nature at times) and the course looked amazing. All in all a great stay and I would recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for relaxation and a good spa.

Reviews.Title: “Highly impressed....”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: *Note* I resubmitted this review as it applies to the Courtyard Pool Villa. Not all villas have hot tubs as I had thought, so I wanted to resubmit and make a specific note, given the price of this place, be sure your room type has the amenities you are expecting. I have stayed in a lot of five star resorts and hotels around the world... I'm not talking about the faux-five-star all inclusive zoos but real five star properties and chains like the Four Seasons. I have to give the Banyan tree a massive thumbs up on all grounds. Food, service, property, everything is just superb. They have integrated their resort into its surroundings with minimal impact on the environment. The guests stay in surprisingly beautiful villas, mine is located on one of the lagoons and I wake up to cormorants swimming and catching fish, songbirds, and other waterfowl. The staff are well trained (ask someone for directions and they drop what they are doing and walk with you to be sure you get there... they do this happily, a sign of high staff to guest ratio), friendly and helpful. An example of the dining experience is that for the Thai restaurant on site, the chef and kitchen staff were brought in from the first Banyan Tree resort in Thailand. I was just a stone's throw away from that place in Thailand two weeks ago, and I can testify the food is authentic as you could ever want. No difference from eating in Thailand or eating here. The chef has been in residence since the resort opened and I believe the goal is to train local staff and then move on eventually to another resort. That the hotel has had them in residence for a year and will be in residence longer shows that the mentality of the organization is to Do Things Right and to take their time with expansion. For me it was a bit funny to come to Mexico from Thailand and get the occasional "Sawatee Kaa" from a Thai woman walking by! Villas come with a pool and a jacuzzi hottub. Everything is beautifully lit at night, and the architecture is very attractive and not overbearing. The location is only about 10 minutes from Playa del Carmen so you are close by if you want to spend your evenings in town. The Rosewood, Fairmont and Banyan Tree have a mutuality agreement and guests can make use of restaurants on all three properties and have it charged back to their mother resort. This expands your options nicely. Free WiFi always gets A++ marks from me. I hate it when you pay for a five star resort, a large bill, then they use the WiFi as a way of nickel and diming you out of a little bit more. Free WiFI here at Banyan Tree with good performance. There are two minibars (more like maxibars) in the villas. One in the study area which is not connected to the bedroom area (a garden inbetween, with the pool and hottub and view of the lagoon). They are stocked with 375 ml bottles of Belvedere, Bailey's, Johnnie Walker Black, etc., basically a full choice of superior spirits. There is also a wine cooler that has a selection of six bottles of wine. No doubt they are priced at minibar prices, but it is nice to have the option and such a well stocked bar. Espresso maker and coffee are here and complimentary as well as a selection of five excellent teas. Soundsystems in the villas are excellent and there is a selection of "relaxing" CD music to choose from (I prefer just to turn it off and listen to the birds). The closest I can get to criticism here is that it's hard to find a well located plug in the wall to run a laptop from, be nice to have one obvious and close to a table, but I am in the minority needing to run a laptop on a regular basis. Any small issues that came up otherwise were dealt with immediately. It is possible perhaps that the beach area is a bit crowded since this is a fairly large resort... and some guests may find the beach to be too far from the villas, however if one is to think about things like hurricanes and tsunamis, it is just another dose of foresight and minimal environmental impact. Many hotels in this area were built very close to the beach and the impact is usually that they have to dredge sand and rebuild beaches and/or evacuate guests during hurricanes. No real problem with that here, though there are a cluster of villas which are beachfront, the majority of the resort is set back from the beach in the lagoon area. I guess the fitness center too is a bit minimalistic. It's so nice outside in the villa that I slept outdoors one night. No issue with mosquitoes though that could be seasonal. Just saying, though you hear "lagoon" there is nothing really to worry about on that front. It was a bit chilly on this trip to Playa del Carmen and female guests were constantly offered silk shawls to wrap up in during the evening if they got caught outside with less than enough clothing. This is just a sign that this chain, their management, and staff, have really thought of everything and are prepared. Lastly the villas are very private, while staying though they are all obviously located nearby each other the other guests have zero impact on me. Privacy from staff is obtained by flipping a switch near the bed which means you will receive ZERO disturbance. Even if the privacy light is not lit outside, staff will first call before entering the villa for cleaning or turndown, to give you the benefit of the doubt. Again, just simply excellent. I am someone who is not afraid to criticize based on the fact that I am paying a lot of money, and if a chain or resort advertises it as five star they are claiming to be the pinnacle of excellence. I really have nothing negative to say. I could just keep gushing on the details, there are many more bright points to touch on but this review could last forever. They sell residential properties here and I'm feeling like buying one. Lastly there is a Greg Norman designed golf course on the Mayakoba property winding through the three resorts. It looks beautiful, I golf but the PGA tour will be here in two days so the course is closed to keep it fresh for the event. I can't recommend this resort highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree lives up to their reputation”
Reviews.Author: BeachyKeenGal
Reviews.Content: The first time I experienced the amazing hospitality and luxury accommodations that Banyan Tree has to offer in Phuket, Thailand in 2004. I recently got back from my Bachelorette weekend at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba and was pleasantly surprised that they were able to recreate the same magical experience I had in Thailand on this side of the globe in Mexico. We stayed in an amazing 2 bedroom villa (#301) that was so luxurious I felt like I was in Thailand. It was very spacious and great for a group of girls to share together for a weekend of relaxation and plenty of space to sprawl out to do your own thing or be a bit loud and not worry about your neighbors. We each had our own bike to ride to the main lobby/hotel area or to the beach area, which was only about a 5 minute ride - very peaceful. The resort has everything you need, no need to leave. The view from the beach was amazing! What a great idea to put the pool and restaurant right on the beach so you had the best of all worlds, not to mention the swim up bar at the pool. The menu was the best pool/beach menu I have ever experienced. 4 pages of anything you could imagine to pick from. I love that when I travel to a resort, that every day I can get something new and there isn't just 1 or 2 things on the menu that end up being edible. By far the best part about the beach/pool area was the service. Jorge and Alfonso took care of our every need each day. I hope my future husband will be so attentive. Speaking of food, the food at the rest of the resort was equally as amazing as the pool area. We ate at the buffet at Oriente Restaurant every day for breakfast and it was amazing. Anything you could imagine they had. 2nd best buffet breakfast I've ever had (second to The Setai hotel's in Miami beach.) Dinner at Oriente one night for Mexican fair was delicious and then 2 nights at Tamarind for more of an eclectic offering. The food was really good, but the Christian and his team were the highlight of the evening. You can tell he and they really take pride in their hotel and the service they provide. Fernando and Omar helped wait on us and did a great job. One last thing I must comment on is the Spa. You MUST book at least one appointment here. We each had a massage. Speaking for my personal experience (although my girlfriends too said the same) this was the best massage I've ever had. Some hotels claim to have a spa, but this place is above and beyond. Just like in Phuket, you get your own spa pavilion - extremely clean, the staff is super thorough and professional and everything about the experience exudes luxury. Sorry for the lengthy review, but this is the first Trip Advisor review I've ever left. I felt compelled to do so because I enjoyed my stay so much. I'm a VERY picky traveler, I only stay in 5 star hotels and have been to many of them around the world. Whoever you come with (group, family or a honeymoon) you will LOVE this place. I stayed at a few places in the Riviera Maya before and never really liked any of them, but this place has totally changed my opinion of the area. If you're looking for LUXURY with a capital "L" this is the place for the Riviera Maya!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: EricArb
Reviews.Content: This place is designed for a honeymoon. Let’s get straight to the negatives. They nickel and dime you for everything. Daily food and drink can easily be $200-300 per person/day. Rooms were nice and intimate. The main body of the resort is located inland about 1/2 mile. You can easily walk or take the "buggy" from your room to the beach; however, one of the best things about the Cancun area is the beauty of the water. Only the highest end 3-bedroom ($2,500/night) villa's are on the water. The staff at Banyan was great and always tried to take care of us. Food was good (not overly exceptional) given the prices. We went to Rosewood one night for dinner - skip it! We frequently travel to the Cancun region for a quick "Sunshine Therapy" every year. A better suggestion for great stay is Grand Velas Riviera Maya. While this IS an All-Inclusive, the quality of the food is amazing. Truely 5-Star. The staff is wonderful and attentive no request goes un-answered. Pools are heated. (All but 1 Banyan Tree Pools are not heated and were cold in February). I typically get a massage daily while on vacation. Grand Velas Spa is the best in the World far exceeding Banyan, Four Seasons, Ritz, Fairmont and Rosewood!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Escape from a Blizzard”
Reviews.Author: LeesburgLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second trip to this resort. My husband and I visited this resort in November 2009 and unfortunately encountered rain during our entire stay due to Hurricane Ida. Since we did not get to enjoy the beach, pools and some of the restaurants which were all shut down due to the weather, we decided to make a return trip in order to experience the full potential of this resort. This time we traveled with our two young daughters (aged 1 and 3) and my parents. Fortunately, this time we escaped a huge blizzard that hit the mid-Atlantic and experienced sunny beautiful weather for the majority of our stay in Mexico. Accomodations: In November, we stayed in the courtyard villa and this time, we stayed in a Terrace Residence. Both types of villas were spacious, lovely and well appointed. The Terrace residences are well suited for families as they have 3 bedrooms, each with their own bathrooms, as well as an open main floor with family room, dining area, and kitchen (microwave, fridge, freezer). There was also an unheated rooftop pool overlooking the golf course. Plenty of space for the 6 of us. I agree that the bedrooms had a somewhat "basement" quality to them since they are located on the lower floor with poorer lighting but it didn't detract from my overall satisfaction with the villa (and I am pretty picky). The courtyard villas are very romantic and more suited for couples traveling alone. Their layouts have been well described already on this site and I agree that they are beyond belief with the outdoor bathtub, hottub, and private pool. I enjoyed both types of villas and would make your decision based on who your traveling companion(s) are. Dining: Breakfast buffet at Oriente is bountiful and varied, as stated by other reviewers. Great way to start the day-fresh juices, hot entrees that change daily, plenty of pastries, cook to order eggs. Our favorite dinner restaurant on both occasions was Saffron. The food is out of this world and the service is unbelievable. We had private tables overlooking the lagoon during both of our dinners (make sure to request the secret Garden table). Sampong, the Saffron manager, is the sweetest and friendliest man who went beyond the call of duty to make all of our meals very memorable. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary during our November trip and he set up a private table by the pool for us and surprised us with a special chocolate cake that he served to us as we relaxed on the pool loungers. The exceptional personal service that he provided was one of the main reasons that we decided to revisit the resort. We also had an early dinner at Sands which was also delicious (great tempura shrimp tacos). This was the only restaurant that we felt comfortable taking our kids. Otherwise, we ordered room service for them at night which was delicious, prompt and delivered with impeccable service. It would have been nice to have more family friendly dining options at night but fortunately, we were lucky to have my parents to babysit at night so we could enjoy some kid-free romantic dinners. Pools/beach: There was a large kiddie pool near the main lobby where my kids could roam freely. They had the pool to themselves each day as they were the only kids at the resort during our stay. We also enjoyed the main pool adjacent to the kiddie pool; although on most days, we felt like it could have been heated better. The pool/beach attendants provided the kids with plenty of sand toys and floatees. The beach had plenty of loungers and umbrellas-no fighting or saving chairs like other resorts. Crystal blue waters, white soft sand-absolutely no complaints. There is even a small Kids Club room next to the beach if the kids need a break from the sun or passsing rain shower. It was more than enough to keep our young kids entertained but older kids may be a bit bored. Spa: Had complimentary massages during both visits and while both were great, my second one was more memorable and relaxing. My husband and I did the unique Rainforest experience during our November stay which we both enjoyed. Overall, top of the line spa facilities and service. Service: As stated by other reviewers, this is the best aspect of the resort and what differentiates it from even other 5 star resorts I have been to (including the neighboring Rosewood and Fairmont Mayakoba). They make each guest feel like a VIP by anticipating your every need yet remaining unobtrusive and sincere. Each and every employee seemed genuinely happy to assist in any way possible, from front desk to pool/beach attendants to waiters to buggy drivers. The service also seemed to improve greatly from our first to second trip as our requests were met more promptly and consistently. During our first trip, we had to occasionally repeat our requests a couple of times before they were executed properly, if at all. Special thanks to Regina at the Kids Club for entertaining our 3 year old daughter...she loved making bracelets and sand castles with you! Negatives: Not many. As previously mentioned, the main pool could have been heated better, and even just one family friendly dining option for dinner would be appreciated for those traveling with little ones. There is no easily accessible tennis court and the resort no longer provides raquets and balls to their guests. We were so glad that we made a return trip to this resort and overjoyed to have great weather this time! We hope to visit again in the near future (with or without kids) as we cannot imagine another resort that could surpass this one. Thanks for the great memories Banyan Tree!

Reviews.Title: “treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: cdweck
Reviews.Content: If you ever go to Banayan tree, it is not a vacation...it is an "experience". Everyone on the staff goes out of their way to treat you like a king. My wife and I just went for our anniversary to MAYAKOBA MEXICO, and it is was the most relaxing trip ever. the hotel staff was the most accomodating, PLEASENT, helpful staff I have ever seen. the gorunds were excellent, spa top notch, and everyone went out of their way to make sure we were happy. I feel spoiled as I do not know if I can handle anywhere else. Here's a little taste..... I took off my t-shirt to go jump in the ocean. came back to my chair, and my t-shirt was perfectly folded, with a towel and bottle of water waiting...... I HIGHLY recomend this to anyone traveling to mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Definition of 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Simonandfamily
Reviews.Content: Many resorts and hotels seek 5 star status. Very few really deserve the rating. A 5 star resort should not just be accomodating and attentive - its needs to be so right that a stay becomes an experience. In every way one could imagine, BTM is well deserving. My wife and I have never been treated like this by a hotel, and we both agree that it doesn't make much sense to look for something better, because it can't be done. The whole focus of the staff is to make your every movement effortless. No opening doors. No carrrying your plate at morning buffet. No getting a towel. They seem to anticipate your every move - almost one step ahead of you. It makes you feel very respected and valued. After 2 days, the entire staff knows you and your preferences - and nothing is too much to ask. If your favorite morning drink is freshly made carrot, ginger and honey juice - it will reappear the next day. At the pool or the beach, the fun staff are virtually at your beck and call, but they also respect your privacy. Alot of unexpected things like cold towels soaked with mint and tapas served on the beach. Luxury is also graded on quality, and that is another attribute of this resorrt. The setting is overwhelming. Quality throughout every detail. The finest cuisine. The softest sheets. The best pillows. etc. Because the Thai atmosphere is so intoxicating, we are now looking at broadening our boundaries and exploring at least one Banyan Tree resort in Asia. One staff member mentioned to us that Banyan Tree Phuket, where the massage threrapists and staff are trained, is an extraordinary resort. He insinuated that it is even more impressive than BTM. We are so there !

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ALABAMA05
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to travel to Banyan Tree Mayakoba after reading the comments we found in Trip Advisor. We wanted to know that singular place about everyone says beautiful things of and above all, verify that the service there is unbeatable. I think all the comments I read have been unfair. People there are unrivalled. Every comment you do turns in a mission for them and they pay attention to you every moment. From the moment you arrive and the car door is open, they receive you with a big smile and they know who you are. The Resort Host offered us a refreshing drink, showed us the lobby and explained to us all the thing we could do during our stay. Thanks a lot Yunita to take care of us with your nice smile and excellent good humor. We enjoyed a lot the beach, the sun, the swimming pool and all the amenities. Really is a very recommendable experience. Mi only suggestion is having a familiar environment in the restaurants, we were not able to enjoy the dinners because they did not accept children.

Reviews.Title: “The Banyon Tree did it again. An incredibly high end resort in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: stevennj
Reviews.Content: As a big fan of the Banyon tree in Phuket, Thailand it was incredible that the Banyon Tree was able to duplicate a resort with incredible service in Mexico which is not know for great service. The spa staffed with a staff from Thailand was every bit as good as their well know spa in Thailand except about 18 Hours closer to NY . The villas with their private seluded pools were amazing . And finally their food was really great as well as the great ambiance. I have already rebooked this great resort for a 3 day stay over Valentines day As a well experienced high end traveler i believe that this is truly one of the most comfortable destinations for the high end traveler

Reviews.Title: “It's another world - perfect private romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: WalkingTree
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree is a different world. Outstanding for couples, the ultimate in privacy. Each unit is its own villa with a courtyard, private pool, and outdoor, walled private bath, complete with candles in the wall. They've used trees, native plants, and walls to "hide" sightlines so that you cannot see into the courtyards of other units. Even the buildings themselves are partially hidden from the water by shrubs and trees, which makes the resort blend in with the surrounding landscape. Great for an anniversary or other special romantic celebration; we chose to celebrate our 25th anniversary there. Service was top notch; it's a great combination of the Mexican culture of hospitality and the Asian culture of unrelenting service and perfection. We are planning to return as soon as possible. Mayakoba security is tight; we had no concerns about our safety. The Mayakoba development is a gated community with a system of canals, a golf course and two more hotels - the Rosewood and Fairmont. While we didn't stay at the Rosewood or the Fairmont, I did note that the Banyan Tree is much more private than the other two resorts. That's not to say anything against the other two resorts, but it did make me appreciate the feeling of utmost privacy that the Banyan Tree provides. Here are some tips if you choose to stay at the Banyan Tree: - Make your wishes known. The staff waits on you hand and foot, and they will make adjustments if you will make your desires known. For example, we noted that our villa had an unusual smell, and within 15 minutes the staff delivered a dehumidifier that took care of the issue. - Use the tripadvisor website to find good deals on stays of three nights or more. We were able to find a stay three nights get two free deal with daily breakfast buffet, massage and $200 resort credit thrown in. - Ask for a bike when you check in. It's a handy way to get around on the property. - Food was superb, but very rich. My wife and I would each order an appetizer or salad and then split an entree. We would eat late morning and then in the evening, and we didn't get hungry. While as you might imagine the food is expensive, our breakfast was included in the package we bought, and sharing our entrees at dinner helped us manage our cost. Long story short, you get what you pay for, and we didn't mind paying for quality. - When you find a good waiter or waitress at a particular restaurant, ask to be seated at their table when you return. They will learn your names and preferences and will be better able to make food recommendations and otherwise serve you. - We enjoyed the boat tour, which they do twice a week. It's a good way to see the canals and wildlife and the other two resorts. - When you want to experience a great end to a truly romantic evening, ask the staff to have your outside bath drawn while you are at dinner. There's nothing quite like returning from a sumptuous dinner only to soak in a warm bubble bath outside while you gaze at the stars with the one you love. - Bring your vitamins; you'll need them!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Chitown40
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from the Banyan Tree and have to say it was the best hotel experience that I have ever had. A friend of mine asked me what the difference was between your typical 5* hotel like a Ritz or Four Seasons and the Banyan Tree and the first thing that came to mind was that those 5* hotels are nice and luxurious places but the Banyan Tree is a total luxury experience.. The Villas, grounds, facilities and restaurants are all top notch but what truly makes this place special are the people that work there. Everyone we came into contact with could not help us enough us and they worked really hard to make us feel special. They all seemed to enjoy working at the Banyan Tree and seemed very genuine. I was impressed with hot the managers always seemd to be around and spent time talking to the guests and helping out their employees when they needed help. I wish I could remember all of the names of the people that we enjoyed talking to and provided great service from but there are too many names to remember like the sweet boy that drove us to the Fairmont and the guy that skippered the boat to the beach. A few names that I can remember that made our stay great include; Alex and Jorge at the Beach/pool Sara at the Beach Club Ed in Food and Beverage Otto at Oriente. The Banyan Tree is a real gem and I can’t wait to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service! Beautiful facility!”
Reviews.Author: bluehon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are finishing our stay at Banyan Tree. We decided to book the round trip transportation which was a great start to our stay. Water and quiet music made the journey fly by (it only took us 35 minutes). Everyone goes out of their way to welcome you and to make sure all of your expectations are not only met, but exceeded. Today, I had two minor problems which were swiftly addressed and remedied to my complete satisfaction. I even received a follow up phone call from our "resort hostess" to apologize. Way to go Banyan Tree!

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Ever!”
Reviews.Author: PassportForever
Reviews.Content: I am going to make this short and sweet!....I am so happy we picked this place for our honeymoon! I loved everything about this hotel.... great food, quiet, clean, modern, private,new,excellent service, great spa, easy access to airport. You will not go wrong.!

Reviews.Title: “Wonder where my review went....”
Reviews.Author: tvl1class
Reviews.Content: I was pretty sure I reviewed Banyan Tree Mayakoba, but can't seem to find it now. I am re-reviewing it mainly because I am trying to plan another getaway and can't seem to think Banyon Tree Mayakoba. The area is beautiful. Upon thinking of returning to Banyan Tree Mayakoba, I still can't get past the fact that most of the villas (which are lovely) are not near the beach. We hade to call a gulf cart half the time to go to the beach, pool, restaurants. we were on the "river", which was nice, but the gulf is better. We are beach people, the rocks at the beach were leathal! i have water shoes, but my husband found it dangerous and even as swimmers, we had to avoid rocks or concrete that were all over. the spa was fabulous, private rooms and excellent professional therapists. the service was attentive. i didn't want to be the complainer, but the rocky beach and distance the rooms were from the water will keep me from returning. had a few engineering calls (shower filling up, hot tub not hot), but they were responded to immediately. Would recommend to a friend who likes long walks TO the beach and doesn't care about swimming in the beach water!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel/resort experience we've ever had”
Reviews.Author: codybosco
Reviews.Content: We left Banyan Tree this morning after staying there 4 days - which wasn't nearly enough. It was our second time here. We came during the height of the Swine Flu scare last April - empty plane, quiet hotel. But we were, and are, simply enchanted with this resort. First, the combination of the Asian/Mexican cultures translated into exquisite service and incredible warmth emanating from the staff. We stayed in a spa pool suite, which combined a separate building (pavilion) with a huge daybed, large flat screen TV. club table and chairs, and bar area. The bedroom in a separate building was beautiful, along with an incredible bathroom with double sinks, frosted glass large shower with steam, separate toilet, and an outside HUGE bathtub by a decorative rock wall with votive candles set in that the staff would light during turndown service. The turndown service was lovely. We came back to the room each night and the robes were laid out on the bed, fresh bottles of water by the bedside, a soothing spa-like CD on the Bose player. The bedding and pillows were lovely. In our compound, which included a jacuzzi, pool, and steam shower, there was an outdoor staircase that led to an area with 2 massage tables, an outdoor shower, a place to sit, and a sink. Our compound was completely private. A buffet breakfast came with our stay, which was both delicious and huge with American, Mexican, and Asian dishes. Of course, there was a cook to make your huevos rancheros to order, or egg whites, scrambled eggs, omelettes. Since breakfast lasted until noon, we worked out in the small but well-equipped gym every morning, showered, and then ate. The first day that we got there, we were by the pool waiting for our room to be ready, and asked if we could have guacamole with just avocados, lime juice, and salt. No problem. Grouper ceviche was on the menu, and we asked if they could make tuna ceviche - no problem. This pervasive willingness to please, and the over-riding warmth of the staff surpassed even the quiet luxury of Banyan Tree Mayakoba. The thousands of details in the beauty of the physical hotel from the lighting at night to the comfortable seating everywhere invites everyone to relax and luxuriate in its essence. In the past, I've been sad to leave a resort, but never like this. Back in Kansas City, my husband and I will need to rely on memories to keep us until our next Banyan Tree experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: IlViaggio
Reviews.Content: I must agree with previous reviews. This is a very impressive property. And it does have the best service I have experienced. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. But do make sure you book the right room. If you want a jacuzzi and spacious rooms don't book the terrace suites. These rooms are smaller and darker than the ones in the villas. The pools are lovely but for us they were too cold to use. The website is very deceptive. Make sure you talk to the front desk and specify exactly what you want. I know they will do everything possible to accommodate any request. Don't miss the breakfast buffet,it is spectacular. We had a wonderful stay. Saffron and Sands were our favorite restaurants. Do go visit Coba with its wonderful ruins. Kudos to the Banyan Tree for their high standards and they way they make it seem effortless.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: TX99
Reviews.Content: I had extremely high expectations for Banyan Tree Mayakoba, based on the reviews it had received in Trip Advisor. For the most part, I think the high ratings other reviewers have given this resort are warranted. The accommodations are very nice, the food is delicious, the service is good. There are a few minor issues that merit mentioning but overall, I give it very high marks. Every room is a private villa, with a pool, hot tub and separate pavilion. The rooms are nicely appointed and we were very pleased with the setting. One thing to remember-the pool, hot tub and deck are mostly, but not completely, private. Not really a big deal, as someone would have to be really trying to see you but something to remember if your expectations were for complete privacy. Also, don't be surprised to see workers in boats go by 1 or 2 times a day. We asked specifically when we checked in if any boats ever used the canal and were told no, only to see a boat go by twice the next day. Not a big deal but, again, be aware that it isn't complete and total privacy. If you really want that, book a spa villa with rooftop pool and lounge area and it won't be an issue. The bathrooms are great and very large. Ours had a very large shower, a (very private) outdoor bathtub (upon request, they staff will draw a bath for you and decorate your room with rose petals) and ample closet and dressing space. The food and service at all of the restaurants was excellent. Waiters and managers remembered our names and our food preferences. One slight drawback-there is no breakfast room service but the breakfast buffet is served until 12 noon, which should give even the latest sleepers ample time to eat. Speaking of breakfast, its served in a huge buffet with plenty of food from which to choose. Mexican, Asian and traditional American breakfast food is available. We usually ate a large, late breakfast and skipped lunch or just snacked. Our other dining experiences were all great; you won't go wrong at any of the restaurants. The flagship restaurant, Saffron, is Thai so if that isn't your thing, any of the others will have plenty of good choices. We spent most of our time laying by the pool in our villa and only occasionally ventured down the the beach. When we did, the service was good and we had no trouble getting towels, lounges and umbrellas. There was plenty of staff around and when we were ready for food or drink, they quickly accommodated us. We didn't visit the main pool but walked by it on our way to and from breakfast and it looked nice, clean and well staffed. My wife and I each had a massage in the spa and everything, from the spa facilities, to our spa therapists, were great. Treatments were a little pricey but that's probably to be expected. My only complaint with the spa is that workers with leaf blowers were right outside my window for about 20 minutes. Overall, we had a great time and can easily recommend Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Just a few things that I think merit a mention: 1) We were surprised at how many families we saw during our stay. For some reason, we expected that there would be more couples and fewer families. This isn't a knock against the hotel, just an observation. 2) When we checked in, our resort host told us all of the restaurants except the Beach Club were booked up that night. Turns out, that wasn't the case and I'm not sure if he was misinformed or just wanted us to eat at the Beach Club. I've seen this same issue addressed in other reviews. My suggestion is to make your dining arrangements for your first night in advance (try Tamarind) and make reservations for your remaining meals soon after you arrive. Don't wait until 5 pm and expect to get a reservation for that night. 3) The resort is laid out in such a way that every villa (or at least most of them) back up to a canal (with the exception of the 12 or so 3 bedroom villas actually at the beach). This means that you have to walk all the way around the villas in order to get anywhere. You can call for a golf cart to pick you up but that can take some time, especially during peak periods. You can also request bicycles but, as a number of other reviews have noted, you may or may not get any and when you do, it may be the night before you check out, as was the case with us. There is a charge for the bicycles, which I think is ridiculous. The resort would do well to buy more bikes and make them available for no charge. 4) Our resort host guided us through check in, took us to our room and after that, we never saw him again. We got along fine without him but during the check in process, he led us to believe that he would be available to us during the rest of our stay. The resort may want to re-think how they want the resort hosts to interact with the guests. None of these issues ruined our stay nor would they make us not want to recommend the hotel to friends and family. I understand that its still a new property and some issues just take a while to work out. Overall, we had a great time and were treated very well. We will return to Banyan Tree Mayakoba soon and expect to again have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel on a pristine Carribean beach.”
Reviews.Author: lmkNy_ny
Reviews.Content: We chanced upon this jewel of a hotel thanks to the trip advisor ratings and reviews. Having heard of its sister hotel in Phuket, we booked it on the spur of the moment, and are currently enjoying our stay. I had thought that Playa Del Carmen would be too commercial for my tastes, but this property and beachfront is so private and pristine that I feel like its my own private resort! The architecture is astounding, with a spare-no-expense attention to detail, from the interior design, to the fixtures, to the horticulture. The rooms are actually villas with private swimming pools, a yard and gazebo, a spacious bedroom, and killer bathrooms with outdoor bathtubs. Interior design is ultra-sleek with a zen-like elegance. The place is quite spread out with cenote streams surrounding the villas, and pathways that circle the property. One can boat from the hotel to the beach, or ride bikes along the many pathways that connect the hotel to the beach and to the other 5 star hotels and golf course in Mayakoba. This makes for a lot of fun, exploring this enormous and idyllic property. The staff here is beyond belief. They clearly have been hand picked to be the most genial,enthusiastic and lovely staff I have encountered in my travels. I swear that the staff outnumbers the guests. I was shocked after dinner the night before my birthday, when the wonderful staff at Saffron brought me out a birthday cake and sang to me. I was perplexed at how they knew it was my birthday. To cap it off, when I got back to the villa, a hot bubble bath had been drawn for me with numerous candles surrounding it. Allessandra, our hostess, apparently had noticed upon check-in that I was having a birthday during the trip and arranged for it all. Unfortunately for us, we had the bad timing of being here during the longest cold spell in memory. I can only imagine how much better this trip would have been were we able to enjoy all the facilities! In light of this event, my only criticism is that all the pools except one are not heated, and that one hasn't been heated enough for the inclement temperature. Nevertheless, I would come back here in the blink of an eye- but I think somewhat regretfully, that word of mouth will spread about this amazing destination, and this hidden gem will become a difficult reservation to book!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to recharge”
Reviews.Author: Ar3enalfan
Reviews.Content: The staff, rooms, service and architecture are tremendous. My wife and I stayed at the end of December and our expectations were very much exceeded. This place is special. We are returning for a second time in March 2010. A lot of thought has gone into making sure that your stay goes beyond what the competition can offer. There are 4 restaurants that each offer very different culinary experiences -- Mexican, Thai, seafood, and hybrid/modern. Each restaurant was extremely good -- and the chef of each restaurant makes a point of visiting the table to check on your eating experience. We didn't get tired of the food like we usually do when dining at the same hotel for several days. The restaurant managers do an excellent job -- service was prompt and the staff couldn't do enough to make sure you get what you want. The commitment to high-end service is found throughout this hotel. My wife and I travel a lot for business and pleasure, and this hotel has found the ideal blend of luxury -- the staff anticipate your next move and steer you into the relaxation zone. The management team has trained the staff wonderfully. The architecture of the hotel is beautiful. The modern Asian-inspired facility blends well with the mangroves and beach area. The rooms (really should be called villas) and common areas have high-end, modern fixtures everywhere -- no cost spared. The property is large -- an 18-hole golf course wraps around the whole property. Electric buggies and an electric boat (to save on environment and keep noise low) transport you around the property -- alternatively you can request bikes. To jog around the property takes 30 minutes -- which is very cool as you get to see the sea, mangroves, bridges, wild life, the golf course, etc. You never feel crowded -- we went at a time when there was high occupancy -- but you would never know -- quite the contrary. My wife and I have stayed in the region before -- we stayed at Maroma Spa & Resort. This facility is a two star resort when compared to the five star Banyan Tree. The rooms are very basic and the hotel needs a serious overall upgrade, whereas Banyan Tree goes beyond your expectations. Looking forward to going back in March -- The Macdonald family.

Reviews.Title: “Best service; unfortunately the architects/designers let them down”
Reviews.Author: AndyENewYork
Reviews.Content: I must admit to being a bit intimidated by the seemingly unanimous reviews that this hotel is the "be all and end all" and the best resort anyone has been to in the Americas, because I think there are several areas where the resort needs improvement. One difference in my views from earlier ones may be that I went during Christmas when rates are about $1,500 minimum a room per night when you include tax and service, and many of the earlier reviews were for promotional rates. While the resort may eventually be included in the list of the best, it has substantial room for improvement, despite the world class staff. Service is the strength of the resort, as in that area I agree with the opinions that the staff was the best I ever encountered. They were friendly, attentive, and adaptive to our needs. They also managed to keep the proper distance to respect privacy. The only minor suggestion I would give would be for the housekeepers to try to work around guests belongings rather than deciding to reorganize them; we had a daily game of guessing where they had relocated a brush, magazine, lotion, eye shades, etc. The facilities are beautiful, but seem limited if you are going to be staying more than a few days. I appreciate a very comfortable lounge chair down by a beautiful beach as much as anyone, but for just so long before feeling "beached". A problem is that there isn't a lot to do at the resort except lounge by the beach/pool. By the way, I know the weather is great usually, but the pools were not used, probably because all but one are not heated; we never got for than a foot into the one in our villa. The resort shares 1 golf course and two very average tennis courts with all the other hotels at Mayakoba and the Mandarin Oriental. The resort gym is minuscule, and unattended. It was impossible to get on one of the very few pieces of equipment or even find room to even stretch if there were more than 4 people at the facility. There is also no real general locker facility; no shower, nor lockers, sauna, steam room, so be prepared to walk around in your sweaty clothes should you be lucky enough to get the use of an aerobics machine. If you decide to take a massage or other treatment (these were very good, btw), you're met in the Spa lobby and walked across outside through a part of the hotel to a private room with a shower and separate bathroom. That essentially is it for exercise and sports facilities. In this way the resort pales behind anything you would find at a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. It makes staying here for more than 3 or 4 days difficult, especially if you're active. I can't talk about the rooms except about ours, which was a three bedroom "Terrace Residence". It's a 3 level building. the top floor being a small (cold) pool with a table and places to lie down with direct views of and from the golf course. The main floor has a nice living/dining room, but has no bathroom. All the bathrooms and the bedrooms are downstairs which has somewhat of a basement feeling. The Master Bedroom is large, but the Master Bathroom is part of the room and separated by sticky sliding "walls" which are difficult to close. The toilet is not in a separate W.C., which with the difficult sliding walls takes a lot away from what I guess could be a romantic setting. Then there's the TV/closet dilemma; there's a nice flat screen TV on a cart that sits in front of the single closet where you can put your empty suitcases; the problem is that the cables to the TV are so short that you can't open the closet at all, and the TV can't quite face the bed. Btw, that's also the only TV in any of the bedrooms, which makes for a potential issues if you're there with a family or another couple.The hotel manager did lengthen the cords on the master TV plus add one to the second bedroom when I asked; like everything, they tried to do anything they could to make your stay best. The second bedroom has a king bed but the room is half the size of the master, and the bathroom (while it does have a door) is very small. The third bedroom is maybe 10'-13', and has two single beds and a small bathroom that also opens to the hall. All the bedrooms are very poorly lighted, which when added to the hard walls and floors contribute to the basement feeling of the entire bedroom level. Also, the showers are more confusing than they should be; the knobs have to be turned towards the 8 o'clock position for hot (wait, it'll go from freezing to hot after a while). There's a patio outside each of the bedrooms, but no furniture of any sort...not even to lay a wet bathing suit. There are no washer or dryers available except through the hotel laundry, which is surprising considering they are commonplace at many other 5 star resorts we have stayed at. Nothing dries inside, and the housekeeping staff keeps bringing your damp clothes in as part of their reorganization drill. The Restaurant Saffron is excellent, and the breakfast buffet fine (btw,at $25 plus the 25% tip on everything there, it's not as badly priced as we had been led to believe). Lunches at the beach are good (luckily, since getting from the beach to the lobby or your villa is a 20+ minute effort usually). We ate dinner in Playa del Carmen three nights, which was a fun trip (170 pesos each way fixed price). If not for Playa del Carmen, I think we would have gone a bit stir crazy. The resort provide basic bikes which are a nice touch and could help to get around; only problem is that they were in short supply during Christmas, and they wear very poorly because of the weather and shoddy construction. The one I got (after a couple of days on a waiting list) had a chain which fell off as well as the entire pedal crank falling apart; both times the staff came running to help and returned them to my villa in whatever was the best condition possible. Sorry to ramble; by adding my thoughts I don't want to accidentally insult the incredible staff as they try their hardest and would move heaven and earth for the guests. My issues are with the people who designed the resort; my hope is that they will add the necessary facilities to make this resort be what it could be. I can think of several resorts which currently are better than Banyan Tree Mayakoba, but none with the level of service. Hopefully the facility will catch up to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit, of many, we hope.”
Reviews.Author: REYMYSTERIOJR
Reviews.Content: Any review cannot truly do this resort service. The other reviews are so accurate and glowing my written skills cannot compare. This hotel is amazing. the location, the setting, the food, and most of all the service is like eating at Alain Ducasse 3 meals a day for your whole life. As this was our second visit in 2009, i cant stop looking forward to our next trip. Don't stay at the Rosewood or Mandarin, you will be wasting your time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: cherrypt
Reviews.Content: This property is the finest in the Americas...I have stayed at many of the finest resorts in the US/Caribbean etc....Simply put, this is the best. The service here makes the 4 Seasons/Ritz/Rosewood seem like a Hyatt/Holiday inn. We are still here in the middle of a 8 night stay and have loved every minute! Caution--get a 3...not a 2 bedroom suite--much more private etc. New Years was extraordinary. Expensive--yes but worth the price.....Well Done Banyan Tree!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HONEYMOON!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaSPAGirl
Reviews.Content: There is not much left to say that hasn't been said before about this incredible resort. We spent the week of Thanksgiving at the Banyan Tree for our Honeymoon. I knew from the reviews and the pictures that the resort was going to be wonderful. I wasn't prepared for how overwhelmed I felt when we first arrived. From the moment we walked into our villa (with the incense burning and spa music playing) we felt so relaxed and welcome. There is not a detail that has been overlooked. The staff was courteous, helpful and eager to please. The food was delicious. The breakfast buffet at Orient has everything you can image from sushi, to pastries, to cereal, to bbq pork, to bacon, to salad, to fruit and vegetables, you name it and it's on the buffet. Room service was prompt and delicious as were all of the other restaurants. The villas are amazing; the outdoor bathtub is especially romantic. I was a little worried at first that it might be difficult or time consuming to get to the beach, but we really enjoyed having the bicycles to ride around the resort and everything is within an easy distance. Whenever we needed a buggy it was just a short phone call away. The beach was beautiful, the service wonderful and the beach chairs (which are more like little mattresses you can lay on) were so comfortable we never wanted to leave. We even enjoyed a "stretch class" (basically yoga) on the beach on day. We are already planning to return some time in the next year. If you are undecided about going to the Banyan Tree, STOP thinking about it and make the reservation today!!!

Reviews.Title: “Once in a lifetime extravagance”
Reviews.Author: MAKTucson
Reviews.Content: Banyan Tree Mayakoba provided everything we expected, and then some, in a total luxury vacation. We had booked a "courtyard villa" and -- even though we had booked through Expedia and thus were already paying a bargain rate -- we were upgraded to a "spa villa," which was far more spacious and luxurious than any hotel accomodation we had ever been in. The "room" -- the term hardly does it justice -- consisted of the following: a large courtyard containing a grassy area, patio, L-shaped swimming pool, separate hot tub and double lounger with umbrella; a pavillion building off to the left containing a mini-bar and fridge, flat screen tv, dining table and chairs, and the largest pillow-surrounded couch I've ever seen; a main building off to the right which contained a king bed, another flat screen tv, direct access doors to both the hammock area and the swimming pool (jump right in if you wanted); an adjoining bath with separate his and her vessel sinks, walk-in clothes closet, steam shower, and separate privacy-walled outside tub area; and a rooftop deck overlooking the golf course with twin massage tables, a sink and bar area and yet another outside shower. All furnished in an exquisite blend of contemporary, Thai and Mexican elements. The service was was in many ways equal to the surroundings: twice daily room cleanings and turn down/towel replenishment; a small gift left every evening with candles lit, evening robes and slippers laid out and incense set up when we returned to the room following dinner or visits to Playa del Carmen; bicycles left at our door for our use to get around the property throughout the week; an ipod full of music to be played in either our bathroom or bedroom docking stations; and a hostess/concierge (Jadira) who made clear that whatever we needed she and the hotel were there to provide. I will mention also the breakfast buffet which was, again, unequalled in our experience of similar provisions at other comparable hotels: platters of fresh fruits constantly refreshed; five or six varieites of cereals and granolas; cold seafood including salmon, sushi and other asian delights; a dozen different varieites of cheeses; an omelette/eggs to order station; at least a half dozen hot dishes every day including pancakes and waffles, bacon, suasages and ham, mexican chicken dishes, Thai/asian based seafood pots, muffins, croissants, bagels, at least a half-dozen different fresh baked and self-slicing breads, and a whole separate station of Mexican sweet cookies and pastries -- and more. The dinner restaurants were also excellent: Saffron was our favorite, for Thai cuisine, and its outside setting was especially tranquil and remorely beautiful; we also enjoyed Tamarind (eclectic Mediterranean, I guess), and Oriente, which I guess I would call fusion. All had novel menus, fresh ingredients, and truly outstanding settings, service and amenities, including complimentary tastings premeal and after dessert. We also had room service in our pavillion one night, and that was a fine experience as well, including personalized service while we relaxed with the tv on. So, was everything perfect? Well, in a sense, yes. Because at a beautiful property where everyone goes out of their way to cated to your every whim, and where your bargain rate already has gotten you more than you might imagine, plus an unpgrade to even greater indulgence, to point out any of the truly minor things that might be deemed less than 5-star ideal, would seem to me the height of ingratitude. But a few things for others to note (none of which, as I say, detracted in any way from our week-in-paridise feeling): the breakfast buffet is expensive (about $40/person including service and taxes) and there really is no alternative, so if at all possible get a package which includes that in your rate; the main part of the hotel is not directly on the beach, but about a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bike ride away and the beach area is fairly narrow, though it has an exquisite pool and beach club; and the fitness facility is surprisingly small, with only 4 pieces of aerobic equipment -- 2 treadmills and 2 cross trainers and no bikes or ellipticals. That, I could imagine, might be a problem in the late afternoons when the place is more full of guests desperate to burn a few of the 2,000 or so calories they put away at breakfast. But, it was never a problem while we were there, so maybe Banyan Tree knows its guests better than I do. One other thing to note -- the staff is trained to react to the slightest suggestion of disappointment, so be careful of what you say and how you say it. One night in Oriente I ordered the Tortilla Soup. My wife found it excellent and finished every drop but I found it just a little too spicy for my palate and so only ate half the bowl. Our waiter of course noticed, and asked if there was something wrong. I said no, just that the soup was a bit spicy for me. He then asked if he could bring me a different appetizer. I said that no, I was fine. Then after our our main dishes had come the restaurant manager came over and again apologized for the soup and offered to treat us to a complimentary after dinner drink or coffee, which we declined. Then, a few minutes later the manager brought the chef over and introduced him, and the chef apologized for my soup and said that please whatever our needs and wants were for our food, we should just make them known and they would do everything they could to accomodate them in any way possible. Which, in a way, sums up our week at Banyan Tree Mayakoba -- a place that does a pretty fantastic job of anticipating your every sybaritic desire and then goes the extra mile just to be sure it has hit all the right notes.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyDLG
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review after having returned home this morning from the Banyan Tree and I already miss it. My first impressions of Banyan Tree were very positive; when we arrived at reception we were warmly greeted by Alejandra who went on to look after us for the rest of the week. We were upgraded not once, but twice, allowing us two villas between 4 of us! (Naturally I moved into the Master bedroom of 309!) The rooms were stunning, more luxurious than anywhere I have ever been to or even seen on TV or in a magazine. Food in the hotel was delicious; I felt like I was in Thailand when eating in Saffron's! In the other restaurant, Christian was a really nice guy and we enjoyed chatting to him. Shame we didn't get to go out in Playa together! With regard to location, you need to take taxis into Playa but it didn't cause us any inconvenience at all as the hotel organises everything for you and not to mention it didn't cost much either. I have never been to a country where the locals have been so friendly. It's not only the hotel staff, but all the locals walk round with a smile on their face and they always ask how you are and if you're enjoying your holiday. The service around the hotel was the best I've ever experienced. All the staff were happy to help and we were always greeted and made to feel very welcome. They went completely out their way to help you. We became friendly with the reception and entrance staff and it was a pleasure to walk past them and have a quick chat. P.S - Alejandra and Dan were absolutely amazing, they went so out of there way to introduce us to the nightlife in Playa del Carmen and it was really appreciated! Gonna miss you guys so much (and Coco Bongo)!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly romantic resort”
Reviews.Author: troutandbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Banyan Tree Mayakoba in a jacuzzi villa. The room had a pool, a jacuzzi, and a media room that meant we rarely had to leave the room. The service and food were top notch. The staff was so well-trained and friendly. Our stay came with breakfast as part of the promotion and it was incredible. A huge very high-quality buffet (similar in quality to St Regis Monarch Beach - which is VERY high). The spa villas were over-water, and the couples massage was very romantic. The boat from the lobby to the beach was fun every time. The tea in the lobby, the fruit in the room. They were so generous. We can't wait to go back. The resort would be great for a honeymoon, but it was also great to travel with the family. It doesn't get much better. What a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The finest resort in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: larefinedtaste1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Las Ventanas, Esperanza, Palmilla One & Only, and various resorts in Puerto Vallarta, as well as in Hawaii and the Caribbean. Banyan Tree Mayakoba is the best of them all. Definitely visit. Every room has a pool and is HUGE.

Reviews.Title: “really wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ybjordi
Reviews.Content: Days to remember and already planning my vacation back. Normally, I do not write reviews, but want to say out loud THANK YOU to a number of staff at Banyan tree that made our unique holiday unforgettable. Dafne who escorted us to our astonish villa was making sure we understood all the services that we could enjoy the villa and also assisted us throughout our stay, so we didn´t miss a thing. At Saffron Restaurant, Benjamin took care of us, apparently the restaurant served a record that night and we didn´t ever felt rush, all was served smooth and with dedication. We spent the days at the Sands lying on the sun, while Brenda and her colleagues approached us at the perfect time, when we needed water, when we needed to move our umbrella and the moment we were ready for lunch. We were actually very full after our daily breakfast at Oriente, where Otto was always there offering his biggest smile. We used to wake up late prepare our own coffee at our villa, read the newspaper, have a swim at our enormous pool, then get some bikes and ride to Oriente… and all this was done with no rush at all… they open till 12hrs and then the menu they offered was for all kind of sense of tastes! Isn´t great? Banyan Tree is part of an integrated resort together with Fairmont and Rosewood, so you have a selection of luxury hotels depending on what you are looking for. If you are looking for a real and unique Experience, or best Spa in Mexico, than Banyan Tree should be your choice. The hotel is not only wonderful and full of Mexican art crafts and colors, but I felt back in Asia, only that this time it was less hours of flight and everyone could understand our language. You don´t need to go further to live Asia´s kindness and attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel... Fantastic staff... Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: ms33
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that I have NEVER reviewed anything online. Ever... But the ten days I just spent at the Banyan Tree in Mayakoba for my honeymoon have compelled me to post my thoughts. From the moment we arrived and up until our check-out, the service was top notch. For a new hotel, there are really very few kinks. Everything runs smoothly, and all of the staff members appear to be very well-trained. From bellmen to waiters to the beach attendants, everyone is gracious, friendly, and willing to help with anything, and they do it in a manner that is neither obtrusive nor obsequious. The front office management has done an incredible job with their employees. The rooms are beyond beautiful, and perfectly designed. Spacious, airy, and well appointed, they far exceeded our lofty expectations. We were in a two bedroom villa and could have easily not left it for our entire vacation. Situated on a lagoon, our villa featured a gigantic pool (this is not the soaking tub that a lot of places try to pass off as a pool- this is a swimming pool, four and a half feet deep and long enough to actually swim) a separate pavilion room with the most comfortable couch/day bed ever,a flat screen tv, dining table, bar area and coffee machine (this was the ONE PROBLEM with the hotel, if I had to site something wrong- it was a huge pain to work). Our bedroom was huge... Two walls of sliding doors open onto both the pool and a patio with a hammock; the bathroom featured a gigantic outdoor tub and shower as well as a very nice indoor one; walk-in closets, ipod docks everywhere...and the turndown service was beyond belief. Every night a crew would show up for an hour, lighting candles, burning scented oils, turning on relaxing new age music... Coming back to the room after dinner was like walking into a spa. Which brings me to the spa. Best. Massage. Ever. The beach was beautiful and incredibly well maintained ,down to the crew who would cart off seaweed that washed ashore. The beach staff went above and beyond- in particular, the main attendants Jorge and Alex, and the waiters Alejandro and Carlos. They're all great and deserve a special shout-out... We thought that we might be bummed out to not have a room directly on the beach, but golf carts were available to pick us up with not much more than a three minute wait... The restaurants were all very good- particularly the decadent breakfast buffet, which was more of a breakfast/brunch/lunch buffet which could fill you up until dinner. Overall, the Banyan Tree experience, and it is just that, is one not to be missed. I can't recommend it enough, and will definitely be traveling back there and look forward to visiting other Banyan Trees.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Peace to all!”
Reviews.Author: ObjectiveTraveller1
Reviews.Content: The resort is world class. The Spa, services, breakfast buffet, villas...all outstanding. We did not eat at the resort restaurants (other than Sands by the beach, the ceviche and appetizers were delicious though). Since we had a short stay we ate dinner in Playa every night (a wonderful experience). If we had stayed longer, the resort restaurant Saffron looked to offer an amazing dining experience. We spent the days relaxing by the beach and the pool. We walked miles each way on the beach and nothing compared to Banyan Tree. The proximity to Playa Del Carmen is convenient; the resort contracted with a Taxi service to provide clean, safe and courteous transportation to town. We'd have a cocktail before or after a night out at La Copa, the resort bar. Sunday evening, after dinner and a night on the town, we watched the Geminids meteor shower from the outdoor patio at La Copa!

Reviews.Title: “Secret Utopia”
Reviews.Author: ECONPHD
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Banyan Tree on Sunday, December 13th, 2009. Alberto greeted us at the hotel and showed us the premises. We were greeted with bracelets made of fresh flowers and a special cocktail to promote health. Alberto escorted us to our villa and showed us how to use all the devices. Everyone has been unbelievably helpful and they are always smiling and helping us improve our remedial Spanish. Speak with any of the employees here and they will tell you this is the best hotel for guests and for employees. The happiness is contagious. Ivan at the Oriente greats you with a smile before you embark on the endless breakfast buffet at the restaurant ORIENTE. Request the TREK bikes from the front desk so that you may ride from the personal pool in your villa, to the large beachfront. Jorge and Manuel prepare a large beach bed in the sand and check on you constantly to ensure you are not in need of anything! Last night we relished in Thai cuisine at the Saffron restuarant on the premises. The cuisine was divine and exceeded our expecatations! We have been here for only two days but I am looking forward to the next four days pf spa appointments and other culinary delights. The pictures I have provided are from our current garden pool villa number 505. I will update the review after the spa and other days. However, I was checking tripadvisor before we left for our trip to the Banyan tree.... if you are curious about whether the previous reviews are legitimate... have no doubt! With any luck we will not have to leave in four days and we can live here forever:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at its best”
Reviews.Author: Arezou
Reviews.Content: We spent the week last week at this incredible resort and we are already looking to book our next visit. Not only arre the grounds and the rooms beautiful, the staff is by far the most well trained, polite, genuine, helpful and pleasant we have ever encountered. Both of us are seasoned travelers with very high standards and the staff at Banyan Tree well exceeded our expectations. Particularly, Alex, Jorge and Alejandro at the pool, Miguel and Rafael at the front lobby, and Ivan and Cesar at Oriente were helpful, always smiling, always on top of any need we had and they made our stay at Banyan Tree even more enjoyable. We cannot thank them enough. During our stay, we had a recurring issue at our room and at check out , Mr. Jose Luis Barberra graciously met with us, listened to our concerns and provided a personalized remedy that was more than satsifactory. One of the most impressive and wonderful things about this hotel is its harmony with the environment and the avid effort on behalf of management to educate the employees and to benefit the community. One of the employees told us that he has become much more aware of environmental issues and even carried his training home (he now recycles, for example). They do not import any food; we were told that all the food served at the hotel comes from local producers. We didn't get to go on the Eco tour but we saw lots of wonderful wildlife around us and the efforts on behalf of the hotel to preserve the wildlife and it's habitat. Employees all seem to have a purpose--this is far more than a job for them. They enjoy the training and education they receive and are committed to creating an incredible experience for the guests. They all demonstrate a stake in the success of the hotel as well. They know the occupancy rate, the check in's and check out's, the issues of yesterday, and goals of today. We were very, very impressed with how the operations of the hotel are managed, much much more impressive than any other five star resort in which we have stayed. Last but not least, the Yoga instructor, Ms. Jenny was fabulous. A true example of Yoga teachings. Massage provided by Champou was incredible as well. We can't wait to go back. Thank you Banyan Tree for making our stay most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_surgeon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an authentic slice of paradise. It is an absolutely gorgeous place... we were essentially living in a spa-like luxurious retreat for an entire week. I almost don't want to post this review because I don't want anyone else to discover our secret! Can we please go back... like now?!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: soxyanks74
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Banyan Tree Mayakoba where we traveled with our friends and family to celebrate our wedding. The service was excellent from the moment that we stepped off the plane at the airport. The car service provided by the hotel was excellent. I strongly recommed this as the taxi drivers at the Cancun airport are comically solicitous and it is a fair ride to the Mayakoba Reserve. We were provided with cold towels and ice water on arrival which was a nice touch as it was well into the 90's when we arrived. The check in process was very relaxing. We were provided with refreshments in the lounge as we waited for about all of 2 minutes for the staff to take care of the arrangements. We were given a quick tour of the main building to familiarize ourselves with the main part of the hotel before we were driven by golf cart to our room. Some people have mentioned that they have had issues with the buggy service but we were there for 10 days and were about as far away as you could get from the main building and there was only one time where we had to wait for more than 5 minutes from the moment we made the call to the desk and we used that service multiple times every day to go to breakfast and dinner. The bikes are a great touch. The Food: Our biggest concern with having our wedding at any hotel was the quality of the food. The food at the hotel was excellent. Saffron was especially good and the food at Tamarind stacks up to places in NY as well. The sea bass was excellent at Tamarind. Also the breakfast spread was better than any comparable hotel with a nice mix of Asian and Mexican dishes that vary every day. There is also standard breakfast fare as well (omlette station, waffles, bagels, lox, etc.) The Service: Impeccable. period. The Property: Excellent layout of the property overall. An actual comment was "you cannot take a bad picture here" There are a lot of mentions of mosquitos and personally I never get bit so they really don't bother me but my wife gets killed by them NY let alone in the middle of an ecological park in Mexico but they didn't bother her any more than on any tropical location we have been too, so not really a big deal and they are only an issue at all for an hour at dusk. Anyway, if you don't like mosquitos a beach location anywhere in the Caribbean is probably not a good choice for you. I would suggest skiing in Colorado, the mosquito population there is pretty sparse in the winter. Rooms: Let's see, 2Bdr, Infinity pool with jacuzzi: check, separate living room/ bar area: check, outdoor bath and shower: check, excellent design: check. Yep, that works. Spa: "Better than NYC" A big compliment comming from a person that to this day insists that the best pizza in the world just happens to be the on on the corner of her block where she grew up in NYC. (It's actually Little City Pizza in Simsbury, CT) Value: Worth every penny Sercive: Clearly a very well trained staff. They went to extraordinary levels to accommodate absolutely anything we needed. First rate. Every single person went far above and beyond what could have been asked. First of all, thank you for such a great time Pancho, Peter, (Jenny, Flo says sorry and she hopes Yoga went well), Mari Lu, Arturo, Raphael, Miguel, Abraham at the pool bar and let's see........ Yvonne!! With all of the great things said above about this hotel there is one thing that stands out above all the others. That is Yvonne. Even with the excellent reviews on the web site, the pictures, the reputation of Banyan Tree in general, we would never have not had our wedding at the Banyan Tree if it was not for Yvonne. For comparison's sake we also looked at the Ritz in Grand Cayman and Amanyara in Turks and Caicos. We had visited the Ritz prior and my Sister and Brother in law checked out Amanyara in person. Due to Yvonne's unmatched professionalism and the fact that she was an absolute pleasure to deal with we decided on the Banyan Tree sight unseen. We were so glad that we did. We could not have asked for a better experience for our wedding. Everything was perfect, even the timing of the weather. (Yvonne, I'm sure you had something to do with that as well so, thank you.) We did not have a lot of time to dedicate to minor details like how many rose petals should be on a place setting or which direction the beach should be raked. As such, we really asked Yvonne to do a lot and she more than delivered. Need a photographer? done. entertainment? all set. Can you serve this specific type of tea that only grows above 9,000 ft in the Himalayas? "We'll send someone right over, he'll be back in 20 minutes" (Kidding there, but you get the idea) Yvonne, above all thank you for taking the stress out of planning a wedding and making it an absolutely perfect day.

Reviews.Title: “pure luxury, could not fault a thing, trip of a life time”
Reviews.Author: mrsmorley
Reviews.Content: the service here was one in a million, the staff treat you like king and queen and would do anything to make your stay the best possible! the villa (we had a garden pool villa) was stunning, nothing can fault it, pure luxury! Very clean, had cleaners come every day without fail and again before bed for turn down service which they would tidy again if needed. best bit was the outside bath, pool just outside your patio, the hammock, the very comfortable bed, the wet room shower... everything! nothing in this villa was a downfall everything was perfect! the food was outstanding in all restaurants, breakfast buffet was absolutely lovely, so much choice and you could have something different everyday if you wanted. sparkling wine with juice was brought round free of charge which was a nice touch. lunch at the beach club was superb, brought to you with silver lids on top, fresh water with ice was brought round regular, as was free acholic drinks to try throughout the day. the beach staff would bend over backwards to help you. dinner was again outstanding, was expensive but worth the money as it was so good. an amazing place, the spa is a must, I had a full body massage and it was out of this world, the whole experience was just so relaxing. If you have the chance to experience this hotel then diffiantly do!

Reviews.Title: “Not much else to add!”
Reviews.Author: COtrips
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this hotel is rated #1. Everything is taken into consideration to make your stay enjoyable. From three options to get you to the beach, to the complimentary afternoon beverage on the beach, the staff has you covered. One of the reasons we stayed here - other than the amazing webdeal - was the attraction of being able to ride bikes to the beach. Upon showing up, they claimed that due to the start of high season, bike are $10 USD per person per day. We complained because this feature - while not for everyone - is one of the details we loved. The following day, the staff informed us that no bike fee would be applied to our stay. It is this type of response that those who stay at a high end resort like this expect and appreciate. Also, the villas are everything you could imagine, my wife said the massage was the best she's had, and Safron is super tasty Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best we've been to!”
Reviews.Author: MissJuliet
Reviews.Content: We were in the Riviera Maya/Cancun areas for a total of a week to celebrate: a wedding, our 1year wedding anniversary and other parties. We saw information about this hotel when it first opened up and took this vacation as an opportunity to stay at this resort. Luckily, there was also an internet special which we were also able to take advantage of. Location: This is definately not a party resort, but I would recommend it for a wedding. This location is pretty secluded. It was a 10-15 minute taxi ride to Playa del Carmen which we found to be neither too far, nor too close. Accomodations: For our short 3night stay here, we were going to be gone for most of the day, therefore we opted for the courtyard villa - the most basic villa. Wow, were we surprised. The villas were beautifully decorated, clean and very spacious. We honestly felt like we were the only guests on the property. The yard area was maintained very well and the pool was really clean. Our only slight disappointment was that the pool was very cold. We were also given bikes which we used to go throughout the property.
