We used the bikes mostly to go the beach every morning and to get to the main lobby. Serivce: Excellent! Alejandra was our designated person for our stay. Whenever we needed anything, she just told her. She definately went above and beyond our requests (mostly small things). Everyone at the resort was extremely friendly and attentive. Food: Since we were gone most of the day, we did not have the opportunity to eat at the resturants. However, we were able to eat at the Orient for a breakfast buffet every morning. Good variety and very fresh. Overall: I recommend this place hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: wdcmpj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Banyan Tree for five nights after having spent some earlier time at Maroma. We loved the Banyan Tree and preferred it over all, though the two resorts are vey different in style. Just by way of comparison, the Banyan Tree feels much larger, a sprawling resort, and is more modern and less intimate in style than Maroma. Some of the pros and cons follow. Pros: The staff to guest ratio nevertheless was very high and the service was extremely attentive. We really loved the large and modern rooms, the high ceilings and the private plunge pool and private courtyard/sitting area. The closet and bathroom at the Banyan Tree felt as large as the main area of our room at the Maroma. We also loved the spa services, the thai massages, classes etc. The workout facility was nice though not exceptional. Everything had a "newness" about it which is not surprising given the hotel's relatively recent opening. We enjoyed just the laid-back feel of the resort, just riding the resort bikes around the grounds was a pleasure. Cons. There were a few cons, though not many. The resort like many in the area is long and narrow with only a small beach area. As others have noted, this means that many of the rooms are quite distant from the beach, requiring a (enjoyable, in our case) bike or "buggie" ride to get there. The restaurants were expensive though the food was good, not great, but good. There were mosquitos on some of the nights during our stay, though that is not particular to this resort (it's the area); that basically was not an issue you just wear repellent when going ount on some of the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: krowenj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip from the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. It was amazing! I would recommend this resort to anyone. Best for couples as it is very romantic, and even though there were some families there I suggest do not go with children. The Rooms: The villas are spectacular, each has its own pool and they are very private. You will never hear another person around you as soon as you enter your villas space. They are VERY spacious. The A/C is great and keeps the room very cool. There are ipod docks in the room and in the bathroom and feel free to blast the music as we asked our neighbors if they could hear it and they said no. The pools are immaculate and clean and huge, they are no splash pool but almost a normal size pool. There are loungers and outdoor beds. A great table and chairs is also provided for in villa dining outside. The beds are incredibly comfortable. The lighting in the rooms is very "zen" and romantic. The outdoor bathtubs are so great, they are huge, and the bath salts, bubbles, and oils are a great addition along with the wall of candles. Everything about the room is great, one suggestion keep your safe closed and all of your belongings in there. If you leave it open and any "valuables" are left out in the room the maid service will put it in the safe and change the code on you. This means they will be in your safe touching your belongings so just a reminder keep it all locked up. The Food The food is amazing from the in room dining to the Sands at the beach for lunch to Saffron which was the absolute best Thai food I have ever eaten. The service at Saffron is spot on and I do not know what they could do to make it any better. Everything we ate there we kept saying "Oh my god this is so good! Amazing! MMMM" You must go here, we ate indoors and it was very romantic, but there is tons of outdoor seating which looked very romantic but we had enough of all the mosquitos. You will not be disappointed by any of the food at this hotel. All fabulous! The Service Sometimes slow when asking for ice to the room or trying to get a buggy to take you around but always pleasant and very helpful. No one ever had any kind of attitude and they are willing to do anything for you. The beach help is very nice and bring you tons of water cold towels and special drinks. Everyone is great. The Spa The spa will blow you away its like being in a different world I had a Balinese massage and it was so relaxing definitely reccommend having lots of treatments done. If i knew how great it was may have gone for more. Overall the hotel is fabulous we are already planning on going back hopefully soon. It is incredibly safe Mayakoba's entrance blows you away, and its closeness to Playa del Carmen is great.

Reviews.Title: “Confused by the reviews...a real mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: travelingman826
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller who leans on TA in making decisions on where to stay. We have been to the Cancun/Riviera Maya several times and enjoy the people, the scenery and the culture. After reading the glowing reviews praising the Mayakoba , I was so looking forward to tsurprising my wife for our get away for five nights. However, I began to have some reservations upon entering the place. I almost hate to criticize because the staff was really good at "service recovery" and were well trained in customer service. It's not that the hotel grounds aren't beautiful; it is very isolated located in a wetlands that surrounds the area. (This property, while it has it's charm, is a haven for mosquitos and early evenings we were driven inside by the biting.) Our check in was flawed and for much of the stay, the staff seemed to be in recovery mode...fixing situations that should have been handled in advance. We arrived at about 1:00 P.M. Our villa wasn't ready because the AC unit wasn't working properly. When you travel over 8 hours to get someplace and you have communicated when you will be there, you'd like to drop your bags, put on something casual like a bathing suit and relax....we had to wait well over an hour for our room to be ready without the offer of a good alternative....given that the place was well below capacity you might think there would have been options... The villas are very private well appointed; very comfortable bed; nice pool and jacuzzi. We could have used more hangars and a better layout to spread out our clothes. We were given an upgrade with a pavilion which is a separate building that has a table, couch, TV, Coffee maker, etc. If we were with a group it would have been a fun place to have a drink but with just two of us, we didn't feel the need to use very often. The beach is fine and well raked and cleaned. Like many of the beaches in the area hit by hurricanes, they are losing sand and the beach has narrowed. We love the beach and the best part of the Mayakoba for us was the beach crew. My thanks to Jorge and the crew at the Sands for the excellent service and making our stay relaxing. The restaurants were just OK. We did enjoy Saffron. The chef and team were very friendly and the food was authentic and service top notch. The Tamarind was terrible, really. We waited for forty minutes for a salad and scallops and were laughing about how mediocre it was...and the place was empty... Service in general was very spotty at the hotel. The Oriente breakfast was excellent with fresh fruits and a great selection. Service was just OK.. to serve someone, there should be more attention at the table; less focus on opening the doors for you...we had to ask for napkins at breakfast; often the coffee/tea was forgotten...again the staff would be in service recovery mode apologizing rather than getting it right the first time. We had plans to have dinner one night at the Sands for the barbeque at 7:30 P.M. We arrived at 7:00 P.M. to have a glass of wine at the bar and were unable to get a drink because there was no bartender. W don't mind the fact that the resort is spread out. We like to walk and bike but wondered if many would find annoying the dependancy on waiting for rides, either a boat or golf cart to get around. We enjoy playing tennis and were dismayed that we couldn't walk or bike to a tennis court...you couldn't even take a golf cart but had to be taken by car instead to a remote spot where the tennis court is located. We come to Mexico because we like the people, the weather, the beach and the culture. While we enjoy private time, we like more action than was available at the Mayakoba. We would go the bar and find it empty. We enjoy Mexican music. While the music on the CDs for your room was soothing enough, the music in the public parts of the hotel (restaurants, etc. was...I really don't know how to describe the music...new age maybe...was not what we were looking for. This is a hotel that has hired many good people(Sarah, Jorge, Pedro, Cesar, Ivan, Alex...) and I am sure will continue to work to get it right. I share the concerns of a previous reviewer that, if the service issues exist while we visited at below 50% capacity, how will they handle when at capacityl?

Reviews.Title: “This is paradise. I don't think we could stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: fgizmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights at the end of October. This was our first real vacation in 10 years and this place lived up to our expectations of a high-end, private, relaxing, pampering vacation. If you are looking for a party, lots of people, nightly entertainment I'd go somewhere else. I love and appreciate architecture and design and absolutely refused to stay somewhere with the vegas style jacuzzi tubs in the room. If you are picky about rooms (I hate most!), then you will absolutely love BTM! The whole resort is a asian/mayan experience. Every detail has been designed, even down to the incense and oil burners, scented cold towels, to the lighting, bathrooms and the incredible smell of the lotions and bath gels. (I agree with another reviewer-I would have spent an insane amount of money to purchase the lotions, bath gels and incense/oils that were not available in the gift shop. They were also out of bathrobes I was hoping to purchase to remember our vacation. I went to the online gift shop to purchase a robe but shipping was terribly expensive - $65 for a $45 robe) Upon check-in, you get a welcoming drink and cold scented towel. They take your luggage to your villa and is already in the room when your arrive via buggy. We stayed in a Courtyard Villa. My husband and I couldn't stop grinning as our hostess gave us a tour of our villa. This Villa has a private courtyard with a very large pool and hot tub. They were all finished with amazing blue glass tiles. Two large loungers, table and hammock as well. The bedroom was on one side of the courtyard and the living room was on the opposite side. The bedrooms are large, very comfortable with large flat panel tv, cd player with ipod docking, satellite tv with an okay amount of channels, stocked mini bar, huge sun filled bathroom with double vessel sinks, seperate toilet and giant shower and huge walk in closet and another ipod docking station. There is also a large private outdoor tub with a wall of candles. The living room has a large sofa, another flat panel tv, cd/dvd player, fresh fruit (delicious!), coffee and tea bar and dining table. Each morning our villa was cleaned and refreshed with towels and fresh fruit. Each evening our room was turned down, robes and slippers set out. Before our trip my husband was very concerned about our room not being on the beach. Well he apologized to me over and over, this place is so incredible and it was fun riding our bikes two minutes to the beach each day it was not an issue at all! There are a few options for getting around the resort . Call for a buggy "boogey", take an electric boat (very cool!) or ride your bike. The buggy never took more than 5 minutes to arrive after our request. You can take a boat tour of the whole property on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The breakfast at the Oriente was also incredible! A huge selection of hot dishes (authentic mexican), breads, cereals, fresh fruits, sushi, cheeses, pastries, and eggs made to order. I also loved our late lunch at the Sands Beach Club. I wish they were open all day, they had a great selection of less fussy food. The Saffron was romantic, the food was good but I don't see eating there 5 or 6 nights. Because of the high quality of the food, the menus were more limited than we were used to but we were still able to find something we liked at each restaurant. Be prepared, the food is pricey, but you have to expect it at someplace so incredible! We had absolutely NO problems with mosquitos. I think I only saw one! Even though the resort is in the middle of mangroves they must do an excellent job fighting them off. We booked a couples swedish massage. Definitely the best, most relaxing massages we've ever had. The girls are from Thailand and of course are the best. This resort is paradise, but without the friendly, helpful staff it would be nothing! Each staff member went over and above in order to take care of us and serve us. From the hostess, buggy drivers, room service, housekeepers and turndown service, waiters....every person there was eager to help and so nice! The first couple of days my husband rode a girls bike. He mentioned this to Juan, and within 20 minutes his bike was replaced with a "man bike" and Juan wrote his name on it! Gabriel and the hard working staff at the beach club never made us wait for a drink. We felt like we had the whole resort to ourselves, it was a completely relaxing vacation. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful. And the beach is SO clean, no rocks, fine white powdered sand and very private, not crowded at all. If you decide to tear yourself from your room and this wonderful resort, Playa del Carmen is a 10 minute $17 taxi ride. Shopping on 5th Ave is okay for a couple of hours (street vendors wear on you after a while), and take the ferry to Cozumel. The whole time I was in Playa, I wished we were back at the resort. I almost hate to tell others about how amazing this place is. Just Go. Now. Stop looking, and book it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: MDgolfer54
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day stay. I just cannot say enough about the attention to customer service. From the time we arrived and were welcomed by Juan and then Sarah who every hotel in the world would be able to learn from her wonderful personality, to Eli, Dffren, Otto, Maria and everyone else who made our stay outstanding. Thank you. The Banyan Tree should be on everyones list of "the place to go". I hope they are able to keep up the incredible customer service. If you are a golfer, the El Camaleon golf course is all outstanding and a good test of golf. Every golfer would enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: qclaw
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for my birthday, and I think it might be the single best hotel we've visited in terms of the overall experience. The resort itself is beautiful, the grounds are amazing, the rooms are incredible, and the staff is just the best. They go above and beyond to accommodate your requests. I'm already looking forward to another visit. If you get the chance, don't hesitate - just go. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this World! Paradise Exists!”
Reviews.Author: bumd168
Reviews.Content: Hands down.....the NICEST resort I have every stayed at. Every aspect was perfection! The grounds are so beautiful, and it looks like they have really taken in the fact that Mayakoba is an ecological preserve, and have gone out of their way to not damage it. Even the transportation throughout the resort is with electrical cars. Yes, the place is beautiful. The rooms are HUGE and magnificent...each with their own pool. The outdoor bathtub was amazing, and can probably fit 3 people comfortably, and there is a whole wall of candles that the housekeeping folks light up when they help you draw the bath. But I think what really sets this place apart is the service. The staff that works there is AMAZING. It's a place which seems like people take pride in their work, and it's not just for tips. Wonderful people. From Rigo at the Beach Club to Christian, Eric, and Eli at the Tamarind restaurant. To Yunita who welcomed us, and checked in with us about our visit every day. Thank you ALL for your help. Without exception the food was delicious from the amazing buffet breakfast at Oriente. We had dinner at Saffron, Tamarinde, and also the Sands Beach Club. All were wonderful, but my favorite was Tamarinde because of the Mayan food that they offered there. The spa was also amazing with masseuses and staff from Thailand. It made me feel like I was in Phuket. I had a collagen facial along with a massage which were both outstanding. Stellar service on beautiful grounds. I can't wait to return. Oh by the way, I did go into Playa Del Carmen on Fifth Avenue....for about 2.5 hours. Unless you're planning on diving in Cozumel....I would just stay at the hotel. It is a much quieter, serene place to rest and relax, then hanging out on Fifth Avenue in the town center. My friend lost a pair of glasses there, and even though they were never found....management and all of the staff checked in with us every day, detailing what they were doing to try to find the glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: pickyvirginialady
Reviews.Content: With so many detailed reviews, I will simply highlight the best and worst components of our stay... The Good: -Breakfast is awesome -Staff is very friendly and eager to please -Villas are very private and well appointed The Bad: -MOSQUITOS--this hotel has so many awesome outdoor spaces, but, unfortunately, we were hardly able to use any of them because we were being eaten alive -The service was very good during the mid-week portion of our trip, but as hotel occupancy grew as the weekend approached, the service became very inconsistent -While the bicycles are a great ammenity, our bicycles were twice taken by other guests, leaving us annoyed and frustrated that the resort did not have enough bicycles for every guest (also--keep in mind the resort was only about 25% occupied) -The resort's restaurants were not always open and serving food during the hours they were supposed to. Also: there is a gap in the restaurant schedule from about 4:30 to 6:00 PM, when nothing is open and the only option is room service Overall, it is a very nice resort with good service, but it does not compare to, say, the Four Seasons. We booked this trip at a great value, and we definitely got our money's worth, but I would not pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't arrived but am already Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: pixiecaribe
Reviews.Content: Five months ago I booked a surprise trip for my boyfriend's birthday this week to Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Based on all the Trip Advisor reviews I was more than excited to experience this truly outstanding resort. Unfortunately Hurricane Ida also decided she wanted to vacation in Playa del Carmen this week. I spent over four hours on the phone with Continental only to find out they were charging us a huge fee to change our flight even though they couldn't fly into Cancun due to the weather. It was really disappointing but what can you do? The staff at Banyan Tree Mayakoba on the other hand, went out of their way to accomodate our changes. Due to difficulties with the airline, we had to call the resort multiple times with questions on dates and availability. Each time they were patient and accomodating. I spoke to Claudia and then another wonderful lady, I believe her name was Alisa. They went above and beyond to help and to assure that they would take care of canceling our spa and dinner resevations and get us rebooked for our Spa Pool Room in December. By the second phone call, they recognized my voice and immediately called me by my first&last name and said I didn't need to worry about anything. We are more excited than ever to visit Banyan Tree in December and meet the fantastic staff who have already impressed us! ~ Kathy & Dennis

Reviews.Title: “loved it but not everything.”
Reviews.Author: fastpace
Reviews.Content: i will not go into great detail about our recent trip because so many already have written detail reviews,but instead touch on what i feel are both high and lows of banyan tree.the hotel and villa are amazing.breakfast was out of this world,i only wish the the rest of the food was that good.on our first day after a long trip we decided to order room service for dinner,a very limited menu,we had order a kobe burger $26 and a chicken wrap.i was disapointed in the burger and expressed this to the waiter when he returned to pick-up.he the offered to get me another the following day.which i took him up on.little did i know he would also charge me for it .which was not me nor my wifes impression.when we question the charge the head of room service came to our roomat 9pm and argued with us about it.this does not reflect a 5 star hotel in my mind.this as well as having to ask 2 or 3 times for things when the hotel was only at 23% was very disapointing on our first and second day. Please dont get the wrong impression the staff was very polite and the hotel beautiful but for the money evan at 50% off i dont know if i would go back.

Reviews.Title: “great villas - great breakfast - but”
Reviews.Author: dee090
Reviews.Content: Had opted to book the current promotion "50% off the best of banyan tree" which related to courtyard pool villa, breakfast for 2 each day, one dinner plus pre-dinner drinks for 2, plus a massage. I went to book via their website and once I typed in the dates we wanted in October, the website told me that the courtyard villas were not available for those dates tho' a garden pool villa was. I therefore proceeded to book. On arrival at the hotel, I was told that our booking did not include the dinner plus pre-dinner drinks for 2 which I was surprised at, as I had assumed that we had booked the offer as per the website with the only difference being that we had been allocated a garden villa instead of a courtyard villa . However as I had nothing in writing to confirm that we were expecting to have dinner on one night included - there was nothing I could do. I found this misleading and it was pointed out to management. That said, we were not disappointed with the garden villa. It was spacious (as others have noted) and in all honesty we would not have needed any more space inside or out. The pool was great - big enough to swim in and the water was a nice temperature so it was pleasant to be in - which is so often not the case with private hotel pools. I loved the peace and quiet of the place. No car sounds - no dogs barking in the distance - no noisy neighbours. Just silence. The first day we just lazed around in our private garden and sunbathed on the large comfortable loungers or headed to the large shaded day bed if it was too hot. For lunch we cycled down to the Sands beach bar. Great to have the bikes. We asked for them as soon as we arrived the first evening and we were told there was a waiting list - but two bikes were waiting for us when we headed off to breakfast the first morning. Cocktails and lunch at Sands were lovely. Mexican food, salads or club sandwiches with fries - all nice. In the afternoon, a well located hammock outside our bedroom door offered a delightful spot to read/doze. It was very hot the second day so we cycled down to the beach again in the morning and got loungers around the pool. the sea breeze made it very pleasant. Service around the pool was excellent. We ate at Tamarind the first and last nights. Food was nice. Seats at tables were wrong height for me so had to sit on a couple of cushions to be at comfortable height for eating. Service was great first night but a bit Faulty Towers the last night. On the second evening we ate at Saffron and that was very enjoyable. Dark and romantic setting - good service and nice menu. As others have raved - breakfast here is wonderful. Fabulous choice and everything looked and tasted delicous - only wish I could have eaten more! The free 90 minute massage was very good indeed. I thought it would only last 1 hour plus extra time for pre/post relaxing but it did last the full 90 minutes. The masseuse was delightful and even tho' I wasn't in the slightest stressed - I left the spa feeling so much more relaxed. They have definitely got just about everything right here. The Garden Villa we were in was really amazing value for the space, privacy and quality. Some of the service was a little erratic (tho' incredibly polite and and pleasant) and maybe a little more training needs to be done re the wine pourers (we had to wrestle the red wine off a waiter who wanted to put it in the wine chiller with the water!). But I must stress these are very minor points. ( My only other niggle was the cereal spoons at breakfast which were very trendy but not very practical for putting in your mouth and extracting food from them!) To sum up - I would happily go back to BT and would certainly have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. I am so glad we stayed there. It was delightful

Reviews.Title: “Perfection- could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: johnny820
Reviews.Content: OK, so I generally don't like to write reviews after taking trips abroad, but after my spouse and I traveled to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba, we felt compelled to get on our laptops to sing the hotels praises. This place is truly one of a kind. The service is EXCEPTIONAL- topped only by the scenery. Everywhere you look, the hotel offers breathtaking views- from the natural surroundings, to the architectural details- Banyan is world class, taken to the nth degree. I would not recommend this hotel for those looking to party and have a rowdy time. It's really serene- amazingly relaxing, and you can't help but feel a sense of overwhelming calm when you are here. The staff are all incredibly kind, and will go out of their way to help you. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, the folks here will jump through hoops to make your stay memorable. I have to say that after my stay, I went online to see where the other Banyan Tree locations were. Whoever oversees this hotel chain is definitely doing something right

Reviews.Title: “I am expecting it to be the best in Mexico if not America”
Reviews.Author: Yzigarza
Reviews.Content: I just couldn't label it diferently, its the best i've ever been... I had all ready stayed in a Banyan tree in Bangkok so i knew the chain but this was not even close to my expectations... the first thing i realized was that the pictures in the web site do no justice to the Resort, i was staying in the smallest room (garden pool Villa) and is worth mentioning the humongous size of the villa, you go in through one door to enter a small garden with your own private pool (right outside your bedroom window, so we just jumped in every morning). at the right side you had a small terrace in which you could spend time reading in your own private villa, and to the left was the room, as you walked in, you could see the 6 meter tall (19 feet) bedroom with a beautiful head rest for the bed made all of wood with metal finishes, in front and to the left of the bed you have a full size window which conect to the private pool... to the other side of the room you have the bathroom with anotehr private hot tub, this is closed and private but open air again... the resto of the hotel is absolutely wonderfull the architecthure has some very interesting asian touch but with a contemporary influence, very interesting indeed.. and as other of the reviews said our only problem was the food... every restaurant has different kind of food but absolutely everything is very "gourmet" and for some reason we like eating more regular food (like a regular cheese burger, or a hot dog or something) but they serve mainly very exotic and gourmet meals... the breakfast was the absolute best by very much (if you go ask for they to be included is the best!!!) we ate breakfast everyday and enjoyed it very very much, this was a very extense experience with noodles and other food they serve in asia but they also have a lot of american an mexican dishes which can be prepared at the moment... my final decision you have to go at least once... even if its to expensive go there im sure you will enjoy it Rg...

Reviews.Title: “Heaven In Riveria Maya”
Reviews.Author: sherber22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip to Banyan Tree to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and OMG - it was the most amazing place we have ever been. We love to travel and stay at different hotels and this was by far the nicest. The service is what stood out the most. Housekeeping/restaurant staff/bar and pool staff were ALWAYS available to assist you with whatever you needed. A Special thanks to Jorge - he was my BEST friend by the pools and every time we would turn around, someone was handing us a cold wet towel or a little treat!! Can not wait to go back - our private little sanctuary in Mexico.........

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for absolute perfection in every detail, look no further than Banyan Tree Mayakoba”
Reviews.Author: IslaIxchel
Reviews.Content: What can I possibly say that would do this slice of heaven justice? Sounding too effusive is going to be my problem, but I assure you, every word is earned and justified. My husband and I travel the world looking for incredible experiences, and we found the best one right in our backyard. We live in Isla Mujeres, a quick trip up the coast, and go to Banyan Tree for every "special occasion" we can rightfully drum up. From the instant you enter the Mayakoba complex, you know that you have landed on a special planet. The rest of the world simply melts away. Winding along an elaborately gorgeous cobblestone road through dense jungle, you glimpse occasional slices of a blinding green golf course meandering softly towards the oceanfront: golfers will be beside themselves. Pulling up to the front of Banyan Tree is a magical experience within itself: I must stress that the staff of this hotel is beyond amazing, unlike any we have ever encountered. Not dutiful, but instead full of personality, individuality, class and warmth. Friendly smiles walk you inside to a view that will take your breath away: an open lobby complex feels more like the (large and crazy) home of your dreams, finished to perfection with sculpture and tastefully appointed furniture which is straight-up Architectural Digest-meets-the-Yucatan, mosaic-tile floors, soft perfect music (often a live acoustic trio), and an African Queen-inspired electric boat waiting to whisk you to your villa. Oh, the villas..... we have stayed in both 301 and 702. Try to reserve one with a pavilion, which is like an unattached den, connected to the main bedroom by a covered walkway, divided by the pool. The rooms.... WOW. Floor-to-ceiling windows overlook your private pool and exotic private garden. Sliding doors from your bedroom lead you right into the pool. Slate floors are warmed by thick, comfy tibetan wool runners. The bathroom, arranged in a circular formation, features a steam shower, his-and-hers vanities divided by a giant round mirror, a tiled outdoor bathtub backed by a wall of candles (lit for you, of course, magically by the invisible staff when you go to dinner), and yummy toiletries. I am a big sound/smell girl, and two of my favorite aspects of the rooms are the house CDs (four of them) which are playing softly every time you enter the room (there are also three iPod docks), and the zen-like combo of Banyan Tree's incense and essential oil lamps (they are always sold out at the gift shop if that tells you anything). Every last detail has been thought through in the rooms. When you can manage the heartbreak of leaving your room, hop on your bicycle and meander to the beach, for a truly luxurious (but always down-to-earth and warm) treatment at the beach club. Order the grouper ceviche and shrimp tacos along with whatever kind of exotic cocktail they've dreamed up that day. The restaurants at Banyan Tree do not disappoint: they combine a harmonious marriage of Yucatan cuisine and Thai/asian yumminess. Definitely eat at Saffron, and - as tacky as this may sound - bring your camera to take pictures of the breakfast spread in the main pavilion, as no one will ever believe you if you try to describe it. More about the staff: they remember us when we return, they sit down and converse with us, and they TRULY LOVE their jobs. Every last one of them says something to the effect of, "working here is not like work." Whoever hires the staff here is a genius at choosing people who are at once attentive and laid-back in the most complimentary, perfect sense. Last time we arrived by helicopter and landed on the beach without telling anyone we were going to do it. It caused quite a scene, but one of bemusement and heartfelt welcome, as if they see that kind of thing daily. I just about cry every time I leave Banyan Tree. Every time we leave we are plotting our next trip. I am in love with this place like no other. A few other cosas: - this is, in spite of being ridiculously romantic, quite a nice place to bring kids. The layout of villas and public space is so private, you can hear a pin drop. But we are planning to bring our son soon, as it is extremely welcoming to families. - the staff all knew that it was our anniversary on our last visit and never ceased to surprise us with rose-petal greetings on our bed, complimentary desserts, and well-wishes - if you are after extreme privacy, this is your place. If I were the most famous celebrity, this is where I would escape. People here are cool and respectful. -the spa is simply world-class. They are #1 in the world. Be sure to find out why. It's too much to try to explain in words. This is my love letter to my favorite hotel. Nothing is left to say. Go, go, go. There is nowhere else that can compare to Banyan Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Simply marvelous”
Reviews.Author: Jazzjourney
Reviews.Content: We spent an all too quick 5 day vacation at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Driving down in a rush from the airport in Cancun we were welcomed to the hotel with cool towels and a refreshing juice to start our stay. Immediately you could feel the stress leave your body. The rooms are actually 3100+ sq ft villas that contain a private garden with your own infinity pool, shaded and unshaded lounge areas and a table and chairs which in our case overlooked a lagoon. Inside you were greeted to a large bedroom with 20 ft ceilings, large walk in closet and bathroom complex. Opening out from there was a private outdoor soaking tub bordered by a wall with recessed candles that could be lit for nighttime bathing, a definite must do experience. Dining was wonderful. The breakfast buffet which was included in our stay is like nothing I've ever seen. Choices were endless and ranged from fresh papaya to chocolate croissants to sushi and everything that you could imagine in between. Dinner is available at several restaurants. We dined at the Tamarind which is billed as International/Mediterranean. Service as in the entire resort was impeccable. Friendly and efficient without being intrusive. I had a Mayan tasting which was delicious. Be forewarned though, dinner is expensive. We spent $160 for two with only 1 glass of wine a piece! The other nights we went to Playa del Carmen, about a 15 minute drive, and had excellent meals in the range of $40-70 US a couple. The spa treatments are to die for! A 90 minute massage was included in our package and we decided to spring for another one. The "basic" Thai massage is a 90 minute affair given by a master Thai masseuse. It starts with a foot bath followed by a top to bottom massage and ends with fragrant tea and fruits. There is a whole range of spa services including a 3 hour ayurvedic massage. We played golf on premises. El Camaleon is an 18 hole PGA championship golf course that winds through the Mayakoba complex which includes the Banyan Tree, Rosewood and Fairmont hotels. Stunning vistas of the ocean, lagoons and mangrove preserves abound. There is even a cenote (water filled limestone cave) on the course! The course itself is challenging but fair but again is expensive ($250/round). However if you play in the afternoon as we did, twilight rates are reasonable. The beach was about a 10 minute bike (they provide bikes at no charge), 15-20 minute walk and about 20-30 water taxi ride on the lagoon from our villa. As you would expect, it is a sugar sand strip (but not very wide) which you can walk on for several miles in either direction. The beach club area has a nice pool, restaurant and again wonderful service. They cover your chairs on arrival and provide bottled water and occasionally little treats (like watermelon sherbet) free of charge. The pool area is right next to the beach. As others have said already, the service is the star of this hotel. Nonetheless, the view (especially the oriental architecture and stunning lines), the fragrances (aromas abound) and all of the amenities offered make this a truly one of a kind hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Chuckus1
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 3 friends to celebrate a 40th birthday at the Banyan Tree. It was an amazing experience. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff rivaled resorts in Bali and the Maldives. No one was ever grumpy or unhelpful. This ranges from the buggy drivers, food/beverage outlets, spa and front desk. The food too is very good. We ate at Oriente for breakfast, Sands for lunch and Tamarind and Saffron for dinner. All were 5 star food and service. The villa was beyond first class. We had a three bedroom terrace residence and it was very spacious with every amenity possible. I did have trouble with the wireless and they tried to fix it, and though they did not succeed, could not have tried harder. If you have young kids though I would watch out. This place is not really for them and with all the pools and canals I would be concerned for their safety. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection--Service and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: CelestialTraveler212
Reviews.Content: This was simply the most beautiful and welcoming beach resort I've ever had the pleasure to stay at. It is the ultimate in refined elegance and service is so gracious and sincere. The beach club is stunning and offers the lovliest place to sunbathe and swim in the sea, relax and order a margarita or lunch delivered right to you on the beach. The other resort pool is equally gorgeous--beautiful tropical birds live in the trees that surround it. It's a tough choice to decide where you want to swim: in your own private villa pool (!), or the ocean, or one of the resort pools... The garden villa we had was spectacular--romantic with a perfect blend of Asian and Mexican aesthetics. I appreciated that wireless internet was included. Turndown service every night was a lovely component to our stay. The food was also a strong point. We ate at the Saffron Restaurant and had truly spectaular (though very pricey) Thai food. The morning buffet was also a delicious, beautiful spread and it offered different choices daily. If you want to be a little more active, request the use of a couple of bicycles and then ride around the resort grounds--it's a great alternative to the use of the buggies they typically use to ferry you between the different parts of the resort, though those were at the ready immediately whenever we requested them. We chose to eat dinner one night at the Fairmont next door and one night at the Rosewood. This was easily arranged by the hotel and they even let us charge the meals back to our room at Banyan Tree. I recommend doing this, if you want to see the other resorts and eat at a variety of places. Food and drinks are very expensive at the resort, so plan accordingly. But the amenities are fantastic and if you're looking for a really romantic (few kids), secluded (we felt like we had not just our villa, but entire parts of the resort to ourselves), relaxing spot with top-notch service and a beautiful beach, this is IT.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: lucky13miami
Reviews.Content: We had such a good time in this amazing hotel located in the beautiful Mayakoba reserve in the Riviera Maya.....The hotel was mostly for ourselves, we were a group of 23 people. The staff was very courteous, friendly and polite ALL the time. The breakfast is amazing...healthy, delicious, with lots of alternatives, including some mexican specialties. The spa its soooooooo beautiful..It has the rainforest area which I would recommend to visit and enjoy.The therapists are mostly from Thailand, which makes the experience something different. (It's not the typical swedish massage...it has an oriental touch...) The rooms are soooooooo beautiful that you don't want to get out of there. Each villa has its own spacious pool and that's a feature I believe no other hotel in this area has. The rooms are also well equiped and super clean. We had dinner in their signature restaurant Saffron. Their Thai menu its delicious, my compliments to the chefs. Also the food in the beach club Sands is really good. Our special thanks to Yvonne, Cynthia, Ian, and all the staff at Sands (they were all very special to us...) Overall an unforgettable experience...would go back TOMORROW if I could...Of course I'll go back to this hotel, hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “the most magical place ever”
Reviews.Author: kikislc
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review, but the whole reason i signed up for traveladvisor was so that I could write a review for Banyan Tree Mayakoba. I don't know how I can put into words what an amazing experience we had at the Banyan Tree. I have traveled a lot throughout Europe & Asia and have never experienced anything quite like this. The resort itself is amazing. The villa, private pools, outdoor bathtubs. I could go on & on. However the thing that sets this resort apart from all others is the staff!!! Oftentimes I think we become so jaded with bad customer service that if someone even does their job we're surprised. At Banyan Tree, the staff obviously took pride in their job and was happy to help you with anything. It's almost like they anticipated your needs. Claudia & Ligia in guest services were incredible. My husband needed to get a prescription filled and somehow they found the medication & magically had it delivered to our room. I could go on and on about this resort. Just know that paradise is a short flight away. You'll think you're staying at some magical, luxurious resort in Thailand. Not that I don't love Mexico, but honestly a few times I forgot I was in Mexico and not Thailand! I got misty eyed when we had to leave. It's not just a vacation, it's an experience! Thank you to everyone at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba for making our stay unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: KPlex11
Reviews.Content: WOW! I am in the hotel business and have travelled quite a bit staying at some of the best five star hotels in the world but this one takes the cake. When I say AMAZING it is an understatement. The resort is breathtaking and the level of service is something I have never experienced before..absolutely phenomenol. If there is one hotel you want to visit its definitely this one! You won't be dissapointed. We had plans to leave the resort and do several activities but we just could not bring ourselves to do so as the resort is so nice and we did not want to leave. As it is still new I can bet in the coming months we will hear a lot more about it as word gets out. I wouldn't doubt it if it comes to be ranked the top resort in north america!

Reviews.Title: “It does NOT get any better than this. Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: VandenAvond
Reviews.Content: I have been at the best resorts in the world, and this by far was the most superior. In fact, nothing else even gets close. I had read all the reviews and was very excited to visit, however, I had such high expectations that I was almost afraid that I would be disappointed. We could not have been more in awe. My husband and I are big golfers and we brought our clubs to golf at Mayakoba. They never saw the light of day. We fell so in love with our villa that we never wanted to leave. Other than breakfast and dinner, we were in our villa ALL day. We stayed in a spa villa and I cannot even begin to describe how amazing it was. The pool was huge and the jacuzzi was great and used every night. The architects of this truly special and unique place thought of everything. Even down to the exact angles of the layout of the villas. We spent a lot of time not completely clothed and there was no way that the villas beside us could see us. Other than the periodic boat going by, it was so secluded. And the natural surrounding beauty was breathtaking. The bedroom, bathroom, outside showers (2), outside bathtub, steam room and extra living room villa could not have been any more elegant. They literally thought of everything. From the i-phone/pod players, incense, coffee maker, tea, fabulous lighting both inside and out, fresh fruit, fresh flowers, etc., I could keep going forever. The food was amazing. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic and HUGE. Anything you could ever want is there. And they change it every day. We had dinner at Safron which was excellent. We also tried the BBQ by the pool and that was great as well. When we did venture out we used the bikes and had a great time. It was such a unique offering they provided. We loved it. It was a great way to see the beautiful surroundings/landscaping of the resort. I saved the best for last - The service was impecible. They MAKE SURE that you have everything you need or want. Every employee that we dealt with went out of their way for us. It was my birthday and they gave me the most beautiful roses and brought me a beautiful b-day cake that looked so beautiful I didn't want to eat it. The massages my husband and I had were over the top. Never had a better massage anywhere in the world. What makes a 5 star hotel really stand out, are the little things. The Banyan Tree has it down. Accomodations, food and service is perfection at it's best. It truly doesn't get any better than this. It is not possible to be disappointed in this amazing resort. If anyone has any questions I would be happy to answer any additional questions. Feel free to email me at: vandenavond1@comcast.net

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LTE
Reviews.Content: We have found an excellent and well-developed Luxury Resort Concept from South East Asia delivered through remarkably warm hearted / friendly staff in Mexico. We were impressed with the eco-friendly overall concept of Mayakoba and specifically at the Banyan Tree. We very much liked the breath-taking resort architecture including the spacious villa layout with every villa having a private pool. We found excellent Thai and Mexican cuisine with a great sortiment of wines as well as passionate restaurant staff and chefs definately making our stay unforgettable. It is very rare, but we experienced that literally every member of staff naturally possessed and displayed a great deal of warmth and provided an exceptionally high level of customer focus and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in the Americas”
Reviews.Author: alelaumac
Reviews.Content: The service is perfect, the villas are perfect, dinner at Saffron was perfect (thanks Chef Omar), amazing that a 100 plus villa resort can feel like a luxury boutique hotel. Everybody does a great job to make this resort the best in Mexico and the Americas. Can´t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "WOW!"”
Reviews.Author: tellat
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations for this resort based on all the wonderful reviews I had read, but this property surpassed them all! I think the most outstanding feature is the service; the staff here truly does treat you like royalty. Any wish or desire is instantly and cheerfully fulfilled. Everything here is absolutely first-rate, from the villas to the food to the beach itself. I stayed in a Garden Villa and it was gorgeous; the highlights being the lovely plunge pool and the outdoor tub.If you like nature, I highly recommend the boat tour of the lagoon area. We saw many unusual birds and even a crocodile! Each restaurant is excellent and offers many unique choices. I especially enjoyed Tamarind and the fabulous service there. Although staying here was quite a splurge, I'll definitely be back (as soon as my wallet can stand the strain)!

Reviews.Title: “The Banyan Tree Mayakoba raises the bar for Beach Resorts in The Americas.”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob77
Reviews.Content: The Travel Snob has met his match. This is it my friends of the five star, the Banyan Tree Mayakoba is a stunning resort in every way. Like other reviewers let me urge you to get the Half Off Best of the BTMK while you still can. Its is the best travel deal going and the word is getting out. After 5 glorious days I can tell you I'll be happy just to get a reservation in the future. I think of myself as a critical reviewer as I believe vacation time is a precious thing and we deerve the best at leisure time.....we are paying for it after all. But, its hard to not to gush as others have about this amazing resort. I've attached pictures of the villa, which is the most amazing thing about BTMK, but her goes: For those of us who don't get a chance to travel to Asia to experience some of these amazing resorts, I think the Banyan Tree and hopefully the Viceroy; coming next door at this location on the Mexican Riveiera, will raise the bar to this level of accomodation. Accomodations: Stayed 2 nights in a Courtyard Pool Villa and 2 nights in a Spa Villa. The villa: Sick. The website and review don't do justice the size. I saw them all. Even the Garden Villa has the same size pool.... The asian design assures privacy, the lighting inside and outside is sleek, there's a lot of room: in the seperate dining area w/flat screen there's a large lounge couch....outside two large plushy beach beds and an outdoor dining table. I would probably not recommend this vacation solo....the villa is made for romance, At night the pool, jacuzzi--a well made one with multiple jets mind you--and entire villa light up. You have an outdoor sunken tub with a wall of candles, and in the Spa Villa's- outdoor showers--one below next to the tub and upstairs. The only difference between Spa and Courtyard is there's an upstairs --a Spa station upstairs for a private massage, a steam shower downstairs--the bathroom is slightly smaller in the Spa Villa btw. The summer months a private message would have to be done very early or late in the day...cause you'll fry. So, I say the Courtyard Villa--which is part of the Best Of BTMK special...even better! The bathroom is huge, the shower is huge, and the bedroom opens up to the outside so you can step right into the pool. The Bed is superplush--heavenly bed plus! 42 in. flatscreen and decent cable. Music is everywhere though--all rooms have I pod-CD players--a great touch. I believe they are using there own brand of soaps....incenses and cintronella burners are also in all rooms and are luxirously created by the Banyan Tree brand. You get your own Illy cappacino maker and tea service with Forte' teas. The amenities are just tremendous...part of what makes this a Five Star. ---------- Dining I fell in love with Saffron. True Thai, done gourmet. I live in Denver Colorado and love Thai--nuff said. This is Banyan Tree's Signature restarurant at all or most resorts. Its devine. Everything is so fresh and bold. Also part of the "best deal" A beautiful looking restaurant as well...with dining inside and out--Romantic lighting everywhere. We were outside both times. Absolutely top notch service--as much as you want-as little as you want. The restaurant overlooks the lagoon. The breakfast buffet--I overhead another guest say this and I agree: " Very similar to the full on buffet you see at The Wynn in Vegas--of The Four in Maui ." We had room service from Saffron--took about 15 min extra--still awesome. Lunch at The Beach, and regular room service. Killer cheesburger! And yeah, its like $26..but oh did I mention most of the dining and services are pricey--but c'mon you really have to expect it. I did not go to Tamarind at the main building. For the wine lover. A fully stocked cellar--you can bring your own and have it stored I imagine-- Beach/Pool Unique free form lagoon type pool with the latest craze in pools. The sun area ledge--tan faster! A sexy pool with deck chairs arranged at different levels for more privacy. Its very large and acoompanied by a smaller lagoon pool for families or just sunning mainly. The Beach Club is Cool-- Also spread out very nicely with a good size pool beyond the dining area---then down to Mexican Riviera--I've been to many spots around the beaches on Playa and this is nice soft sand area--the ocean can still be a little rough at time, but the service and beach cabana's or lounge chairs on the beach are first class. Did not see any solicitors on the beach....only a few jet ski's lookin for riders. Spa We did the Rain forest and if you're a water lover and you have a companion do this! Relaxing, invogorating different water showers, steam. sauna and mud. It all ends up with a large pool with powerful jacuzzi's a water neck message and water jacuzzi bed. Just another special amenitiy that makes BTMK that much better. We did not do the message. Workout room/Business Center: top of the line machines for jogging, stepping, lifting. Free weights, all the extras you'd expect--towels, water a plenty, fruit. Air condidtioned properly. Computers that work, printers, faxes--private and comfortable if you need em. Other Aesthetics and comments: For us travel buffs who've read about Banyan Tree resorts for years but did not have the time or resources to get to Asia this was a real special vacation. The archetecture, use of lighting, the landscaping--The Golf Course was amazing--I did not play it, but will next time. This is finest resort I've ever been to in my life for a romantic vacation for two. The service is 5-star--this staff is top notch--friendly, not imposing, professional and accomodating. The BTMK is large---much larger than I thought and you can call for a buggy or get a bicycle---thats a nice touch--you ride your bike to the pool or beach... If I had to be Super Critical and look for something that you might not dig about the Banyan Tree I would have to say if you were looking for an "on the beach resort." Like Pink Sands in the Bahamas, you may not love the view from your room. The layout of your room maximizes privacy so you can't have it both ways to get these super incredible rooms. The Lagoon itself adds to the aesthetics of the resort, and a boat can take you around the resort, but its au natural and isn't a Disney moat-- It can be a little buggy--I've read the bug comments--but just as you might say this resort is too pricey--remember where you are --on both accounts. My Spanish isn't up to par and I did occasionally not communicate clearly enough--They are trained to deal mostly with us Americans--are we a tad more impatient? :) But, I would say knowing some Spanish in Mexico--duh. I believe the resort was at around 20% capacity. We had the Beach Pool, Lagoon Pool, and Rainforest all to ourselves. That just added to the experience for us. The economy and H1N1 scare our giving us a rare opportunity to get to BTMK at a deal before the rest of the America's finds out. If your discimnating about the best--this truly is. In over 50 reviews: This is my first and only Five Star reccomendation. Salute!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: rizadorojo
Reviews.Content: Though there are hundreds of hotels from Cancun to Tulum along the Mayan Riviera, this hotel is outstanding, the best of the best. The Banyan Tree Mayakoba is the first western hotel of this Asian group. It combines the best of Asia and Mexico in its decor, food, and hospitality. Our large, private villa included a high-ceilinged bedroom, a large light-filled bathroom, a walk-in closet. The usual amenities are available plus an espresso machine and fresh milk, mosquito spray, incense, candles. In addition, we had an outdoor bathtub and our own swimming pool. The room was cleaned twice a day. Each evening the staff left a small gift. From the moment we arrived, the staff was helpful, attentive, and generous. Every staff member we met smiled and introduced him/herself and called us by name. They truly cannot do enough for you. The grounds are large and bikes are available for recreation and transportation. In addition, there are staff to chauffeur you in golf carts. Call and they arrive within minutes. The hotel has a lagoon running through the grounds. You can take a boat along the lagoon to the beach. Twice weekly, you can take this boat with an expert for a tour to learn about the birds, animals, and plants on the hotel grounds. The beach is pristine. Staff will make up the lounges with fresh towels, bring you cold cloths, and take your food and drink orders. They are attentive, but not intrusive. The spa is beautiful, with treatment rooms built over the lagoon. The Rainforest Treatment is unlike anything I've seen anywhere in my travels. Both Saffron Restaurant (Thai cuisine with chefs brought from Phuket) and Tamarind Restaurant (Mediterranean Mexican) are excellent with service to match. The breakfast runs until noon (wonderful for us late sleepers) and includes a complete egg menu plus a buffet of fresh fruits and juices, baked goods, cheeses, cold cuts, and Asian and Mexican hot dishes--congee to chilaquiles. Every morning there were new choices. When I enquired about the recipe for one of the sauces, I was introduced to the chef and taken on a tour of the kitchen, given the recipe, and on my last day, given some of the sauce to take home! Generous indeed!

Reviews.Title: “The staff takes this romantic resort above & beyond 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: alex_NYC_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a wonderful stay at the Banyan Tree. We booked a Spa Villa- room 702, which had a wonderful view of the mangroves and blew away our expectations. The room was impeccably clean each day, with spa scents from lotions, soaps & incense left in your rooms relaxing you each time you walk in the door. Your entire bedroom has floor to ceiling window that open up into the pool on both sides. In the morning you can hear the birds chirping- I kept forgetting I was in mexico as it really reminded us of our trips to Bali. After staying at many high end resorts all over the world (including aman, four seasons), we were stunned by the level of service. The service at Bayan tree made Four Seasons service look like that of the Holiday Inn. While the resort itself is flawless-what made our experience is the staff. Never before had we had such attentive personal service. Obviously the manager has hired individuals at the top of their profession & I would encourage guests to get to know these wonderful people during your stay. The staff made our experience what it was. Our personal hosts- Yurita & Guadalupe (Maria) greated us on arrival & followed up on our experiences/needs each day (and night). These hosts were so gracious and attentive, handling our every wish and any issues we had encountered. My husband lost a small bag at the airport, they called found it and had it waiting for us on our return- and even offered to have it sent to the hotel. We lost one of our bikes, they had another sent to our room immediately. We didn't have to ask for a buggy to be sent to our villa prior to each of our touring departures. It seemed like every concern we could have had was already thought of and addressed without our asking. The food- was far superior to other resorts we have stayed. Breakfast every morning is included and was incredible. It is served in the Oriente restaurant- the manager otto greeted us everymorning & noted our likes/dislikes. They offer mexican foods, thai foods, sushi, a variety of fruits, grains, pastries, eggs, juices. The servers are attentive & flawless. Thanks to the manager Otto- who subtlely noticed our preverences and often brought special things to table for us to try. My husband and I sadly miss our relaxing morning breakfasts, reading the paper, overlooking the banyan tree pool. Saffron is excellent (we ate there twice and is the hotel's signature restaurant). I recommend the soups (coconut chicken soup) & the chilean sea bass. It is pricey, but if you share smaller things is reasonable. The sometimes overlooked mediterranean restaurant Tamarind is a must. Fernando (chef) and Fernando (waiter) created a lovely dinner for us- a must try is the mushroom ravioli & rack of lamb. Musicians played music during our dinner. Many guests don't go to Tamarind because they want mexican or thai- but this is a hidden gem at Banyan tree and chef Fernando needs a bigger audience! They also so offer some mayan quisine on the menu. Prior to dinner each night, I would highly recommend having drinks at La Copa while the sun sets. It has a beautiful view overlooking the resort and the stars. Javier and Maricel took good care of us, sometimes bringing up small things from chef (creative appetizers). Lovely people, lovely conversation. Two of the nicest & attentive people I have met. We spent several days at the beach pool (Sands) where Jorge (pool manager) & Manuel greated us when we walked in & took care of us. Each time when we got out of the pool we found the towels on our chairs were refreshed. The staff frequently offers small complementary apptetizers/drinks from the chef or bar. Jorge and Manuel worked non-stop and maintained this level of attentiveness even when the resort was very busy toward the end of our stay. Little things they noticed- like once my bike was a little wobbly- they heard me telling my husband and told me they were going to get me a new bike. They were incredible. Top notch. It is a must to get to know both of these people if you head to Sands. Thank you Jorge & Manuel. My husband and I did a lot of diving during our week stay- we would recommend Dive Mexico- which handled our dives in playa del carmen, cozumel, and to the cenotes. Our highlight was the cenotes dives, which were beyond our expectations. Another must is the whale shark snorkling. The negatives: while they were few- here were a few things we did note. First- the resort needs an ATM (for getting into playa del carmen or tipping). Second- the food is sometimes a little high priced. I expect as the resort reaches higher capacity they will offer some lower priced items on their menus. I hope this review was helpful- the other reviews of the rooms & resort were dead on as far as the quality of the rooms & service. This resort is very romantic- perfect for a weekend getaway. If you love asia & bali- it will bring you there without the distance. Thanks again to the entire staff- even the people who remained namelss as they kept up the resort. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree Mayakoba- the new FS Hualalai???”
Reviews.Author: DNMJJ
Reviews.Content: Many experienced luxury vacationers and travel publications routinely rank Four Seasons Hualalai as North America's premier beach resort for good reason; it's fabulous! Don't be surpised though in the coming months to learn a hotelier new to North America, Banyan Tree, has risen to become the pinnacle property in the Americas and Carribean with the opening of Banyan Tree Mayakoba. Our recent 15 day vacation included 11 nights at Banyan Tree and 4 nights at Rosewood. Rosewood is very nice, but we shortend our stay there as my wife and kids (ages 6 and 3) could not wait to get back to Banyan Tree. The service of every staff member from arrival to departure was friendly, courteous, and professional. Our resort host, Ana, ensured every wish was accounted for in a curated manner. Adrian, the boat captain, is emblematic of a gracious Mexican host. Eduardo, the recreation manager, I'm sure will be invited to my daughter's wedding in twenty or so years. The food was very good, especially at the signature restaurant Saffron. Chef Prasong and manager Sompong made each of our eight dinners memorable. Roberto and Alberto provided service with pleasure each evening and host Maria was a wonderful companion for our kids when their patience ran out. Prasong has two young children as well and prepared child-friendly meals each night that our kids loved. The spa features Thai therapists from Banyan Tree Phuket who are alone worth the vist to Mayakoba. Many of the beautiful treatment rooms are located over the lagoon and are wonderful settings. We highly recommend the Classic Thai and Balinese massages. The villas are among the finest we have had the opportunity to experience. Our first five nights were in a very private lagoon view two bedroom villa that had a 500sf pool, hot tub, and detached air conditioned living/dining pavilion. The rooms are well appointed, generous, and feature a bath with an enclosed outdoor asian garden with shower and soaking tub. The second six nights we enjoyed a three bedroom beach front villa. This was similar to the two bedroom villa with an addtional bedroom suite attached to the pavilion, and provided an incredible view of the azure sea. When we departed, Ana, Ed the suave F/B manager, our bell friends, and General Manger Pancho Llamas all were there to waive goodbye. Before we left the eco-friendly Mayakoba property we were already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “I would visit again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: pikachuta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the BT Mayakoba for four nights & upgraded ourselves from the Garden Villa to the Courtyard Villa. We could not be more pleased with our decision. The bedroom and bathroom is in one pavilion, while the living area is in the other pavilion with a courtyard/pool/spa/garden that separates the two pavilions. We truly enjoy the fact that each villa has it's own privacy. Even though it's facing the lagoon and we have an unobstructed view of the mangroves, we got used to walking around in our birthday suite without fearing that anyone else will see us. jSorry for the mental image, believe me, you'll be tempted to do the same thing! Having the luxury of swimming at any hour in the privacy of our own villa is priceless. We also enjoyed free wi-fi and the free bike rentals (highly recommend). Each morning we would bike around the complex, to the beach and around the golf course to work up an appetite for the free daily buffet. Occupancy was only around 30% and we definitely felt that the resort's staffs out-numbered the guests. Bottom line, we felt we were being treated as royalties, staffs greeted us by name. I would come back in a heartbeat! Here are some other tips/advise: Transportation - This is our 3rd time in the area, having a rental is really the best way to go. We rented form Avis + full insurance coverage + pre-paid gas for around $ 40 a day. Driving in Mexico is not that bad. Unlike Hawaii, Mexico is not known for car thefts, but as with any tourist destination, you don't want to leave valuables in the car. Getting to the resort from the airport - the resort is off the main highway about 30 minutes south of the airport. The resort is south of the "Tres Rios" and "Mandarin Oriental" resort. So if youa re seeing signs for these two, you are less than a minute away. If you see the "Grand Velas resort," you've gone too far. And if that's the case, just find the next "retorno" and do a U turn. You'll see a big "Mayakoba Golf Course" sign on your right, and on your immediate left, you'll see a grand entrance with shiny big sign that says "Mayakoba." Turn left to enter the gate. Please note - you will not see a sign for Banyan tree until you've made a left passed the gate. Mayakoba has 3 other resorts (BT, Fairmont & Rosewood) all sharing the same grand entrance. Once you've passed the gate, follow signs to BT on a small tree-lined one lane road (5mph), it'll take you 5 minutes to get to the hotel lobby from the gate. Security is tight. Check in - You are assigned a hostess that will greet you, offer you cold towels, welcome drink and so forth. Your hostess will escort you in a golf cart directly into your villa to continue with the check in process. I really like not having to wait in line behind some jerk who leans over the counter & takes his time with too many questions. Sounds familiar? I love how we bypassed all that non-sense. Restaurants - The daily buffet is complimentary and we were NOT disappointed. Since it's complimentary, we thought it would be continental breakfast, but it was not. See my pictures, it's a full buffet. There is an egg station, cooked food station, salad/cheese station, fruit area, and pastries. The selection was very good. We also dined at Saffron, which was very expensive and since we are Asians living in LA and have traveled to Thailand, we thought Saffron was not authentic and overly priced. But it's what we expected anyways. With that said, we did enjoyed the dining experience. We did most of our dining in the Playa del Carmen & Cancun area. We asked the hotel staffs for places that "they go to," not places for tourists. Ecological boat tour - since the resort is located on a lagoon, the resort offers free boat tours around the lagoon. It'll show you the different types of vegetations, you'll go through mangroves, be able to see the other resorts (Rosewood, Fairmont...) and your guide will point out different birds/animals along the way. Please note - we intended on doing this tour on our last day, but was very disappointed to find out that the tours do not operate daily. So if you are interested in doing this (I don't know if it's free), please be sure you check out the schedule. Currently, we were told it's only Tues/Thurs. 90 Minute massage - I had this done my last day. It's really a 60 minute massage, and the other 30 minutes is check in, walking to the treatment room, drinking tea, selecting music & incense. Unlike other spas, you do not need to arrive early to enjoy the steam/sauna/jacuzzi. Those are NOT included in your complimentary 90 minute massage. If you want to use those facilities, you'll need to purchase it as an add on, or purchase other packages that includes the use of those facilities. I was a little disappointed with that since I was under the impression that I'll spend about 2 to 3 hours pampering myself. Other guests - Because the hotel was only about 30% occupied, and each villa has it's own pool, we really felt like we were the only guests at the hotel. The only time we ran into other guests were during breakfast. Most guests would be around 30s and 40s, mainly couples. We didn't run into noisy children or crying babies (Yay!). Overall - book this hotel if you are considering. I did a lot of research between Mandarin Oriental, Fairmont and Rosewood. I also emailed other travelers who has been to some of these resorts and concluded that BT was the place to blow our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a great 2 night stay at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. We stayed under the Best of the Banyan Tree rate – an amazing deal if you can get it. After reading the other reviews at trip advisor, we upgraded to a spa room villa. We never toured the courtyard villa but were blown away by the space, the beauty and the luxury of our Spa Villa--number 706. We did not rent a car and took the cadillac escallade transfer option and were very glad we did. Security at the hotel is very tight. We stayed at the Rosewood Mayakoba last year and there is much more security present at the Banyan Tree. When we arrived, we were taken to our room – pretty and spacious. The courtyard houses a pool and Jacuzzi along with two separate pavilions – the king bedroom and large bathroom with outdoor tub on the left, and a separate eating/lounging pavilion on the right. We were traveling alone, but the separate pavilion seems like an large enough for a child traveling. There’s also a large deck upstairs with an outdoor shower, sink, couch and two massage tables. The deck is somewhat covered by a slanted roof of large twigs, but it does not have enough coverage to block out the sun and heat present most of the day. I had a massage included in the package, but was encouraged to take my treatment in the spa due to the heat/sun. There are 8 spa villas, all completely private facing only a body of water so you can walk around in the buff. All 8 Spa Villas are much the same but 701 has a view of the golf course (And the players may have view of you!) NIght time star gazing is possible off the rooftop deck of the Spa Villa and this feature alone makes the Spa VIlla a worthwhile upgrade. Bikes: The hotel will provide bicycles if you ask for them – make sure to request them as soon as you check in. We asked, but it took several phone calls and we received them by 11am the following morning--they are in demand and currently in short supply. The bikes make getting around the grounds much easier. Who wants to wait for a buggy when you can pedal to the beach in half the time? I also used the bike to get to the golf clubhouse and to the golf range. I expect the Mandarin and Rosewood will start offering bikes to their guests since this is such a popular feature of the Banyan tree property. The food: We had great food during our stay--superior to the offerings at the Rosewood Mayakoba next door. The buffet breakfasts at Oriente were plentiful and delicious. We ate our breakfast at 11:30 each morning so we could skip lunch and save room for dinners. The first night we checked in we wanted to eat light, so we ordered the tortilla soup and the Caesar salad with grilled shrimp from the in villa dining. The menu for in room dining is quite limited but we were both very happy with our selections. Dinner for two at Saffron was included in our rate and it was a set, 4 course meal. The food was some of the best Thai food I’ve ever had. The chicken dip with saffron bread was amazing, as was the thai crab cake. The dinner is served family style and we were stuffed trying to finish everything they served us. The service: When we had one small issue and it was immediately addressed by tthe resident manager Peter who took care of the problem right away and removed the charge from our bill. He also went out of his way to come find us at breakfast, to thank us for bringing the problem to his attention and to make sure we were satisfied with the results. The service at both Oriente and Saffron was friendly, very attentive and helpful. The Beach attendants are very quick to bring you towels, water, ice towels and take your drink orders. They all got to know us by name. There were plenty of beach chairs so no need to wake up early and reserve. The Spa: I had a choice of a 90 minute treatment, included in our rate. I chose the Balinese massage, which is similar to a deep tissue massage. The massage is actually a 60 minute service– the 90 minute experience includes being taken to a private room, given a foot bath while you choose the type of incense you would like during your treatment and the music you would like played. The massage was wonderful and I was able to take a shower in the room afterwards before enjoying my ginger tea, melon and carrots while looking out at the lagoon. There were two types of rooms for treatments – mine was a standard pavilion which housed two massage beds. The deluxe rooms are for scrubs and for combination treatments. The Beach: The beaches in this area are some of the prettiest in the world. We have spent a lot of time in Hawaii, Fiji and the Carribean but there’s something about the soft white sand and the warm, clear water in Playa del Carmen that keeps us coming back. The water temperature had to be in the high 80s – lovely and warmer than any of the swimming pools on the property. There is a nice pool at the beach (SANDS) and restaurant, but we never ate at that restaurant. We staked out one of the palapas on the beach and travelled between the ocean, the outdoor showers and the pool for most of our stay. Make sure to use ample sunscreen. We did and still came back a bit red, but loved every minute of being in the water. The water is definitely calmer in the morning, so we’d recommend any snorkeling trips or boating early in the day. Eduardo at the Beach Club was particularly outstanding , arranging for a tour of one of the three bedroom beach villas after we inquired about the rooms. At the Banyan Tree, the only rooms on the water are the 3 Bedroom Beach Villa. Just note that they do not have the privacy of the Spa Villas, since they are set in a semicircle around the beach view, there is not total privacy. We took a tour of the beach villa (812) and while quite lovely and spacious, we were happy with the privacy that the spa rooms had. One warning though – while I enjoyed a short tanning session without my suit, I did look up to see a boat tour slowly passing by our room! I was surprised, given that I had been told that no boats travelled by the spa rooms, but live and learn… I really wanted to stay a third night and given the 20% occupancy, the room was available but sadly the flights were not. We are already planning our next trip back and can’t wait to experience more of the wonderful service the Banyan Tree has to offer. Golf While I rarely golf while on holiday, I took the opportunity to play the back nine of the course for an after 4pm rate of 77$. It is a beautiful course with a lovely par 3 (#15) right on the water. I shot a 50 and lost 6 balls so I am cured of playing golf for awhile. Overall, the Banyan Tree Mayakoba blew away the Rosewood Mayakoba. Since it just opened in March, the staff is trying really hard to get everything right and they go the extra distance. They were extremely friendly and were never expecting any additional tips--they never had their hand out. Note: If you are determined to stay on the beach in a one bedroom Villa, the Rosewood has a great beach front 1 bedroom villa.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilbertroad3079
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights and found the Banyan Tree to be an amazing hotel. We had a courtyard pool villa and it was very spacious with a large pool and very private with plenty of room to lounge by the pool or in the shade on the day bed and hammock. The service at the Banyan Tree is what really stands out from anywhere else I have stayed in Asia, Australia and Europe. The staff did absolutely everything they could to make your stay enjoyable and were always nearby should we need anything.
