I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to get away and relax in an amazing luxury resort. A couple of other things to mention are that we both had a 3 hour spa treatment that was also amazingingly wonderful and also the private villa BBQ one night which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH EVERY PENNY**** GO BEFORE IT GOES UP”
Reviews.Author: al740739
Reviews.Content: Amazing, astounding, gorgeous hotel I’ve very limited time to write reviews but this time I’ll take the time because this place is the PLACE. If you are thinking in Playa del Carmen this is the place to go no questions asked we had a look at many of the top hotels, Mandarin, Velas, RoseWood, Fairmont etc and by far this is the best of the best in every category, service, luxury, amenities, etc the staff is open to walk the extra mile for you in any request. Is pricy yes but is worth it every single penny if you are thinking in saving 50 or 100 per night using another hotel please don’t, you won’t regret it and if you play golf you have to play this course is PGA course. Ask for the boat tour which happens at 11 am Tuesdays and Thursdays and the pampering service at sands (beach pool)

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable, Luxurious, and Amazing”
Reviews.Author: atn107
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have traveled to Playa del Carmen/Riviera Maya approximately 6 times in the last 2 years so we know this area pretty well. The last time we came here, we stayed at the Rosewood (also in the Mayakoba) and we thought it couldn't get any better. We initially thought about staying at the Rosewood again, but decided to stay at the newly opened Banyan Tree to try something different. We really didn't think it could get much better than the Rosewood - boy were we wrong. Both resorts are 5-star and you can't go wrong staying at either place, but the Banyan Tree is just a step above. The villas - One of the main differences between the villas at the Rosewood and the Banyan Tree are the private pools that accompany each villa. The pool at the Rosewood is small and is not that inviting. The private pool with our villa was a HUGE endless pool that was surrounded by beautiful landscaping and several lounging areas. Some of the villas come with a hot tub which I would highly recommend you upgrade to. It's just nice to come home from dinner or a day at the beach and soak in the hot tub. The food at the Banyan Tree is excellent. The main restaurant, called Saffron, serves Thai food and they have actually staffed world class chefs, restaurant managers, waitresses from Thailand so it feels like a truly authentic experience. The restaurant itself is so beautiful and romantic. There are 3 main seating areas, 2 outdoor and 1 indoor if you would rather sit in air conditioning. I recommend sitting outdoor overtop the lagoon. It just creates an unforgettable dining experience. We couldn't get enough of the food from Tamarind, the hotel's other main restaurant. Our first night there, we had the pleasure of meeting Christian Roth, the Food and Beverage director of Tamarind and the hotel bar, La Copa. He set up a special tasting menu for us with fantastic wines from Mexico. We rated it as one of the top meals we have ever had (almost better than Laserre in Paris!). We loved it so much that we even had dinner at Tamarind a second night with Christian. We had friends in town so he set up a beautiful dinner for us in their private banquet room called La Cava (where they served the president of Mexico when he attended the opening of the hotel) which is room where they also store their wines. We were treated with a brand new tasting menu with specially selected wines from Christian. Needless to say, it was amazing! Spa - The spa at Rosewood doesn't even compare to the spa at the Banyan Tree. And before the Rosewood, I didn't think I could ever find a nicer spa. The service is unbelievable. We scheduled a swedish and balinese massage. In addition to our massages, they give you a footbath, facial massage, head massage, and refreshments. Our 60 minute massage was 90 minutes of absolute bliss. We were tempted to go back for a second round the next day but didn't have time. They also have this amazing facility called the Rain Forest. We didn't have time to experience it, but we heard it is a must. The staff - they remember who you are from the minute you walk in to the minute you walk out. Everywhere we went, we were greeted by name (they even remembered how to pronounce my name which no one ever does). They are above and beyond attentive. At one point while I was on the beach, I asked one of the attendants the time because I didn't have a watch and every time he saw me after, he would tell me the time. If they are that attentive about small things like this, imagine how they are about everything else. I could go on and on about all of things I loved about the resort (the bikes they have for guests to ride around, the fresh fruit in your room each day, the outdoor bath area, the cold towels on the beach, the concierge that flawlessly set up my scuba certification) but this would get too long. Unfortunately, we only spent 5 days at this resort. If you have the time, stay for as long as possible. You will not regret it!! We're already trying to figure out when we can come back.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star in Every Way -- Including the Price”
Reviews.Author: Asian_traveller_TX
Reviews.Content: Extremely exceptional resort that is truly amazing in terms of service, facilities, and amenities. Probably the best hotel/resort we have stayed, and we've been to the usual Four Seasons, Mandalay Orientals, and Ritz Carltons. Also the best massage that I've ever received. Few things that you should know however: Food inside the resort is very costly. Expect about $60-100 per person for decent meal with all charges & fees added. We opted to go out to town for dinners because of price in resort. If you can book a packaged deal that includes breakfast ($50 per person) and maybe some resort credits it may ease the shock. Unless you book a 2 or 3 bedroom villas ($$$$) on the beach most of the standard one bedroom villas are about 15 minute buggy ride away from the beach ... NOT a walking distance! If you are looking for a place where you can simply walk out onto the beach from your room you will be disappointed. Regardless because of the sheer beauty of the place I can easily overlook this inconvenience. Except for the fact that I thought the food was WAY overpriced, this resort is top notch. The staff is very accommodating and helpful, and I cannot say enough good things about them.

Reviews.Title: “incredible service”
Reviews.Author: jshien
Reviews.Content: what can i say that hasn't already been said about this place? it's truly a one of a kind place in the riviera maya. being in the mayakoba complex it has similarities to the other resorts of the complex. banyan tree like the others are not all inclusive and pays close attention to the ecology of the land. they have tried to preserve as much of the natural area as possible. the architecture and decor far surpasses any of the other mayakoba resorts. it is zen without feeling cold which sometimes can be a hard thing to do. throughout the resort there are numerous large scale light fixtures as well as old asian antiques. the overall effect is one of perfection. the service is also outstanding, not to say the other resorts lack in service but there's something personable about the way they treated us. we felt like we were welcomed into somebodys home-somebodys great BIG home. you can give great service but exceptional service comes with warmth and genuinity. everyday at the beach we were met with the entire sands staff welcoming us. we enjoyed refreshing little treats throughout the day. one of the few hotels where bottled water was complimentary and constantly being replenished. the beach bar is probably one of the best ive seen. bars where you can stand and order your drink from within the pool is quite common nowadays but one with such close proximity to the beach is not common. you can order your drink, sit and enjoy the view of the ocean all the while still being in the pool. awesome! jorge, ricardo and the entire sands staff worked so hard everyday and we thank them for taking care of us! we even received a wonderful rejuvenating massage treatment on the beach from them. the amenities in the rooms are great. and all the extras are a very nice touch. i enjoyed my in house slippers very much. they have slippers at all hotels but these were just so pretty and color coordinated for his and hers, now thats unique! thats exactly whats great about banyan tree everything is so unique and done so tastefully. thats what i love about great hotels they take the time to make the simplest thing different and unique. i wont bore you with a lengthy review of everything that has already been posted. i just want to say that this place is very special and if they continue treating their guests as well as they have they will soon be one of the great resorts in the riviera maya.

Reviews.Title: “This will become one of the best resorts- catch it now”
Reviews.Author: TennersUk
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an eleven day stay at the BT Mayakoba, travelling with my wife and four kids, we are seasoned five and six star travellers with the usual bunch of Four Seasons,One and Only and Ritz Carlton scalps... The BT has got a huge amount going for it, it also needs a bit more polish in one or two areas that if addressed will make the experience truely outstanding. We had booked two sunrise villas, and when I enquired about possible deals on offer I was unexpectedly offered upgrades to two sunset villas on the beach peninsula at no increase in costs. The hotel was only 20% occupied so you can shop for offers whilst they get over the combination of the Banking crisis (real issue) Swine flu(not an issue) and getting their name out there for a new property( I am sure next year will be different) Arrival and meet and greet was good , rooms are large and stylish , very private and well equipped. We particularly liked the large separate annexe room or as we called it the chill out room, as during the middle of the day at top temps it was a haven with a large day bed that all of us could lie on. The staff are absolutely fantastic and a real credit to BT and themselves, always willing always on hand, and some of the very best we have ever encountered, make sure you appreciate them as they do make the difference. The beach area is small but gets a great breeze off the ocean and when we were there was never crowded ( see above) however during peak times it will be a little cozy. The main pool is a good one and on a couple of days we were the only ones there so service was superb, and of course you have your own pools which are large and very private. Note the beach and beach villas are a good 10 mins from the main hotel, we ran one morning, but usually took the bikes to the Gym , cycled back and then all went to breakfast on the bikes again later- great fun and healthy!..alternatively book a buggy which never took more than 10 mins to come (again think about busy times) or the enjoyable boat , which takes 15 mins but was only running sporadicaly. Lots of wildlife, some rather too exotic and the whole area was very secure. We played golf three times on the local course, a great one and again the staff who are part of the Fairmont dropped us back to the hotel and were fantastic. We hired a couple of cars from the company at the BT, and they were good quality, low mileage premium cars. The area outside Mayakoba is a little desolate if you are looking for the real Mexico, we travelled to Tullum and further to see the real sites but a few days is enough to get the picture. The peninsula is pretty boring overall and as we were trying it as a replacement to the hurricane damaged carribean where we normally summer, I am afraid it was a little short of interest. So the areas that we think need some work: Spray for mosquitos, we faced into the mangroves and the property was protected from the onshore breeze and got very hot and humid. We were rich meat for the mozzies, and were also regularly bitten in the restaurants and attacked on the golf course at around 4pm. The gym need more aerobic kit, there are two step crosstrainers and two running machines , and a full weights cycle, however with four people in there unless you want to pump up your muscles it is very limited, also no earphones, cold towels or fresh juice which you would expect from a 5Star hotel. The restaurants were limited, the food was excellent but on some nights only Tamarind was open, so whilst the resort was quiet you really need to have more choice. The beach bar was great but shut at 5pm and would have made a good alternative at least one evening, and the Thai Saffron is superb. Room service was good but the menu is far too limited to make it a real attraction beyond a couple of days. The solution we found was to ask for food off the restaurant menus and room service, which they obliged us with, and although a little longer to arrive we did get a better choice, I would suggest the hotel incorporates this into the normal room service menu. So this resort has enormous potential, a quiet and modern haven once you are in the resort, staffed by superb , willing and attentive staff. I am sure it will be the next big thing on the world's top hotels carousel Enjoy whilst you can.

Reviews.Title: “If a picture is worth 1,000 words, experiencing this resort is worth 10,000!”
Reviews.Author: TTeacher
Reviews.Content: After reading all the detailed and helpful reviews here, we booked a spa pool villa at the promotional rate of $403+tax and service charge directly through the hotel with the helpful attention of Grecia and Brigitte. As we approached the hotel, we found the Asian inspired architecture and grounds with a Mayan twist to be simply spectacular. Claudia, our kind hostess, greeted us with a green drink and cool scented towel. She came with us to one of the 8 spa pool villas via an electric golf cart aka a buggy to check us in. We entered the gated enclosed villa to find a long pool, an in ground hot tub, and a 2 person chaise lounge with umbrella. Past the chaise lounge was a table and chairs that overlook a garden area that backs up to a lagoon. On either side of the pool are two separate living areas. One side is 2 levels. A spacious king bedroom with a large flat screen TV, desk area and cd/dvd player is within view as you open the door. A hallway leads to a circular vanity with 2 black and white floral designed sinks. Men and women’s toiletries are kept in matching black and white bags next to the sinks. A nice selection of liquid soap, bath gel, bath oil, shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion are in matching cream-colored ceramic dispensers on the counters. A large circular mirror is in the center of the vanity and there is a floor to ceiling wall mirror as well. You'll find an Ipod docking station in the bathroom, too. Off the bathroom is a walk in closet equipped with a safe, four robes and slippers and the most comfortable pair of beach flip-flops we’ve ever worn. One drawer of four holds matching black and white designed bags for the beach or pool. The closet has a counter and seat with a make up mirror and hairdryer. Bug spray and a flashlight were kept in a basket here. We didn't use the bug spray while we were there but we did avoid being outdoors at dusk. In the bathroom a separate tiled room has a toilet, and behind another glass door is a tiled steam shower. Sliding glass doors open to the outdoors to another completely private large soaking tub. Around the corner from the tub is an outdoor shower. Back at the gated entry are steps to the second level. There's a lounge area, with a couch, 2 massage tables for spa treatments, another outdoor shower and a sink. Views of the surroundings are a sight to see on the second level but somehow the design maintains the private oasis of your villa and the surrounding villas, too. Across from the bedroom is your living area with another big screen TV, and a dvd/cd player. There’s a table with 4 chairs, a wine refrigerator and mini-bar. There’s an espresso machine with Illy coffee and Tea Forte teas. Water and fruit are complimentary. There’s a comfortable couch as deep as a bed with throw pillows. Our only suggestion for the living space here would be to add easy outlet access to plug in a computer. My husband commented how much he relaxed and actually enjoyed working out of this room. The spa pool villa is ‘sensational. ’ As visually pleasing as the spa pool villa design and décor is with it’s contrast of light and dark, there is incense to burn, and aromatic oils wafting in your living space while soothing music is playing in the background. This ‘sensationalism’ carries over to the spa, restaurants, beach, and in fact, the entire resort! Housekeeping did an exceptional job keeping the villa in tip-top shape. We enjoyed talking to Eric who was so accommodating. Lee, when she found our bathing suits and cover-ups draped on the outdoor tub, went and brought back some extra hangers and hung up the wet clothes to dry. Turndown service was reliable and I enjoyed seeing what little gift we would discover when we returned to our villa at night. Breakfast was included with our rate and we ate at a bountiful breakfast buffet at the Oriente. What’s not at the buffet can be ordered off a menu. Lorena, Moises, Elena, Raphael, and Jorge were some of our excellent servers. The manager, Otto, greeted us everyday and even carried our plates from the buffet to our table. Dinner our first evening was at Saffron, Banyan Tree's signature Thai restaurant that overlooks the lagoon. We enjoyed the atmosphere, food, and service so much we returned night after night. Nadia was our waitress the first night and was so gracious. She, and the other staff, Alberto, Bernardino, the Thai chefs, the resort manager, Mr. Peter, in fact all the employees we met there made for an exceptional dining experience. Saffron is about as perfect an example of what attentive yet unobtrusive service is all about. Ramon, Ricardo, and every driver we encountered offered a friendly greeting and asked about our day. The resort seemed so spread out riding the buggy around. After we figured our way around we found out how close we actually were to the spa and restaurants. Trek bikes were a lot of fun to ride around the resort. The security guards along the paths are great to keep you from making a wrong turn and help you find your way to the beach. There’s a scenic boat ride you can take from the lobby through the canals to the beach. We smiled when music was played even on the boat as we departed from the dock. One of the highlights of our stay was a couple’s Bali massage in the spa. One 90-minute massage was included with our hotel stay. Ping and Seen, from Thailand, gave us one of the best massages we’ve ever had. I had a birthday while at Mayakoba. If you get the chance, your birthday will be made into an enjoyable day! Thank you, Fernando, at Sands for the prize-winning melon drink created in a melon carriage! Thank you, to the staff at Saffron for the delicious birthday cake. That cake alone was worth the trip! Every single employee we came across at the resort offered us exceptional service. We wish we had written down all their names to acknowledge them all. The luxury we experienced at the Banyan Tree Mayakoba is memorable and is now one of our all time favorite vacations. With those promotional rates we were able to get, we’d be delighted to book a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “A very wonderful experience, indeed!”
Reviews.Author: ScoBid
Reviews.Content: The Banyan Tree Mayakoba is just terrific. I wasn't sure what to make of an Asian resort in Mexico, but it turns out that the fusion of Mayan architecture and aesthetics with Thai ambience and service is a natural and wonderful combination. The result is something very special. Here are the highlights: 1. The Villas--It doesn't get much better than this. They are beautifully appointed and have huge infinity pools. The blend of indoor and outdoor space makes for a private oasis. I traveled with my parents and we stayed near the beach, first in a two bedroom that was very secluded and private, and then we were upgraded to a beach front. The turquoise waters of the Caribbean greeted us every morning. I have stayed at other Banyan Trees, almost all the Aman resorts, and many other deluxe resorts and these villas top the list. Every night they leave a little gift with the turn down service--a coin purse or a Mayan sachet--my Mom loved it. 2. The Restaurants--We loved the food! The breakfast buffet in Oriente was perfect. A broad selection always fresh and beautifully presented was complimented by delicious a la carte selections. The service was so friendly and prompt. I don't think I've ever been to a place where quite so many staff immediately new my name and were tuned into our days plan, etc. Very attentive. If there were even the slightest hiccup, it was corrected immediately and so effectively that I can't recall it. Saffron was the best Thai food I've had outside Thailand. The setting is really quite magical as if you're having dinner in a Thai boat on the water of a canal. Tamarind has healthy fare presented in a warm setting. We found a great deal of variety at the resort and felt that we had plenty of options for the week. The President of Mexico stopped by during our stay and it impeded things a bit and required them to close some venues. At the slightest suggestion of an inconvenience they agreed to specially open Sands at the Beach Club for dinner--problem solved before it even occurred. We loved lunch at Sands--great ceviche, quesadillas, salads, salmon. My parents are somewhat picky eaters but always found something they liked. A review or two has critiqued in-villa dining. While the menu is not extensive, we had room service several times and actually found those meals to be some of our favorites. They serve a spinach and chicken wrap that I could have eaten every day. We had dinner at the Rosewood Resort one night and enjoyed it but felt that the Banyan Tree food was superior and the service at Rosewood was quite slow (and suffered from the problem of over promising--ie. your food will be here in five minutes when it took fifteen). Still, nice to have other options nearby in the same compound. 3. The Amenities--A small but very well-equipped gym. I'm a workout hound and found everything I needed. The boat tour through the canals was just charming and a nice way to get around the resort when we weren't in a hurry. The bikes were great fun, too. Still, when we needed to get around fast, a golf cart would appear almost before we could request it. The golf course is beautiful (though quite challenging) and we had two good rounds. 4. Tours--We had them arrange a deluxe tour to Chichen-Itza and it was perfect. We had a great driver and a separate guide in an Escalade. It was planned perfectly. We went early, so in-villa dining had prepared breakfasts for us in the car--delicious breakfast burritos, fruit, juices, etc. At every stop we had a cool towel and some new treat--little sandwiches, candies, etc. The guide was deeply knowledgeable but also sensed how to gauge our level of interest. When we asked to visit Tulum on the return since we were passing by it, they agreed immediately and did so at no additional charge. Very classy! OVERALL--This is a place I hope to visit many times. The General Manager, Pancho Llamas, was extraordinarily kind, and Ed Diluca, the Food and Beverage Manager, was ever attentive. They are well on their way to building one of the best resorts you can imagine after only a very few months of operation. I applaud them. Some comparisons to the competition. Candidly, when I booked the Banyan Tree I had an aching feeling that when I saw the Rosewood or the Mandarin Oriental that I would get that sense of regret. Quite the contrary, while both are quite nice, neither meets the standard of the Banyan Tree. The Rosewood Villas are not true suites, but more junior suites and their plunge pools are very small relative to Banyan Tree. It is also more contemporary and doesn't quite fit the place with no real connection to the Yucatan or Mayan Culture. The Mandarin Oriental is also beautiful, but even more contemporary and actually quite cold (and I'm usually drawn to the more modern). It is long and narrow and outside of the Mayakoba compound which seems to be a real disadvantage. So, go, first chance you get!

Reviews.Title: “Raising the bar for Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Wanderkinder
Reviews.Content: Having experienced BT in several of its other locations, we had very high hopes for Mayakoba. For the most part, we were not disappointed. The villa was perfectly appointed, and all our needs were anticipated. We did experience a bit of noise one morning as we were situated across the way from the bodegas and maintenance area - which we did not see until the morning after we arrived. (courtyard villas 201-204). Our concern was promptly addressed. We were a bit surprised when a few services failed us and have concerns about how service will hold up when the hotel is full (it was only 19% occupancy while we were there). The turn-down service was twice not completed during the 90 min interval in which we requested it be done, and also a wake up call did not materialize. Food is a bit limited. Saffron here is more authentic Thai than fusion as in other BTs. Menus in both Tamarind, Sands & Saffron are not extensive (and there is no Thai beer), but what they do have is done well. Room service menu also limited, but again, well done. Beware of the in-house tour desk, Maritour. For scuba & whaleshark snorkeling tours, they contacted only 2 possible operators and gave us incorrect information about what is available. Had we not gone out to Playa del Carmen ourselves to seek out other such operators, we would have not been able to do anything we had planned for this trip. Spa is also up to BT standards. The Yoga massage is unparalleled - and non-existent in any other spas in the Americas. The facials using natural ingredients as well. Service in the spa is impecable. The crowd tends to be trendy/ look-at-me types, but they're avoidable for the most part since everyone has their own villas. Having stayed also in a number of 5 star resorts in the Playa/Cancun areas, BTMayakoba comes out on top. Overall, BT Mayakoba has set new standards to which other resorts should aspire. I hope they keep up the good work and improving on themselves. I plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss on the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: RSNY1
Reviews.Content: Warning: this is a long review that we hope will be helpful to others that are considering a stay at the new Banyan Tree Mayakoba. My wife and I were craving a taste of Asia but could not bear the thought of an 18 hour flight to get there. However my wife had read about a promotion that the new Banyan Tree Mayakoba was offering, but we went to the web site to check the rates the system was down and was showing the hotel booked for the month of July. A bit frustrated, we looked at other resorts in the area. We considered both the Mandarin Oriental and the Rosewood, but we finally settled on the Rosewood. We were ready to book when I decided to e-mail the Banyan tree directly to see if there was any chance of a promotional rate ( I assumed that with such great rates the hotel was full). We received a quick reply from Grecia with unbelievable rates for our dates (the best villa at the Banyan Tree was being offered to us for the same rate as the lowest villa at Rosewood and for a 1/4 of what the Mandarin was offering). After reading every review on Trip Advisor it was a no brainer for us and we booked a spa suite villa for 7 nights with breakfast and 2- 90 minute spa treatments. Our Stay: Airport to Villa We took the option of having the hotel pick us up at the airport and were very happy to have done so, we were greeted by a BTMK driver and quickly escorted to a spotless Cadillac Escalade and whisked away to the resort. The experience started in the SUV, we were given cold scented towels and chilled water served in a BT Batik cloth holder, the SUV had a DVD playing that entertained us on the way to the resort. The driver spoke perfect English and was very informative along the way. $225 round trip may seem like a lot of money to get to and from the resort but it is worth it! When we arrived at the gates of Mayakoba we realized that this is going to be a special property, the shiny stainless steel Mayakoba sign is a beautiful contrast to the dark wood and white stone only to be complimented by impeccably planted Agave Azul plants ( Tequila) the gate is shared by the Rosewood, Fairmont and Banyan Tree ( there will be one more property managed by Viceroy but we were told that the construction had been stopped) Once through the gates you begin your journey through the jungle to the resort, they have done a fantastic job in damaging as little of the jungle to make room for the road. This area is also up lit at night. There are several security guards along the way giving you a sense that your safety is being well looked after. When we arrived at the resort we were overwhelmed with the beauty of the lobby area, you feel as though you are on a private island. The furnishings, art and lighting are sublime. We were greeted by Claudia who gave us another cold towel and a chilled cucumber juice (delicious) while she explained a bit about the resort; we were quickly taken to our villa in a golf cart and did the check in when we arrived. The Villa: The villas are actually a small compound consisting of a courtyard pool area, living pavilion, a separate building with the bedroom and bathroom and a roof top terrace. The décor is a fusion of Asian and Mayan with black slate floors, dark wood furniture accented by Mayan colored fabrics and deep wool carpet runners. Courtyard: This is the reason to take the Spa Pool Villa; once you enter through the gate you are overwhelmed with the size of the pool and Jacuzzi! The area faces the canal but is elevated and landscaped for privacy. The pool is stunning with cobalt blue mosaic tiles and an infinity edge; you can enter the pool via stairs from the courtyard or from the bedroom veranda. There is an oversized double sun lounger with a market umbrella there is also an outdoor table and chairs for eating but we never used it once as there is a slight mosquito problem in the evening. The pool and Jacuzzi are very private and were well used during our visit. (This sun lounger can use a cover as it rained the first 2 days that we were at the resort and the cushions were still wet 2 days later) Pavilion: The Pavilion is a 14’x20’ Asian inspired tea house with glass on 2 sides that opens to the courtyard and swimming pool areas. The amenities in the Pavilion are endless: Dining table with 4 chairs Extra large day bed with a sea of pillows and cushions (really comfortable, but could use some throws as the A/C can leave the room chilly when watching TV) 37” Samsung flat screen TV, Phillips CD/DVD player Well stocked mini bar and a separate wine fridge stocked with a good selection of wines The BEST coffee and teas service ever! There is a Francis/Francis coffee machine with Illy coffee, and a separate water boiler to prepare the Tea Forte (one of my favorite teas) I wake up earlier than my wife and the Pavilion served as a great place to do my e-mails in the morning and a REALLY comfortable place to watch T/V in the evening Bedroom: The bedroom is very large with a King Sized bed topped with a featherbed mattress and lots of pillows of all densities! There is a large desk area suitable for a suite like this and an additional TV, we would have used a DVD player at night had there been one as the pay per view movies were just ok. The bedroom has glass on 2 sides that opens to the pool or a veranda overlooking the canal with a hammock. Bathroom: The bathroom is large but not too big; it has a round island area with 2 surface mounted Mexican sinks and a huge mirror that separates the two. There is a separate toilet room, shower with steam, a very large outdoor bath tub and a separate dressing room. The bathroom is well equipped with his and hers amenity bags, beach towels, beach bags, lightweight robes and heavier terry cloth robes, bedroom slippers, beach sandals, flashlight, and mosquito repellant. Roof top deck: The space is very nice and outfitted well but we never used it as it was too hot to have massages up there and we were happy to sit by the pool or in the Pavilion. The Senses: I think it is important to comment on how this resort has addressed the senses, the sights, smells and sounds have all been addressed and are without fault, everything from the furnishings to the staff uniforms are visually prefect, everywhere the sounds have been chosen carefully, the beach club has upbeat lounge music, the villas have tranquil Asian music that is playing when you arrive and after they do the turndown service. EVERYWHERE you go your sense of smell is stimulated, the cold towels, the resort restrooms, the gift shops, the oil burners in the bedroom and pavilion all have a scent of the day! This resort is Asian and has not missed a beat in keeping to the details! The Spa : The Spa at BTMK is unlike others as it is spread out over 3 separate areas, the Spa lobby is located on the lower area of the main building, and it is a large beautiful reception area but other than booking your treatments and checking in for them the area is really not used. The changing rooms are located in a separate building which is also where the rainforest is, and the treatment rooms are several separate pavilions located a short walk away along the canal. Our package included 2- 90 minute massages and I opted for the rainforest experience before one of them. The rainforest is a great experience and completely unique to the Banyan Tree resorts but in my opinion not worth the time or money, with the exception of the Aroma Steam and the Vitality pool it is just a series of showers and lights ( very beautifully done) and I felt completely water logged at the end. After the rainforest I had a 90 minute Balinese massage, I say 90 minutes but the actual massage is 60 minutes with a foot bath, tea and relaxing time making up the remainder of the time ( a bit misleading). Had this not been part of our package and I was paying $160 for a 60 minute massage I would feel slighted. Overall the spa and services are the tops but VERY expensive, one would think that if you are spending $160 on a 60 minute massage that the rainforest would be included as a pre or post spa treatment experience. One thing that I did find interesting is unlike other spas I was not pressured into buying overpriced product that I don’t need! The Beach/Pool: The beach and pool at BTMK is absolutely stunning! We visited several resorts during our stay and none could even begin to compare with BTMK. The overall design is just beautiful ,everything is top quality and well thought out; the service is the best that we have ever had. They come by about every 15 minutes (not obtrusively) with cold towels, drink samples and little nibbles. When you leave your lounger to go in the pool or to go to lunch the pool attendant quickly changes your towels and freshens up the area. The little pillows for your head are a really nice touch. The pool is the nicest in the area, it is large and beautiful and the water seems to be the perfect temperature. The beach is much nicer and bigger than others in the area. Service; By the time we arrived the resort I think there were some cutbacks with the staff but I can say that everyone that we dealt with was very polite and willing to bend over backwards to make us happy or more comfortable. One of the buggy drivers said that he had worked at other resorts but never had the extensive training that Banyan Tree has offered; he mentioned that people came from Asia to train the local staff and this is apparent and well noted! We were in the villa one day when housekeeping was cleaning and they left no surface untouched they even mopped the stone under the sun loungers. Shopping: Unless you want typical touristy knick knacks don’t waste your time going to Play del Carmen, the one street (5th Ave) is just one shop after the other selling the same junk. We also found the gift shop at the hotel to be a waste of space, 99% of the items for sale are the Banyan Tree items used throughout the resort. We had hoped that we could find some nice art and gifts like what is used throughout the resort but there was none to be found. Mexico is known for its arts and crafts and this was a big letdown. Service charges and taxes; I am always a big tipper especially for good service but I found myself a bit frustrated with the service charge policy. If you choose to add 15% to everything purchased at the resort (including the breakfast and spa treatments that come with the package) you should not feel like you need to leave more unless you receive exceptional service. Every bill that you get includes the service charge but also has a place for an additional gratuity which makes you feel like if you don’t leave more you are being cheap. Food: I left this until last as this is where the Banyan Tree has failed (for the moment I hope) this is the type of resort that you can come to and never leave but we felt driven to leave just to find a better variety of restaurants. Saffron: We ate at Saffron the first and last night night and it was fantastic, the décor, food and service were all tops, but 2 times in 1 week is plenty for gourmet Thai food. Tamarind; We never ate at Tamarind as we just couldn’t get it, the restaurant does not know what it is the menu is just a Hodge Podge of items with none of them exciting us enough to visit. Why they are serving Maine lobster in the Caribbean I will never know. The atmosphere is more lobby bar than resort restaurant. Oriente: Due to low occupancy this restaurant is only open for breakfast, as the breakfast was included in our package we took advantage of it. The buffet is beautiful and offers a great selection of fruit, juices, yogurts, cereals and breakfast breads. However the cooked breakfast was a letdown, the Mexican dishes were presented well but were not authentic. I love chiliquillas but these were just tortilla chips smothered in sauce served in a corn husk bowl. This really needs work, if we had paid the $47 pp ++ for breakfast I would have been very disappointed. In room dining: I can sum this up with 2 words “don’t bother” this was such a huge disappointment for us. Usually at other villa style hotels the in room dining menu is usually comparable with the restaurants, this menu is just plain boring and $35 ++ for a chicken wrap is ridiculous! We were offered the menu from Tamarind but we were not excited about that menu either. This needs a lot of work Sands: This is the resorts best dining option after Saffron but it is only open for lunch. The Mexican Pizza, Ceviche, Shrimp Tempura Tacos and Beef Tacos are all outstanding but there are only so many times that you can have this in one week. Food Overview: We spoke with several of the staff about the food and the menus and they seem to have heard this before and said that the menus are being reviewed based on guest’s comments and will hopefully change. We found ourselves craving real Mexican food and fresh fish and seafood. We ate at the beach restaurants at both the Rosewood and the Mandarin Oriental and they were both very good but we had wished that we didn’t have to leave the property to find a good selection of food. General Overview If you are looking for a high end villa resort with impeccable service I highly recommend you to stay at the BTMK, even if we were paying the full rate I feel the villas are levels above both the Rosewood and Mandarin Oriental resorts. However we would like to come back but only if we learn that the food issues are resolved. I hope that the comments about the food are taken as constructive criticism, if they sort this out there is no reason to stay anywhere else or to leave the resort during your stay. As much as we love the resort we will not return until we are assured that these issues are resolved

Reviews.Title: “Banyan Tree Mayakoba is a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: farfalla1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 1 week and cannot get the Banyan Tree out of our minds! They had only a 15% occupancy level (i imagine it was due to the swine flu and low season) so we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves. They even upgraded our villa to show their appreciation for us being there. There was an amazing attention to detail in not only the cleanliness, decor, and landscaping, but also in the service as well. Everyone always asked how our stay was going and offered assistance with any minor difficulty. The staff was the most pleasant group of people in the world and I don't recall anywhere I've stayed where there was the same genuine, gracious hospitality. Just a few examples: upon our arrival, we were offered a refreshing cucumber drink, and were given a personal tour of the resort and our villa; the chef at Tamarind did not speak much English but made it a point to greet each guest after their meal. Another staff member offered us towels before we left the resort for an outdoor activity - a minor detail we hadn't thought of, but he fortunately was paying attention for us :) The Sands Beach Club staff was extremely accommodating, and always offering complimentary special drinks and snacks on the beach throughout the day. (and after taking a walk on the beach, my boyfriend and I agreed that it was the nicest beach club on the beach!) The villa we stayed in was immaculate, comfortable, and romantic. Having our own jacuzzi and pool in front of the lagoon was wonderful - we really felt at home (and wish we could live there). If you are thinking of booking Banyan Tree, don't hesitate! It is THE BEST resort on the Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back there...”
Reviews.Author: traveler2002
Reviews.Content: I have been home for a week now and can’t get the Banyan Tree Mayakoba out of my head (or my heart). I have fallen in love with the resort and the lovely people who work there. It has been a long time since I have been “wowed” by a property. My husband and I used to travel a lot, taking every opportunity to visit a Four Seasons property or a luxurious game lodge in Africa. Now that we have kids, we try to choose special destinations for the rare moments that we get away on our own. To say that we hit the jackpot on our tenth anniversary is an understatement. I knew we had arrived somewhere special before we opened our car doors--the fragrance of the day greeted us, taking me back to wonderful holidays in Thailand and Bali. The resort lobby is beautiful and sets the scene for a relaxing holiday with beautiful architecture, gorgeous light fixtures, furniture, and artwork, and a welcoming hostess. The entrance at the beach club is equally beautiful, but also offers that first glimpse of the cerulean sea—it’s breathtaking. Our room, the Spa Pool Villa, set the stage for a romantic and relaxing getaway. While the room is set away from the beach, we had a perfect location on a cenote (canal) that offered us many opportunities to see beautiful birds in a natural environment. The villa was centrally located, giving us easy walking or cycling access to all of the restaurants, spa, main pool, and other guest services. Getting to the beach from our villa was also very easy—we either called for a cart, which always arrived promptly, or we took a boat from the main lobby (the boat is so fun and relaxing, allowing for a leisurely tour of the property). The bed had wonderful linens, the villa pool was the perfect temperature, the Jacuzzi and steam shower were optimal for relieving stress, and the outdoor tub and wall of candles—sensual. Those were just the extravagant things that made the room extraordinary. Practically speaking, the two large flat screen televisions, the iPod dock, the couch/bed and the Francis Francis espresso maker with Illy coffee made me absolutely giddy. Breakfast at Oriente was a perfect way to start the day. The coffee was delicious. They offered a lovely selection of hot and cold items, everything delectable and flavorful. Most of all, the service was outstanding, with multiple servers making sure you always had a beverage or providing you with a helping hand to take your dishes to the table. We spent most of our days on the beach. It was hard to resist the mesmerizing ocean, sun and cloud-filled sky, and comfy lounge chairs. Service at the beach and beach pool was amazing. We were treated like special guests and wanted for nothing. We both loved having lunch on the beach: tacos, ceviche, guacamole, papas fritas—all delicious. If it wasn’t on the menu, they would do their best to get it for you. One afternoon, I wanted an iced coffee (not on the menu). Our server said, “No problem. I can make that for you.” He brought me a delicious frozen coffee beverage that made me very happy. Saffron was our favorite restaurant on the property. I am half Thai so I appreciated having my comfort food so readily available. We ate there twice and found both meals perfect, and especially enjoyed the crispy grouper with green mango and the green curry with eggplant and heart of palm. We had fun and informative dinner conversations with the restaurant manager and enjoyed speaking with the servers and the chef. Service was excellent. A trip to the Banyan Tree cannot be mentioned without discussing the spa. This was truly a heavenly experience. The morning after our arrival, we had a couples treatment in a beautiful, private pavillion. What a great way to start a vacation. The body scrub, the steam shower, the massage itself--fantastic. I loved how we were treated and I felt great afterward. A visit to the spa is a must! The Banyan Tree Mayakoba is one of the most beautiful and serene resorts I have ever visited. The people who work there are extraordinary. If you want to relax and unwind—this is the perfect place. I can’t wait to get back there…

Reviews.Title: “Was it all just a dream?”
Reviews.Author: TyRyIzzie
Reviews.Content: Oh where to begin...Let me just start by saying this is one of the most fabulous resorts we have ever had the pleasure of visiting. We could go on and on for days describing the utter beauty the Banyan Tree Mayakoba exudes through it's supreme level of service, breathtaking architecture & exotic grounds. This place is special. No detail is spared down to the sounds and scents in your private villa. We enjoyed our stay so much we extended our trip twice totaling our time at the Banyan Tree to almost 3 weeks. Because of our extended stay we were able to sample 3 types of villas: The Courtyard, Spa and 3br Ocean Front. Every one of these villas exceeded our expectations ten fold and each possessed it's own charm and uniqueness. There is not an undesirable room on campus. The Courtyard villa is equipped with a spacious master suite/bath including an outdoor bathtub and shower. There were bath oils, salts and foam available outside as well as a wall filled with candles that when lit created a scenic backdrop. There is a separate pavilion on the opposite side of the outdoor pool, hot tub and lounge area. The pavilion included a large lounging sofa, TV, CD/iPod player, coffee station and dining table. The pool & lounge area were spacious, immaculately clean and the view of the lagoon was serene. The Spa villa included everything the Courtyard villa had but was slightly larger with an upper level terrace that included 2 massage tables. The view of the lagoon was more private than the courtyard villa because there were only mangrove trees across the water. The Ocean Front villa was spectacular, the beach was just a few steps away from the private infinity pool. Each of the 3 brs had it's own outdoor entrance, full bath and ocean view. The 2nd br located above the master was the equivalent of an addional master suite with a huge private balcony and the 3rd bedroom is located in the pavilion building. We were pleasantly surprised that the service staff from Sands including Alberto, Martin, Manuel, Eduardo, Jorge & Edgar paid visits to us providing drinks, towels and lunch right from our terrace. The grounds are laid out in such a way to protect the natural environment of the mangroves. Villas, pathways and wooden bridges naturally wind around the lagoons which are loaded with tropical fish, turtles and birds. We really got the feeling that we were lodging in the middle of an unspoiled rain forest...with uber luxurious amenities that is. We are major beach people so we were a little concerned with the distance of the beach from the interior villas prior to our arrival, we soon realized that our worries were completely unfounded. When venturing to the beach we had 2 convenient options, buggy or bike. Affectionately the staff pronounces buggy as "boogy". A quick call to guest services had a "boogy" at your villa door in less than five minutes, the same time frame applied when your days at Sands beach house had come to a close. We had many nice conversations with Rafaelle, Miguel and Efren on these trips. Each had wonderful recommendations for attractions and day trips as well as infinite knowledge of the resorts history and wildlife. Riding the bikes to the beach was a delightful and relaxing mode of transportation as well. Our bikes were always right outside of our villa door and never had to be locked up, even at the beach. If you collected too many shells to ride your bike back to the villa, a buggy would pick you up and the staff would return your bikes to your doorstep within minutes. The service level at the beach was incomparable. There were always 3 or 4 people waiting on us at all times. Our beach butler Jorge spoiled us with cold facial towels, ice water, and light conversation. Jorge was the hardest worker at the resort always making sure that everyone was enjoying themselves to the highest level. Somehow he always noticed when we were swimming, allowing him to place a fresh towel for us to dry off with once exiting the ocean or pool. Lunches at Sands were tasty with many options to choose from and the bartenders Efren & Allejandro were quite talented. Try the Sands Passion tropical drink, it's the cats meow. Our favorite restaurant on site was the Banyan Trees' signature Saffron. Tableside visits from Chef and Manager really made us feel special. The Thai food was some of the best we have ever had, the staff actually went to the extent of growing their own herbs used in food preparation. Every dish was fresh and cooked with affection. Try the Tom Yum soup or the chicken curry, you will not be disappointed. Breakfast at Oriente was one of our favorite meals of the day. The lovely Lorena elegantly greeted us every morning and provided us with freshly squeezed juices and a warm smile. Moises the service assistant treated us with tableside origami artwork which he ingeniously created during his down time, and the various servers were like old friends of ours by the end of our stay. Tamarind's spa food was also delicious, we particularly enjoyed the tabouleh and pancetta ravioli soup. It would be sacrilegious to visit a Banyan Tree and pass up the spa services. We each enjoyed three hour massage & body treatments in addition to an hour in the rainforest hydrotherapy rooms. The spa is definitely a splurge but lets put it this way...out of body experiences are priceless. We were spoiled so much at the Banyan Tree that we almost don't feel right leaving any negative comments. But being loyal Tripadvisor readers we feel we must mention that meals are very pricy at the resort. The quality is high and the food is well worth the price but financially you need to account for this extra cost because it does add up. I can't depart with out mentioning our resort hosts Ana Ruth, Sarah, Daphne & Claudia. Anything we needed they provided with enthusiasm and extreme professionalism. We had an incident with a credit card which caused us to have to have a new card Fed Exed from Chicago. Our card was held up in customs and the hotel actually went to Cancun and picked it up for us. This saved us immeasurable time and allowed us to avoid a potentially stressful situation. We also needed a lot of assistance rebooking our flights, making dinner reservations and organizing taxi rides. I know we were a handfull and these women went the extra mile giving 150% to make sure our vacation was something we would remember and treasure forever. All in all we can not wait to return to the Banyan Tree Mayakoba. We are engaged, have a honeymoon to plan and we can't fathom how to top this location. I guess we will have to try Banyan Tree Phuket. Jay Vohra & Tyler Burns Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “On our last day, everyone was actually depressed that they had to leave. It was bizarre.”
Reviews.Author: BaldricAdder
Reviews.Content: We just came back from having our wedding at the Bayan Tree and normally I don’t leave reviews but the experience has moved me enough to make an exception. The property itself is amazing but what sets the Bayan Tree Mayakoba apart from any other places we have been to is the exemplary service. To me, what differentiates good service from great service is what happens when a staff is presented with a request or opportunity that falls outside of the norm. Let me give you an example, we had decided to go for an impromptu swim in front of the Sands Beach Club. I removed my sandals about 3 meters away from the water line. When we came out, one of the staff had placed a table near my sandals with towels for us to dry ourselves off. As we headed back to our villa, the same person came out with cold hand towels for us to wipe our face and hands. On another occasion, my niece had to pay a visit to the hospital and Pedro from the Bayan Tree rode in his motorcycle behind the ambulance, in the rain to provide his assistance at the hospital. He then helped to chase down medicine at different pharmacies and did not leave till everyone was back in the resort…at 3am! He was my personal hero that day. I won’t spoil it for people by going into details but there are many surprises to be had. Make sure you take the boat ride along the river at least once. Make sure you ride the bikes that are provided. It was so much fun and it’s a great way to discover the resort. Make sure you eat at the Safron at least once. I disagree with the reviewer that said that it is like any other Thai restaurant. I have spent a bit of time in Thailand and the Safron is one of the best. Try the Chilean Sea Bass. And if you do decide to get marry there, Yvonne is simply amazing. I don’t know how she does it but she is has an eye for detail and was on top of everything. I would love to have her on my team managing projects. And she has such a great energy about her. On our last day, everyone was actually depressed that they had to leave. It was bizarre. Take advantage of the Swine Flu scare and go there now. You will feel like you have the whole resort to yourself. I cannot recommend this pace enough.

HotelInfo.Name: Banyan Tree Mayakoba
HotelInfo.Address: Carretera Federal, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
